Description:
[reaction] After you defeat an enemy: Discover 1 clue at your location. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] effect: +1 for each clue on your location.
Description2: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Guardian cards ([guardian]) level 0-5, Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0-2, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Roland's .38 Special, Cover Up, 1 random basic weakness.
Flavor: Everything by the book: every "i" dotted, every "t" crossed. It has worked, until now.
Flavor2: Roland had always taken comfort in procedure and rules. As an agent in the Bureau, he was relieved to have guidelines to follow in any given situation. But lately, his Federal Agent's Handbook had been entirely unhelpful given the cases he'd been assigned. Try as he might, Roland could find no mention of what to do when confronted with strange creatures, gates through time and space, or magic spells. If he hadn't seen it with his own eyes, he would never have believed it... and there's no way his superiors would understand. Roland knew he would have to handle this one himself.
Name: Roland Banks

Description:
You may take an additional action during your turn, which can only be used on [[Tome]] [action] abilities.
[elder_sign] effect: +0. If you succeed, draw 1 card for each [[Tome]] you control.
Description2: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0-5, Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 0-2, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Daisy’s Tote Bag, The Necronomicon (John Dee Translation), 1 random basic weakness.
Flavor: "I know of books so powerful, they can rewrite reality."
Flavor2: As a respected librarian at Miskatonic University, Daisy had always felt that books were the most important thing in her life. She explored in fiction what she abhorred in life: horror, violence, fear. Then, she stumbled across the John Dee translation of the Necronomicon. It was blasphemous, unholy, and too awful to be read. But given her studies in obscure and occult subjects, Daisy knew there was more truth than fiction within the book's pages. She began to wonder what other secrets the restricted collection of the Orne Library held...
Name: Daisy Walker

Description:
[free] During your turn, spend 2 resources: You may take an additional action this turn. (Limit once per turn.)
[elder_sign] effect: +2. If you succeed, gain 2 resources.
Description2: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Rogue cards ([rogue]) level 0-5, Guardian cards ([guardian]) level 0-2, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): On the Lam, Hospital Debts, 1 random basic weakness.
Flavor: "I didn't get out of the joint just to watch the world end."
Flavor2: Skids hadn't planned on a life of crime. But sometimes doing the right thing means getting your hands dirty. The cops didn't care that Skids needed the money for his mother's operation. His mother died of her illness during the second year of his sentence. His cellmate, Brad Hollins, told him there were worse fates than death. He ranted and raved in a quiet voice every evening about the "Old Ones" and told Skids about bizarre adventures he'd had while dreaming. Skids didn't give it much thought until the night he woke to the sight of his cellmate bursting into flames. When Skids was finally released, he returned to Arkham, looking for answers.
Name: "Skids" O'Toole

Description:
[reaction] After 1 or more horror is placed on Agnes Baker: Deal 1 damage to an enemy at your location. (Limit once per phase.)
[elder_sign] effect: +1 for each horror on Agnes Baker.
Description2: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 0-5, Survivor cards ([survivor]) level 0-2, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Heirloom of Hyperborea, Dark Memory, 1 random basic weakness.
Flavor: "I remember another life, one of sorcery and conquest."
Flavor2: Agnes Baker may be just an unassuming waitress in this life, but in a previous life, in a time and age undreamed of in the modern world, she had been a powerful witch. It began when she found a strange artifact - a key of some kind - in a dusty collection of family belongings in her attic. When she touched it, the memories came flooding back, along with one word: "Hyperborea." The more she delved into the visions and memories of her former life, the stronger her powers grew... and the more frightened she became.
Name: Agnes Baker

Description:
[reaction] When you reveal a chaos token, choose and discard 1 card from your hand: Cancel that chaos token and return it to the bag. Reveal a new chaos token. (Limit once per test/ability.)
[elder_sign] effect: +0. If Wendy's Amulet is in play, you automatically succeed instead.
Description2: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Survivor cards ([survivor]) level 0-5, Rogue cards ([rogue]) level 0-2, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Wendy's Amulet, Abandoned and Alone, 1 random basic weakness.
Flavor2: Mama used to let Wendy play with her necklace when she was small. Mama would tell her stories, and Wendy would spin the necklace and watch as it glittered. Then, word came that her father had been lost at sea, and Mama started acting strange, drawing unusual symbols in chalk all over the house. They took Mama to the asylum, and Wendy went to the orphanage. Before they took her away, Mama gave her the necklace, to "protect her." Wendy stayed in the orphanage for several years before running away, deciding that she could take better care of herself on her own.
Name: Wendy Adams

Description: Roland Banks deck only. Uses (4 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack (if there are 1 or more clues on your location, you get +3 [combat], instead). This attack deals +1 damage.
Name: Roland's .38 Special

Description: Revelation - Put Cover Up into play in your threat area, with 3 clues on it. [reaction] When you would discover 1 or more clues at your location: Discard that many clues from Cover Up instead. Forced - When the game ends, if there are any clues on Cover Up: You suffer 1 mental trauma.
Name: Cover Up

Description:
Daisy Walker deck only.
You have 2 additional hand slots, which can only be used to hold [[Tome]] assets.
Name: Daisy's Tote Bag

Description: Revelation - Put The Necronomicon into play in your threat area, with 3 horror on it. It cannot leave play while it has 1 or more horror on it. Treat each [elder_sign] you reveal on a chaos token as a [auto_fail]. [action]: Move 1 horror from The Necronomicon to Daisy Walker. Then, if The Necronomicon has no horror on it, discard it.
Name: The Necronomicon

Description:
"Skids" O'Toole deck only.
Fast. Play after your turn begins.
Until the end of the round, non-[[Elite]] enemies cannot attack you.
Flavor: I ain't going to the pen a second time.
Name: On the Lam

Description: Revelation - Put Hospital Debts into play in your threat area. [free]: Move 1 resource from your resource pool to Hospital Debts. (Limit twice per round.) Forced - When the game ends, if Hospital Debts has fewer than 6 resources on it: You earn 2 fewer experience for this scenario.
Name: Hospital Debts

Description:
Agnes Baker deck only.
[reaction] After you play a [[Spell]] card: Draw 1 card.
Flavor: The etchings on its surface change from day to day, shifting and moving whenever I'm not looking.
Name: Heirloom of Hyperborea

Description: Place 1 doom on the current agenda. This effect may cause the current agenda to advance. Forced - If Dark Memory is in your hand at the end of your turn, reveal it and take 2 horror.
Flavor: No... not again!
Name: Dark Memory

Description: Wendy Adams deck only. You may play the topmost event in your discard pile as if it were in your hand. Forced - After you play an event or discard an event from play: Place it on the bottom of your deck instead of in your discard pile.
Name: Wendy's Amulet

Description: Revelation - Take 2 direct horror and remove all cards in your discard pile from the game.
Flavor: I don't need them. I don't need anyone.
Name: Abandoned and Alone

Description: Uses (4 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage.
Name: .45 Automatic

Description:
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [willpower] for this skill test.
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [combat] for this skill test.
Name: Physical Training

Description:
You get +1 [combat].
[free] Discard Beat Cop: Deal 1 damage to an enemy at your location.
Name: Beat Cop

Description:
Uses (3 supplies). If First Aid has no supplies, discard it.
[action] Spend 1 supply: Heal 1 damage or horror from an investigator at your location.
Name: First Aid

Description: [action]: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack. If the attacked enemy is the only enemy engaged with you, this attack deals +1 damage.
Flavor: Cuts through vines, underbrush, and tentacles equally well.
Name: Machete

Description: [reaction] When an enemy attack deals damage to Guard Dog: Deal 1 damage to the attacking enemy.
Flavor: Fiercely loyal, these trained canines make for perfect companions.
Name: Guard Dog

Description:
Fast. Play after you defeat an enemy.
Discover 1 clue at your location.
Flavor: Just as I suspected!
Name: Evidence!

Description:
Fast. Play when an enemy attacks an investigator at your location.
Cancel that attack.
Name: Dodge

Description: Choose either your location or a connecting location. Deal 3 damage to each enemy and to each investigator at the chosen location.
Name: Dynamite Blast

Description: If this skill test is successful during an attack, that attack deals +1 damage.
Flavor: With a sickening smack, he struck the abomination over and over... until at last, it stopped moving.
Name: Vicious Blow

Description: Place 3 ammo tokens on a [[Firearm]] asset controlled by an investigator at your location.
Flavor: I've never met a beast that could outsmart a bullet.
Name: Extra Ammunition

Description:
You get +1 [willpower].
[free] While an investigator at your location is taking his or her turn, discard Police Badge: That investigator may take 2 additional actions this turn.
Name: Police Badge

Description:
You get +1 [combat].
[free] Exhaust Beat Cop and deal 1 damage to it: Deal 1 damage to an enemy at your location.
Name: Beat Cop

Description: Uses (2 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +3 [combat] for this attack. Instead of its standard damage, this attack deals 1 damage for each point you succeed by (to a minimum of 1, to a maximum of 5). If you fail and would damage another investigator, this attack deals 1 damage for each point you fail by (to a minimum of 1, to a maximum of 5).
Name: Shotgun

Description:
Fast.
You get +1 [intellect] while investigating.
Flavor: A lens into a world unseen can reveal things you wish it hadn't.
Name: Magnifying Glass

Description: [action] Exhaust Old Book of Lore: Choose an investigator at your location. That investigator searches the top 3 cards of his or her deck for a card, draws it, and shuffles the remaining cards into his or her deck.
Name: Old Book of Lore

Description: [reaction] After Research Librarian enters play: Search your deck for a [[Tome]] asset and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.
Flavor: "There have been problems at the Orne Library, as we both know, given poor Armitage's condition, and the other, unrelated... incident of a few years ago..."
Name: Research Librarian

Description:
You get +1 [intellect].
[reaction] After you successfully investigate: Gain 1 resource.
Flavor: "While I truly believe that this nightmare is just a singular abomination, I must admit that I am exhilarated by the possibility that this is but one specimen of a new genus!"
Name: Dr. Milan Christopher

Description:
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [intellect] for this skill test.
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [agility] for this skill test.
Name: Hyperawareness

Description: [action] Choose an investigator at your location and test [intellect] (2). If you succeed, heal 1 damage from that investigator. If you fail, deal 1 damage to that investigator.
Name: Medical Texts

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Until the end of the round, you may use your [intellect] in place of your [combat] and [agility].
Name: Mind over Matter

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Discover 1 clue at your location.
Name: Working a Hunch

Description: Attach to your location. Non-[[Elite]] enemies cannot move into attached location. Forced - When an investigator leaves attached location: Discard Barricade.
Name: Barricade

Description: If this skill test is successful while investigating a location, discover 1 additional clue at that location.
Flavor: I knew I had seen this symbol before. I must warn the others before it is too late!
Name: Deduction

Description:
Fast.
You get +1 [intellect] while investigating.
[free] If there are no clues on your location: Return Magnifying Glass to your hand.
Flavor: A lens into a world unseen can reveal things you wish it hadn't.
Name: Magnifying Glass

Description: [reaction] When a non-[[Elite]] enemy spawns at your location, discard Disc of Itzamna: Discard that enemy.
Flavor: Do they fear it because of what it will do to them? Or, do they fear it because of what it will do to you?
Name: Disc of Itzamna

Description: [action] Exhaust Encyclopedia: Choose an investigator at your location. That investigator gets +2 to a skill of your choice until the end of the phase.
Flavor: It's supposed to be comprehensive, but the more I search through its pages, the more I realize we know nothing about the real truths of the cosmos.
Name: Encyclopedia

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Choose an investigator at your location. That investigator draws 3 cards.
Name: Cryptic Research

Description: Fast. [action]: Fight. If you succeed by 2 or more, this attack deals +1 damage.
Name: Switchblade

Description: [action] Exhaust Burglary: Investigate. If you succeed, instead of discovering clues, gain 3 resources.
Name: Burglary

Description: [reaction] After you evade an enemy, exhaust Pickpocketing: Draw 1 card.
Name: Pickpocketing

Description: Uses (3 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. If you succeed by 2 or more, this attack deals +1 damage.
Name: .41 Derringer

Description: You may take an additional action during your turn.
Flavor: "I was born in Mississippi. Louisiana just sounded better."
Name: Leo De Luca

Description:
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [combat] for this skill test.
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [agility] for this skill test.
Name: Hard Knocks

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Disengage from each enemy engaged with you and move to a revealed location with no enemies.
Name: Elusive

Description: Fight. This attack uses [agility] instead of [combat]. This attack deals +2 damage.
Name: Backstab

Description: Deal 2 damage to an exhausted enemy at your location.
Name: Sneak Attack

Description:
Commit only to a skill test you are performing.
If you succeed by 3 or more, return Opportunist to your hand after this test instead of discarding it.
Name: Opportunist

Description: You may take an additional action during your turn.
Flavor: "I was born in Mississippi. Louisiana just sounded better."
Name: Leo De Luca

Description:
You get +1 [agility].
[action] Exhaust Cat Burglar: Disengage from each enemy engaged with you and move to a connecting location. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
Name: Cat Burglar

Description:
Fast. Play after you reveal a chaos token with a negative modifier.
Switch that token's "-" to a "+".
Name: Sure Gamble

Description: Gain 10 resources.
Flavor: "I win again! Sorry sugar, it's just not your night."
Name: Hot Streak

Description:
Uses (4 secrets). If Forbidden Knowledge has no secrets, discard it.
[free] Exhaust Forbidden Knowledge and take 1 horror: Move 1 secret from Forbidden Knowledge to your resource pool, as a resource.
Name: Forbidden Knowledge

Description: You get +1 [willpower].
Flavor: Whether focused through a mundane trinket or a mystical artifact, there is real power in faith all the same.
Name: Holy Rosary

Description: Uses (4 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Fight. This attack uses [willpower] instead of [combat] and deals +1 damage. If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol is revealed during this check, take 1 horror.
Name: Shrivelling

Description:
Uses (3 charges).
[action] Exhaust Scrying and spend 1 charge: Look at the top 3 cards of any investigator's deck or the encounter deck. Return them to the top of that deck in any order.
Name: Scrying

Description:
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [willpower] for this skill test.
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [intellect] for this skill test.
Name: Arcane Studies

Description: Forced - After Arcane Initiate enters play: Place 1 doom on it. [free] Exhaust Arcane Initiate: Search the top 3 cards of your deck for a [[Spell]] card and draw it. Shuffle your deck.
Name: Arcane Initiate

Description: Draw the top card of the encounter deck. Then, discover 2 clues at your location.
Flavor: "We live on a placid island of ignorance in the midst of black seas of infinity, and it was not meant that we should voyage far." <cite>H. P. Lovecraft, "The Call of Cthulhu"</cite>
Name: Drawn to the Flame

Description:
Fast. Play when you draw a non-weakness treachery card.
Cancel that card's revelation effect. Then, take 1 horror.
Name: Ward of Protection

Description: Evade. This evasion attempt uses [willpower] instead of [agility]. If you succeed, deal 1 damage to the enemy just evaded. If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol is revealed during this evasion attempt, lose 1 action this turn.
Name: Blinding Light

Description: If this skill test is successful, heal 1 horror.
Flavor: Only by standing firm against the darkness can we live to see the light of another day.
Name: Fearless

Description:
Fast. Play after a phase begins.
Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location. Treat the chosen enemy's printed text box as if it were blank (except for [[Traits]]) until the end of the phase.
Name: Mind Wipe

Description: Evade. This evasion attempt uses [willpower] instead of [agility]. If you succeed, deal 2 damage to the enemy just evaded. If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol is revealed during this evasion attempt, lose 1 action this turn and take 1 horror.
Name: Blinding Light

Description:
You have 1 additional arcane slot.
[action] Exhaust Book of Shadows: Add 1 charge to a [[Spell]] asset you control.
Name: Book of Shadows

Description:
Uses (4 charges). If Grotesque Statue has no charges, discard it.
[reaction] When you would reveal a chaos token, spend 1 charge: Reveal 2 chaos tokens instead of 1. Choose 1 of those tokens to resolve, and ignore the other.
Name: Grotesque Statue

Flavor: The coat was not the most fashionable choice, but it did feel warm and reassuring in its bulk.
Name: Leather Coat

Description: [reaction] After you successfully investigate by 2 or more, exhaust Scavenging: Choose an [[Item]] card in your discard pile and add it to your hand.
Name: Scavenging

Description: [action]: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage. If a [skull] or [auto_fail] symbol is revealed during this attack, discard Baseball Bat after the attack resolves.
Name: Baseball Bat

Description: [reaction] After you fail a skill test, exhaust Rabbit's Foot: Draw 1 card.
Flavor: They claimed it would bring me good luck. I wouldn't say that's true. But now I feel like it would be even worse luck to get rid of it.
Name: Rabbit's Foot

Description: [free] Discard Stray Cat: Automatically evade a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location.
Flavor: He never came if you called for him. It always seemed like he had his own agenda.
Name: Stray Cat

Description:
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [willpower] for this skill test.
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [agility] for this skill test.
Name: Dig Deep

Description: Evade. Automatically evade all enemies at your location.
Flavor: That should buy us some time.
Name: Cunning Distraction

Description:
Fast. Play after you fail a skill test by 2 or less while investigating.
Discover 2 clues in your location.
Name: "Look what I found!"

Description:
Fast. Play when you would fail a skill test.
Get +2 to your skill value for that test.
Name: Lucky!

Description: If this skill test is successful during an evasion attempt, the evading investigator may immediately disengage from each other enemy engaged with him or her, and may move to a connecting location.
Name: Survival Instinct

Description: [reaction] When an enemy attacks you, exhaust Aquinnah and deal 1 horror to her: Deal that enemy's damage to another enemy at your location, instead. (You still take horror dealt by the attack.)
Flavor: "Do not be frightened by what you see. Be frightened by what you cannot see."
Name: Aquinnah

Description:
Fast. Play after a non-weakness, non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location is evaded.
Shuffle that enemy into the encounter deck.
Name: Close Call

Description:
Fast. Play when you would fail a skill test.
Get +2 to your skill value for that test. Draw 1 card.
Name: Lucky!

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Until the end of your turn, do not reveal chaos tokens for any skill tests you perform.
Name: Will to Survive

Description: [action]: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack. [action] Discard Knife: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage.
Name: Knife

Description: Uses (3 supplies). [action] Spend 1 supply: Investigate. Your location gets -2 shroud for this investigation.
Name: Flashlight

Description: Gain 3 resources.
Flavor: You can never be too prepared.
Name: Emergency Cache

Description:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
If this test is successful, draw 1 card.
Flavor: Stay back! I'll handle this.
Name: Guts

Description:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
If this test is successful, draw 1 card.
Flavor: At last, I've found it!
Name: Perception

Description:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
If this test is successful, draw 1 card.
Flavor: Die, you beast!
Name: Overpower

Description:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
If this test is successful, draw 1 card.
Flavor: Too easy.
Name: Manual Dexterity

Description: Max 1 committed per skill test.
Flavor: Sometimes, the most selfless acts can come from the strangest places
Name: Unexpected Courage

Flavor: Bullets are one thing... twelve-inch fangs quite another.
Name: Bulletproof Vest

Flavor: This has been in my family for generations. Take care of it, and it will take care of you.
Name: Elder Sign Amulet

Description: Revelation - Choose and discard all but 1 card from your hand.
Flavor: Wait... where am I? What was I doing?
Name: Amnesia

Description: Revelation - Discard all your resources.
Flavor: What was that noise?
Name: Paranoia

Description: Revelation - Add Haunted to your threat area. You get -1 to each of your skills. [action] [action]: Discard Haunted.
Name: Haunted

Description: Revelation - Add Psychosis to your threat area. Forced - After you take 1 or more horror: Take 1 direct damage. [action] [action]: Discard Psychosis.
Name: Psychosis

Description: Revelation - Add Hypochondria to your threat area. Forced - After you take 1 or more damage: Take 1 direct horror. [action] [action]: Discard Hypochondria.
Name: Hypochondria

Description: Prey - Bearer only. Hunter. [action] Spend 4 resources: Parley. Discard Mob Enforcer.
Flavor: You knew you shouldn't have borrowed money from the O'Bannion gang. It seems like they're always looking to collect at the worst times.
Name: Mob Enforcer

Description: Prey - Bearer only. Hunter. Forced - After Silver Twilight Acolyte attacks: Place 1 doom on the current agenda.
Flavor: You'll never forget the day you learned the true secret of the Silver Twilight Lodge's inner circle. The truth is too terrible for the Lodge to let you live.
Name: Silver Twilight Acolyte

Description: Prey - Bearer only. Hunter. While Stubborn Detective is at your location, treat your investigator as if his or her printed text box were blank (except for [[Traits]]).
Flavor: Despite everything, he still won't believe you had nothing to do with those murders.
Name: Stubborn Detective

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull] -X. X is the number of [[Ghoul]] enemies at your location.
[cultist] -1. If you fail, take 1 horror.
[tablet] -2. If there is a [[Ghoul]] enemy at your location, take 1 damage.
Description2:
Hard / Expert
[skull] -2. If you fail, after this skill test, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Ghoul]] enemy, and draw it. Shuffle the encounter deck.
[cultist] Reveal another token. If you fail, take 2 horror.
[tablet] -4. If there is a [[Ghoul]] enemy at your location, take 1 damage and 1 horror.
Name: The Gathering

Description2: The lead investigator must decide (choose one): Either each investigator discards 1 card at random from his or her hand, or the lead investigator takes 2 horror.
Flavor: It is late at night. You are holed up in your study, researching the bloody disappearances that have been taking place in the region. A few hours into your research, you hear the sound of strange chanting coming from your parlor, down the hall. At the same time, you hear dirt churning, as if something were digging beneath the floor.
Flavor2: Your house continues to change before your very eyes. The walls have decayed, and the ground in many rooms has turned to dirt. It is almost as if you have been transported somewhere else entirely, although every now and again you recognize elements of your former home.
Name: What's Going On?!

Description2: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a [[Ghoul]] enemy is discarded. The lead investigator draws that enemy.
Flavor: The floor beneath you is giving way, and you see a vast network of tunnels, twisting into the darkness below. Shapes and silhouettes of strange creatures move swiftly through the tunnels, trying to find a way up. You probably don't want to be here when they do...
Flavor2: A feral beast, roughly humanoid with a canine cast and hooves for feet, tears through the ground in front of you. Below the floor, you can see vast tunnels beneath your house. Fiendish howling echoes from deep within the underground caverns.
Name: Rise of the Ghouls

Description: Forced - At the end of the enemy phase: Each unengaged [[Ghoul]] enemy moves 1 location towards the Parlor. Forced - At the end of the round: Place 1 doom on this agenda for each [[Ghoul]] enemy in the Hallway or Parlor.
Description2: - If the investigators are at Act 1 or 2, they are trapped inside the house as the ghouls tear them apart. (→R3) - If the investigators are at Act 3, they barely escape with their lives, allowing the ghouls to run rampant. Each investigator that has not resigned is defeated and suffers 1 physical trauma.
Flavor: You hear a crazed howl outside, and suddenly all the creatures turn their attention to that sound. They rush to escape the house, breaking down doors and clawing at everything in their way.
Flavor2: The ground begins to shake and you can see claws rising up from the dirt as uncanny creatures desperately try to claw their way out of the ground all around you. Everywhere you turn, you see monsters rising from the earth. Terrified, you flee as fast as you can.
Name: They're Getting Out!

Description2:
Put into play the set-aside Hallway, Cellar, Attic, and Parlor.
Discard each enemy in the Study.
Place each investigator in the Hallway.
Remove the Study from the game.
Flavor: As you leap to investigate, the door to your study vanishes before your eyes, leaving behind only solid wall. You're trapped inside your study until you can find another way out.
Flavor2:
You notice that the edges of your newly purchased rug are tattered and mud-stained. Finding this odd, you shift the furniture aside and pull back the rug. To your surprise, you see the door leading out of your study. You slowly turn the knob, and the door swings open, revealing your hallway below.
You jump through the doorway, landing on your feet on soft dirt. The door to the study slams shut above you. The smell of burning wood fills the narrow hall, intermingled with the scent of rot and decay.
Name: Trapped

Description: Objective - When the round ends, investigators in the hallway may, as a group, spend the requisite number of clues to advance.
Description2:
The barrier blocking passage into the parlor has vanished. Reveal the Parlor.
Put the set-aside Lita Chantler into play in the Parlor.
Spawn the set-aside Ghoul Priest in the Hallway.
Flavor: A glowing barrier blocks the path to your parlor. As you move toward it, intense heat forces you to back away. Picking up a handful of dirt, you toss it as the barrier and watch in horror as the dirt incinerates. Perhaps there's something in the cellar or attic that can help.
Flavor2: Using the barrel from the attic, you carry ice and snow from the cellar and hurl it at the barrier. The barrier sparks and shudders as it consumes the ice, then hisses and fades out of existence.
Name: The Barrier

Description: Objective - If the Ghoul Priest is Defeated, advance.
Description2: The lead investigator must decide (choose one): - It was never much of a home. Burn it down! (→R1) - This hell-pit is my home! No way are we burning it! (→R2)
Flavor: A woman with a torch stands in your parlor, a glimmer of hatred in her eyes. "What have you done to my barrier?" she screams, furious. Before you can enter, a ghastly wail sounds behind you, and a creature wearing robes and a deer skull mask tears through the wall, advancing towards you.
Flavor2:
When the robed creature falls, the fiendish swarm burrows back into the ground and the chaos of the house quiets. But the stranger in your parlor chamber doesn't seem relieved.
"You broke my seal that was set to trap the ghouls within." She raises her torch. "Now, we must take more direct measures and burn this hell-pit to the ground!"
Name: What Have You Done?

Flavor: The door to your study has vanished.
Flavor2: You've been investigating the strange events occurring in Arkham for several days now. Your deck in covered in newspaper articles, police reports, and witness accounts.
Name: Study

Flavor: The walls of your house are splattered with mud, and your hardwood floor is gone, replaced with a dirt path.
Flavor2: A moment of panic and disorientation strikes as you land upon the floor of the hallway. The world spins, as if turned on its head.
Name: Hallway

Description: Forced - After you enter the Attic: Take 1 horror.
Flavor: The bloody carcass of a malformed beast swings from a meat hook chained to the ceiling. Blood drains slowly from the carcass, dripping into a small barrel.
Flavor2: The smell of rotten meat assaults your nostrils as you approach the attic stairs.
Name: Attic

Description: Forced - After you enter the Cellar: Take 1 damage.
Flavor: Your cellar seems to have been replaced with an underground network of icy tunnels and caverns. The cold chills you to the bone.
Flavor2: The stairs leading down to your cellar are slick, and they glisten with a thin layer of ice...
Name: Cellar

Description: [action] Resign. "This is too much for me!" You run out the front door, fleeing in panic. While Lita Chantler is not controlled by a player, she gains: "[action]: Parley. Test [intellect] (4). If you succeed, take control of Lita Chantler."
Description2: The entrance to the Parlor is blocked by a darkly glowing unfathomable barrier. You cannot move into the Parlor.
Flavor2: You're unsure what would happen if you tried to cross the threshold of the strange barrier, but based on its extreme heat, you sure as hell don't want to try.
Name: Parlor

Description: Prey - Highest [combat]. Hunter. Retaliate.
Flavor: A figure in red robes wearing a bone mask. It gibbers and snarls before leaping to attack.
Name: Ghoul Priest

Description:
While you control Lita Chantler, she gains:
"Each investigator at your location gets +1 [combat].
[reaction] When an investigator at your location successfully attacks a [[Monster]] enemy: That investigator deals +1 damage."
Name: Lita Chantler

Description: Spawn - Attic.
Flavor: A monstrous creature feeds from the rotting carcass in the attic.
Name: Flesh-Eater

Description: Spawn - Cellar.
Flavor: Inside the tunnels beneath the house, a massive beast tears its way out of the ice. It is covered in a think layer of frost, its breath visible in the bitter cold.
Name: Icy Ghoul

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the highest number of doom on a [[Cultist]] enemy in play.
[cultist]: -2. Place 1 doom on the nearest [[Cultist]] enemy.
[tablet]: -3. If you fail, place 1 of your clues on your location.
Description2:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is the total number of doom in play.
[cultist]: -2. Place 1 doom on each [[Cultist]] enemy in play. If there are no [[Cultist]] enemies in play, reveal another token.
[tablet]: -4. If you fail, place all your clues on your location.
Name: The Midnight Masks

Description: [action]: Resign. You don't want to risk taking too long, so you head to safety with the information you've gathered.
Flavor: Lita seems convinced of a conspiracy within the city of Arkham. She believes that a secret cult serves the ghouls that live in the crypts beneath the city, and that several of the cult's prominent members are scattered throughout Arkham. As you begin searching for them, you can't shake the feeling that you, too, are being hunted.
Name: Predator or Prey?

Description: [action]: Resign. You don't want to risk taking too long, so you head to safety with the information you've gathered.
Flavor: The minutes pass quickly as your investigation continues.
Flavor2: Twelve bells ring out across the town. It is midnight. There is no time left to investigate the city; you must act based on the information you've collected from the cultists you've found.
Name: Time Is Running Short

Description: [action] The investigators spend 2 clues per investigator, as a group: Draw the top card of the Cultist deck. Objective - Find as many unique [[Cultist]] enemies as you can and add them to the victory display. If there are 6 unique [[Cultist]] enemies in the victory display, advance. (Note: Not all 6 of them are in the Cultist deck.)
Flavor: You have one night to find the members of this cult and unveil their plan. The more members of the cult you can find and interrogate before midnight, the better.
Flavor2: You've successfully uncovered the identities of all of the cult's high-ranking members within Arkham. The man who had stalked you throughout the city was dedicated in his conviction, as was Herman, the undertaker of the graveyard. Others seemed to have been coerced to aid the cult. Ruth, the mortician, had been told that her family would be killed if she did not supply the ghouls with fresh corpses. Thankfully, you managed to help her escape the hospital safely. Peter, the professor, had to be convinced that his involvement with the cult would do more harm than good. Victoria's obsession with occult artifacts had landed her deep within the cult's web. When you confronted Drew in the asylum, he attacked you - but interestingly, he did so because he thought you were part of the cult. The deeper you delve into this conspiracy, the clearer it becomes that many lives have been ruined by it.
Name: Uncovering the Conspiracy

Description: Forced - When the Ghoul Priest spawns: Spawn it here instead of at its normal location. [action]: Draw 1 card and gain 1 resource. (Limit once per turn.)
Flavor: You still feel uneasy about going back.
Flavor2: Despite what happened, you just couldn't bring yourself to destroy your home.
Name: Your House

Flavor: There is something unsettling about the water of the Miskatonic River tonight. It ripples and bubbles as though something is moving beneath the surface.
Flavor2: The banks of the Miskatonic River are lined with docks, warehouses and small shops in a district aptly named Rivertown.
Name: Rivertown

Description: [action]: Draw 3 cards. (Limit once per game.)
Flavor: The Georgian manor housing the Historical Society is well known for its private library, where local records, maps, and artifacts from Arkham's past hint at secrets better left alone.
Flavor2: Middle-class houses with gambrel roofs crowd together between the streets of Southside. The neighborhood is known for its cultural and social landmarks, such as South Church, Ma's Boarding House, and the Historical Society.
Name: Southside

Description: [action]: Search your deck for an [[Ally]] asset and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck. (Limit once per game.)
Flavor: Ma's is famous for its cheap rooms and Mystery Meat Mondays. A motley variety of characters can be found coming and going at all times of day.
Flavor2: Middle-class houses with gambrel roofs crowd together between the streets of Southside. The neighborhood is known for its cultural and social landmarks, such as South Church, Ma's Boarding House, and the Historical Society.
Name: Southside

Description: [action]: Heal 3 damage. (Limit once per game.)
Flavor: An extended stay at St. Mary's can do wonders for the body, but its effect on one's psyche is unclear.
Flavor2: Arkham's only hospital, St. Mary's has a twenty-four-hour receiving room and is busy at all hours of the night. Doctor Mortimore and Nurse Sharon have been particularly stressed lately, thanks in part to recent events.
Name: St. Mary's Hospital

Description: [action]: Search the top 6 cards of your deck for a [[Tome]] or [[Spell]] card and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.
Flavor: The campus is quiet and lonely. Several of the buildings have been left unlocked for students and faculty working late into the night.
Flavor2: Miskatonic University is one of the most prestigious colleges in the Northeast. The university library is famous for its collection of occult books maintained by the esteemed Dr. Henry Armitage.
Name: Miskatonic University

Description: [action]: Gain 3 resources. (Limit once per game.)
Flavor: We'll call this a "loan."
Flavor2: The Downtown area of Arkham is filled with government buildings, including City Hall. The First Bank of Arkham, Independence Square, and Arkham Asylum can also be found in this area. It is the busiest district in the city.
Name: Downtown

Description: [action]: Heal 3 horror. (Limit once per game.)
Flavor: A refuge for the mind, or a prison for the soul?
Flavor2: The Downtown area of Arkham is filled with government buildings, including City Hall. The First Bank of Arkham, Independence Square, and Arkham Asylum can also be found in this area. It is the busiest district in the city.
Name: Downtown

Description: While you are in Easttown, reduce the cost of each [[Ally]] asset you play by 2.
Flavor2: The Easttown neighborhood, situated on the northern banks of the Miskatonic River, contains lower-class housing, the Arkham Police Station, and popular eateries like Velma's Diner.
Name: Easttown

Description: Forced - After you enter the Graveyard: Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, you must either take 2 horror or move to Rivertown.
Flavor2: The graveyard lies at the foot of French Hill. Some of the headstones date back to the seventeenth century, when the earliest colonists came to Arkham. Considering what happened in your house, you're not completely keen on heading there.
Name: Graveyard

Description: [action] Spend 5 resources: Gain 2 clues from the token pool. (Group limit once per game.)
Flavor: In Northside, nothing gets people talking faster than a piece of dough.
Flavor2: Northside is a commercial district that contains many offices and factories, as well as the train station.
Name: Northside

Description: Peril. Revelation - You must choose either (choose one): Spend 1 clue or take 2 damage.
Flavor: A shadowy figure follows you in the rain. When you look back, your head pounds in agony and your vision blurs.
Name: Hunting Shadow

Description: Revelation - If you have no clues, False Lead gains surge. If you have 1 or more clues, test [intellect] (4). For each point you fail by, place 1 of your clues on your location.
Name: False Lead

Description: Spawn - Downtown. Forced - When "Wolf-Man" Drew attacks: Heal 1 damage from him.
Flavor: Drew is a longtime patient at Arkham Asylum. Rumor has it he was locked up for committing cannibalism several years ago. He is considered extremely dangerous.
Name: "Wolf-Man" Drew

Description: Spawn - Graveyard. [action] Choose and discard 4 cards from your hand: Parley. Add Herman Collins to the victory display.
Flavor: The undertaker in the local graveyard has been digging strange tunnels underneath the mausoleum... but for what purpose?
Name: Herman Collins

Description: Spawn - Miskatonic University. [action] Spend 2 clues: Parley. Add Peter Warren to the victory display.
Flavor: A professor of the occult has been seen reading strange books that relate to cannibalism. Maybe he knows something we don't?
Name: Peter Warren

Description: Spawn - Northside. [action] Spend 5 resources: Parley. Add Victoria Devereux to the victory display.
Flavor: Oliver Thomas, the proprietor of the Curiositie Shoppe, has informed you that a new client has taken a keen interest in a mysterious mask...
Name: Victoria Devereux

Description: Spawn - St. Mary's Hospital. Forced - After Ruth Turner is evaded: Add her to the victory display.
Flavor: Bodies from the morgue have mysteriously gone missing. Perhaps the mortician in St. Mary's had something to do with these disappearances.
Name: Ruth Turner

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the number of [[Monster]] enemies in play.
[cultist]: -2. Place 1 doom on the nearest enemy.
[tablet]: -3. If there is a [[Monster]] enemy at your location, take 1 damage.
[elder_thing]: -5. If there is an [[Ancient One]] enemy in play, reveal another token.
Description2:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -3. If you fail, after this skill test, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Monster]] enemy, and draw it. Shuffle the encounter deck.
[cultist]: -4. Place 2 doom on the nearest enemy.
[tablet]: -5. If there is a [[Monster]] enemy at your location, take 1 damage and 1 horror.
[elder_thing]: -7. If there is an [[Ancient One]] enemy in play, reveal another token.
Name: The Devourer Below

Description2: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck and discard cards from the top until a [[Monster]] enemy is discarded. Spawn that enemy in the Main Path. Then, place 1 doom on that enemy.
Flavor: After interrogating members of the conspiracy within Arkham, you have learned that they are performing a rite of vengeance in response to the destruction of one of their master's lairs. You have entered the woods outside Arkham to try and stop them. The woods seem unnaturally cold, and filled with a deathly silence.
Flavor2:
Throughout the woods, a shrieking cry echoes. From somewhere deeper in the forest, a score of hideous voices answer the call, inhuman as the baying of hounds and yet articulate, repeating a singular name:
"Umôrdhoth... Umôrdhoth... Umôrdhoth..."
Name: The Arkham Woods

Description: Each enemy gets +1 fight and +1 evade.
Description2: In player order, each investigator must test [willpower] (6). Each investigator who fails must search his or her collection for a random basic [[Madness]] weakness and add it to his or her hand.
Flavor:
"Umôrdhoth... Umôrdhoth... Umôrdhoth..."
The chanting builds in intensity, echoing into the cold air of the night. The sparse clouds in the sky coalesce above the Arkham woods, blotting out the faint light of the stars.
Flavor2: A dark presence approaches, and you are assaulted by invisible pressures that bring you to your knees. A terrible force threatens to invade your mind and soul. Your throat clenches and your eyes water as the sensation burns through you.
Name: The Ritual Begins

Description: Forced - When this agenda advances: - If the investigators are at Act 1, put the set-aside Ritual Site into play and spawn the set-aside Umôrdhoth there. - If the investigators are at Act 2 or 3, discard all enemies at the Ritual Site and spawn the set-aside Umôrdhoth there.
Description2: Revelation - Replace the current Act and Agenda with The Devourer Below. This card is both the current Act and the current Agenda. Objective - If Umôrdhoth is defeated, (→R2)
Flavor: The world begins to shift and change as the ritual nears its conclusion. The air grows chilly, and the entire forest is covered in a layer of rime. The trees bend unnaturally, and their shadows lengthen into weird shape.
Name: Vengeance Awaits

Description2:
Put the set-aside Ritual Site into play if it is not already in play.
Search the collection for each enemy recorded in your Campaign Log under "Cultists Who Got Away," and spawn those enemies at the Main Path.
Flavor: The evidence you've gathered has led you to the woods south of Arkham, where you believe a ritual to summon a being called "Umôrdhoth" is about to take place. Steeling your resolve, you set forth deeper into the woods, hoping to find the site of this ritual.
Flavor2:
Scattered throughout the forest you've seen glyphs and arcane sigils in various places - etched into the bark of trees, carved upon the faces of stones, and dripped in blood upon the ground. Though you cannot decipher these glyphs, you notice that most of them tend to face south. Following these signs leads you by twists and turns towards a cave in the darkest and coldest part of the forest.
As you advance, shadowy figures emerge from the trees, blocking the only path to the cave.
Name: Investigating the Trail

Description: Objective - If an investigator enters the Ritual Site, advance.
Description2: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until 1 enemy is discarded (2 enemies instead if there are 3 or more players in the game). Spawn each discarded enemy at the Ritual Site.
Flavor: The remaining cultists have followed you into the woods to try to stop you, and now they block the path to your objective. They stand ominously beneath the overhanging trees, silent sentinels in the night. You must defeat them or sneak past if you are to gain access to the site of their ritual.
Flavor2: When you enter the cave, the air grows cold, and your nostrils are assaulted by the pungent smell of blood and rot.
Name: Into the Darkness

Description: [action] Spend 1 clue: Test [willpower] (3) or [agility] (3). If you succeed, place 1 clue on this Act. Objective - If there are 2 clues per investigator on this Act, advance.
Flavor: The site of the cult's ritual is inside a large cavern in a dark corner of the woods. In the center of the chamber is a candlelit circle marked by rocks and arcane runes.
Flavor2: You brave the unnatural chill and weave through arcane symbols, crossing the threshold of the circle. You smother the markings on the ground, covering them with dirt, breaking apart the carefully constructed pattern of smooth rocks. A shrill noise pierces your ears as the air grows suddenly warmer, and the world distorts around you, settling into normality.
Name: Disrupting the Ritual

Description: The Main Path is connected to each other [[Woods]] location. [action]: Resign. "There's nothing we can do to stop them!" You flee from the woods, leaving Arkham to its grisly fate.
Flavor2: Hangman's Brook separates Uptown from the woods south of Arkham. Passing over the small bridge, you follow the main path deeper into the trees.
Name: Main Path

Description: Forced - After you enter this location: Test [willpower] (4). If you fail, take 1 horror and 1 damage.
Flavor: This clearing has been the site of dark rites since colonists first came to the area over two centuries ago.
Flavor2: Growing up, you were always warned to stay out of the woods at night. Now you know why.
Name: Arkham Woods

Description: Forced - When you move out of this location: Test [intellect] (3). If you fail, cancel the effects of the move.
Flavor: This path seems to twist and turn upon itself, almost as if it were alive.
Flavor2: Growing up, you were always warned to stay out of the woods at night. Now you know why.
Name: Arkham Woods

Description: This location is investigated using [willpower] instead of the skill indicated by the investigation attempt.
Flavor: A house at the edge of the trail, covered in vines. Inside, the walls and floors are bloodstained and littered with dirt, mud, and discarded bones.
Flavor2: Growing up, you were always warned to stay out of the woods at night. Now you know why.
Name: Arkham Woods

Description: This location is investigated using [agility] instead of the skill indicated by the investigation attempt.
Flavor: Atop a nearby plateau, you can see signs of cultist activity. You will have to climb the cliff in order to reach the top.
Flavor2: Growing up, you were always warned to stay out of the woods at night. Now you know why.
Name: Arkham Woods

Description: This location is investigated using [combat] instead of the skill indicated by the investigation attempt.
Flavor: An old horse trail in colonial days, this overgrown path hasn't been used in over a decade.
Flavor2: Growing up, you were always warned to stay out of the woods at night. Now you know why.
Name: Arkham Woods

Description: [action]: Heal 1 damage or heal 1 horror. (Limit once per turn.)
Flavor: This would be a nice picnic spot, if it weren't for all the monsters.
Flavor2: Growing up, you were always warned to stay out of the woods at night. Now you know why.
Name: Arkham Woods

Description: Forced - At the end of the round, if there are fewer than 2 clues per investigator on Ritual Site: Add clues to it until it has 2 clues per investigator on it.
Flavor: The sigils on the wall begin to flicker in and out of focus, and the air grows heavy with the smell of death.
Flavor2: The large central chamber of a cold, dark cavern, adorned with arcane markings and dimly lit by candlelight.
Name: Ritual Site

Description: Hunter. Massive. Umôrdhoth gets +4 health per investigator. Forced - At the end of each investigator's turn: Ready Umôrdhoth. [action] If you control Lita Chantler: "It's only after her!" You throw Lita to Umôrdhoth in order to spare your lives. (→R3)
Name: Umôrdhoth

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (5). For each point you fail by, you must either (choose one): Choose and discard a card from your hand, or take 1 damage and 1 horror.
Flavor: A deathly chill from below engulfs you, attempting to suck your life force away.
Name: Umôrdhoth's Wrath

Description: Hunter.
Flavor: A horde of cruel rats skitters forth in an undulating wave of claws, teeth, and mottled fur.
Name: Swarm of Rats

Flavor: It was a colossal and nameless blasphemy with glaring red eyes, and it held in bony claws a thing that had been a man, gnawing at the head as a child nibbles at a stick of candy. <cite>H. P. Lovecraft, "Pickman's Model"</cite>
Name: Ghoul Minion

Description: Prey - Lowest remaining health.
Flavor: The sight of the thing raised the question: Do we eat to live, or do we live to eat?
Name: Ravenous Ghoul

Description: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). For each point you fail by, take 1 damage.
Flavor: Decaying hands rise up from below and grasp and claw at your ankles.
Name: Grasping Hands

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). For each point you fail by, take 1 horror.
Flavor: A sickening display of gore causes you to retch. You're glad this wasn't you.
Name: Rotting Remains

Description: Revelation - Put Frozen in Fear into play in your threat area. The first time you perform one of the following actions (move, fight, or evade) each round, it costs 1 additional action. Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Frozen in Fear.
Name: Frozen in Fear

Description: Revelation - Put Dissonant Voices into play in your threat area. You cannot play assets or events. Forced - At the end of the round: Discard Dissonant Voices.
Name: Dissonant Voices

Description: Revelation - Place 1 doom on the current agenda. This effect can cause the current agenda to advance.
Flavor: Dark forces stir against you. If you do not act quickly, a sinister plot will be fulfilled.
Name: Ancient Evils

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (4). If you fail, choose and discard 1 asset you control (if you cannot, take 2 damage instead).
Flavor: The supernatural cold threatens to freeze your soul.
Name: Crypt Chill

Description: Revelation - Attach to your location. Limit 1 per location. Attached location gets +2 shroud. Forced - After attached location is successfully investigated: Discard Obscuring Fog.
Name: Obscuring Fog

Description: Spawn - Any empty location. Forced - After Acolyte enters play: Place 1 doom on it.
Flavor: It was only a small sacrifice.
Name: Acolyte

Description: Spawn - Any empty location. Retaliate. Forced - At the end of the mythos phase: Place 1 doom on Wizard of the Order.
Name: Wizard of the Order

Description: Revelation - Place 2 doom on the nearest [[Cultist]] enemy. If there are no [[Cultist]] enemies in play, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Cultist]] enemy and draw it. Shuffle the encounter deck.
Name: Mysterious Chanting

Description:
Hunter.
While attempting to evade Hunting Nightgaunt, double the negative modifier of each revealed chaos token.
Flavor: ... they had no faces at all to smile with, but only a suggestive blankness where a face ought to be. <cite>H. P. Lovecraft</cite>
Name: Hunting Nightgaunt

Description: Revelation - Test [agility] (4). If you fail, take 1 horror and 1 damage. Then, disengage with each non-[[Nightgaunt]] enemy engaged with you and move to a [[Central]] location.
Flavor: A nightgaunt swoops down from the sky and grabs you with its clawed hands, carrying you off into the night.
Name: On Wings of Darkness

Description: Revelation - Attach to the location in play with the most clues, and without a Locked Door attached. The attached location cannot be investigated. [action]: Test [combat] (4) to break down the door or [agility] (4) to pick the lock. If you succeed, discard Locked Door.
Name: Locked Door

Description: Prey - Lowest remaining sanity. Hunter. While engaged with an investigator with remaining sanity 4 or fewer, Screeching Byakhee gets +1 fight and +1 evade.
Name: Screeching Byakhee

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (4). If you fail, take 2 horror and search your deck for a [[Madness]] weakness. Draw that card and shuffle your deck.
Flavor: They came to me slowly as if I had forgotten them, and at last I could make some sense out of the sounds. It was this: "Have you found the Yellow Sign?" <cite>Robert W. Chambers, "The Yellow Sign"</cite>
Name: The Yellow Sign

Description: Prey - Fewest cards in hand. Forced - When Yithian Observer attacks you: Discard 1 card at random from your hand. If you cannot, Yithian Observer deals +1 damage and +1 horror for this attack.
Name: Yithian Observer

Description: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): draw 2 cards and place 2 doom on the current agenda (this effect can cause the current agenda to advance), or take 2 horror.
Flavor: A voice inside your head offers you power... For a price.
Name: Offer of Power

Description: Prey - Lowest [agility]. Forced - At the end of the round: Heal 2 damage from Relentless Dark Young.
Flavor: The trees trembled, leaves fluttering around us. The earth shook as the thuds of giant hooved feet grew ever closer...
Name: Relentless Dark Young

Description: Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - After Goat Spawn is defeated: Each investigator at this location takes 1 horror.
Flavor: The creature was at once terrible and graceful, the result of blasphemous trafficks with some otherworldly horror.
Name: Goat Spawn

Description: Prey - Lowest [combat]. Hunter. Forced - After Young Deep One engages you: Take 1 horror.
Name: Young Deep One

Description: Revelation - Put Dreams of R'lyeh into play in your threat area. You get -1 [willpower] and -1 sanity. [action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, Discard Dreams of R'lyeh.
Name: Dreams of R'lyeh

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -2 (-4 instead if you are at a [[Bayou]] location).
[cultist]: -2. If the Rougarou is in your location, reveal another token.
[tablet]: Reveal another token. If you fail, until the end of the round, you cannot move.
[elder_thing]: -4. If the Rougarou is at your location, it attacks you.
Description2:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -3 (-6 instead if you are at a [[Bayou]] location).
[cultist]: -3. If the Rougarou is in your location, reveal another token.
[tablet]: Reveal another token. If you fail, until the end of the round, you cannot move.
[elder_thing]: -4. If the Rougarou is at your location or a connecting location, it attacks you.
Name: Curse of the Rougarou

Description2:
Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.
If The Rougarou is in play, find a non-[[Bayou]] location with the fewest clues on it. Move The Rougarou (one location at a time) until it enters that location.
If The Rougarou is not in play, after advancing to agenda 2a, add 1 doom to that agenda.
Flavor: After arriving in New Orleans the next day, you start your investigation by asking the locals what they knew of the recent killings. As you suspected, most know very little of the incidents. You do manage to find several eyewitnesses who give similar descriptions of the creature: its lithe, muscular form, lanky arms, and wolf-like visage. A promising start - but if there is any truth to the rumors about this "curse", you'll have to talk to Lady Esprit herself.
Flavor2: A violent storm rolls in as your search continues. Black rainclouds conquer the sky, the air thick with humidity. You recall that all of the recent killings took place late at night, under the cover of dark clouds. A shiver runs down your spine - what if you are next?
Name: A Creature of the Bayou

Description2:
Shuffle all copies of On the Prowl from the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.
If The Rougarou is in play, find a non-[[Bayou]] location with the fewest clues on it. Move The Rougarou (one location at a time) until it enters that location.
If The Rougarou is not in play, after advancing to agenda 3a, add 1 doom to that agenda.
Flavor: Around you, the bayou feasts. Flesh rips and jaws snap just beyond the trees, and light droplets of rain ripple upon the surface of the water. You can't tell exactly where the sounds are coming from. Perhaps it's the dreadful ambience of the bayou itself.
Flavor2: A clash of thunder roars through the sky, and you reel in pain from the sudden explosion of noise. Your vision doubles, and bile leaps up your throat. A lone howl returns the call of the sky, echoing throughout the bayou. You wrench yourself off the muddy ground and find your bearings, unable to shake the feeling that you're running out of time.
Name: The Rougarou Feeds

Description: Forced - At the end of the investigation phase, if The Rougarou is not engaged with an investigator: Add 1 doom to this agenda.
Description2:
The bearer of the Curse of the Rougarou weakness read the following (out loud):
You feel something dripping from your hand, and are surprised to find your knuckles bloody and torn. Nearby, the bard of a tree is smashed and dripping with blood. The anger of your failure slowly fades as you realize the blood is yours.
(→R1)
If no investigators gained the Curse of the Rougarou: (→R1)
Flavor: Tendrils of slime ooze from the bogs, crawling over tree roots and grasping at you as you pass. The air hangs heavy with a noxious heat. You feel as though you are sinking, sinking deep into the bayou, sinking beneath the heaviness of the black sky and the rank mist...
Flavor2: A high-pitched shriek echoes through the bayou, followed by the sinister howls of the accursed Rougarou. The beast has drawn blood again - this you are sure of.
Name: The Curse Spreads

Description: Objective - Only investigators at a [[Bayou]] location may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.
Description2:
Put the set-aside Lady Esprit into play at a [[Bayou]] location. Put into play each set aside location. Put the set-aside The Rougarou enemy into play at any non-[[Bayou]] location. Shuffle the encounter discard pile and each encounter card from the Curse of the Rougarou encounter set into the encounter deck. The lead investigator reads the following (out loud):
As you leave Lady Esprit's shack, a terrible sickness courses through you, and you drop to your knees.
The lead investigator puts the set-aside Curse of the Rougarou weakness into play in his or her threat area.
Flavor: According to your contact, Lady Esprit is a Voodoo priestess who lives deep within the bayou. Most tend to stay clear of her lonely shack. After all, the bayou can be a dangerous place, even were it not for the recent rash of savage killings.
Flavor2: Finding Lady Esprit's shack is no simple endeavor, but eventually you spot the decrepit shanty through the mist. Lady Esprit greets you as you enter, not at all surprised by your intrusion. She claims that the Rougarou was once a man, cursed by a being known as "Shub-Niggurath" into the form of a great wolf. She believes that she can lift the Rougarou's curse from the bayou, but only if the creature is destroyed.
Name: Finding Lady Esprit

Description: Forced - After The Rougarou leaves a location: Place 1 clue from the token bank on that location. Objective - "We have to destroy the beast!" If The Rougarou is defeated: (→R2) Objective - "Maybe there's another way..." While an investigator is engaged with The Rougarou, he or she may choose to advance. (Limit once per phase.)
Description2: If each of the following requirements are met, proceed to (→R3). Otherwise, flip this act back to its "a" side. - "We must learn more about the curse." The investigators must have 4 [per_investigator] clues, as a group. - "We must keep it contained." The Rougarou must have a [[Trap]] card attached to it. - "We must protect ourselves." The Rougarou must have at least 1 [per_investigator] damage on it. - "We must calm it down." The investigators must have either "found a binding stone" or "found a strange doll."
Flavor: The Rougarou is somewhere within the vast bayou. You must track it down and destroy it, lest the beast's curse consume you as well.
Flavor2: Conversing with the creature is a daunting task. Whenever it is cornered, it bellows and attacks, like a feral beast. If there is still some semblance of humanity left inside the create, it is buried deep beneath the rage and bloodlust of the curse.
Name: Hunting the Rougarou

Description: [action]: Take 1 damage. You get +2 to your skill value for the next skill test you make this turn. Forced - When you leave Cursed Shores: Choose and discard a skill card from your hand.
Flavor2: Black storm clouds loom above you, watching patiently as you trudge through the bayou. Their shapes twist and churn in the night sky, blotting out the stars.
Name: Cursed Shores

Description: [action]: Test [agility] (7) to try to break into a nearby greenhouse and take a look around. If you succeed, remember that the investigators have "found a strange doll."
Flavor: A trail of blood and mangled flesh led you here. You suspect this is no ordinary garden.
Flavor2: It is late, but the city's nightlife is in full swing. Jazz clubs and speakeasies rule the night. But your interest lies elsewhere...
Name: Garden District

Description: [action]: Resign. "We can't catch the beast!" You make your way to safety, letting the beast roam free.
Flavor: People are just now beginning to settle what began as an untamed marsh. Truth is, some evils run too deep to exorcise that easily.
Flavor2: It is late, but the city's nightlife is in full swing. Jazz clubs and speakeasies rule the night. But your interest lies elsewhere...
Name: Broadmoor

Description:
While you are at Brackish Waters, you cannot play assets.
[action] Discard 2 assets from your hand or from play: Test [agility] (3) to wade through the dark waters and retrieve an abandoned fishing net. If you succeed, take control of the set-aside Fishing Net asset.
Flavor2: The reeking odor of dead fish overwhelms your senses. You can't help but hold your breath as you wade through the repugnant shallows.
Name: Brackish Waters

Description: Forced - When you evade an enemy at Audubon Park: Discard a random card from your hand.
Flavor: Leaves flutter in the cold wind, breaking the stillness of the park. With an area strangely abandoned, you feel as though you don't belong here.
Flavor2: Even at this late hour, bells and shouts sound across the piers as dockworkers go about their business.
Name: Audubon Park

Description: While you are at Fauborg Marigny, reduce the cost of each asset you play by 1. [action]: Resign. "We can't catch the beast!" You make your way to safety, letting the beast roam free.
Flavor2: Even at this late hour, bells and shouts sound across the piers as dockworkers go about their business.
Name: Faubourg Marigny

Description: Forced - When you leave Forgotten Marsh: Lose 2 resources.
Flavor2: You warily eye the web of vines and blackened bog waters before you, and your heart sinks. You long for the comforts of home, and yet you press onward.
Name: Forgotten Marsh

Description:
While you are at Trapper's Cabin, you cannot gain resources.
[action] Spend 5 resources: Test [intellect] (3) to convince an old trapper to sell you his last bear trap. If you succeed, take control of the set-aside Bear Trap asset.
Flavor2: After hours of navigating through impenetrable fog and overgrowth, your clothes stick to your skin and you swat at what seems like the thousandth mosquito.
Name: Trapper's Cabin

Description: [action]: Gain 2 resources and take 1 horror.
Flavor: This region is covered in twisted plants that grow odd-looking berries. They look absolutely delicious...
Flavor2: After hours of navigating through impenetrable fog and overgrowth, your clothes stick to your skin and you swat at what seems like the thousandth mosquito.
Name: Twisted Underbrush

Description:
While you are at Foul Swamp, you cannot heal horror or cancel horror.
[action] Take up to 3 horror: Test [willpower] (7) to search the boneyard. You get +1 [willpower] for this test for each horror taken as part of this ability's cost. If you succeed, remember that the investigators have "found an ancient binding stone."
Flavor2: The stench of death and decay washes over you as you slog through this putrid swamp. It's hard to imagine what could live in these waters, sullied as they are by rot and putrefaction.
Name: Foul Swamp

Description: Forced - After you end your turn at Ritual Grounds: Draw 1 card and take 1 horror.
Flavor: A macabre display greets you as you venture deeper into the bayou, where black magick and occult rituals find their home.
Flavor2:
Iä! Iä Shub-Niggurath!
Que tous les démons volent de cette endroit,
The world is your prey, your bloodlust unending...
Name: Ritual Grounds

Description: [action] Spend 2 resources: Heal 2 horror. (Limit once per game.)
Flavor: These cairnstones were placed here centuries ago, their purpose unknown.
Flavor2:
Iä! Iä! Shub-Niggurath!
Que tous les démons volent de cette endroit,
The world is your prey, your bloodlust unending...
Name: Overgrown Cairns

Description: [action] Exhaust Lady Esprit and deal her 1 horror: Heal 2 damage or gain 2 resources. Any investigator at Lady Esprit's location may activate this ability.
Name: Lady Esprit

Description: [free]: Attach Bear Trap to your location. Forced - After The Rougarou enters attached location: Attach Bear Trap to The Rougarou. Attached enemy gets -1 fight and -1 evade.
Name: Bear Trap

Description:
[free] If The Rougarou is exhausted and at your location: Attach Fishing Net to The Rougarou.
Attached enemy loses retaliate.
Name: Fishing Net

Description: Prey - Lowest [agility]. While Bog Gator is at a [[Bayou]] location, it gets +2 fight and +2 evade.
Flavor: They were apex predators even before the curse took hold.
Name: Bog Gator

Description: Spawn - Any [[Bayou]] location. Swamp Leech cannot be evaded. Forced - When Swamp Leech enters a non-[[Bayou]] location: Discard it.
Name: Swamp Leech

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). For each point you fail by, take 1 damage. If you are at a [[Bayou]] location, you cannot commit cards to this skill test.
Name: Cursed Swamp

Description: Revelation - Attach to a [[Bayou]] location. Limit 1 per location. Each skill test performed at attached location gets +1 difficulty. [action]: Test [intellect] (2) to disrupt the source of the mist. If you succeed, discard Spectral Mist.
Name: Spectral Mist

Description: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). If you fail, add Dragged Under to your threat area. Forced - When you leave your current location: take 2 damage and discard Dragged Under. Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [agility] (3). If you succeed, discard Dragged Under.
Name: Dragged Under

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). For each point you fail by, take 1 horror. If you are at a [[Bayou]] location, you cannot commit cards to this skill test.
Flavor: There are dangers deep within the mire you can only begin to imagine.
Name: Ripples on the Surface

Description: Aloof. Retaliate. As an additional cost for an investigator to engage The Rougarou, the investigators must spend 1 clue, as a group (2 clues instead if there are 3 or 4 investigators). Forced - After The Rougarou takes 1 [per_investigator] damage during a single phase: Find the location that is farthest from all investigator. Move The Rougarou (one location at a time) until it enters that location.
Name: The Rougarou

Description: Revelation - Put Curse of the Rougarou into play in your threat area. Forced - At the end of your turn, if you have not dealt any damage this turn: Take 1 horror.
Flavor: Your stomach convulses and you feel the first ghastly pangs of hunger.
Name: Curse of the Rougarou

Description: Fast. Set the base value of your [willpower] and [intellect] to 2. Set the base value of your [combat] and [agility] to 5. [action] Exhaust Monstrous Transformation: Fight. You deal +1 damage for this attack.
Name: Monstrous Transformation

Description: Spawn - Any non-[[Bayou]] location. Prey - Lowest remaining health. Hunter. Forced - When Slime-Covered Dhole enters a location: Each investigator at that location takes 1 horror.
Name: Slime-Covered Dhole

Description: Spawn - Any [[Bayou]] location. Hunter.
Flavor: A great thrashing accompanied by an echoing roar turns your blood to ice.
Name: Marsh Gug

Description: Spawn - Any [[Bayou]] location. Forced - When 1 or more clues are placed on Dark Young Host's location: Place those clues on Dark Young Host. Forced - When Dark Young Host is defeated: Move all clues on Dark Young Host to its location.
Name: Dark Young Host

Description: Surge. Revelation - Find a non-[[Bayou]] location with the fewest clues on it. Move The Rougarou (one location at a time) until it enters that location.
Flavor: A dreadful howl pierces your eardrums. The Rougarou is on the move...
Name: On the Prowl

Description: Revelation - The Rougarou makes an immediate attack against each investigator at The Rougarou's location and each connecting location. If no attacks were made by this effect, place 1 doom on the current agenda.
Flavor: Driven by hunger, it cares for naught but its next meal.
Name: Beast of the Bayou

Description: Revelation - Attach to The Rougarou. The Rougarou gets +1 fight, +1 damage, +1 horror, and cannot be evaded. Forced - After The Rougarou takes damage: Discard Insatiable Bloodlust.
Name: Insatiable Bloodlust

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -2. This token has an additional -1 for each Innocent Reveler underneath the agenda deck.
[cultist]: Reveal another token. If you fail this test, draw the top card of the encounter deck.
[tablet]: -3. If you fail, deal 1 damage or 1 horror to the nearest Innocent Reveler in play.
[elder_thing]: -4. If you fail and Cnidathqua is in play, it attacks you.
Description2:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -2. This token has an additional -1 for each Innocent Reveler underneath the act or agenda decks.
[cultist]: Reveal another token. If you fail this test, draw the top card of the encounter deck.
[tablet]: -4. Deal 1 damage or 1 horror to the nearest Innocent Reveler in play.
[elder_thing]: -6. If you fail and Cnidathqua is in play, it attacks you.
Name: Carnevale of Horrors

Flavor: Last-minute ocean liner tickets from Boston to Italy set you back a fair bit of dough, but after a tense journey, you arrive in Venice. The Carnevale has already begun, and the city is in celebration. Colorful confetti rains from above, covering the streets. Many revelers throng in Piazza San Marco, the square outside of Basilica. The parade is to begin shortly. You find the nearest uniformed Carabinieri and show him a copy of the symbol you'd transcribed from "Zanni's" mask. He pauses to decide your trustworthiness, nods, and escorts you into the basilica to see the Abbess Allegria Di Biase.
Name: The Festivities Begin

Description2:
If there are 1 or more Masked Carnevale-Goers in play, the lead investigator chooses 1 and flips it to its other side. If its other side is an Innocent Reveler, place it underneath the agenda deck.
If there is still a Masked Carnevale-Goer in play, flip this agenda back to agenda 2a.
Otherwise, advance to agenda 3a.
Flavor: The clamor and celebration of the Carnevale has for the most part drowned out the terrors you've seen in the city... Until now. The sun vanishes behind the moon, and darkness overtakes the sky. There is a solitary cry and the sound of crashing water. Within moments, screams erupt throughout the city. And yet, somehow, you see revelers still celebrating with wide, crazed smiles.
Flavor2: The shadow of the eclipse is unrelenting. Throughout the city, a dull chant overtakes the screaming and the chaos, its language ancient and morbid. Tentacles course through the canals from the south, weaving beneath bridges and trapping entire islands within their grasp.
Name: The Shadow of the Eclipse

Description: Forced - After a Writhing Appendage enters play: Place 2 doom on it.
Description2: In player order, Cnidathqua attacks each investigator in play, regardless of their location. Damage and horror from these attacks must be assigned to an Innocent Reveler first, if able. Then, flip this agenda back to agenda 3a.
Flavor: In the lagoon, an ancient terror stirs. The creature's tentacles coil around the city, and the water level begins to rise. As if in response, the chanting you hear throughout the city grows louder.
Flavor2: Great tentacle-arms, covered with acrid slime, rise from the canals and lash at you and anyone else unfortunate enough to be in the vicinity.
Name: Chaos at the Carnevale

Description: [action] The investigators spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Look at the other side of a Masked Carnevale-Goer at any location. Objective - If there are a total of 3 Innocent Revelers underneath the act and/or agenda decks, advance.
Description2:
Put the set-aside Cnidathqua enemy into play in the center of all of the locations. For the remainder of the scenario, Cnidathqua is considered to be in play but is not at any location.
The lead investigator chooses a Masked Carnevale-Goer in play and flips it to its other side.
Flavor: The abbess addresses you privately: "So, you know what is coming?" You nod. "Then you know what must be done. They are using the celebration as a sacrifice for their wretched master. Bring as many innocents as you can here, where I can protect them. But beware - the creature's servants will try to blend into the crowd with their false masks."
Flavor2: Many of the revelers are under the sway of a foul spell, and they cannot see the danger emerging around them. You push your way through the crowded streets, gathering what few sane revelers you can find and guiding them toward the relative safety of the Basilica. As the last of them is escorted inside, the ground shakes violently, and a watery shape looms above the island to the south from deep within the lagoon. Their ritual nearly finished, the "revelers" in the streets begin to unmask...
Name: The Carnevale Conspiracy

Description: Forced - After the mythos phase begins: Choose a Masked Carnevale-Goer in play and flip it to its other side. Objective - If each undefeated investigator is at Canal-side, advance.
Flavor: The civilians in the Basilica are safe for now, but Venice is doomed if you don't act quickly. The only way to ensure the safety of the sacrifices is to draw the creature in the lagoon away from the city. Sweat beads down your forehead as you realize this decision may be your last. Legs trembling, you head towards the moored boats docked by the canals.
Name: Get to the Boats!

Description: Forced - When you would draw the top card of the encounter deck: Instead look at the top 5 cards of the encounter deck and put each Writhing Appendage among those cards into play, engaged with you. Discard the rest of those cards. Objective - If there are 4 [per_investigator] resources on Gondola, advance.
Flavor: Relief turns to desperation as the creature draws its attention to your gondola. You have only one chance if you are to survive.
Flavor2: The skin on your hands blisters, rubbed raw by the oar, and your arms ache with pain. The creature movement is slow, its body covered in acrid slime, but its countless tentacles lash at you from the dark waters, coiling around your gondola and attempting to pry the oar out of your hands. With a heart-wrenching snap, the oar splinters into two pieces, the bottom half splashing into the lagoon. You desperately try to propel the gondola forward using any means you can, but it is futile. The beast gains on you, looming over the boat with an impossible feathery shape, its tendrils reaching for you. Above it, the black shape of the moon begins to slide. A thin crescent of sunlight pierces through the mist as the eclipse ends, and the creature's tendrils recoil to surround its body. Slowly it sinks into the lagoon, its body melting as the sun escapes its prison.
Name: Row!

Description:
San Marco Basilica is connected to the location in the clockwise direction.
[action]: Place an Innocent Reveler you control underneath the act deck, out of play.
Description2: San Marco Basilica is connected to the location in the clockwise direction.
Flavor: Blessed and warded by the abbess, the Basilica is about as safe a place as you can find in Venice. But it is not safe enough.
Flavor2: You cannot help but marvel at the Basilica's opulence and towering presence. In the piazza outside, revelers dance and celebrate, oblivious to their peril.
Name: San Marco Basilica

Description:
Canal-side is connected to the location in the clockwise direction.
[reaction] After you enter Canal-side: Place 1 clue on Canal-side from the token bank.
Description2: Canal-side is connected to the location in the clockwise direction.
Flavor: The water ripples and swells, causing some boats to sway and even capsize. You made a mental note to stay away from the docks.
