Flavor2: Canals course through the city's many islands, lined with gondole, traghetti, and other boats. The redolence of the festival clashes with the pungent odor of the water. Here the music of the Carnevale is faded, replaced by the sound of gentle sloshing against the docks and canal walls.
Name: Canal-side

Description: Streets of Venice is connected to the location in the clockwise direction. [free]: Move (to the location in the clockwise direction).
Description2: Streets of Venice is connected to the location in the clockwise direction.
Flavor2: The parade of masks follows a circuitous route through the city, through the canal-side walkways and over more bridges than you can count. Streamers and confetti litter the streets where the parade has already passed by.
Name: Streets of Venice

Description: Rialto Bridge is connected to the location in the clockwise direction. Forced - After you leave Rialto Bridge: Lose 1 action.
Description2: Rialto Bridge is connected to the location in the clockwise direction.
Flavor2: The Ponte di Rialto is the oldest bridge spanning the Grand Canal. It has endured for centuries, but even its stone may crumble should you fail.
Name: Rialto Bridge

Description:
Venetian Garden is connected to the location in the clockwise direction.
[action] [action] Spend 2 resources: Heal 2 horror. (Limit once per game.)
Description2: Venetian Garden is connected to the location in the clockwise direction.
Flavor: The garden's quiet elegance stands in stark contrast to the raucous celebrations throughout the city.
Flavor2: The parade's path meanders away from the canals and winds through a beautiful garden. Moonlight streams through the leaves, dappling the ancient marble statues.
Name: Venetian Garden

Description: Bridge of Sighs is connected to the location in the clockwise direction. Forced - After you leave Bridge of Sighs: Take 1 horror.
Description2: Bridge of Sighs is connected to the location in the clockwise direction.
Flavor2: With a pang of discomfort, you imagine how disheartening the view would be from inside the enclosed bridge, looking out of its cramped windows.
Name: Bridge of Sighs

Description:
Flooded Square is connected to the location in the clockwise direction.
[action]: Automatically evade a non-[[Elite]] enemy at the location in the counter-clockwise direction. (Group limit once per turn.)
Description2: Flooded Square is connected to the location in the clockwise direction.
Flavor2: As the rising tide of the acqua alta floods the square, you trudge through the numbingly cold water. The parade continues across a makeshift wooden bridge that spans the square, too narrow for your comfort.
Name: Flooded Square

Description: Accademia Bridge is connected to the location in the clockwise direction. Forced - After you leave Accademia Bridge: Lose 2 resources.
Description2: Accademia Bridge is connected to the location in the clockwise direction.
Flavor2: The long and narrow Ponte dell'Accademia is one of only four bridges that span the Grand Canal. Many pairs of yellow eyes gaze at the bridge from the academy's high windows, seemingly waiting for you to cross...
Name: Accademia Bridge

Description:
The Guardian is connected to the location in the clockwise direction.
[reaction] After you enter The Guardian: Draw 1 card.
Description2: The Guardian is connected to the location in the clockwise direction.
Flavor: You're sure it's made of stone. Why does it seem so alive?
Flavor2: The statue's eyes seem to glow with the light of the moon.
Name: The Guardian

Description:
Hunter.
While resolving the hunter keyword on Don Lagorio, his location is connected to the location in the counter-clockwise direction, as well as the clockwise direction.
Name: Don Lagorio

Description: Aloof. Forced - When you look at Elisabetta Magro using the ability on Act 1a: Flip her to this side. Forced - When the mythos phase ends: Place 1 doom on Elisabetta Magro.
Name: Elisabetta Magro

Description:
Retaliate.
Salvatore Neri's fight value is equal to the attacking investigator's base [combat].
Salvatore Neri's evade value is equal to the evading investigator's base [agility].
Name: Salvatore Neri

Description:
Hunter.
While resolving the hunter keyword on Savio Corvi, his location is connected to the location across from him, as well as in the clockwise direction.
Name: Savio Corvi

Description: [action]: Parley. Test [intellect] (2) to convince the reveler to follow you to safety. If you succeed, take control of Innocent Reveler. Forced - When Innocent Reveler would be discarded: Place it underneath the agenda deck, out of play. Each investigator takes 1 horror.
Name: Innocent Reveler

Description: [free]: Exhaust Abbess Allegria Di Biase: Move from her location to a connecting location, or to her location from a location connected to it. Any investigator may trigger this ability.
Name: Abbess Allegria Di Biase

Description:
Limit 1 [[Mask]] in play.
[reaction] After Bauta enters play: Gain 2 resources.
[reaction] When you initiate a non-[combat] test, discard Bauta: Use [combat] for this test, instead of the skill indicated.
Name: Bauta

Description:
Limit 1 [[Mask]] in play.
[reaction] After Medico Della Peste enters play: You heal 1 damage or 1 horror.
[reaction] When you initiate a non-[willpower] test, discard Medico Della Peste: Use [willpower] for this test, instead of the skill indicated.
Name: Medico Della Peste

Description:
Limit 1 [[Mask]] in play.
[reaction] After Pantalone enters play: Draw 2 cards.
[reaction] When you initiate a non-[intellect] test, discard Pantalone: Use [intellect] for this test, instead of the skill indicated.
Name: Pantalone

Description:
Limit 1 [[Mask]] in play.
[reaction] After Gilded Volto enters play: Treat the next asset you play this turn as if it has fast.
[reaction] When you initiate a non-[agility] test, discard Gilded Volto: Use [agility] for this test, instead of the skill indicated.
Name: Gilded Volto

Description: You may fight Cnidathqua as if it were at your location (it is not engaged with you). Cnidathqua cannot be evaded. Forced - After you fail a test while attacking Cnidathqua: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Writhing Appendage and spawn it engaged with you. Objective - If Cnidathqua is defeated, (→R2).
Name: Cnidathqua

Description: Spawn - Canal-side. Prey - Most Innocent Revelers controlled. Hunter.
Flavor: Dark waters hold darker secrets.
Name: Poleman

Description: Spawn - The location across from you. Retaliate. You cannot look at the other side of Masked Carnevale-Goers at Carnevale Sentinel's location using the ability on Act 1a.
Flavor: Uninvited guests are not welcome.
Name: Carnevale Sentinel

Description: Retaliate. Forced - After Writhing Appendage attacks you: Discard a random card from your hand. Forced - When Writhing Appendage is defeated, if Cnidathqua is in play: Deal 1 damage to Cnidathqua.
Name: Writhing Appendage

Description: Peril. Revelation - You must either take 2 damage or take each Masked Carnevale-Goer, shuffle them so the investigators do not know which is which, and place 1 in each location, starting with the location clockwise from you (Masked Carnevale-Goer side face-up).
Name: Mass Hysteria

Description: Peril. Revelation - You must either take 2 horror or move to the location across from you.
Flavor: How exactly did you end up here?
Name: Lost in Venice

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (4). Each investigator who controls an Innocent Reveler must also perform this skill test. Each investigator who fails takes 1 horror, which must be assigned to Innocent Reveler first, if able.
Name: Watchers' Gaze

Description: Revelation - Test [agility] (4). Each investigator who controls an Innocent Reveler must also perform this skill test. Each investigator who fails takes 1 damage, which must be assigned to an Innocent Reveler first, if able.
Name: Chaos in the Water

Description: Revelation - If there are no Masked Carnevale-Goers at your location, Mesmerize gains surge. If there is a Masked Carnevale-Goer at your location, flip it. If it is an Innocent Reveler, move it to the farthest location clockwise from you with no investigators, then deal it 1 damage and 1 horror.
Name: Mesmerize

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, you must either lose all of your resources or choose and discard an [[Ally]] asset you control.
Flavor: When the revelers come out to celebrate, they come out to feed.
Name: Abduction

Description: Revelation - Attach to the nearest location in the clockwise direction with no Acrid Miasma. Forced - After an investigator enters attached location, he or she tests [willpower] (2). If failed, that investigator must either take 1 damage and 1 horror, or resolve the hunter keyword on each enemy in play.
Name: Acrid Miasma

Description:
While you have 1 or more doom among cards you control, you may take an additional action during your turn, which can only be used to play [[Spell]] cards or activate [[Spell]] [action] abilities.
[elder_sign] effect: +1. You may add 1 doom to or remove 1 doom from a card you control.
Description2: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: [[Spell]] cards level 0-5, Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 0-3, Neutral cards level 0-5, [[Occult]] cards level 0, up to five other level 0 Seeker and/or Survivor cards ([seeker] and/or [survivor]). Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Mystifying Song, Baron Samedi, 1 random basic weakness.
Flavor2: Marie Lambeau always had a voice to die for. People called her "the Smoky Velvet." They said she was born to sing jazz, that she had the magic touch - and maybe they were right. After all, the songs she heard in her dreams ever since her Grand-Mère passed away were like nothing she'd ever heard before. The vocals sounded like no language spoken on Earth, the notes twisted and warped. Why her Grand-Mère had moved from New Orleans to Arkham, Marie would never know. People used to call her Grand-Mère a witch. Maybe there's more than just jazz in Marie's blood, after all...
Name: Marie Lambeau

Description:
Marie Lambeau deck only.
Fast. Play when the agenda would advance by reaching its doom threshold.
Until the end of the phase, the agenda cannot advance by reaching its doom threshold. Remove Mystifying Song from the game.
Name: Mystifying Song

Description: Revelation - Put Baron Samedi into play. He cannot leave play while he has less than 3 doom on him. Forced - When any amount of damage is placed on an investigator in Baron Samedi's location: Place 1 additional damage on that investigator. [free] Exhaust Baron Samedi: Place 1 doom on Baron Samedi. If he has 3 or more doom on him, discard him.
Name: Baron Samedi

Description:
[reaction] After you become engaged with an enemy: Gain 1 resource.
[elder_sign] effect: +1. If this skill test is successful during an attack, that attack deals +1 damage.
Description2: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Guardian cards ([guardian]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to five other level 0 cards from any other class. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Zoey's Cross, Smite the Wicked, 1 random basic weakness.
Flavor: "God has spoken. I will do His work without hesitation."
Flavor2: Zoey had known that she was special ever since God spoke to her one night when she was six years old... the night that terrible fire took away her parents. He told her that He had chosen her from among all the people of the world to be His agent. She would protect the innocent and punish the wicked. Since then, He comes to her in times of trouble, offering guidance and comfort. Zoey now travels from city to city, taking work as a chef to support herself. When she isn't working, she stalks the night, guided by the Lord's voice. Wherever she finds wickedness, she strikes it down without remorse or hesitation.
Name: Zoey Samaras

Description:
[reaction] After you succeed at a skill test by 2 or more while investigating: Discover 1 clue at your location.
[elder_sign] effect: +2. You may instead choose to automatically fail this skill test to draw 3 cards.
Description2: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to five other level 0 cards from any other class. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Search for the Truth, Rex's Curse, 1 random basic weakness. Deckbuilding Restrictions: No [[Fortune]] cards.
Flavor: "This time, nothing will stop me from getting at the truth!"
Flavor2: When disaster strikes, Rex Murphy is usually on hand, suffering the consequences. After spending a day with Rex, even the most hardened skeptic will concede that the man is cursed. Anytime he had a lead on a good story, something would go wrong. That business in Innsmouth with the photographs that had blown out to sea. The tracks in Dunwich that had washed away in the rain just before he'd brought the sheriff. His terrible fortune has more than once exposed him to gruesome beasts and occult conspiracies. To survive, Rex has developed an inquisitive mind, keeping one step ahead of the next disaster.
Name: Rex Murphy

Description:
You collect 1 additional resource during each upkeep phase.
[elder_sign] effect: +1 for each resource you have.
Description2: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Rogue cards ([rogue]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to five other level 0 cards from any other class. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Jenny's Twin .45s, Searching for Izzie, 1 random basic weakness.
Flavor: "No more 'Miss Barnes' from you. My friends call me Jenny."
Flavor2: Jenny Barnes has spent the majority of her young life in pursuit of creature comforts, fine dining, and the latest fashions. That all changed when she received a letter from her sister, Isabelle. In this letter, Isabelle confessed that mysterious forces were aligning against her and that she feared she may fall victim to some paranormal threat. It was the last letter Jenny received from her beloved sister. Jenny has since returned to the States to track down and investigate all occult occurrences she can find. Hardly a wilting flower, she has proven herself a crack shot as well as a fearless and clever investigator of the unknown. Until Isabelle's disappearance is explained, Jenny will never relent in her search.
Name: Jenny Barnes

Description:
Treat the modifier on [skull] tokens you reveal as "0."
Anytime you reveal a [elder_sign] token, you may choose to instead treat it as a [skull] token.
[elder_sign] effect: +1.
Description2: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to five other level 0 cards from any other class. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Jim's Trumpet, Final Rhapsody, 1 random basic weakness.
Flavor: "No, not quiet at all. Dead folks get downright rambunctious when I play my horn."
Flavor2: Jazz has been nothing but trouble for Jim since the day he picked up his daddy's trumpet. There was something weird and otherworldly about the writing on the inside of the bell, but the tones from it were smooth and dark, like good coffee. That trumpet landed Jim a lot of gigs until the time it made Widow Jenkins get up and dance, the day he played at her funeral. After that, it was kind of hard to find work. Since then, Jim has learned a lot about jazz - and the things the graveyard ghouls talk about on cold autumn nights. Lately, they've been talking about The End, as in the end of everything that is and could be. The Final Rhapsody. The fact is, Jim isn't too keen on that idea.
Name: Jim Culver

Description:
You begin the game with Duke in play.
[free] Discard a card from your hand: Ready an asset you control. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] effect: +2. Ready Duke.
Description2: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Survivor cards ([survivor]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to five other level 0 cards from any other class. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Duke, Wracked by Nightmares, 1 random basic weakness.
Flavor: "C'mere, boy. We got work to do."
Flavor2: At night, "Ashcan" Pete sleeps wherever his travels take him: in a field, on a train, or maybe, if he's lucky, in a barn. He bunks with his loyal hound dog, Duke, on one side and his beat-up guitar on the other. And sometimes when Pete sleeps, he dreams. He dreams of haunted, tortured places and of horrible creatures. When he wakes up, he knows that someone needs his help, because his dreams are true. He could not say how long he has been on the road, living by his wits, but he can say for certain no place is too far to go to help someone in need. And as long as Pete can help people, he is not likely to stop wandering any time soon.
Name: "Ashcan" Pete

Description:
Zoey Samaras deck only.
[reaction] After an enemy becomes engaged with you, exhaust Zoey's Cross and spend 1 resource: Deal 1 damage to that enemy.
Name: Zoey's Cross

Description: Revelation - Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded. Attach Smite the Wicked to that enemy and spawn it at the location farthest from you. Forced - When the game ends, if attached enemy is in play: Zoey Samaras suffers 1 mental trauma.
Name: Smite the Wicked

Description:
Rex Murphy deck only.
Draw X cards, where X is the number of clues on Rex Murphy (to a maximum of 5).
Flavor: When things went his way, which wasn't often these days, Rex was a good reporter, with a nose for a story and an eye for detail... <cite>Graham McNeill, Ghouls of the Miskatonic,</cite>
Name: Search for the Truth

Description: Revelation - Put Rex's Curse into play in your threat area. Forced - When you would succeed at a skill test: Return the revealed chaos token to the bag and reveal a new chaos token. If this effect causes you to fail the test, shuffle Rex's Curse into your deck. (Limit once per test.)
Name: Rex's Curse

Description: Jenny Barnes deck only. Uses (X ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage.
Flavor: "...Say, are those Mr. Donohue's guns?" Jenny held a pistol over her shoulder and struck a pose. "I think they suit me better than him. Don't you agree?"
Name: Jenny's Twin .45s

Description: Revelation - Attach Searching for Izzie to the location farthest from you. [action] [action]: Investigate. If you succeed, instead of discovering clues, discard Searching for Izzie. Forced - When the game ends, if Searching for Izzie is in play: Jenny Barnes suffers 1 mental trauma.
Name: Searching for Izzie

Description:
Jim Culver deck only.
[reaction] When a [skull] token is revealed during a skill test, exhaust Jim's Trumpet: Heal 1 horror from an investigator at your location or a connecting location.
Flavor: Daddy used to say, "Jazz is a lot like liquor, it makes everything go down a little smoother." Daddy used to say a lot of stupid things.
Name: Jim's Trumpet

Description: Revelation - Reveal 5 chaos tokens from the chaos bag. For each [skull] and [auto_fail] token revealed, take 1 damage and 1 horror.
Flavor: When the dead start talking about what scares them, that's when it's time to listen.
Name: Final Rhapsody

Description: "Ashcan" Pete deck only. [action] Exhaust Duke: Fight. You attack with a base [combat] skill of 4. This attack deals +1 damage. [action] Exhaust Duke: Investigate. You investigate with a base [intellect] skill of 4. You may move to a connecting location immediately before investigating with this effect.
Name: Duke

Description: Revelation - Exhaust all assets you control and put Wracked by Nightmares into play in your threat area. Assets you control cannot ready. [action] [action]: Discard Wracked by Nightmares.
Name: Wracked by Nightmares

Description: [action]: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack. If you perform this attack against an enemy engaged with another investigator and you fail, you deal no damage.
Name: Blackjack

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Engage any number of enemies at your location.
Flavor: You steel your nerves and shout into the darkness. "Come and get me!"
Name: Taunt

Description: Investigators at your location may give or trade any number of [[Item]] assets, [[Ally]] assets, or resources among one another.
Flavor: It's dangerous to go alone.
Name: Teamwork

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Engage any number of enemies at your location. Draw 1 card for each enemy engaged in this way.
Flavor: You steel your nerves and shout into the darkness. "Come and get me!"
Name: Taunt

Description:
Your maximum hand size is increased by 2.
[reaction] After Laboratory Assistant enters play: Draw 2 cards.
Name: Laboratory Assistant

Description: [action] Test [intellect] (4). If you succeed, discard Strange Solution and draw 2 cards. Record in your Campaign Log that "you have identified the solution."
Flavor: By all accounts, it should not even exist.
Name: Strange Solution

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Choose an investigator at your location. Move that investigator to a connecting location.
Flavor: You know this town like the back of your hand.
Name: Shortcut

Description: Investigate. If you succeed, instead of discovering a clue at your location, discover a clue at a connecting location.
Flavor: Some people need to know the truth at any cost. Some truths can cut like knives.
Name: Seeking Answers

Description:
Uses (4 supplies).
[action] Spend 1 supply: Choose an investigator at your location to heal 1 horror. Then, that investigator tests [willpower] (2). If the test succeeds, he or she heals 1 additional horror. If the test fails, he or she discards 1 card at random from his or her hand.
Name: Liquid Courage

Description:
Fast. Play when an enemy would spawn at your location.
Immediately move to a connecting location. (The enemy still spawns at your previous location.)
Name: Think on Your Feet

Description:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
Double the difficulty of this skill test. If this skill test is successful, resolve the effects of the successful test twice.
Name: Double or Nothing

Description: You get +1 [combat]. Forced - At the end of the upkeep phase: You must either pay 1 resource or discard Hired Muscle.
Name: Hired Muscle

Description: Uses (3 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Investigate. Investigate using [willpower] instead of [intellect]. If you succeed, discover 1 additional clue at this location. If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol is revealed during this test, after this test resolves lose all remaining actions and immediately end your turn.
Name: Rite of Seeking

Description: [reaction] After a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], or [elder_thing] symbol is revealed during a test you are performing: You get +1 skill value for this test.
Flavor: The wax tapers give off an eerie glow, and the flames move as if they are alive.
Name: Ritual Candles

Description:
Uses (3 charges).
[action] Spend 1 charge: Heal 1 horror from an investigator at your location.
Flavor:
From the unreal lead me to the real
From the darkness lead me to the light
From the dead lead me to the immortal
Name: Clarity of Mind

Description: Evade. This evasion attempt uses [willpower] instead of [agility]. If you succeed and the enemy is non‑[[Elite]], evade it and attach Bind Monster to it. [reaction] When attached enemy would ready: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, attached enemy does not ready. If you fail, discard Bind Monster.
Name: Bind Monster

Description: [action]: Fight. If you have no resources in your resource pool, this attack deals +1 damage. [free] During an attack using Fire Axe, spend 1 resource: You get +2 [combat] for this skill test. (Limit three times per attack.)
Name: Fire Axe

Description:
You get +1 [agility].
[reaction] After your turn ends: Heal 1 horror from Peter Sylvestre.
Flavor: The broad-shouldered young man exudes the sort of confidence one only finds in youth.
Name: Peter Sylvestre

Description: Evade. If you succeed, if the enemy is non-[[Elite]], evade the enemy and move it to a connecting location.
Name: Bait and Switch

Description:
You get +1 [agility] and +1 [willpower].
[reaction] After your turn ends: Heal 1 horror from Peter Sylvestre.
Flavor: The broad-shouldered young man exudes the sort of confidence one only finds in youth.
Name: Peter Sylvestre

Description: [action]: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack. If you succeed, you may spend 1 additional action to deal +1 damage for this attack.
Name: Kukri

Description:
Permanent.
You start each game with 2 fewer resources.
Flavor: One man's loan is another man's treasure.
Name: Indebted

Description: Revelation - Place Internal Injury into play in your threat area. Forced - At the end of your turn: Take 1 direct damage. [action] [action]: Discard Internal Injury.
Name: Internal Injury

Description: Revelation - Place Chronophobia into play in your threat area. Forced - At the end of your turn: Take 1 direct horror. [action] [action]: Discard Chronophobia.
Name: Chronophobia

Description: [reaction] After you draw a non-weakness card, discard that card and exhaust Dr. Henry Armitage: Gain 3 resources.
Flavor: Armitage knew he would be meddling with terrible powers, yet saw that there was no other way to annul the deeper and more malign meddling which others had done before him. - H. P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"
Name: Dr. Henry Armitage

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -1. If you fail, discard the top 3 cards of your deck.
[cultist]: -1 (-3 instead if there are 10 or more cards in your discard pile).
[elder_thing]: -X. Discard the top 2 cards of your deck. X is the total printed cost of those discarded cards.
Description2:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -2. If you fail, discard the top 5 cards of your deck.
[cultist]: -1 (-5 instead if there are 10 or more cards in your discard pile).
[elder_thing]: -X. Discard the top 3 cards of your deck. X is the total printed cost of those discarded cards.
Name: Extracurricular Activity

Description2:
Each investigator with 5 or more cards in his or her discard pile takes 1 horror. Each investigator with 10 or more cards in his or her discard pile takes 2 horror, instead.
If the players have completed The House Always Wins, advance directly to agenda 2b. If Extracurricular Activity is the first scenario in the campaign, advance to agenda 2a.
Flavor: You have arrived at the Miskatonic University campus in search of Professor Warren Rice. Classes are over, and a mysterious silence hangs in the air over the quad.
Flavor2: The university is dead silent. The shadows coil about your feet as you walk, and you swear there is something following you with each step you take. Is it just your imagination? Or is there really someone - or something - stalking you?
Name: Quiet Halls

Description: Each investigator's maximum hand size is reduced by 3 while checking his or her hand size during the upkeep phase.
Description2:
If the Dormitories location is not in play, put it into play.
If The Experiment is in play, move it 1 location towards the Dormitories.
If The Experiment is not in play, spawn it in the Science Building.
Flavor: Professor Rice's disappearance isn't the only thing amiss at the university. You're unsure exactly what is going on, but you're starting to believe Armitage was right in asking for your help.
Flavor2: A cry of fear echoes through the campus, and several students flee from the eastern side of the university, where the Science building can be found. Could this commotion be linked to Professor Rice's disappearance?
Name: Dead of Night

Description: Forced - When this agenda would advance by reaching its doom threshold: Instead, remove all doom in play and move The Experiment 1 location toward the Dormitories. Objective - If The Experiment enters the Dormitories, advance.
Description2: Each investigator immediately takes 3 horror. Then, proceed to (→R4).
Flavor: Some kind of wild creature is on the loose. Whatever it is, it appears to be headed toward the university dormitories.
Flavor2: Before you are able to act, you hear screaming from the northern side of the campus. You begin to make your way toward the screaming, your vision darkening with each step. As soon as the creature enters sight, you feel the darkness overtake you, and a force pulls you out of your consciousness. Everything goes black, and you pass out.
Name: The Beast Unleashed

Description2: Shuffle the encounter discard pile and the set-aside "Jazz" Mulligan into the encounter deck.
Flavor: Professor Rice was last seen several hours ago by one of Armitage's students, in the Humanities building.
Flavor2: You were unable to find Professor Rice, but one of the students you spoke with mentioned a strange man entering Rice's office. Unfortunately, the door leading to the faculty offices is locked at this late hour. The student says that the head janitor, "Jazz", might be able to let you in, if you can find him.
Name: After Hours

Description: [action] Spend 1 clue: Discard the top 5 cards of the encounter deck (top 10 instead if there is only 1 player in the game). Forced - If you discard "Jazz" Mulligan for any reason, resolve his revelation effect. Objective - When you take control of "Jazz" Mulligan, advance.
Description2:
If the Alchemy Labs location is not in play, put it into play. If you are at Agenda 1 or 2, spawn The Experiment in the Alchemy Labs.
If you have completed The House Always Wins, put the set-aside Alchemical Concoction into play underneath the Alchemy Labs. If Extracurricular Activity is the first scenario of the campaign, remove the set-aside Alchemical Concoction from the game, instead.
Flavor: Concerned for Professor Rice's safety, you seek out the head janitor, who can let you into the locked sections of the campus.
Flavor2:
You convince "Jazz" that something strange is going on, and that Professor Rice may be in danger. He doesn't trust you enough to hand you his keys, but agrees to come with you.
All of a sudden, you hear a crash coming from the Science building, and a student rushes toward you. "Help!" he cries. "There's some kind of animal loose in the chem labs! I only barely caught a glimpse of it, but..." He shudders. "I think it's heading to the dorms! You've got to do something!"
Name: Rice's Whereabouts

Description: Objective - Find and complete an objective on another encounter card.
Flavor: You have only moments to react. You could warn the students in the dormitories and escort them to safety, or continue your task of searching the faculty offices for Professor Rice. Or, perhaps you could try to slay the beast that threatens the campus.
Flavor2: The monstrous creature lets out a terrible shriek as it succumbs to its wounds and collapses onto the ground. A foul odor emanates from the corpse as its flesh begins to bubble and froth. Your relief turns to disgust as the body begins to shrink and disintegrate. Minutes later, the body has almost entirely evaporated into a sticky mass, and the awful odor has vanished. Inside the remnants of the creature's body, all you can find is a set of bones - the skeletal structure of a canine.
Name: Campus Safety

Description: [action]: Resign. "We can't find Rice anywhere..." You leave the campus, hoping Armitage will forgive you.
Flavor: Surrounded by fences and gates of wrought iron, you can't help but feel as much a prisoner here as a guest.
Flavor2: A too-early winter has stripped the trees bare. Their dead branches whistle as a sharp, cold wind cuts across the empty quad.
Name: Miskatonic Quad

Description: Forced - At the end of your turn, if you are in the Humanities Building: Discard the top X cards of your deck, where X is the amount of horror on you.
Flavor: The power is out, plunging the building's halls into heavy darkness. There is no sign of Professor Rice.
Flavor2: Professor Rice was last seen in the humanities building, teaching one of his Latin classes. The murky windows of the weatherworn structure emit no light, and the night is silent around you.
Name: Humanities Building

Description: You must spend 1 additional action to investigate the Orne Library.
Flavor: The Orne Library is a labyrinth of dusty bookshelves and poorly lit halls.
Flavor2: Three floors of weathered grey granite, the library looks more like a reliquary than a place of learning. Stone gargoyles snarl down from above arched windows, and Latin script winds around the double doors at the top of a wide set of stone steps.
Name: Orne Library

Description: Forced - After Student Union is revealed: Put the set-aside Dormitories into play. [action] [action]: Heal 1 damage and 1 horror.
Flavor2: Even at this late hour, you can hear a muffled chatter from inside the student union. Perhaps one of the students will know where Professor Rice is.
Name: Student Union

Description: Objective - If investigators in the Dormitories spend 3 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: (→R2)
Description2: The door leading into the Dormitories is locked. You cannot move into the Dormitories.
Flavor: As you explore these old, well-kept buildings, you find yourself wondering whether the beds are comfortable...
Flavor2:
The red brick form of the west dormitory could be seen through the trees...
Graham McNeill, Ghouls of the Miskatonic
Name: Dormitories

Description: Forced - After Administration Building is revealed: Put the set-aside Faculty Offices into play. Forced - At the end of your turn, if you are in the Administration Building: Discard the top card of your deck.
Flavor2: Around the aged administration building, creepers of ivy climb from the ground in an effort to claim it. The old hall stands alone in an isolated section of the campus, apart from the day-to-day bustle of students.
Name: Administration Building

Description: Forced - After Faculty Offices is revealed: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Humanoid]] enemy and spawn it here. Shuffle the encounter deck. Objective - If investigators in the Faculty Offices spend 2 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: (→R1)
Description2: The door leading into the Faculty Offices is locked. You cannot move into the Faculty Offices.
Flavor2: You come to a locked door at the top of the stairs leading to the third floor of the administration building. Through its frosted window, you glimpse a shadow darting across the hall.
Name: Faculty Offices

Description2: The door leading into the Faculty Offices is locked. You cannot move into the Faculty Offices.
Flavor: There is no sign of Professor Rice in his office. You call his name, and it echoes fruitlessly through the hall.
Flavor2: You come to a locked door at the top of the stairs leading to the third floor of the administration building. Through its frosted window, you glimpse a shadow darting across the hall... or maybe it's just your imagination.
Name: Faculty Offices

Description: Forced - After Science Building is revealed: Put the set-aside Alchemy Labs into play. Forced - When you fail a [willpower] test in the Science Building: Take 1 damage.
Flavor: A trail of viscous ooze snakes through the halls of the Science building's first floor, leading down into the basement.
Flavor2: The Science building dominates the eastern side of the campus. Its windows are dark, save for a lone window shining faintly in the corner of the basement.
Name: Science Building

Description: [action]: Investigate. If you are successful, instead of discovering clues, take the Alchemical Concoction from underneath this location if able.
Description2: The door leading into the Alchemy Labs is locked. You cannot move into the Alchemy Labs.
Flavor: Peculiar concoctions and obscure reagents line the shelves of the laboratory. What manner of science is going on down here?
Flavor2: A pungent stench rises from the laboratory downstairs. The silence of the hall is broken by the unmistakable hiss of a burner.
Name: Alchemy Labs

Description: Massive. The Experiment gets +3 [per_investigator] health. Forced - When the enemy phase begins: Ready The Experiment. Objective - If The Experiment is defeated, advance to act 3b.
Name: The Experiment

Description: [action]: Fight. This attack uses [intellect] instead of [combat]. If used to attack The Experiment, this attack deals +6 damage. If you succeed, remove Alchemical Concoction from the game.
Name: Alchemical Concoction

Description: Revelation - Put "Jazz" Mulligan into play at your location. While "Jazz" Mulligan is not controlled by a player, he gains: "[action]: Parley. Test [intellect] (3). If successful, take control of "Jazz" Mulligan." While you control "Jazz" Mulligan, you ignore the text on each unrevealed [[Miskatonic]] location.
Name: "Jazz" Mulligan

Description:
You get +1 [intellect].
[reaction] After you discover the last remaining clue in your location, exhaust Professor Warren Rice: Draw 1 card.
Name: Professor Warren Rice

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -2. You may spend 2 resources to treat this token as a 0, instead.
[cultist]: -3. If you succeed, gain 3 resources.
[tablet]: -2. If you fail, discard 3 resources.
Description2:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -3. You may spend 3 resources to treat this token as a 0, instead.
[cultist]: -3. If you fail, discard 3 resources.
[tablet]: -2. Discard 3 resources.
Name: The House Always Wins

Description:
Each [[Criminal]] enemy gains Aloof.
If an investigator deals damage to a [[Criminal]] enemy: Immediately advance.
Description2:
Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.
If the players have completed Extracurricular Activity, advance directly to agenda 2b. If The House Always Wins is the first scenario in the campaign, advance to agenda 2a.
Flavor: You have entered the Clover Club Casino in search of Dr. Morgan. The club is bustling at this late hour, filled with patrons looking to relax and drink, or make it big. You don't appear to be in much danger.
Flavor2: Your questioning has drawn the attention of several men - hired thugs, by the look of them. "Francis doesn't want to be bothered," one of them says. "We suggest you leave the premises before we force you to leave."
Name: The Clover Club

Description2: Spawn a random enemy from the set-aside Hideous Abominations encounter set in Clover Club Lounge. Shuffle the rest of that encounter set, the set-aside Striking Fear encounter set, and the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Move all investigators and unengaged enemies from La Bella Luna to the Clover Club Lounge. Remove La Bella Luna from the game.
Flavor: Most of the other patrons seem oblivious to the mobsters and goons closing in around you. But you recognize this for what it really is - you're about to get roughed up.
Flavor2: You hear a crash from somewhere outside and screams of pain in the lounge. A terrible monstrosity smashes through the entrance to the club, crushing the stairwell and knocking over gangsters and patrons alike.
Name: Underground Muscle

Description: Forced - At the start of the enemy phase: Discard each [[Criminal]] enemy in the same location as an [[Abomination]] enemy.
Flavor: Amidst the chaos and confusion, the strange abominations attack everyone in the club. Screams echo through the halls as the blood begins to spray.
Flavor2: As the strange abominations continue to rampage through the club, the building's foundations shake and tremble. You flee toward the exit, but you are caught in the collapsing rubble as the club is destroyed.
Name: Chaos in the Clover Club

Description: [reaction] When you reveal a chaos token: You may treat that token as if it were any other token in the chaos bag. If you do, remember that you have "cheated." (Group limit once per round.) Objective - When the investigators have collected the requisite number of clues, they must immediately spend them and advance.
Description2:
Put the set-aside Darkened Hall into play.
If it is Agenda 1, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a [[Criminal]] enemy is discarded, and spawn that enemy in the Darkened Hall.
Flavor: You need to find Dr. Morgan. The club is packed; perhaps somebody knows where he is.
Flavor2: After speaking to a number of gamblers and servers, it seems as though Dr. Morgan has had quite the run lately. Instead of cashing out his winnings, he was convinced to double down. He was last seen entering the guarded hall near the back of the cardroom.
Name: Beginner's Luck

Description: Objective - Only investigators in the VIP Area may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.
Description2:
If the players have not yet completed Extracurricular Activity:
You find Dr. Morgan gambling in one of the VIP rooms... but he appears to be playing cards with two unconscious bodies, his pupils dilated as though in a trance. He can't seem to stop laughing, smiling, and chatting with the other "players."
Put the set-aside Dr. Morgan into play in the VIP Area. Advance to Act 3a - "All In."
If the players have completed Extracurricular Activity:
The VIP rooms are filled with the mangled and bloody bodies of unfortunate patrons. There doesn't appear to be any trace of Dr. Morgan. You hear screaming and gunfire from the main area of the club.
Put the set-aside Peter Clover into play in the Clover Club Bar. Search the encounter deck (or out of play) for an [[Abomination]] enemy, and spawn it in the Clover Club Bar. Advance to Act 3a - "Fold."
Flavor: Dr. Morgan is somewhere in the private section of the club, where only VIPs and the club's managers are allowed. If you are to find him, you're going to have to sneak or even fight your way in.
Name: Skin Game

Description: While Dr. Morgan is not controlled by a player, he gains "[action]: Parley. Test [willpower] (3) to shake Dr. Morgan out of his daze. If you succeed, place 1 clue from the token bank on him. If there are 1 [per_investigator] clues on Dr. Morgan, take control of him." Objective - If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.
Description2: - If an investigator resigned with Dr. Francis Morgan under his or her control, (→R2) - Otherwise, (→R1)
Flavor: With or without Dr. Morgan, you have to get out of here. Fast.
Flavor2: You escape the club, doing your best to look inconspicuous as several cars pull up near the street. A handful of grim-faced men and women exit, running toward the restaurant's entrance to take control of the situation. One of them catches your eye, his hand on the grip of his .38, but thankfully he turns his attention back to the rest of his crew and follows them into the club. You breathe a sigh of relief...
Name: All In

Description: While Peter Clover is not controlled by a player, he gains "[action]: Parley. Test [willpower] (3) to convince Peter to follow you. If you succeed, place 1 clue from the token bank on him. If there are 1 [per_investigator] clues on Peter Clover, take control of him." Objective - If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.
Description2: - If an investigator resigned with Peter Clover under his or her control, (→R3) - Otherwise, (→R1)
Flavor: "Free drinks for whoever gets me the hell out of here!" A man exclaims from the bar.
Flavor2: You make your way toward the rain-slicked streets of Arkham.
Name: Fold

Description: [action]: Resign. This was a bust.
Flavor: The music is cliché and they only serve spaghetti. As far as covers for underground speakeasies go, it's not particularly creative.
Flavor2: La Bella Luna was a "multi-purpose" establishment.
Name: La Bella Luna

Description:
While it is Act 1, Clover Club Lounge gains:
"[action] Discard an [[Ally]] asset from your hand: Gain 2 clues from the token pool. (Limit once per game.)"
Flavor2: Comfortable leather couches, mahogany furniture, and an array of beautiful art greets gamblers, tempting them into the life of the would-be affluent.
Name: Clover Club Lounge

Description:
While it is Act 1, Clover Club Bar gains:
"[action] Spend 2 resources: Gain 2 clues from the token pool and draw 2 cards. Remember that you have 'had a drink.' (Limit once per game.)"
Flavor2: The shelves behind the bar sag beneath the weight of all manner of bootlegged drinks: cheap ales, moonshine, expensive bottles of wine, aged whiskey. If only you had a couple hours to kill...
Name: Clover Club Bar

Description:
While it is Act 1, Clover Club Cardroom gains:
"[action] Spend 2 resources: Reveal a random chaos token.
If it is a [elder_sign] symbol, gain 2 clues and 2 resources from the token bank.
If it is an even number, gain 2 clues from the token bank.
If it is an odd number or a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol, nothing happens."
Flavor2: As you approach the cardroom, the clinking of poker chips and the shuffling of cards is punctuated by shouts of revelry and frustration. Your thoughts are nearly drowned out by the racket.
Name: Clover Club Cardroom

Description: Forced - When Darkened Hall is revealed: Put into play the 3 set-aside Back Hall Doorway locations.
Flavor: The door slams shut behind you, and you stand in sudden silence. This area of the club is lonesome and devoid of warmth and color. Somehow, the spotless floor and walls seem more sinister than inviting.
Flavor2: A heavy oak door stands in a secluded corner of the club. As you approach it, the air grows heavy and the clamor of the cardroom fades behind you.
Name: Darkened Hall

Description: Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating the Art Gallery: Lose 2 resources.
Flavor: Exotic art and antiques adorn the walls of Peter Clover's private gallery. An evening breeze rustles the worn pages of a ledger back and forth.
Flavor2: You approach an unmarked door toward the back of the Clover Club.
Name: Art Gallery

Description: While you are in the VIP Area, you cannot draw cards or gain resources during the upkeep phase.
Flavor: The coppery smell of blood assaults your senses. The floor is littered with broken glass, and the upholstery has been torn to shreds. Where is Dr. Morgan?
Flavor2: You approach an unmarked door toward the back of the Clover Club.
Name: VIP Area

Description: [action]: Resign. We can get out this way!
Flavor: A steep, narrow staircase ascends to a second unmarked door. To your surprise, it leads into a back alley behind La Bella Luna. This must be where they smuggle in their "goods."
Flavor2: You approach an unmarked door toward the back of the Clover Club.
Name: Back Alley

Description: Prey - Highest [intellect]. Hunter. Forced - After an investigator at Clover Club Pit Boss's location gains any number of clues: Clover Club Pit Boss readies, engages that investigator, and makes an immediate attack.
Name: Clover Club Pit Boss

Description: Forced - At the start of the enemy phase, if no investigator controls Peter Clover: Deal 1 damage to him. [free]Exhaust Peter Clover: Automatically evade a [[Criminal]] enemy in your location.
Name: Peter Clover

Description:
You get +1 [combat].
[reaction] After you defeat an enemy, exhaust Dr. Francis Morgan: Draw 1 card.
Name: Dr. Francis Morgan

Description: Surge. Revelation - Each player who has "had a drink" loses 1 action.
Flavor: An unpleasant warmth fills your body, and you sluggishly look at your empty glass.
Name: Something in the Drinks

Description: Revelation - Place 1 doom on each [[Criminal]] enemy at your location. If no doom was placed by this effect, lose 2 resources.
Flavor: Eyes are all around you, watching your every move.
Name: Arousing Suspicions

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (5). For each point you fail by, discard the top card of your deck.
Flavor: Are these visions of things to be, or things as they might be? Or could these horrors have already happened?
Name: Visions of Futures Past

Description: Surge. Revelation - Put Beyond the Veil into play in your threat area if there is no copy of Beyond the Veil in your threat area. Forced - If your deck has no cards in it: Take 10 damage and discard Beyond the Veil.
Name: Beyond the Veil

Description: Peril. Revelation - You must attach Light of Aforgomon to either the current agenda or the current act. Limit 1 per agenda/act. Treat all damage as direct damage and all horror as direct horror.
Name: Light of Aforgomon

Description: Spawn - Location with the most clues. Retaliate.
Flavor: A malevolence has overtaken their minds, turning them into soulless puppets.
Name: Thrall

Description: Prey - Least cards in hand. Hunter. Forced - When the engaged investigator draws a [[Hex]] or [[Pact]] card: Wizard of Yog-Sothoth attacks that investigator.
Name: Wizard of Yog-Sothoth

Description: Revelation - Put Unhallowed Country into play in your threat area. You cannot play [[Ally]] assets. Treat the printed text box of each [[Ally]] asset you control as if it were blank. Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Unhallowed Country.
Name: Unhallowed Country

Description: Revelation - Attach Sordid and Silent to your location. Forced - At the end of the round: Each investigator at attached location takes 1 horror. Forced - When the agenda advances: Discard Sordid and Silent.
Name: Sordid and Silent

Description:
Aloof. Hunter.
Each investigator at Whippoorwill's location gets -1 [willpower], -1 [intellect], -1 [combat], and -1 [agility].
Flavor: "It is vowed that the birds are psychopomps lying in wait for the souls of the dying..." <cite>H. P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"</cite>
Name: Whippoorwill

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (2). Increase this skill test's difficulty by 1 for each damage on you. If you fail, take 2 horror.
Flavor: "If they can catch the fleeing soul when it leaves the body, they instantly flutter away chittering in daemonic laughter..." <cite>H. P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"</cite>
Name: Eager for Death

Description: Revelation - Put Cursed Luck into play in your threat area. You get -1 skill value during skill tests. Forced - After you succeed at a skill test by 1 or more: Discard Cursed Luck.
Name: Cursed Luck

Description: Revelation - Reveal a random token from the chaos bag. If you reveal a [elder_sign] symbol or positive number, nothing happens. If you reveal any other number, take 1 damage. If you reveal a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol, take 2 horror.
Name: Twist of Fate

Description: Prey - Lowest [intellect]. Hunter. While Avian Thrall is being attacked using a [[Ranged]], [[Firearm]], or [[Spell]] asset, it gets -3 fight.
Name: Avian Thrall

Description: Spawn - Farthest location from you. Prey - Lowest [agility]. Hunter. Retaliate.
Flavor: What manner of wolf has that many teeth?
Name: Lupine Thrall

Description: Revelation - If there are no [[Abomination]] enemies in play, Altered Beast gains surge. Otherwise, choose an [[Abomination]] enemy. Heal all damage from that enemy and attached Altered Beast to it. Forced - When you enter attached enemy's location (or vice-versa): Take 1 horror.
Name: Altered Beast

Description: While O'Bannion's Thug is engaged with you, you cannot gain resources.
Flavor: "Are we going to have a problem here?"
Name: O'Bannion's Thug

Description: Retaliate. Forced - After Mobster attacks you: Lose 1 resource.
Flavor: "You better scram, pal, unless you're hungry for boot leather and lead."
Name: Mobster

Description: Revelation - If there are no unengaged [[Criminal]] enemies in play, Hunted Down gains surge. If there are 1 or more unengaged [[Criminal]] enemies in play, each of them moves 1 location toward you. Each [[Criminal]] enemy that engages you as a result of this effect makes an immediate attack.
Name: Hunted Down

Description: Revelation - Choose and shuffle a non-story asset you control into your deck and discard the top 3 cards of your deck. If a copy of that asset is discarded, take 2 horror.
Name: Pushed into the Beyond

Description: Peril. Revelation - Choose one of the following cardtypes (asset, event, or skill). Each player must discard each card in his or her hand that is of the chosen cardtype. If this is not the first copy of Terror from Beyond drawn this phase, choose two cardtypes instead.
Name: Terror from Beyond

Description: Revelation - Attach to your location. As an additional cost to move into or out of attached location, test [willpower] (4). If successful, discard Arcane Barrier. Otherwise, you must either cancel the effects of the move or discard the top 5 cards of your deck.
Name: Arcane Barrier

Description: Prey - Lowest [willpower]. Hunter. Forced - After you perform an attack against the Conglomeration of Spheres using a [[Melee]] card: Discard that card.
Name: Conglomeration of Spheres

Description: Prey - Lowest [agility]. Hunter. Forced - When Servant of the Lurker attacks you: Discard the top 2 cards of your deck.
Name: Servant of the Lurker

Description: Choose an investigator at your location. Heal 2 damage from that investigator or from an [[Ally]] asset he or she controls.
Name: Emergency Aid

Description:
You get +1 [willpower].
Brother Xavier may be assigned damage and/or horror dealt to other investigators at your location.
[reaction] When Brother Xavier is defeated: Deal 2 damage to an enemy at your location.
Name: Brother Xavier

Description: Fight. This attack uses [intellect]. You deal +1 damage for this attack for each clue you have (max +3 damage).
Flavor: "That's the worst plan I've ever heard. Well, what are we waiting for?"
Name: "I've got a plan!"

Description: [free]During your turn, if you are not engaged with any enemies, exhaust Pathfinder: Move to a connecting location.
Flavor: Searchers after horror haunt strange, far places. - H. P. Lovecraft, "The Picture in the House"
Name: Pathfinder

Description: Choose an asset controlled by an investigator at your location. Double the number of ammo or supply tokens on that asset.
Flavor: It may not be legal, but it gets the job done.
Name: Contraband

Description:
Permanent.
In between each game of a campaign, you may swap up to two level 0 cards out of your deck in exchange for an equal number of level 0 cards. (You must still follow all deckbuilding rules for your investigator).
Name: Adaptable

Description: In player order, each investigator draws 1 card from the top of the encounter deck. Then, add Delve Too Deep to the victory display.
Flavor: Some things, once seen, can't be unseen.
Name: Delve Too Deep

Description: Uses (5 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Fight. This attack uses [willpower] instead of [combat]. You get +1 [willpower] for this attack. If a [skull] symbol is revealed during this attack, this attack deals +2 damage.
Name: Song of the Dead

Description:
Fast. Play after you fail a skill test by 2 or less while attacking an enemy engaged with you.
Deal this attack's damage to a different enemy at your location.
Name: Oops!

Description: [action]: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack. [action] Exile Fire Extinguisher: Evade. You get +3 [agility] for this test. If you are successful, evade each other enemy engaged with you, as well.
Name: Fire Extinguisher

Description: Either (choose one): - Fight. You get +3 [combat] and deal +2 damage for this attack. Exile Flare. - Search the top 9 cards of any investigator's deck for an [[Ally]] asset and put it into play under your control. Then, exile Flare. Shuffle the searched deck.
Name: Flare

Description:
Uses (3 supplies).
[free] Spend 1 supply, exhaust Smoking Pipe, and take 1 damage: Heal 1 horror.
Flavor: A good pipe can calm the most frazzled of nerves.
Name: Smoking Pipe

Description:
Uses (3 supplies).
[free] Spend 1 supply, exhaust Painkillers, and take 1 horror: Heal 1 damage.
Flavor: Do not exceed the recommended dosage.
Name: Painkillers

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -1 (-3 instead if Hunting Horror is at your location.)
[cultist]: -1. If you fail, search the encounter deck, discard pile, and the void for Hunting Horror and spawn it at your location, if able.
[tablet]: -2. Return 1 of your clues to your current location.
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, discard an asset you control.
Description2:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -2 (-4 instead if Hunting Horror is at your location.)
[cultist]: -3. If you fail, search the encounter deck, discard pile, and the void for Hunting Horror and spawn it at your location, if able.
[tablet]: -4. If Hunting Horror is at your location, it immediately attacks you.
[elder_thing]: -5. If you fail, discard an asset you control.
Name: The Miskatonic Museum

Description: Forced - When Hunting Horror enters play: Attach the set-aside copy of Shadow-spawned to it, or add 1 resource to Shadow-spawned if it is already attached.
Description2:
If Hunting Horror is in play, add 1 doom to it.
If Hunting Horror is not in play, search the encounter deck, discard pile, and the void for Hunting Horror and spawn it in Museum Halls, if able. Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.
Flavor: Dr. Armitage has given the university’s Latin translation of The Necronomicon to his associate, Harold Walsted, the curator of the Miskatonic University Museum. Worried that someone might still be after the book, you have gone to the museum to recover it.
Flavor2: From the shadows of the museum halls, a terrible creature slithers forth, long and serpentine, and propelled by black leathery wings.
Name: Restricted Access

Description: Forced - When Hunting Horror enters play: Attach the set-aside copy of Shadow-spawned to it, or add 1 resource to Shadow-spawned if it is already attached.
Description2:
If Hunting Horror is in play, add 1 doom to it.
If Hunting Horror is not in play, search the encounter deck, discard pile, and the void for Hunting Horror and spawn it in Museum Halls, if able. Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.
Flavor: The shadows in the museum grow and become darker. As the shadows lengthen and shift, they begin to suggest the sinewy body of an uncanny creature darting at the periphery of your awareness...
Flavor2: The creature does not relent, pursuing you throughout the museum.
Name: Shadows Deepen

Description: Forced - When Hunting Horror enters play: Attach the set-aside copy of Shadow-spawned to it, or add 1 resource to Shadow-spawned if it is already attached.
Description2: Each investigator who has not resigned is defeated and suffers 1 physical trauma.
Flavor: The creature in the museum grows larger and more terrifying with each passing moment. Its body slithers from shadow to shadow, every corner of every room a potential hiding place for the hideous beast.
Flavor2: With no way of defeating the creature in the museum, you flee. In every shadow of every corridor, the serpentine horror’s slithering body can be seen, the museum halls growing darker with the creature’s presence. As you reach the entrance, it blocks the doorway and attacks you with its terrible fangs. You barely manage to escape the building with your life, though the effects of the creature’s venom will scar you forever.
Name: In Every Shadow

Description2:
If you spent clues to advance:
You find the window nearest to the guard and tap it loud enough to get his attention. He gives a startled jump, then shifts open the window. “What do you want?” he asks timidly. You explain the situation to him and tell him he is in grave danger. He warily opens the front door to the Museum, shaking his head. “I wasn’t even supposed to be here today...”
Choose an investigator to take control of the set-aside Adam Lynch asset. Reveal the Museum Halls. Advance to Act 2a - "Night at the Museum."
If you successfully performed the [action] ability on the Museum Halls to advance:
With great strength, you break down the door to the Museum, making considerable noise as you do. The security guard sees you enter, cries out in fear, and rushes toward the back of the museum.
The door leading into the Museum Halls is broken. Reveal the Museum Halls. Advance to Act 2a - "Breaking and Entering."
Flavor: Unfortunately, the entrance to the Museum is kept locked at this late hour. A security guard is visible through the building’s front windows, oblivious to his surroundings. Perhaps you can find a way to get his attention and convince him to let you in.
Name: Finding A Way Inside

Description: Objective - If an investigator enters the Exhibit Hall (Restricted Hall), advance.
Description2: Search the encounter deck, discard pile, the void, and all play areas for Hunting Horror, and place it in the Exhibit Hall (Restricted Hall), ready. Advance to Act 3a.
Flavor: The Necronomicon is being kept in a Restricted Hall somewhere in the museum. Adam barely knows his way around, and gives a startled jump at every creak of the old building. "I just started here last week," he explains. "What sort of trouble did you say was going on?" You haven’t the heart to give him the full story.
Flavor2: When you enter the restricted hall, you find the curator of the museum lying in a pool of blood, his intestines strewn about in a grotesque display. Your stomach turns over and you resist the urge to vomit. Whatever did this, it’s still nearby...
Name: Night at the Museum

Description: Objective - If an investigator enters the Exhibit Hall (Restricted Hall), advance.
Description2: Choose an investigator to take control of the set-aside Harold Walsted asset. Search the encounter deck, discard pile, the void, and all play areas for Hunting Horror, and place it in the Exhibit Hall (Restricted Hall), ready. Advance to Act 3a.
Flavor: The Necronomicon is being kept in a Restricted Hall somewhere in the museum.
Flavor2: When you enter the Restricted Hall, you find the curator of the museum clutching an ornate statue as if it were a club, his suit stained with blood, a panicked expression on his face. The security guard you saw earlier lies in a pool of blood nearby, his intestines strewn about in a grotesque display. Your stomach turns and you resist the urge to vomit. "I tried to stop it, but..." the curator says quietly, his voice quivering. Whatever did this, it’s still nearby...
Name: Breaking and Entering

Description: Objective - If there are no clues remaining in the Exhibit Hall (Restricted Hall), advance.
Description2: The investigators must decide (choose one): - It's too dangerous to keep around. We must destroy it. (→R1) - It's too valuable to destroy. We must keep it safe.(→R2)
Flavor: Somewhere in this area is Olaus Wormius’s Latin translation of the Necronomicon. You must find it and escape while you can!
Flavor2:
At last, you find the locked case containing the Necronomicon.
The tome, over eight hundred pages in length, is filled with all manner of macabre imagery, formulae, spells, prophecies, and descriptions of creatures from beyond the threshold of space.
Without a doubt, it is a dangerous book... But its secrets could be very useful.
Name: Searching for the Tome

Description: Investigators at the Museum Entrance cannot gain resources. [action] Resign. "Eh. How important can a book really be, anyway?"
Flavor: As you approach the museum, you draw your coat tighter around your body to keep the wintry air away. The full moon drapes the building in ominous bright moonlight.
Flavor2: The Miskatonic Museum is an opulent and stately building, supported by expeditions funded by the university. Its sizable collection of exotic artifacts, curios, and art has drawn visitors from all over the country.
Name: Museum Entrance

Description:
Museum Halls is connected to each copy of Exhibit Hall.
[action] Investigators in the Museum Halls spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Put the top card of the Exhibit deck into play, unrevealed.
Description2:
The entrance to the Museum Halls is locked. You cannot move into the Museum Halls.
Museum Entrance gains: "[action]: Test [combat] (5) to attempt to break down the door to the Museum. If you are successful, immediately advance to Act 1b."
Name: Museum Halls

Description: [action] [action]: Search the top 6 cards of your deck for a card and add it to your hand. Shuffle the rest back into your deck. (Limit once per turn.)
Flavor: Somebody must have left the security office in a hurry. Blood stains the floor under the desk nearby. Thankfully, there are some useful supplies here you may be able to use.
Flavor2: A plaque next to this doorway reads: "Security." The door is ajar, and inside you catch the scent of blood.
Name: Security Office

Description: [action] [action]: Look at the revealed side of an Exhibit Hall in play, or the top card of the Exhibit deck. (Limit once per turn.)
Flavor: Somebody must have left the security office in a hurry. Blood stains the floor under the desk nearby. There are some maps of the Museum in here, as well.
Flavor2: A plaque next to this doorway reads: "Security." The door is ajar, and inside you catch the scent of blood.
Name: Security Office

Description: You cannot investigate Administration Office while you have 4 or fewer resources.
Flavor: This office is meticulously organized, from the books in alphabetical order on the shelves to the stacks of forms organized by category on each desk. A coat is draped over one of the nearby chairs; perhaps somebody other than the security guard is still here at this late hour.
Flavor2: A sturdy wooden door with a plaque next to it reads: "Administration." In the hall outside the doorway, you see a row of paintings depicting the museum’s many curators through the years, each adorned with their name and years of employment. Perhaps it’s just your imagination, but they look more distressed in recent years.
Name: Administration Office

Description: You cannot investigate Administration Office while you have 4 or fewer cards in your hand.
Flavor: This office is meticulously organized, from the books in alphabetical order on the shelves to the stacks of forms organized by category on each desk. A coat is draped over one of the nearby chairs; perhaps somebody other than the security guard is still here at this late hour.
Flavor2: A sturdy wooden door with a plaque next to it reads: "Administration." In the hall outside the doorway, you see a row of paintings depicting the museum’s many curators through the years, each adorned with their name and years of employment. Perhaps it’s just your imagination, but they look more distressed in recent years.
Name: Administration Office

Description: Forced - After you enter this location: Lose all of your remaining actions and immediately end your turn. While you are in this location, you get +2 [agility].
Flavor: A strange chill fills this hall, as if the climate of Alaskan wilderness has traveled along with the artifacts on display.
Flavor2:
What alluring artifacts are displayed inside?
Do they, too, hold a sinister secret?
Name: Exhibit Hall

Description: Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating this location: Discard an asset you control.
Flavor: Who would immortalize such a terrible fate?
Flavor2:
What alluring artifacts are displayed inside?
Do they, too, hold a sinister secret?
Name: Exhibit Hall

Description: Forced - After you enter this location: Discard 2 cards from your hand at random.
Flavor: Nothing about this exhibit is natural.
Flavor2:
What alluring artifacts are displayed inside?
Do they, too, hold a sinister secret?
Name: Exhibit Hall

Description: Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating this location: Lose 1 action.
Flavor: Sandstone sculptures and bejeweled artifacts from another era clutter this exhibit, like the tomb of an ancient pharaoh.
Flavor2:
What alluring artifacts are displayed inside?
Do they, too, hold a sinister secret?
Name: Exhibit Hall

Description: Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating this location: Take 1 horror.
Flavor:
I need no reminder of my mortality.
I know my death is imminent.
Flavor2:
What alluring artifacts are displayed inside?
Do they, too, hold a sinister secret?
Name: Exhibit Hall

Description: While Hunting Horror is at this location, this location cannot be investigated.
Flavor: Exhibit Not Yet Open For Viewing.
Flavor2:
What alluring artifacts are displayed inside?
Do they, too, hold a sinister secret?
Name: Exhibit Hall

Description: You get +2 [intellect] while investigating [[Miskatonic]] locations. Forced - When Harold Walsted leaves play: Remove him from the game and add 1 [tablet] token to the chaos bag for the remainder of the campaign.
Name: Harold Walsted

Description: While you control Adam Lynch, treat the "[action] [action]" ability on the Security Office as if it were an "[action]" ability. Forced - When Adam Lynch leaves play: Remove him from the game and add 1 [tablet] token to the chaos bag for the remainder of the campaign.
Name: Adam Lynch

Description:
You get +1 [intellect].
[action]: Gain 2 resources.
Flavor: It was Abdul Alhazred’s magnum opus.
Name: The Necronomicon

Description: Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - At the start of the enemy phase: Reveal a random token from the chaos bag. If the revealed token has a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol, ready Hunting Horror. Forced - When Hunting Horror leaves play, place it in the void.
Name: Hunting Horror

Description:
Shadow-spawned remains attached to Hunting Horror if it enters the void.
Hunting Horror gets +1 fight, +1 health, and +1 evade for each resource on Shadow-spawned. If there are 3 resources on Shadow-spawned, Hunting Horror also gains Massive.
Name: Shadow-spawned

Description: Revelation - If Hunting Horror is in play, it readies, engages you, and attacks each investigator at your location. Otherwise, Stalked in the Dark gains surge.
Flavor:
...viperine creatures, which had curiously distorted heads, and grotesquely great clawed appendages...
-H.P. Lovecraft & August Derleth, The Lurker at the Threshold
Name: Stalked in the Dark

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). This test has +2 difficulty if Hunting Horror is at your location. If you fail you must either (choose one): discard the top 5 cards of your deck, or take 1 direct damage and deal 1 damage to each of your [[Ally]] assets.
Name: Passage into the Veil

Description: Revelation - Test [intellect] (3). If you fail, lose 1 action for each point you failed by.
Flavor: Are you watching the exhibits, or are the exhibits watching you?
Name: Ephemeral Exhibits

Description: Revelation - If Hunting Horror is in play, add 1 doom to it. If Hunting Horror is not in play, search the encounter deck, discard pile, and the void for Hunting Horror and spawn it at your location, engaged with you. Shuffle the encounter deck.
Name: Slithering Behind You

Description: You have 1 additional hand slot, which can only be used to hold a [[Weapon]] asset.
Name: Bandolier

Description: Choose another investigator at your location. Both you and that investigator draw 2 cards and gain 2 resources.
Flavor: They won't take us down that easily!
Name: Stand Together

Description: [reaction] After Art Student enters play: Discover 1 clue at your location.
Name: Art Student

Description: If this skill test is successful while investigating a location, discover 1 additional clue at that location (2 additional clues instead if it succeeds by 2 or more).
Flavor: I knew I had seen this symbol before. I must warn the others before it is too late!
Name: Deduction

Description: Play only if there is a scenario card with a 'resign' ability in play. Resign. You get the hell out of here.
Flavor: Quitters may never win, but they also rarely die.
Name: "I'm outta here!"

Description: Fast. [action] Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. If you succeed by 2 or more, this attack deals +1 damage.
Name: Switchblade

Description:
Fast. Play when an enemy attacks an investigator at your location.
Cancel that attack. Then, reveal a random token from the chaos bag. If it has a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol, deal the attacking enemy's damage to itself.
Name: Hypnotic Gaze

Description: Uses (4 charges). [action] Spend one charge: Fight. This attack uses [willpower] instead of [combat]. You get +2 [willpower] and deal +1 damage for this attack. If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol is revealed during this attack, take 1 horror.
Name: Shrivelling

Description: You get +2 [intellect] while investigating if you have no clues.
Flavor: There's nothing in the headlines about the horrors you've witnessed. But the obituaries section is disturbingly long.
Name: Newspaper

Description: Attach to your location. During the enemy phase, each enemy that moves does so along the shortest path toward the attached location, instead of to where it would normally move. Forced - While attached, at the end of the round: Discard Lure.
Name: Lure

Description:
Permanent.
You have 1 additional accessory slot.
Flavor: No stone unturned, no ancient treasure left behind.
Name: Relic Hunter

Description:
Permanent.
You have 1 additional ally slot.
Flavor: When you turn on the charm, it could light the entire town.
Name: Charisma

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the current Agenda #.
[cultist]: -1. If you fail and it is your turn, lose all remaining actions and end your turn immediately.
[tablet]: -2. Add 1 doom token to the nearest Cultist enemy.
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, choose and discard a card from your hand.
Description2:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is 1 more than the current Agenda #. 
[cultist]: Reveal another token. If you fail and it is your turn, lose all remaining actions and end your turn immediately.
[tablet]: -4. Add 1 doom token to each Cultist enemy in play.
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, choose and discard a card from your hand for each point you failed by.
Name: Essex County Express

Description2:
Remove the leftmost location from the game (or place it in the victory display if it has Victory X and no clues on it). Each investigator at that location is defeated. Each enemy and asset at that location is discarded.
Discard all clues controlled by the investigators.
Flavor: As the train to Dunwich comes to a jarring stop, you look out the window behind you and see an immense tear in the sky, like a rip in a piece of cloth. Several of the rearmost train cars are pulled backwards, and there is a dreadful metallic crunch as they are detached. The train cars topple upwards and into the rift in the sky. Nearby passengers are panicking, others are cowering in their seats, and one elderly man has fainted in fear.
Flavor2: The rearmost car of the train detaches as it is pulled backwards. To your horror, it rises off the tracks and is consumed by the gate above you.
Name: A Tear in Reality

Description2:
Remove the leftmost location from the game (or place it in the victory display if it has Victory X and no clues on it). Each investigator at that location is defeated. Each enemy and asset at that location is discarded.
Discard all clues controlled by the investigators.
Flavor: The tear grows larger, and you can feel the rearmost car of the train shaking as it is pulled backwards. The situation threatens to erupt into chaos as more passengers realize the danger they are in. Some passengers are looking for places to hide, while others are running about the compartments in terror.
Flavor2: The next train car is ripped backwards with violent force. A middle-aged man hangs from his fingertips as the car flies unhindered toward the rift. In moments, the car is consumed whole, and the man lets go rather than be pulled into the void. He starts to fall, but is caught by the rift's force and pulled inside it anyway.
Name: The Maw Widens

Description2:
Remove each of the two leftmost locations from the game (or place it in the victory display if either one has Victory X and no clues on it). Each investigator at those locations is defeated. Each enemy and asset at those locations is discarded.
Discard all clues controlled by the investigators.
Flavor: The pull of the rift in the sky seems to grow stronger, and the entire train begins to roll backwards along the tracks. The rearmost cars of the train begin to rattle, the force of the rift threatening to detach them. You must get out of these cars as fast as you can!
Flavor2: Two of the train cars closest to the gate are severed from the rest of the train by a sheet of impossibly hot steam, which slices through metal like a knife through butter. The cars are sucked upwards and fly into the gate. Something above the train lets out a terrible screech, though to your ears it is like the shrill sound of a broken steam pipe.
Name: Rolling Backwards

Description2:
Remove each of the two leftmost locations from the game (or place it in the victory display if either one has Victory X and no clues on it). Each investigator at those locations is defeated. Each enemy and asset at those locations is discarded.
Discard all clues controlled by the investigators.
Flavor: The gate crackles with power as its strength increases. Dirt and rocks from the edge of the bridge behind you are torn from the ground and trees are uprooted, pulled in by the gate. One younger passenger smashes the window of your car and shouts, “We gotta get outta here!” He leaps out of the window, but before he lands in the river below, he is snatched in the talons of a swift flying creature, and carried out of sight. A trail of steam is left in the creature’s wake.
Flavor2: The two rearmost train cars begin to melt as they are filled with superheated steam. The metal warps, and the passengers inside scream in agony. The cars are ripped from the train tracks along with rail slats and chunks of the bridge behind you.
Name: Drawn In

Description2: Each investigator is immediately defeated and takes 1 mental trauma. (→R2)
Flavor: The rift in the sky twists and shakes, completely distorted. Its size is now massive, its shape warping and shifting, as if it is about to explode.
Flavor2: The entire bridge cracks under the pressure of the gate, and breaks apart. Instead of plummeting into the river, the remaining train cars are pulled into the sky, toward the rift. You hang on for dear life and scream in horror as you are pulled into the gate. Then, everything goes black.
Name: Out of Time

Description: Objective - If an investigator enters the Engine Car, immediately advance.
Description2:
The investigator entering the Engine Car reads the following (out loud):
A tender car filled with coal blocks your way to the engine cab. Swallowing your fear, you climb out of the nearby window and clamber onto the roof of the train, making your way across the tender car. The steady backward motion of the train makes it difficult for you to keep your footing. As you get close, a winged creature swoops down from above, its body composed of piping hot steam.
You must decide (choose one): - Test [agility] (3) to attempt to dodge the creature. If you fail, you leap too far and barely grip the side of the train, hanging on for dear life. Although you manage to pull yourself up, the experience is terrifying. You suffer 1 mental trauma. - Test [combat] (3) to attempt to endure the creature's extreme heat. If you fail, the creature flies through you and the heat burns you. You suffer 1 physical trauma.
Flavor: The train has stopped on a bridge high above the Miskatonic River - you might be able to survive the fall, but you don’t like your chances. Your best bet is to make your way to the engine car as fast as you can and get the train running again.
Name: Run!

Description: Objective - If there are no clues in the Engine Car, immediately advance.
Description2: (→R1)
Flavor: You’ve managed to make it to the engine cab, but now you have to get the engine started again so you can outrun the pulling force of the gate!
