Description2: - Add the new [[Present-Day]] locations to the original locations from The Boundary Beyond encounter set. Remove 1 of the 2 copies of each of these locations from the game at random. Put the remaining locations into play. - After setup, search the collection for the new Harbinger of Valusia (The Sleeper Returns) and set it aside, out of play. If the Harbinger of Valusia would enter play during this scenario, use this version instead of the original one. - When building the exploration deck, use only the 12 single-sided [[Ancient]] locations. Do not include any of the other encounter cards listed in the original setup instructions.
Name: Return to The Boundary Beyond

Description: [reaction] After you successfully investigate Temple Ruins: Explore. Draw the top card of the exploration deck. If it is a location with a matching location symbol in the upper-left corner, place it on top of this location, taking its place.
Flavor2: Though the exact location of the main temple of Tenochtitlán is not yet known, excavation has begun in search of the ruins of the many temples that once covered this area.
Name: Temple Ruins

Description: [action] Take 1 horror: Gain 2 resources. [action] If you have 10 or more resources: Explore. Draw the top card of the exploration deck. If it is a location with a matching location symbol in the upper-left corner, place it on top of this location, taking its place.
Flavor2: The Catedral Metropolitana, situated on the northern side of the Plaza de la Constitución, was built by conquistadors after the conquest of the Aztec Empire. Cloud wisps swirl eerily over each of the cathedral's bell towers.
Name: Metropolitan Cathedral

Description: Forced - After you fail an [agility] test while at Chapultepec Park: Take 1 damage. [action]: Explore. Test [agility] (3). If you succeed, draw the top card of the exploration deck. If it is a location with a matching location symbol in the upper-left corner, place it on top of this location, taking its place.
Flavor2: One of the largest city parks in the west, the Bosque de Chapultepec is a beautiful ecological landmark overlooking the city, built in what was once a sacred forest many centuries ago.
Name: Chapultepec Park

Description: [action] Discard cards with a combined total of at least 4 skill icons from your hand: Explore. Draw the top card of the exploration deck. If it is a location with a matching location symbol in the upper-left corner, place it on top of this location, taking its place.
Flavor2: The main square in central Mexico City, once the ceremonial center of Tenochtitlán, stretches before you. Silver lightning flashes in the storm clouds overhead, and you are shocked to find a tide of blood swelling over the plaza. The entire city is bizarrely devoid of any life.
Name: Zócalo

Description: [reaction] After you successfully fight or evade an enemy at Xochimilco: Explore. Draw the top card of the exploration deck. If it is a location with a matching location symbol in the upper-left corner, place it on top of this location, taking its place.
Flavor2: A small wooden boat bumps up against the side of the canal, swaying gently in the rippling water. A juniper tree sticks out of the shallow water nearby, bending in the mild breeze.
Name: Xochimilco

Description: While you are at Coyoacán, damage/horror cannot be healed from cards you control. [action] If you have 5 or more total damage and/or horror on your investigator: Explore. Draw the top card of the exploration deck. If it is a location with a matching location symbol in the upper-left corner, place it on top of this location, taking its place.
Flavor2: Although not always a part of Mexico City, Coyoacán has always been a historic area, marked by narrow cobblestone streets and plazas. The ground shakes as you walk down one of the village’s many confined paths, and you suspect there is more that lives below the surface...
Name: Coyoacán

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Forgotten Age Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to Heart of the Elders, Part 1 shown here. - Remove Act 1a - "Search for the Pattern" from the game and replace it with the new Act 1a - "A Familiar Pattern." (Continued on reverse side.)
Description2:
- When building the exploration deck, include only 1 of the 2 locations with each of the following connection symbols, chosen at random: Purple Moon, Blue Triangle, Red Square, Orange Heart. Remove the other 4 [[Jungle]] locations from the game without looking at them. Do not include any of the other encounter cards listed in the original setup instructions. (There should be a total of 6 cards.)
For the duration of this scenario, the following additional rules apply: "The 'check your supplies' ability on the Mouth of K'n-yan can be used from any location. Forced - After a successful exploration ends: Shuffle the top card of the encounter deck into the exploration deck." Attach this card to the scenario reference card as a reminder.
Name: Return to Heart of the Elders, Part 1

Description: Objective - When the investigators have collected the requisite number of clues, they must immediately spend them and advance.
Flavor: Six stone pillars surround the entrance to the cavern, each carved with a series of uncanny grooves and hieroglyphs that form an intricate pattern. Touching them causes the grooves to glow brightly, and twisting them causes the patterns to shift and change. Perhaps these patterns match the glyphs found in other regions of the rainforest?
Name: A Familiar Pattern

Description: X is the number of pillar tokens on Mouth of K'n-yan. While X is 3 or higher, Feathered Serpent gains alert and hunter. [action]: Evade. Check your supplies. If you have a mysterious scepter, you automatically evade the serpent and command it to deal its damage to another enemy at its location.
Name: Feathered Serpent

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Forgotten Age Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to Heart of the Elders, Part 2 shown here. - After setup, search the collection for the new Harbinger of Valusia (The Sleeper Returns) and set it aside, out of play. If the Harbinger of Valusia would enter play during this scenario, use this version instead of the original one. (Continued on reverse side.)
Description2:
- When building the exploration deck, include only 1 of the 2 locations with each of the following connection symbols, chosen at random: Purple Moon, Blue Triangle, Red Square, Green Diamond. Remove the other 4 [[Ancient]] locations from the game without looking at them. Do not include any of the other encounter cards listed in the original setup instructions. (There should be a total of 5 cards, not counting the set-aside Descent to Yoth.)
For the duration of this scenario, the following additional rules apply: "The 'check your supplies' ability on the Mouth of K'n-yan can be used from any location, and it discards enemies as well as treacheries. Forced - After a successful exploration ends: Shuffle the top card of the encounter deck into the exploration deck." Attach this card to the scenario reference card as a reminder.
Name: Return to Heart of the Elders, Part 2

Description: [action] [action]: Check your supplies. If you have a compass, discover 2 clues on Ruins of K'n-yan. (Group limit once per game.)
Name: Ruins of K'n-yan

Description: [fast] If there are no clues on Subterranean Swamp: Check your supplies. If you have a canteen, place 1 doom on this location and record "sticky goop" in your supplies. (Group limit once per game.) Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating Subterranean Swamp: Check your supplies. If you do not have a pocketknife, lose all remaining actions and end your turn.
Name: Subterranean Swamp

Description: Forced - After the last clue is discovered from Chthonian Depths: Check your supplies. If no investigator at this location has torches, place 1 doom on it.
Name: Chthonian Depths

Description: [action]: Check your supplies. If you have a pickaxe, reduce the shroud value of Treacherous Descent by 2 for the remainder of the scenario. (Group limit 3 times per game.)
Name: Treacherous Descent

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Forgotten Age Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to The City of Archives shown here. - Put Halls of Pnakotus (Southern Corridors) into play. (Continued on reverse side.)
Description2: - Set Cyclopean Vaults and Alien Conservatory aside, out of play. (These locations should be put into play during act 1b when the remainder of the set-aside locations are put into play.) - Remove Act 2a - "Restricted Access" from the game and replace it with the new Act 2a - "Unrestricted Access."
Name: Return to The City of Archives

Description: Objective - If three of the following are true, you must advance: - An investigator "found the process." - An investigator "dissected an organ." - An investigator "interviewed a subject." - An investigator "realized what year it is." - An investigator "activated the device." - An investigator controls The Custodian. - An investigator "read about Earth." - An investigator "saw a familiar specimen."
Description2: You no longer have to perform any of the following tasks. However, the more you have performed by the time the scenario ends, the easier the transition to your human body will be, and the less likely the process is to fail or backfire. Be careful... Put this act into play with this side faceup as a reminder. - An investigator "found the process." - An investigator "dissected an organ." - An investigator "interviewed a subject." - An investigator "realized what year it is." - An investigator "activated the device." - An investigator controls The Custodian. - An investigator "read about Earth." - An investigator "saw a familiar specimen."
Flavor2: The truth is hard to accept. Your body was never brought to this place. Your mind has been transferred into the body of one of these creatures. Somewhere, in another place - in another time - one of the reviled creatures dwells in your body.
Name: Unrestricted Access

Description: This location is connected to Halls of Pnakotus (Eastern Corridors) and Halls of Pnakotus (Western Corridors), and vice versa. [free] During your turn, choose and discard a card from your hand: Move to another copy of Halls of Pnakotus. (Limit once per turn.)
Description2: This location is connected to Halls of Pnakotus (Eastern Corridors) and Halls of Pnakotus (Western Corridors), and vice versa.
Name: Halls of Pnakotus

Description:
[action]: Discard each non-weakness card in your hand.
[action] If you have no cards in your hand: Remember that you "read about Earth."
[action] [action] If you have fewer than 5 cards in your hand: Draw cards until you have exactly 5 cards in your hand.
Flavor2: I came at last to a low, circular crypt with arches - still in a marvellous state of preservation - opening off on every side. The walls, or such parts of them as lay within reach of my torchlight, were densely hieroglyphed and chiselled with typical curvilinear symbols - some added since the period of my dreams. - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Shadow out of Time</u>
Name: Cyclopean Vaults

Description:
While you are in the Alien Conservatory, decrease your maximum hand size by 2.
[action]: Test [willpower] (1). If you succeed, test [agility] (2). If you succeed, test [intellect] (3). If you succeed, remember that you "saw a familiar specimen."
Flavor2: ...the Great Race itself waxed well-nigh omniscient, and turned to the task of setting up exchanges with the minds of other planets, and of exploring their pasts and futures. - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Shadow out of Time</u>
Name: Alien Conservatory

Description: Spawn - Alien Conservatory. Aloof. Retaliate. If an investigator "read about Earth" or "saw a familiar specimen," Captive Subjects loses aloof and gains hunter.
Name: Captive Subjects

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Forgotten Age Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to The Depths of Yoth shown here. - After setup, search the collection for the new Harbinger of Valusia (The Sleeper Returns) and set it aside, out of play. If the Harbinger of Valusia would enter play during this scenario, use this version instead of the original one. (Continued on reverse side.)
Description2:
- After building the exploration deck during setup, shuffle the Perils of Yoth treachery into the exploration deck.
For the duration of this scenario, the following additional rule applies: "Forced - After a new exploration deck is created during act 1b: Search the encounter deck, discard pile, and all out-of-play areas for Perils of Yoth and shuffle it into the exploration deck. Shuffle the encounter deck if it was searched." Attach this card to the scenario reference card as a reminder.
Name: Return to The Depths of Yoth

Description: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Set Perils of Yoth aside, out of play. (This exploration fails.) - Set Perils of Yoth aside, out of play: take horror or damage equal to the current depth level; and continue exploring as if you had not drawn Perils of Yoth.
Name: Perils of Yoth

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Forgotten Age Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to Shattered Aeons shown here. - When building the exploration deck, use only the 4 single-sided [[Otherworld]] locations. Do not include any of the other encounter cards listed in the original setup instructions. (Continued on reverse side.)
Description2:
- Set the new [[Shattered]] locations aside, out of play.
For the duration of this scenario, the following additional rule applies: "Forced - After a successful exploration ends: Shuffle the top card of the encounter deck into the exploration deck." Attach this card to the scenario reference card as a reminder.
Name: Return to Shattered Aeons

Description: [reaction] After you move to Great Hall of Celeano, place 1 doom on it: Look at the top card of the encounter deck, the exploration deck, or any player deck. You may discard that card.
Name: Great Hall of Celeano

Description: Buenos Aires gets -2 shroud for each doom on it. Forced - At the end of the mythos phase: Place 1 doom on Buenos Aires.
Name: Buenos Aires

Description: Forced - After Ultima Thule enters play: Search the chaos bag for the [elder_sign] chaos token and seal it on Ultima Thule.
Name: Ultima Thule

Description: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Reveal 4 chaos tokens. For each [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol revealed, take 1 damage and 1 horror. - Choose and discard 1 card from your hand and shuffle Unknowable Past into the exploration deck. You cannot choose this option if Unknowable Past was drawn from the exploration deck.
Name: Unknowable Past

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Forgotten Age Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to Turn Back Time shown here. - Gather the 3 Pit Viper cards from the Serpents encounter set and set them aside, out of play. - Before setup, remove the original Burial Pit, Underground Ruins, and Secret Passage locations from the game. (Continued on reverse side.)
Description2:
- Beforoe setup, replace the original Entryway, Ancient Hall, Grand Chamber, and Chamber of Time locations with the new versions from this encounter set. - Before setup, replace the original Harbinger of Valusia enemy with the new Harbinger of Valusia (The Sleeper Returns). - When building the exploration deck, use only Sealed Passage, Mosaic Chamber, Tomb of the Ancients, Throne Room, Snake Pit, Ancient Hall, and Grand Chamber. Do not include any of the other encounter cards listed in the original setup instructions.
For the duration of this scenario, the following additional rule applies: "Forced - After a successful exploration ends: Shuffle the top card of the encounter deck into the exploration deck." Attach this card to the scenario reference card as a reminder.
Name: Return to Turn Back Time

Description: Forced - After any number of clues are discovered at Riverside Temple: Check your supplies. If no investigator at Riverside Temple has chalk, shuffle an equal number of cards from the top of the encounter deck into the exploration deck.
Name: Riverside Temple

Description: [reaction] When you investigate Waterfall: Check your supplies. If an investigator at Waterfall has rope, reduce Waterfall's shroud by 3 for this investigation. Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating Waterfall: Discard 1 card at random from your hand.
Name: Waterfall

Description: Forced - After you investigate or explore while at Trail of the Dead: Check your supplies. If no investigator at Trail of the Dead has binoculars, take 1 horror.
Name: Trail of the Dead

Description: Forced - When an enemy at Cloud Forest would be dealt any amount of damage: Check your supplies. If no investigator at Cloud Forest has torches, cancel that damage.
Name: Cloud Forest

Description: Spawn - Location with the most [[Cultist]] enemies. Aloof. Forced - After Brotherhood Acolyte enters plaay: Place 1 doom on each other [[Cultist]] enemy at its location.
Name: Brotherhood Acolyte

Description: Spawn - Any empty location. Retaliate. Stolen Mind gets +1 fight for each doom on it. Forced - At the end of the mythos phase: Place 1 doom on Stolen Mind.
Name: Stolen Mind

Description: Revelation - Test [intellect] (4). Place X doom on [[Cultist]] enemies in play, divided as evenly as possible. X is the amount you failed by. If you fail and there are no [[Cultist]] enemies in play, instead search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Cultist]] enemy and draw it (shuffle the encounter deck).
Name: From Another Time

Description: Revelation - Take 1 horror and attach Resentful Wilds to the nearest location without a copy of Resentful Wilds attached. Forced - After you successfully explore at attached location: Add Resentful Wilds to the victory display.
Name: Resentful Wilds

Description: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Lose 2 actions. - Shuffle the top card of the encounter deck into the exploration deck.
Name: Best-Laid Plans

Description: Revelation - Discard the top 5 cards of your deck. For each card in your hand that matches one of the cards (by title), discard that card from your hand and lose 1 action. Shuffle each weakness discarded by this effect into your deck.
Name: Merging Timelines

Description: Alert. Retaliate. Forced - After Tindalos Alpha attacks you: Shuffle a non-story asset you control into your deck, moving all damage and horror from that asset to your investigator. Discard Tindalos Alpha. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase: Discard Tindalos Alpha.
Name: Tindalos Alpha

Description: Hunter. Forced - After you draw Vengeful Serpent: Draw each Vengeful Serpent in the victory display as well.
Name: Vengeful Serpent

Description: Spawn - Nearest location with at least 1 clue. Aloof. While Serpent Guardian is unengaged, its location gets +2 shroud. While there are 3 or more vengeance points in the victory display, Serpent Guardian loses aloof and gains hunter.
Name: Serpent Guardian

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (2). This test gets +1 difficulty for each vengeance point in the victory display. If you fail, put a set-aside Poisoned weakness into play in your threat area (if you cannot, take 2 damage).
Name: Wrath of Yig

Description:
"Skids" O'Toole deck only. Advanced.
Fast. Play during any [fast] window.
Until the end of the round, non-[[Elite]] enemies cannot attack you. At the end of the round, you may disengage from each engaged enemy and move up to 2 locations away.
Name: On the Lam

Description: Advanced. Revelation - Put Hospital Debts into play in your threat area. [fast]: Move 1 resource from your resource pool to Hospital Debts. (Limit three times per round.) Forced - When the game ends, if Hospital Debts has fewer than 9 resources on it: You earn 2 fewer experience for this scenario.
Name: Hospital Debts

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -1 for each clue you have.
[cultist]: -2 (-4 instead if you have 10 or more resources).
[tablet]: -2. If you fail, lose 3 resources.
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, "Skids" O'Toole takes 1 horror.
Description2:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -2 for each clue you have.
[cultist]: -4 (-8 instead if you have 10 or more resources).
[tablet]: -3. Lose 3 resources.
[elder_thing]: -5. If you fail, "Skids" O'Toole takes 1 horror.
Name: All or Nothing

Description: [action] If you are in the Clover Club Cardroom, spend any number of clues: You cash in your chips. Gain 5 resources for each clue just spent. Forced - If "Skids" O'Toole is defeated: (→R2)
Description2: Each investigator who has not resigned is defeated and suffers 1 physical trauma. If "Skids" O'Toole has resigned, proceed to (→R1). Otherwise, proceed to (→R2)
Flavor: The Clover Club is filled with mobsters and gamblers from all walks of life. Winning big without causing alarm may not be as easy as you thought.
Flavor2: It's getting late, and you've been gambling all night. Exhausted, you try to stand up, but stumble and spill your drink all over a scruffy-looking fellow at your table. Slowly turning to you with a wicked scowl, the husky hoodlum stares at you with contempt. The man leaps out of his seat and lunges at you. Now you've done it. The mobsters are sure to kick you out...
Name: Eyes All Around You

Description: Investigators cannot resign. Clover Club Pit Boss gains aloof. Forced - After a [[Criminal]] enemy is defeated: Place 1 doom on the agenda. Objective - At the end of the round: If an investigator has 15 or more resources, advance.
Description2: Spawn the set-aside Siobhan Riley enemy in La Bella Luna. Each investigator spawns 1 set-aside Clover Club Bouncer enemy engaged with them.
Flavor: You don't want trouble, so it's best not to cause it. Try not to go all in too soon, or you'll likely take the bounce.
Flavor2:
Fueled by luck and adrenaline, you've wont a bit too much and failed to keep a low profile. The O'Bannions know you're here and despise having their money stolen by "cheaters." A commanding voice from La Bella Luna calls out, "That O'Toole vermin is here. Split up and get him!"
You freeze and your mind clears at the sound of your name. It may be time to stop. Once-oblivious mobsters now rise and pursue you with fierce determination. Do you confront the trouble before escaping out the front, or do you try to find the back door?
Name: Playing Cards

Description: Each [[Criminal]] enemy gains hunter and gets +1 health. Forced - When an investigator resigns: Place each of that investigator's resources on this act. Objective - Collect as many resources as you can and get out. When each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.
Flavor: Collect your winnings and escape!
Flavor2: You run out the door and sprint around the corner, winnings in hand. The adrenaline rush is like no other. Once at a safe distance, you count your money. You take a deep breath and are relieved; this outing put a big dent in your debts. Surely this night will only add to your reputation. Lady Luck is always on your side!
Name: Hot on your Tail

Description: Forced - After Siobhan Riley engages you: For every 5 resources you have, lose 1 resource. Forced - After an investigator at Siobhan Riley's location gains 1 or more resources during the investigation phase: Siobhan Riley readies, engages that investigator, and makes an attack.
Name: Siobhan Riley

Description: When Clover Club Bouncer is engaged with you, it gets +1 fight and +1 evade for every 5 resources you have. [action] Spend 3 resources: Parley. Test [intellect] (2). If you succeed, disengage from Clover Club Bouncer and exhaust it. It does not ready during the next upkeep phase.
Name: Clover Club Bouncer

Description:
[reaction] When you deal damage to an enemy by an event or a fight ability on an event: Deal 1 additional damage. (Limit once per phase.)
[elder_sign] effect: +1. If this skill test is successful during an attack, return an event from your discard pile to your hand.
Description2: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Guardian cards ([guardian]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Randall Cho, Tommy Malloy, 1 random basic weakness.
Flavor: "I must fight on."
Flavor2: When up-and-coming boxer Nathaniel Cho was offered lots of dough for a title fight, he thought he'd finally hit the big time. But his promoter turned out to be part of the notorious O'Bannion gang, and Nathaniel was pressured to fix fights by taking a dive every now and then. His refusal led to his brother Randall's "accident." Nathaniel is rightly fed up with the mobsters endangering Arkham's citizens on a nightly basis. Now he puts his fists to better use, patrolling the streets and defending others from harm. But he's about to find out there are much more dangerous things that lurk in the shadows of Arkham than simple gangsters...
Name: Nathaniel Cho

Description: Nathaniel Cho deck only. [reaction] After Randall Cho enters play: Heal 3 damage or search your deck and discard pile for a [[Weapon]] asset, play it (paying its cost), and shuffle your deck.
Flavor: "You gotta give this up, Nathaniel. Sooner or later, you're gonna get yourself killed."
Name: Randall Cho

Description: Prey - Nathaniel Cho only. Hunter. Forced - When Tommy Malloy would take any amount of damage: Reduce that amount to 1.
Flavor:
They call him "The Big Palooka."
Nathaniel calls him scum.
Name: Tommy Malloy

Description: Revelation - Put Self-Destructive into play in your threat area. Forced - When you deal 1 or more damage to an enemy: Take 1 damage. [action] [action]: Discard Self-Destructive.
Name: Self-Destructive

Description:
You get +1 [combat] while fighting.
[reaction] After you defeat an enemy, exhaust Boxing Gloves: Search the top 6 cards of your deck for a [[Spirit]] event and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.
Name: Boxing Gloves

Description:
Uses (4 charges).
[reaction] When you are dealt damage and/or horror from an enemy attack, exhaust Flesh Ward and spend 1 charge: Cancel 1 damage or horror just dealt from that attack.
Name: Flesh Ward

Description:
You get +1 [combat].
[reaction] After you defeat an enemy, exhaust Grete Wagner and deal 1 damage to her: Discover 1 clue at your location.
Flavor: "With Iron and Salt. With Water and Fire."
Name: Grete Wagner

Description:
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [willpower] for this skill test.
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [combat] for this skill test.
Name: Physical Training

Description:
[reaction] When you deal excess damage to an enemy, exhaust Relentless: Place that excess damage on Relentless.
[fast] Discard Relentless: Gain resources equal to the amount of damage on it.
Name: Relentless

Description: [reaction] After another investigator moves from your location to a connecting location, exhaust Safeguard: Move to that location.
Flavor: Keep an eye out for any trouble, she told me. I rolled my eyes. There was always trouble.
Name: Safeguard

Description: Fight. When this action begins, gain 2 resources.
Flavor: Time to tighten some screws.
Name: Clean Them Out

Description: Fast. Play after an enemy attacks you, even if that attack was canceled. Fight. This attack targets the attacking enemy.
Name: Counterpunch

Description:
Fast. Play when an enemy attacks an investigator at your location.
Cancel that attack.
Name: Dodge

Description: Engage. Fight. Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location or a connecting location. Move that enemy to your location, engage it, and attack it.
Name: "Get over here!"

Description:
Fast. Play after you defeat an enemy.
Draw 2 cards.
Flavor: Ding, ding, ding!
Name: Glory

Description: Fight. This attack deals +1 damage.
Name: Monster Slayer

Description: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack. If you succeed, you may fight that enemy again. You get +2 [combat] and deal +1 damage for that attack.
Flavor: Nathaniel is renowned for his rapid left jab and right cross signature move.
Name: One-Two Punch

Description: Choose another investigator at your location. Both you and that investigator gain 2 resources.
Flavor: They won't take us down that easily!
Name: Stand Together

Description: If this skill test is successful during an attack, that attack deals +1 damage.
Flavor: With a sickening smack, he struck the abomination over and over... until at last, it stopped moving.
Name: Vicious Blow

Description:
Fast. Play after you defeat an enemy.
Discover 1 clue at your location (2 clues instead if you defeated enemies with a combined total of at least 4 printed health this turn).
Flavor: Just as I suspected!
Name: Evidence!

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Ready a [guardian] asset you control. You may take an additional action during your turn, which can only be used to fight.
Name: Galvanize

Description: Fast. Play when an enemy attacks you (before resolving that attack). Fight. This attack targets the attacking enemy. You get +2 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack.
Name: Counterpunch

Description: Fast. Play during any [free] window. Engage. Fight. Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy up to 2 locations away. Move that enemy to your location, engage it, and attack it.
Name: "Get over here!"

Description:
Fast. Play after you take damage from an enemy attack.
Discover 2 clues at your location.
Name: Lesson Learned

Description:
Play only as your first action.
Deal 2 damage to an enemy engaged with you. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
Name: Mano a Mano

Description:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
If this test is successful, draw 1 card (2 cards instead if it succeeds by 2 or more).
Flavor: Die, you beast!
Name: Overpower

Description:
You get +2 [combat] while fighting.
[reaction] After you defeat an enemy, exhaust Boxing Gloves: Search the top 9 cards of your deck for a [[Spirit]] event and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.
Name: Boxing Gloves

Description:
You get +1 [combat] and +1 [intellect].
[reaction] After you defeat an enemy, exhaust Grete Wagner and deal 1 damage to her: Discover 1 clue at your location or a connecting location.
Flavor: "With Iron and Salt. With Water and Fire."
Name: Grete Wagner

Description:
Fast. Play during any [fast] window.
Choose either your location or a connecting location. Deal 3 damage to each enemy and investigator at the chosen location.
Name: Dynamite Blast

Description:
Fast. Play during any [fast] window.
Engage any number of enemies at your location. For each enemy engaged this way, deal it 1 damage and draw 1 card.
Flavor: You steel your nerves and shout into the darkness. "Come and get me!"
Name: Taunt

Description:
Uses (2 resources). Replenish these resources at the start of each round.
[free] Spend 1 resource from your resource pool or from Physical Training: You get +1 [willpower] or +1 [combat] for this skill test.
Name: Physical Training

Description: Fight. You automatically succeed and deal +1 damage for this attack. You may fight again. You get +3 [combat] and deal +2 damage for that attack.
Flavor: Nathaniel is renowned for his rapid left jab and right cross signature move.
Name: One-Two Punch

Description:
[reaction] After an investigator at your location draws 1 or more cards from their deck during the investigation phase: That investigator draws 1 card. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] effect: +1. Draw 1 card.
Description2: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Vault of Knowledge, Thrice-Damned Curiosity, 1 random basic weakness.
Flavor: "I have experience dealing with these sorts of horrors."
Flavor2: Professor Walters began as a devotee of the archaic and obscure, but over the years he has discovered that his knowledge of ancient languages, profane relics, and strange rituals is vital to addressing dangers in the modern day. He is both an avid collector of prehistoric ephemera and a fount of knowledge regarding the bizarre primordial religions that worshipped nightmarish gods eons ago. There is perhaps no sane person alive who knows more about the occult than Harvey. When a supernatural event occurs, Professor Walters brings his considerable resources and experience to bear.
Name: Harvey Walters

Description:
Harvey Walters deck only.
Your maximum hand size is increased by 2.
[reaction] After you successfully investigate, exhaust Vault of Knowledge and choose an investigator at your location: That investigator draws 1 card.
Name: Vault of Knowledge

Description: Revelation - For every 3 cards in your hand: Take 1 damage.
Flavor:
"... I can only hope that my account will not arouse a curiosity greater than sane caution on the part of those who believe me at all."
- H. P. Lovecraft, "At the Mountains of Madness"
Name: Thrice-Damned Curiosity

Description: Revelation - Put Obsessive into play in your threat area. Forced - When your turn begins: Discard 1 non-weakness card at random from your hand. [action] [action]: Discard Obsessive.
Name: Obsessive

Description:
Your maximum hand size is increased by 1.
You have 1 additional hand slot, which can only be used to hold a [[Tome]] asset.
Flavor: An augmented mind can memorize entire volumes of books.
Name: Arcane Enlightenment

Description:
While you have...
- ...5 or more cards in hand, you get +1 [intellect].
- ...10 or more cards in hand, you get +1 [willpower].
- ...15 or more cards in hand, you get +1 [intellect].
Name: Celaeno Fragments

Description: [reaction] When a non-[[Elite]] enemy spawns at your location, discard Disc of Itzamna: Automatically evade that enemy or deal it 2 damage.
Flavor: Do they fear it because of what it will do to them? Or, do they fear it because of what it will do to you?
Name: Disc of Itzamna

Description:
Uses (5 secrets).
[action] Exhaust Encyclopedia and spend 1 secret: Choose an investigator at your location. That investigator gets +2 to a skill of your choice until the end of the phase.
Name: Encyclopedia

Description:
Uses (3 secrets).
[action] Exhaust Feed the Mind and spend 1 secret: Test [intellect] (1). For each point you succeed by (to a maximum of 3), draw 1 card.
Name: Feed the Mind

Description:
Uses (5 secrets).
[action] Exhaust Forbidden Tome and spend 1 secret: Draw 1 card. Then, if you have 10 or more cards in your hand and there are no secrets on Forbidden Tome, you may discard it to record in your Campaign Log that "you have translated the tome."
Name: Forbidden Tome

Description:
While you have 5 or more cards in your hand, Higher Education gains:
"[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [willpower] for this skill test.
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [intellect] for this skill test."
Name: Higher Education

Description:
Your maximum hand size is increased by 2.
[reaction] After Laboratory Assistant enters play: Draw 2 cards.
Name: Laboratory Assistant

Description:
While you control a [[Tome]] or [[Relic]] asset, you get +1 [intellect].
[reaction] After you reveal a location or put a new location into play, exhaust Whitton Greene: Search the top 6 cards of your deck for a [[Tome]] or [[Relic]] asset and draw it. Shuffle your deck.
Name: Whitton Greene

Description: Investigate. When this action begins, gain 2 resources.
Flavor: You'll sleep when you're dead.
Name: Burning the Midnight Oil

Description:
Gain 2 resources.
[reaction] After you draw Cryptic Writings during your turn: Play it.
Flavor: "...these are few as compared with those in languages I cannot understand." - H. P. Lovecraft, "The Statement of Randolph Carter"
Name: Cryptic Writings

Description:
Reduce the cost to play Extensive Research by 1 for each other card in your hand.
Discover 2 clues at your location.
Flavor:
"Nothing in here, either. How many do we have left?"
"...See the wall behind you?"
Name: Extensive Research

Description: As an additional cost to play Occult Invocation, discard up to 2 cards from your hand. Fight. - This attack uses [intellect] instead of [combat]. You get +1 [intellect] and deal +1 damage for this attack for each card discarded as part of this card's cost.
Name: Occult Invocation

Description:
Play only if there is a clue on your location.
Draw 3 cards.
Name: Preposterous Sketches

Description: If this skill test is successful while investigating a location, discover 1 additional clue at that location.
Flavor: I knew I had seen this symbol before. I must warn the others before it is too late!
Name: Deduction

Description: [reaction] After Library Docent enters play, return a [[Tome]] asset you control to its owner's hand: Play a different [[Tome]] asset (by title) from your hand, reducing its cost by 2.
Name: Library Docent

Description: Draw 1 card. Shuffle any number of non-weakness cards from your hand into your deck. Then, draw that many cards.
Flavor: Ignorance is a bliss you cannot afford.
Name: Glimpse the Unthinkable

Description:
Uses (4 secrets).
[action] Spend 1 secret: Choose a revealed location up to 3 connections away from your location. Move to that location.
Name: Esoteric Atlas

Description:
While you control a [[Tome]] or [[Relic]] asset, you get +1 [willpower] and +1 [intellect].
[reaction] After you reveal a location or put a new location into play, exhaust Whitton Greene: Search the top 9 cards of your deck for a [[Tome]] or [[Relic]] asset and draw it. Shuffle your deck.
Name: Whitton Greene

Description:
Gain 3 resources (4 resources instead if you have 10 or more other cards in hand).
[reaction] After you draw Cryptic Writings during your turn: Play it.
Flavor: "...these are few as compared with those in the languages I cannot understand." - H. P. Lovecraft, "The Statement of Randolph Carter"
Name: Cryptic Writings

Description: Fight. This attack uses [intellect] instead of [combat]. You get +2 [intellect] for this test. You deal +1 damage for this attack for each clue you have (max +3 damage).
Flavor: "That's the worst plan I've ever heard. Well, what are we waiting for?"
Name: "I've got a plan!"

Description:
Fast. Play during your turn.
Until the end of the round, add your [intellect] to your [combat] and [agility]. Draw 1 card.
Name: Mind over Matter

Description: Investigate. If you succeed, instead of discovering a clue at your location, discover 2 total clues from among your location and connecting locations.
Flavor: Some people need to know the truth at any cost. Some truths can cut like knives.
Name: Seeking Answers

Description:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
If this test is successful, draw 1 card (2 cards instead if it succeeds by 2 or more).
Flavor: At last, I've found it!
Name: Perception

Description:
Researched.
[action] [action] [action] [action] Exhaust Forbidden Tome: Move 1 damage from a player card at your location to an enemy at your location. Reduce this ability's cost by 1 action for every 4 cards in your hand (to a minimum of [action]).
Name: Forbidden Tome

Description:
Researched.
[action] [action] [action] [action] Exhaust Forbidden Tome: You may move to a connecting location. Discover 1 clue at your location. Reduce this ability's cost by 1 action for every 4 cards in your hand (to a minimum of [action]).
Name: Forbidden Tome

Description: [fast] During your turn, if you have 8 or more cards in your hand, exhaust Farsight: Play an event from your hand (paying its cost).
Flavor: Beyond all points in time. Beyond all angles of space. Beyond the curves of reality.
Name: Farsight

Description: Permanent. Limit 1 per deck. You have 2 additional ally slots, which can only be used to hold [[Miskatonic]] assets. Forced - When you take damage or horror: No more than 1 of that damage/horror can be assigned to a [[Miskatonic]] asset.
Name: Miskatonic Archaeology Funding

Description:
Uses (6 secrets). Limit 1 per deck.
[free] Spend 1 secret: You get +2 skill value for this skill test.
[free] Spend 2 secrets: Draw 2 cards.
[free] Spend 3 secrets: Discover 1 clue at any location.
[free] Spend 4 secrets: Deal 3 damage to an enemy engaged with you.
Name: The Necronomicon

Description:
[free] If 2 different non-weakness cards you control are committed to this skill test: Draw 1 card. (Limit once per test.)
[elder_sign] effect: +1. After this test ends, for every 2 points you succeeded by, return a card you committed to this test to your hand.
Description2: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Rogue cards ([rogue]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Anything You Can Do, Better; Arrogance; 1 random basic weakness.
Flavor: "I can top that."
Flavor2: Winifred - Weethao as her parents know her, Wini to her friends - was one of the smartest kids in her reservation school. However, her reckless attitude and lack of respect for authority meant she often got herself into trouble. The course of her life changed forever when she found an old biplane in a farmer's garage and decided to "take it out for a spin." The owner, a former pilot in the Great War, was awestruck by her natural talent and offered to teach her what he knew. Now Wini is known as the "woman without fear," showing off her skills in barnstormers all across the country. That nickname would be tested when, during one of her shows, she spotted a creature she could scarcely describe: a thing with leathery wings and a single, mutated, pus-filled eye.
Name: Winifred Habbamock

Description:
Winifred Habbamock deck only.
Commit only to a skill test you are performing.
Flavor: "Told you."
Name: Anything You Can Do, Better

Description:
You must commit Arrogance to each eligible skill test you perform.
This skill's icons subtract from your skill value instead of adding to it.
If this test succeeds, return this skill to your hand.
Name: Arrogance

Description: Commit only to a skill test you are performing (of any type) that has no other cards committed to it. Other cards cannot be committed to this skill test. If this test fails, return this skill to your hand. Forced - If Reckless is in your hand at the end of your turn: Reveal it and lose 2 resources.
Name: Reckless

Description: [action] Exhaust Lockpicks: Investigate. Add your [agility] value to your skill value for this investigation. If you do not succeed by at least 2, discard Lockpicks.
Name: Lockpicks

Description: Uses (5 ammo). [action] Exhaust Mauser C96 and spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +1 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack. If you succeed by 2 or more, either ready Mauser C96 or gain 1 resource.
Name: Mauser C96

Description: Fast. [action]: Fight. If you succeed by 2 or more, this attack deals +1 damage.
Name: Switchblade

Description: [reaction] After you succeed at a skill test by 2 or more, exhaust Lucky Cigarette Case: Draw 1 card.
Flavor: "It’s not really all that lucky. Just in the mood for a smoke."
Name: Lucky Cigarette Case

Description:
You get +1 [combat].
[fast] Exhaust Lonnie Ritter and spend 1 resource: Choose an [[Item]] asset controlled by an investigator at your location. Heal 1 damage from that asset and 1 horror from Lonnie Ritter.
Name: Lonnie Ritter

Description: Fast.
Flavor:
"You think wearing that makes you look like the cat's meow?"
"Nah, I already know I'm the cat's meow. This just lets everyone else know."
Name: Leather Jacket

Description:
[free] Spend 2 resources: You get +2 [intellect] for this skill test.
[free] Spend 2 resources: You get +2 [agility] for this skill test.
Name: Streetwise

Description: Fight. Add your [agility] value to your skill value for this attack. If you succeed by 2 or more, automatically evade the attacked enemy.
Flavor: "Aim for the eyes," they told me.
Name: Cheap Shot

Description:
Fast. Play when you would succeed at a skill test.
You get +2 skill value for this test.
Flavor:
"McGlen, are you tryin' to get us both killed?"
"Not this time, pal. Not this time."
Name: Daring Maneuver

Description: Evade. Add your [intellect] to your skill value for this evasion attempt. If you succeed by 2 or more and the evaded enemy is non-[[Elite]], it does not ready during the next upkeep phase.
Name: Slip Away

Description: Investigate. This investigation uses [agility] instead of [intellect]. If you succeed, discover 2 additional clues at your location.
Name: Pilfer

Description: Evade. When this action begins, gain 2 resources.
Flavor: Being told not to do something was generally Winifred's cue to proceed as planned.
Name: Sneak By

Description: For each point this skill test succeeds by, after it resolves, you may immediately move to a connecting location (to a maximum of 3 times).
Name: Nimble

Description: After you commit Daredevil to a skill test, discard cards from the top of your deck until you discard a [rogue] skill you can commit to this test. Commit it. Shuffle each weakness that was discarded by this effect back into your deck.
Flavor:
"You're a maniac, Wini!"
"I know! Isn't it wonderful?"
Name: Daredevil

Description:
Commit only to a skill test you are performing.
If you succeed by 3 or more, return Opportunist to your hand after this test instead of discarding it.
Name: Opportunist

Description:
Uses (4 supplies).
[action] Spend 1 supply: Choose an investigator at your location to heal 1 horror. Then, that investigator tests [willpower] (2). If the test succeeds, they draw 1 card. If the test fails, they heal 1 additional horror and discard 1 card at random from their hand.
Name: Liquid Courage

Description: Uses (5 ammo). [action] Exhaust Mauser C96 and spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +2 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack. If you succeed by 2 or more, either ready Mauser C96 or gain 1 resource (if you succeed by 4 or more, do both).
Name: Mauser C96

Description:
Fast. Play when you would succeed at a skill test.
You get +3 skill value for this test. Draw 1 card.
Flavor:
"McGlen, are you tryin' to get us both killed?"
"Not this time, pal. Not this time."
Name: Daring Maneuver

Description: Fight. Add your [agility] value to your skill value for this attack. If you succeed by 1 or more, automatically evade the attacked enemy. If you succeed by 3 or more, return Cheap Shot to your hand at the end of your turn.
Flavor: "Aim for the eyes," they told me.
Name: Cheap Shot

Description: Evade. Add your [intellect] to your skill value for this evasion attempt. If you succeed by 1 or more and the evaded enemy is non-[[Elite]], it does not ready during the next upkeep phase. If you succeed by 3 or more, return Slip Away to your hand at the end of your turn.
Name: Slip Away

Description:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
If this test is successful, draw 1 card (2 cards instead if it succeeds by 2 or more).
Flavor: Too easy.
Name: Manual Dexterity

Description: [reaction] After you succeed at a skill test by 1 or more, exhaust Lucky Cigarette Case: Search the top X cards of your deck for a card, draw it, and shuffle the remaining cards into your deck. X is the amount you succeeded by.
Name: Lucky Cigarette Case

Description:
[reaction] When you use a fight ability on a [[Firearm]] asset, exhaust Sharpshooter: Choose one, or both - 
- This attack uses [agility] instead of [combat]. All modifiers to your [combat] for this attack modify your [agility] instead.
- Use the attacked enemy's evade value for this attack, instead of their fight value.
Name: Sharpshooter

Description: Investigate. This investigation uses [agility] instead of [intellect]. If you succeed, discover 2 additional clues at your location. If you succeed by 2 or more, return Pilfer to your hand at the end of your turn.
Name: Pilfer

Description: Fight. This attack uses [agility] instead of [combat]. This attack deals +2 damage. If you succeed by 2 or more, return Backstab to your hand at the end of your turn.
Name: Backstab

Description: After you commit Copycat to a skill test, search the discard pile of another investigator for a skill you can commit to this test, and commit it. After this test ends, place that card on the bottom of its owner's deck.
Name: Copycat

Description: Uses (4 ammo). [action] Exhaust Beretta M1918 and spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +4 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack. If you succeed by 2 or more, either ready Beretta M1918, or this attack deals an additional +1 damage (if you succeed by 4 or more, do both).
Name: Beretta M1918

Description:
[reaction] When you play a [[Tactic]] or [[Trick]] event, exhaust Chuck Fergus: Choose two -
- That event gains fast.
- That event costs 2 fewer resources to play.
- You get +2 skill value while performing a skill test during the resolution of that event.
Name: Chuck Fergus

Description:
[reaction] When an investigator at your location would reveal any number of chaos tokens: Reveal 2 additional tokens. Of the revealed tokens, choose and cancel 2 non-[auto_fail] tokens, or 1 [auto_fail] token. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] effect: +1. If this effect is canceled or ignored, draw 1 card.
Description2: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Arbiter of Fates, Dark Future, 1 random basic weakness.
Flavor: "The future can be rewritten."
Flavor2: Blood. Fire. Destruction. Every night, Jacqueline's dreams are filled with things that have not yet come to pass. At first, she thought of these dreams as a terrible curse. However, as she began to control her visions and observe the events within in greater detail, she now understands they are no curse, but a calling. The world is about to be plunged into a thousand years of indescribable chaos, and only she knows the warning signs. Her dreams have never been wrong, but she cannot let the nightmares that haunt them become a reality.
Name: Jacqueline Fine

Description:
Jacqueline Fine deck only.
[reaction] When you use Jacqueline Fine's [reaction] ability, exhaust Arbiter of Fates: This use of her ability does not count towards its limit.
Flavor: I can see the threads. I know when they will snap.
Name: Arbiter of Fates

Description: Revelation - Put Dark Future into play in your threat area. You cannot cancel or ignore [elder_sign], [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], and [auto_fail] tokens. Forced - At the end of your turn: Reveal 5 random tokens from the chaos bag. If an [elder_sign] symbol is revealed, discard Dark Future.
Name: Dark Future

Description: Revelation - Put Nihilism into play in your threat area. Forced - After you reveal, cancel, or ignore an [auto_fail] token: Take 1 damage and 1 horror. [action][action]: Discard Nihilism.
Name: Nihilism

Description: [reaction] After a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], or [elder_thing] symbol is revealed during a test you are performing: You get +1 skill value for this test.
Flavor: The wax tapers give off an eerie glow, and the flames move as if they are alive.
Name: Ritual Candles

Description: Uses (4 secrets). [reaction] After a skill test at your location begins, exhaust Scrying Mirror and spend 1 secret: Perform the "reveal chaos token" step of the test now (before committing cards), instead of after committing cards.
Name: Scrying Mirror

Description: Uses (4 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Fight. This attack uses [willpower] instead of [combat] and deals +1 damage. If an [elder_sign], "+1," or "0" token is revealed during this attack, take 1 damage.
Name: Azure Flame

Description: Uses (3 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Investigate. Investigate using [willpower] instead of [intellect]. If you succeed, discover 1 additional clue at this location. If an [elder_sign], "+1," or "0" token is revealed during this investigation, take 1 horror.
Name: Clairvoyance

Description: Uses (3 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Evade. This evasion attempt uses [willpower] instead of [agility]. If you succeed, deal 1 damage to the evaded enemy. If an [elder_sign], "+1," or "0" token is revealed during this evasion attempt, lose 1 resource.
Name: Ineffable Truth

Description: You have 1 additional arcane slot, which can only be used to hold a [[Spell]] asset.
Flavor: "Thou art wholly unworthy. But I shall serve thee for now."
Name: Familiar Spirit

Description:
You get +1 [willpower].
[reaction] After a skill test at your location begins, exhaust Crystal Pendulum: Name a number. If this test succeeds by that number or fails by that number, draw 1 card.
Name: Crystal Pendulum

Description: [reaction] When you play a [[Spell]] card, exhaust Robes of Endless Night: Reduce the cost of that card by 1.
Flavor: Dark is the abyss without. Bright is the abyss within.
Name: Robes of Endless Night

Description: Move. Move to any revealed location and reveal a random token from the chaos bag. If you reveal a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol, you must discard an [[Item]] or [[Ally]] asset you control (if you cannot, take 1 damage).
Flavor: Extradimensional travel had its risks, he knew. But who could resist the frontiers beyond time and space?
Name: Astral Travel

Description:
Fast. Play when an enemy attacks an investigator at your location.
Cancel that attack. Then, reveal a random token from the chaos bag. If it has a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol, deal the attacking enemy's damage to itself.
Name: Hypnotic Gaze

Description: Look at the top 4 cards of the encounter deck. Reveal a random token from the chaos bag. If it has a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol, shuffle those cards into the encounter deck. Otherwise, return them to the top of the encounter deck in any order.
Flavor: "If I said that I could tell you when you were going to die, would you want to know?"
Name: Parallel Fates

Description: Gain 1 resource. Reveal 3 random tokens from the chaos bag. For each [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol revealed, gain an additional 2 resources.
Name: Voice of Ra

Description:
Fast. Play when you would reveal a chaos token.
Reveal 5 chaos tokens instead of 1. Choose one of those tokens with a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol to resolve, and ignore the rest. (If no such token is revealed, choose any one of those tokens to resolve, and ignore the rest.)
Flavor: The secrets were written in the stars.
Name: Dark Prophecy

Description: Before revealing chaos tokens for this test, choose one of the following symbols: ([skull], [cultist], [tablet], or [elder_thing]). Ignore the effects of the chosen symbol during this test (including its modifier).
Flavor: “No.”
Name: Defiance

Description:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
After you commit Prescient to a skill test, name "even," "odd," or "symbol." After this test ends, if a chaos token of the named type was revealed during this test, you may return a [[Spell]] card from your discard pile to your hand.
Name: Prescient

Description:
Fast. Play when you would resolve an effect on a [mystic] card that triggers "when," "if," or "after" a chaos token is revealed.
Either cancel that effect, or resolve it an additional time.
Name: Eldritch Inspiration

Description:
Uses (3 charges). If Grotesque Statue has no charges, discard it.
[reaction] When you would reveal a chaos token, spend 1 charge: Reveal 2 chaos tokens instead of 1. Choose one of those tokens to resolve, and ignore the other.
Name: Grotesque Statue

Description: [reaction] When you play a [[Spell]] card, exhaust Robes of Endless Night: Reduce the cost of that card by 1. Playing that card does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
Flavor: Dark is the abyss without. Bright is the abyss within.
Name: Robes of Endless Night

Description:
Fast. Play when an enemy attacks an investigator at your location.
Cancel that attack. Then, reveal a random token from the chaos bag. If it has a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol, deal damage to the attacking enemy equal to its damage or horror.
Name: Hypnotic Gaze

Description:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
If this test is successful, draw 1 card (2 cards instead if it succeeds by 2 or more).
Flavor: Stay back! I'll handle this.
Name: Guts

Description: Uses (4 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Fight. This attack uses [willpower] instead of [combat]. You get +2 [willpower] and deal +1 damage for this attack. If an [elder_sign], "+1," or "0" token is revealed during this attack, take 1 damage.
Name: Azure Flame

Description: Uses (3 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Investigate. Investigate using [willpower] instead of [intellect]. You get +2 [willpower] for this investigation. If you succeed, discover 1 additional clue at this location. If an [elder_sign], "+1," or "0" token is revealed during this investigation, take 1 horror.
Name: Clairvoyance

Description: Uses (3 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Evade. This evasion attempt uses [willpower] instead of [agility]. You get +2 [willpower] for this evasion attempt. If you succeed, deal 1 damage to the evaded enemy. If an [elder_sign], "+1," or "0" token is revealed during this evasion attempt, lose 1 resource.
Name: Ineffable Truth

Description:
Uses (2 resources). Replenish these resources at the start of each round.
[fast] Spend 1 resource from your resource pool or from Arcane Studies: You get +1 [willpower] or +1 [intellect] for this skill test.
Name: Arcane Studies

Description: Choose a [[Spell]] or [[Relic]] asset controlled by an investigator at your location and reveal a random chaos token from the chaos bag. If you reveal a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol, add 1 charge to the chosen asset. Otherwise, add 4 charges to the chosen asset.
Name: Recharge

Description: Uses (4 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Fight. This attack uses [willpower] instead of [combat]. You get +3 [willpower] and deal +2 damage for this attack. If an [elder_sign], "+1," or "0" token is revealed during this attack, take 2 damage.
Name: Azure Flame

Description: Uses (3 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Investigate. Investigate using [willpower] instead of [intellect]. You get +3 [willpower] for this investigation. If you succeed, discover 2 additional clues at this location. If an [elder_sign], "+1," or "0" token is revealed during this investigation, take 2 horror.
Name: Clairvoyance

Description: Uses (3 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Evade. This evasion attempt uses [willpower] instead of [agility]. You get +3 [willpower] for this evasion attempt. If you succeed, deal 2 damage to the evaded enemy. If an [elder_sign], "+1," or "0" token is revealed during this evasion attempt, lose 2 resources.
Name: Ineffable Truth

Description:
[reaction] After you fail a skill test: You may take an additional action during your turn this round. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] effect: +1. You may instead choose to automatically fail this skill test to heal 1 damage and 1 horror.
Description2: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Survivor cards ([survivor]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): 3 copies of Neither Rain nor Snow, 1 copy of Called by the Mists, 1 random basic weakness.
Flavor: "I can hear it. Can it hear me?"
Flavor2: Before Stella began working for the postal service in Arkham, she knew two things with certainty. First, her parents made a mistake when they called her their son and gave her a boy's name. Second, the house on the cliff in Kingsport whispered her true name - the name she chose for herself - late at night: "Stella." Delivering the mail six days a week in all kinds of weather wasn't an easy job, but Stella loved knowing that she was helping people connect with one another. Then she started finding the letters. At the end of her route, there was always one extra envelope in her bag. It was always addressed to her. It was always postmarked from Kingsport. And it always contained a letter with one typed word: "Stella."
Name: Stella Clark

Description:
Stella Clark deck only.
If this skill test fails, cancel all effects of the failed test.
Flavor: ...nor gloom of night stays these couriers from the swift completion of their appointed rounds.
Name: Neither Rain nor Snow

Description: Revelation - Put Called by the Mists into play in your threat area. Forced - After you initiate a skill test with a difficulty of 4 or higher: Take 1 damage. [action] [action]: Discard Called by the Mists.
Name: Called by the Mists

Description: Revelation - Put Atychiphobia into play in your threat area. Forced - After you fail a skill test: Take 1 horror. [action] [action]: Discard Atychiphobia.
Name: Atychiphobia

Description: Uses (2 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +2 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack. If you fail, place 1 ammo on .18 Derringer.
Name: .18 Derringer

Description:
Uses (4 secrets).
[reaction] After an investigator at your location fails a skill test by 2 or more, exhaust Grimm's Fairy Tales and spend 1 secret: Heal 1 horror from that investigator.
Name: Grimm's Fairy Tales

Description: Uses (2 keys). If there are no keys on Old Keyring, discard it. [action]: Investigate. Your location gets -2 shroud for this investigation. If you succeed, remove 1 key from Old Keyring.
Name: Old Keyring

Description:
You get +1 [willpower].
[reaction] When an investigator at your location would fail a skill test, exhaust Granny Orne: That investigator fails by either 1 less or 1 more.
Name: Granny Orne

Description: [fast] Discard Mysterious Raven and take 1 horror: Discover 1 clue at your location.
Flavor:
"And his eyes have all the seeming
of a demon's that is dreaming..."
- Edgar Allan Poe, "The Raven"
Name: Mysterious Raven

Description: [reaction] After you fail a skill test, exhaust Rabbit's Foot: Draw 1 card.
Flavor: They claimed it would bring me good luck. I wouldn't say that's true. But now I feel like it would be even worse luck to get rid of it.
Name: Rabbit's Foot

Description:
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [combat] for this skill test.
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [agility] for this skill test.
Name: Scrapper

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Do not reveal chaos tokens for the next skill test you perform this turn.
Name: Will to Survive

Description:
Fast. Play when an investigator at your location draws a non-weakness treachery card.
Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, cancel that card's revelation effect.
Flavor: With or without hope, all you can do is resist.
Name: A Test of Will

Description:
Fast. Play after you fail a skill test by 2 or less during an evasion attempt against a non-[[Elite]] enemy.
Place that enemy on top of the encounter deck.
Flavor: Fortune favors the oblivious.
Name: Dumb Luck

Description:
Fast. Play after you fail a skill test.
You get +1 to each of your skills for the remainder of the round.
Name: Grit Your Teeth

Description: Fast. Play after a skill test you failed ends (after resolving all effects from the failed test). Attempt that test again. You get +2 skill value for this test.
Name: Live and Learn

Description:
Fast. Play after you fail a skill test by 2 or less while investigating.
Discover 2 clues in your location.
Name: "Look what I found!"

Description:
Fast. Play after you fail a skill test by 2 or less while attacking an enemy engaged with you.
Deal this attack's damage to a different enemy at your location.
Name: Oops!

Description:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
You may commit Take Heart to any type of test.
If this test fails, the performing investigator draws 2 cards and gains 2 resources.
Name: Take Heart

Description: Forced - When Cherished Keepsake is defeated by horror: Exile it.
Flavor: Mr. Pawterson always told Wendy things would turn out okay. But then again, Mr. Pawterson was a teddy bear, and he didn't know any better.
Name: Cherished Keepsake

Description: Forced - When Leather Coat is defeated by damage: Exile it.
Flavor: The coat was not the most fashionable choice, but it did feel warm and reassuring in its bulk.
Name: Leather Coat

Description: Uses (3 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +2 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack. If you fail, place 1 ammo on .18 Derringer and the next time you trigger this ability this round, you get an additional +1 [combat] for that attack.
Name: .18 Derringer

Description:
Fast. Play when an investigator at your location draws a non-weakness treachery card.
Cancel that card's revelation effect. Then, test [willpower] (3). If you fail, exile A Test of Will.
Flavor: With or without hope, all you can do is resist.
Name: A Test of Will

Description:
Fast. Play after you fail a skill test by 3 or less while investigating.
Discover 2 total clues from among your location and connecting locations.
Name: "Look what I found!"

Description:
Fast. Play after you fail a skill test by 3 or less during an evasion attempt against a non-[[Elite]] enemy.
Place that enemy on the bottom of the encounter deck.
Flavor: Fortune favors the oblivious.
Name: Dumb Luck

Description:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
If this test fails, return Unexpected Courage to your hand.
Name: Unexpected Courage

Description:
You get +1 [willpower] and +1 [intellect].
[reaction] When an investigator at your location would fail a skill test, exhaust Granny Orne: That investigator either gets +1 skill value or -1 skill value for that test.
Name: Granny Orne

Description:
Fast. Play when an investigator at your location would fail a skill test.
They get +3 to their skill value for that test. That investigator draws 1 card.
Name: Lucky!

Description: Uses (3 supplies). [action] Spend 1 supply: Fight. You get +2 [combat] and deal +2 damage for this attack. If this attack fails, either place 1 supply on Chainsaw or deal 1 damage to the attacked enemy.
Name: Chainsaw

Description:
Permanent.
During or before your first action of each of your turns, each skill test you perform gets +1 difficulty.
During or after your third action of each of your turns, each skill test you performed gets -1 difficulty.
Name: Quick Learner

Description:
Permanent.
In between two scenarios of a campaign, reduce the experience cost to repurchase up to 3 cards that you exiled during the last scenario by 1 each.
Flavor: Haven't you seen this before?
Name: Déjà Vu

Description:
[reaction] After you defeat an enemy: Discover 1 clue at your location. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] effect: +1 for each clue on your location.
Description2: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Guardian cards ([guardian]) level 0-5, Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0-2, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Roland's .38 Special, Cover Up, 1 random basic weakness.
Flavor: Everything by the book: every "i" dotted, every "t" crossed. It has worked, until now.
Flavor2: Roland had always taken comfort in procedure and rules. As an agent in the Bureau, he was relieved to have guidelines to follow in any given situation. But lately, his Federal Agent's Handbook had been entirely unhelpful given the cases he'd been assigned. Try as he might, Roland could find no mention of what to do when confronted with strange creatures, gates through time and space, or magic spells. If he hadn't seen it with his own eyes, he would never have believed it... and there's no way his superiors would understand. Roland knew he would have to handle this one himself.
Name: Roland Banks

Description:
You may take an additional action during your turn, which can only be used on [[Tome]] [action] abilities.
[elder_sign] effect: +0. If you succeed, draw 1 card for each [[Tome]] you control.
Description2: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0-5, Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 0-2, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Daisy’s Tote Bag, The Necronomicon (John Dee Translation), 1 random basic weakness.
Flavor: "I know of books so powerful, they can rewrite reality."
Flavor2: As a respected librarian at Miskatonic University, Daisy had always felt that books were the most important thing in her life. She explored in fiction what she abhorred in life: horror, violence, fear. Then, she stumbled across the John Dee translation of the Necronomicon. It was blasphemous, unholy, and too awful to be read. But given her studies in obscure and occult subjects, Daisy knew there was more truth than fiction within the book's pages. She began to wonder what other secrets the restricted collection of the Orne Library held...
Name: Daisy Walker

Description:
[free] During your turn, spend 2 resources: You may take an additional action this turn. (Limit once per turn.)
[elder_sign] effect: +2. If you succeed, gain 2 resources.
Description2: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Rogue cards ([rogue]) level 0-5, Guardian cards ([guardian]) level 0-2, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): On the Lam, Hospital Debts, 1 random basic weakness.
Flavor: "I didn't get out of the joint just to watch the world end."
Flavor2: Skids hadn't planned on a life of crime. But sometimes doing the right thing means getting your hands dirty. The cops didn't care that Skids needed the money for his mother's operation. His mother died of her illness during the second year of his sentence. His cellmate, Brad Hollins, told him there were worse fates than death. He ranted and raved in a quiet voice every evening about the "Old Ones" and told Skids about bizarre adventures he'd had while dreaming. Skids didn't give it much thought until the night he woke to the sight of his cellmate bursting into flames. When Skids was finally released, he returned to Arkham, looking for answers.
Name: "Skids" O'Toole

Description:
[reaction] After 1 or more horror is placed on Agnes Baker: Deal 1 damage to an enemy at your location. (Limit once per phase.)
[elder_sign] effect: +1 for each horror on Agnes Baker.
Description2: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 0-5, Survivor cards ([survivor]) level 0-2, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Heirloom of Hyperborea, Dark Memory, 1 random basic weakness.
Flavor: "I remember another life, one of sorcery and conquest."
Flavor2: Agnes Baker may be just an unassuming waitress in this life, but in a previous life, in a time and age undreamed of in the modern world, she had been a powerful witch. It began when she found a strange artifact - a key of some kind - in a dusty collection of family belongings in her attic. When she touched it, the memories came flooding back, along with one word: "Hyperborea." The more she delved into the visions and memories of her former life, the stronger her powers grew... and the more frightened she became.
Name: Agnes Baker

Description:
[reaction] When you reveal a chaos token, choose and discard 1 card from your hand: Cancel that chaos token and return it to the bag. Reveal a new chaos token. (Limit once per test/ability.)
[elder_sign] effect: +0. If Wendy's Amulet is in play, you automatically succeed instead.
Description2: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Survivor cards ([survivor]) level 0-5, Rogue cards ([rogue]) level 0-2, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Wendy's Amulet, Abandoned and Alone, 1 random basic weakness.
Flavor2: Mama used to let Wendy play with her necklace when she was small. Mama would tell her stories, and Wendy would spin the necklace and watch as it glittered. Then, word came that her father had been lost at sea, and Mama started acting strange, drawing unusual symbols in chalk all over the house. They took Mama to the asylum, and Wendy went to the orphanage. Before they took her away, Mama gave her the necklace, to "protect her." Wendy stayed in the orphanage for several years before running away, deciding that she could take better care of herself on her own.
Name: Wendy Adams

Description: Roland Banks deck only. Uses (4 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack (if there are 1 or more clues on your location, you get +3 [combat], instead). This attack deals +1 damage.
Name: Roland's .38 Special

Description: Revelation - Put Cover Up into play in your threat area, with 3 clues on it. [reaction] When you would discover 1 or more clues at your location: Discard that many clues from Cover Up instead. Forced - When the game ends, if there are any clues on Cover Up: You suffer 1 mental trauma.
Name: Cover Up

Description:
Daisy Walker deck only.
You have 2 additional hand slots, which can only be used to hold [[Tome]] assets.
Name: Daisy's Tote Bag

Description: Revelation - Put The Necronomicon into play in your threat area, with 3 horror on it. It cannot leave play while it has 1 or more horror on it. Treat each [elder_sign] you reveal on a chaos token as a [auto_fail]. [action]: Move 1 horror from The Necronomicon to Daisy Walker. Then, if The Necronomicon has no horror on it, discard it.
Name: The Necronomicon

Description:
"Skids" O'Toole deck only.
Fast. Play after your turn begins.
Until the end of the round, non-[[Elite]] enemies cannot attack you.
Flavor: I ain't going to the pen a second time.
Name: On the Lam

Description: Revelation - Put Hospital Debts into play in your threat area. [free]: Move 1 resource from your resource pool to Hospital Debts. (Limit twice per round.) Forced - When the game ends, if Hospital Debts has fewer than 6 resources on it: You earn 2 fewer experience for this scenario.
Name: Hospital Debts

Description:
Agnes Baker deck only.
[reaction] After you play a [[Spell]] card: Draw 1 card.
Flavor: The etchings on its surface change from day to day, shifting and moving whenever I'm not looking.
Name: Heirloom of Hyperborea

Description: Place 1 doom on the current agenda. This effect may cause the current agenda to advance. Forced - If Dark Memory is in your hand at the end of your turn, reveal it and take 2 horror.
Flavor: No... not again!
Name: Dark Memory

Description: Wendy Adams deck only. You may play the topmost event in your discard pile as if it were in your hand. Forced - After you play an event or discard an event from play: Place it on the bottom of your deck instead of in your discard pile.
Name: Wendy's Amulet

Description: Revelation - Take 2 direct horror and remove all cards in your discard pile from the game.
Flavor: I don't need them. I don't need anyone.
Name: Abandoned and Alone

Description: Uses (4 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage.
Name: .45 Automatic

Description:
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [willpower] for this skill test.
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [combat] for this skill test.
Name: Physical Training

Description:
You get +1 [combat].
[free] Discard Beat Cop: Deal 1 damage to an enemy at your location.
Name: Beat Cop

Description:
Uses (3 supplies). If First Aid has no supplies, discard it.
[action] Spend 1 supply: Heal 1 damage or horror from an investigator at your location.
Name: First Aid

Description: [action]: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack. If the attacked enemy is the only enemy engaged with you, this attack deals +1 damage.
Flavor: Cuts through vines, underbrush, and tentacles equally well.
Name: Machete

Description: [reaction] When an enemy attack deals damage to Guard Dog: Deal 1 damage to the attacking enemy.
Flavor: Fiercely loyal, these trained canines make for perfect companions.
Name: Guard Dog

Description:
Fast. Play after you defeat an enemy.
Discover 1 clue at your location.
Flavor: Just as I suspected!
Name: Evidence!

Description:
Fast. Play when an enemy attacks an investigator at your location.
Cancel that attack.
Name: Dodge

Description: Choose either your location or a connecting location. Deal 3 damage to each enemy and to each investigator at the chosen location.
Name: Dynamite Blast

Description: If this skill test is successful during an attack, that attack deals +1 damage.
Flavor: With a sickening smack, he struck the abomination over and over... until at last, it stopped moving.
Name: Vicious Blow

Description: Place 3 ammo tokens on a [[Firearm]] asset controlled by an investigator at your location.
Flavor: I've never met a beast that could outsmart a bullet.
Name: Extra Ammunition

Description:
You get +1 [willpower].
[free] While an investigator at your location is taking his or her turn, discard Police Badge: That investigator may take 2 additional actions this turn.
Name: Police Badge

Description:
You get +1 [combat].
[free] Exhaust Beat Cop and deal 1 damage to it: Deal 1 damage to an enemy at your location.
Name: Beat Cop

Description: Uses (2 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +3 [combat] for this attack. Instead of its standard damage, this attack deals 1 damage for each point you succeed by (to a minimum of 1, to a maximum of 5). If you fail and would damage another investigator, this attack deals 1 damage for each point you fail by (to a minimum of 1, to a maximum of 5).
Name: Shotgun

Description:
Fast.
You get +1 [intellect] while investigating.
Flavor: A lens into a world unseen can reveal things you wish it hadn't.
Name: Magnifying Glass

Description: [action] Exhaust Old Book of Lore: Choose an investigator at your location. That investigator searches the top 3 cards of his or her deck for a card, draws it, and shuffles the remaining cards into his or her deck.
Name: Old Book of Lore

Description: [reaction] After Research Librarian enters play: Search your deck for a [[Tome]] asset and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.
Flavor: "There have been problems at the Orne Library, as we both know, given poor Armitage's condition, and the other, unrelated... incident of a few years ago..."
Name: Research Librarian

Description:
You get +1 [intellect].
[reaction] After you successfully investigate: Gain 1 resource.
Flavor: "While I truly believe that this nightmare is just a singular abomination, I must admit that I am exhilarated by the possibility that this is but one specimen of a new genus!"
Name: Dr. Milan Christopher

Description:
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [intellect] for this skill test.
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [agility] for this skill test.
Name: Hyperawareness

Description: [action] Choose an investigator at your location and test [intellect] (2). If you succeed, heal 1 damage from that investigator. If you fail, deal 1 damage to that investigator.
Name: Medical Texts

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Until the end of the round, you may use your [intellect] in place of your [combat] and [agility].
Name: Mind over Matter

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Discover 1 clue at your location.
Name: Working a Hunch

Description: Attach to your location. Non-[[Elite]] enemies cannot move into attached location. Forced - When an investigator leaves attached location: Discard Barricade.
Name: Barricade

Description: If this skill test is successful while investigating a location, discover 1 additional clue at that location.
Flavor: I knew I had seen this symbol before. I must warn the others before it is too late!
Name: Deduction

Description:
