Flavor2: Muffled chanting fills the corridor from behind one of the two doors on the second floor. The reverberation of sound throughout the hall makes it difficult to determine which.
Name: Hall of Loyalty

Description: Forced - After you reveal Hall of Rebirth: Draw the set-aside Apostle of Dagon enemy.
Flavor: "Offer yourself to Mother Hydra and Father Dagon and be born anew!" the whispers propose.
Flavor2: Muffled chanting fills the corridor from behind one of the two doors on the second floor. The reverberation of sound throughout the hall makes it difficult to determine which.
Name: Hall of Rebirth

Description: Forced - After Hall of Silence is revealed: Place the set-aside purple key on it. Forced - After an investigator at this location fails a skill test: Add 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag.
Description2: Investigators cannot move to Third Floor Hall unless an investigator has "unlocked the third floor."
Flavor2: A circular indentation on the door at the top of the staircase suggests that something must be placed here in order to open the way forward.
Name: Hall of Silence

Description: - After Doorway to the Depths is revealed: Place the set-aside green key on the location with the most clues. [action] Investigators at the Doorway to the Depths spend the green key and 3 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Remember that you have "unlocked the final depths".
Flavor2: The air is frigid here, and there is no sound but the faint plinking of water dripping onto the rough stone ground. You shudder and proceed onward...
Name: Doorway to the Depths

Description: Forced - After you enter Lair of Dagon: Test your lowest skill (3). If you fail, take 1 horror. [action]: Test [willpower] (3) or [agility] (3). If you succeed, place 1 of your clues on the current act. You may spend 1 key to place 1 more of your clues on the current act.
Flavor2: The steep, twisting stairway beyond the doorway leads you deeper and deeper into the caverns below the building. Effigies depicting aquatic monstrosities watch you from both sides as you descend into a realm of alien architecture and otherworldly riches.
Name: Lair of Dagon

Description: Massive. Dagon gets +6 [per_investigator] health. Forced - After an investigator at this location fails a skill test: Ready Dagon. Dagon attacks that investigator.
Name: Dagon

Description: Apostle of Dagon gets +1 [per_investigator] health. Forced - After Apostle of Dagon enters play: Place the set-aside black key on it. Forced - When an investigator deals 1 or more damage to Apostle of Dagon: Add 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag.
Name: Apostle of Dagon

Description: Prey - Lowest [willpower]. Hunter. Forced - After Cerenerian Deep One engages you: Add 2 [curse] tokens to the chaos bag.
Name: Cerenerian Deep One

Description: Revelation - If it is... - ... act 1, test [agility] (3). - ... act 2, test [agility] (3), then [combat] (2). - ... act 3, test [agility] (3), then [combat] (2), then [intellect] (2). For each of these skill tests you fail, take 1 damage.
Name: Fulfill the Oaths

Description: Revelation - Add 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag. Test [willpower] (4). If you fail, place 1 doom on each [[Cultist]] enemy and take 1 horror (2 horror instead if 1 or more [curse] tokens were revealed during this test).
Name: Secret Gathering

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (4). If you fail, choose and discard 2 cards from your hand or discard an asset you control (if 1 or more [curse] tokens were revealed during this test, do both instead).
Name: Esoteric Ritual

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3) (5 instead if your location is flooded). For each point you fail by, add 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag (if you cannot, Heralds of the Deep gains surge).
Name: Heralds of the Deep

Description: Revelation - Attach to the nearest location without a Stone Barrier attached. If attached location is flooded, Stone Barrier gains surge. While Stone Barrier is ready, investigators cannot move out of attached location. [action]: Test [agility] (1), [combat] (2), or [intellect] (3). If you succeed, exhaust Stone Barrier.
Name: Stone Barrier

Description:
[fast] Exhaust Y'ha-nthlei Statue: Deal 1 damage to a [[Humanoid]] enemy at your location.
[fast] Exhaust Y'ha-nthlei Statue: Remove 2 [curse] tokens from the chaos bag and replace them with an equal number of [bless] tokens.
Name: Y'ha-nthlei Statue

Description:
As an additional cost to play Hallow, return a total of 10 [bless] tokens to the token pool from the chaos bag or sealed on cards in play.
Remove 1 doom from any card in play.
Flavor: Even in the deepest darkness, light can still bloom.
Name: Hallow

Description: [action]: Fight. You get +2 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack. When you initiate this ability, you may release a [bless] token sealed on Holy Spear. [action] Search the chaos bag for 2 [bless] tokens and seal them on Holy Spear: Fight. You get +4 [combat] and deal +2 damage for this attack.
Name: Holy Spear

Description:
Permanent. Exceptional.
Your deck must include at least 10 skills. Your deck size is increased by 5.
[reaction] Before drawing your opening hand: Attach 5 random non-weakness skills from your deck facedown to this card.
[fast] Exhaust Ancestral Knowledge: Draw 1 attached skill.
Name: Ancestral Knowledge

Description:
Uses (0 secrets).
Secrets on Ariadne's Twine can be spent as if they were on any asset controlled by an investigator at your location.
[free] Exhaust Ariadne's Twine: Move 1 secret from an asset you control to your resource pool, as a resource, or vice versa.
Name: Ariadne's Twine

Description: Fast. Uses (4 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. If the attacked enemy is exhausted, you get +2 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack. [reaction] After you evade an enemy at your location: Perform the above Fight ability without spending an action.
Name: .25 Automatic

Description:
You may commit Justify the Means to any type of test.
As an additional cost to commit Justify the Means to a skill test, add [curse] tokens to the chaos bag equal to this test's difficulty.
This test automatically succeeds.
Name: Justify the Means

Description:
Exceptional.
[reaction] When you reveal a non-[curse], non-[auto_fail] chaos token, add 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag: Ignore the just revealed chaos token and reveal another one to resolve. If that token has a [curse] or [auto_fail] symbol, return Lucky Dice to your hand (cannot be ignored/canceled).
Name: Lucky Dice

Description:
Either (choose one):
- Add X [curse] tokens to the chaos bag to add X [bless] tokens to the chaos bag.
- Remove X [curse] and X [bless] tokens from the chaos bag to heal X total horror from among cards at your location.
Name: Rite of Equilibrium

Description:
Jacob Morrison does not ready during the upkeep phase.
[reaction] When you would fail a skill test, exhaust Jacob Morrison: You get +2 skill value for that test.
[reaction] After a [bless] token is revealed from the chaos bag during a skill test you are performing: Ready Jacob Morrison.
Name: Jacob Morrison

Description: Attach to your location. Uses (3 offerings). Attached location gains: "[fast] Draw the top card of the encounter deck, exhaust Shrine of the Moirai, and spend 1 offering: Return up to 2 cards with a total combined level of 5 or less from your discard pile to your hand. Any investigator at this location may trigger this ability." Card design by the Moirai at Arkham Nights 2019.
Name: Shrine of the Moirai

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -1 (-3 instead if there are 4 or more unflooded [[Y'ha-nthlei]] locations in play).
[cultist]: -3. If you fail, place 1 doom on the current agenda (this may cause the current agenda to advance).
[tablet]: -4. If you fail, you must either increase the flood level of your location or take 1 damage.
[elder_thing]: -5. If you fail and there is a key on your location, take 1 horror.
Description2:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -2 (-4 instead if there are 4 or more unflooded [[Y'ha-nthlei]] locations in play).
[cultist]: -4. If you fail, place 1 doom on the current agenda (this may cause the current agenda to advance).
[tablet]: -5. If you fail, you must either increase the flood level of your location or take 1 damage.
[elder_thing]: -6. If you fail and there is a key on your location, take 1 horror.
Name: Into the Maelstrom

Description: Forced - When your turn begins, if you are at a fully flooded location, you struggle for air: When your turn ends, if you did not enter an unflooded or partially flooded location during your turn, take 5 direct damage.
Description2: Shuffle the set-aside Lloigor enemy and the set-aside Aquatic Abomination enemy into the encounter deck, along with the encounter discard pile.
Flavor: Your boat lands on the black reef, and you descend once more into the tidal caverns. Deeper and deeper still you travel, until all thoughts of returning to the surface seem like fantasy.
Flavor2: The waters continue to roil in ebullient energy, as if somehow alive. With each passing moment, the sea grows more and more volatile. Stranger still are the monstrous creatures that now prowl the dark waters - creatures that defy all laws of nature...
Name: Under the Surface

Description: Forced - When your turn begins, if you are at a fully flooded location, you struggle for air: When your turn ends, if you did not enter an unflooded or partially flooded location during your turn, take 5 direct damage.
Description2: If Hydra is in play, flip her to her (Awakened and Enraged) side. If Dagon is in play and slumbering, flip him to his (Awakened and Enraged) side.
Flavor: Even this deep beneath the surface of the ocean, you can tell that your time is running short. You feel the pull of the tide as it courses through the water. Every bone in your body quakes. The walls breathe as though alive.
Name: Celestial Alignment

Description: If an [[Ancient One]] enemy is slumbering, flip it to its (Awakened and Enraged) side. Forced - When your turn begins, if you are at a fully flooded location, you struggle for air: When your turn ends, if you did not enter an unflooded or partially flooded location during your turn, take 5 direct damage.
Flavor: The great flood has begun. With the ritual complete, the seas shall overtake the Earth, and there will be nothing left but the primordial ocean and its denizens. You are all that stands in the way of humanity's extinction.
Flavor2: The chanting of the Deep Ones rises to a crescendo. The alien walls of Y'ha-nthlei twist and contort before your eyes, like lungs desperately clawing for breath. The air becomes thin. Water seeps through the walls. Nothing can stop the pull of the tide now. Nothing can stop the great flood. A triumphant roar sounds throughout the city, and the citizens of the deep rise to meet the cry in their jubilance. You collapse in exhaustion and resignation. Your part is over, now. The part of humanity will soon follow.
Name: The Flood

Description: Objective - If each investigator is at Gateway to Y'ha-nthlei and the investigators possess each of the following keys (blue, red, yellow, and green), you may choose to advance.
Description2: Remove each location other than Gateway to Y'ha-nthlei from the game (or add them to the victory display if they have Victory X and no clues remaining). Discard each card at those locations. Put set-aside locations into play as shown in the Campaign Guide, following the "Act 2 Setup" instructions. (Note that the number of Y'ha-nthlei locations used and the arrangement of the locations varies depending on the number of investigators in the game.) Put the set-aside Hydra enemy into play in the Lair of Hydra, (Deep in Slumber) side faceup. Put the set-aside Dagon enemy into play in the Lair of Dagon. Check Campaign Log. If Dagon has awakened, he enters play (Awakened and Enraged) side faceup. If Dagon still slumbers, he enters play (Deep in Slumber) side faceup.
Flavor: Finally you reach the gateway to the final depths: a swirling vortex of otherworldly currents beyond which Y'ha-nthlei, the city of the Deep Ones, waits. Somehow, you must gain entrance...
Flavor2: A maelstrom of currents tugs at your flesh as you cross through the gateway. When you emerge on the other side, you are no longer in the simple tidal caverns beneath Devil Reef, but inside a vast city within the depths: a city of otherworldly, alien architecture and, surprisingly, riches beyond your wildest imagination.
Name: Back into the Depths

Description: [fast] Either remove 1 [per_investigator] damage from an [[Ancient One]] enemy at your location, or investigators at a [[Lair]] location spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Decrease the flood level of any non-[[Sanctum]] location in play Objective - Stop the Deep Ones' ritual by draining the city. If each location in play is unflooded, advance.
Description2: Add this card to the victory display. - If there is another act card in play, you may choose to either continue playing in order to accomplish the objective on that act card, or proceed immediately to (→R1) without fulfilling that objective. - If there are no other act cards in play, proceed to (→R1). Victory 2.
Flavor: Deep within the city of Y'ha-nthlei, the Deep Ones are performing a ritual that will drown the Earth under the seas. The only way to counteract this ritual is to unveil the depths and expose the city to the sky.
Flavor2: The seas part with a roaring torrent. Chill air flows through the corridors of Y'ha-nthlei as it rises. When the stars look down upon its alien, emerald halls, something in the air changes. There is a sound like a snap and the hissing of air being pulled through the vacuum of space. Then, like automobiles lurching to life, the Earth and the Moon begin to move once more.
Name: City of the Deep (v. I)

Description: Objective - Recover the riches of the Deep Ones. If the Lair of Dagon, the Lair of Hydra, and the Vault of Riches with the purple key have no clues on them, advance.
Description2: Add this card to the victory display. - If there is another act card in play, you may choose to either continue playing in order to accomplish the objective on that act card, or proceed immediately to (→R1) without fulfilling that objective. - If there are no other act cards in play, proceed to (→R1). Victory 2.
Flavor: You've agreed to help Agent Harper complete her mission to find and bring back the vast wealth of Y'ha-nthlei. Who knows what the government will do with such riches...
Flavor2: The gold and jewels hoarded in the vaults of the Deep Ones are too plentiful to count. There is no doubt in your mind: This is how the creatures - and by proxy, the Esoteric Order of Dagon - were able to manipulate the people of Innsmouth and bring more into their fold. Even a few handfuls of such riches would be enough for one to live comfortably for the rest of their life. You and Agent Harper grab only the most valuable relics you can find, leaving the rest to sink with the remainder of the city. "We have submarines stationed off the coast. When we're done here, they'll blow this place apart," she explains.
Name: City of the Deep (v. II)

Description: Objective - Collapse the vault containing the Deep Ones' riches. If Dagon and Hydra each have at least 4 [per_investigator] damage on them, advance.
Description2: Add this card to the victory display. - If there is another act card in play, you may choose to either continue playing in order to accomplish the objective on that act card, or proceed immediately to (→R1) without fulfilling that objective. - If there are no other act cards in play, proceed to (→R1). Victory 2.
Flavor: You refuse to be a pawn in the government's schemes. Even so, you don't wish Agent Harper to come to any harm. You tell her to escape while she can, and she slips away, cursing under her breath. Now you have a new goal - send the riches of Y'ha-nthlei into the depths so they can never again be used against humanity.
Flavor2: With the deities of the Deep Ones thrashing and howling in pain, sections of the city begin to collapse all around you. Hoping to use this to your advantage, you lure the creatures closer and closer to the vaults where their riches are held. The vast hoards of gold and jewels are no doubt how the creatures - and by proxy, the Esoteric Order of Dagon - were able to manipulate the people of Innsmouth and bring more into their fold. You cannot let that ever happen again. One final blow sends one of the creatures staggering through the wall. The ceiling collapses, and a torrent of seawater follows. You escape just before you are caught inside.
Name: City of the Deep (v. III)

Description: Forced - After Dark Abyss is revealed: Randomly choose 1 of the set-aside facedown keys and place it on Dark Abyss without looking at it. Forced - After the last clue is discovered from Dark Abyss: Dark Abyss becomes fully flooded. Increase the flood level of each location connected to Dark Abyss.
Flavor2: The air is frigid here, and there is no sound but the faint plinking of water dripping onto the rough stone ground. You shudder and proceed onward...
Name: Dark Abyss

Description2: Gateway to Y'ha-nthlei enters play partially flooded (even while it is unrevealed).
Flavor: The gateway to the city of the deep is a roiling vortex of seawater - a portal of currents beyond which lies Y'ha-nthlei, your final destination.
Flavor2: "Stupendous and unheard-of splendours await me below, and I shall seek them soon." - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Shadow over Innsmouth</u>
Name: Gateway to Y'ha-nthlei

Description: [action] If you control the black key: Place it on Sunken Halls. Forced - After an enemy enters Sunken Halls, if the black key is on Sunken Halls: Deal 2 damage to that enemy.
Description2: Y'ha-nthlei enters play partially flooded (even while it is unrevealed).
Flavor2: "We shall swim out to that brooding reef in the sea and dive down through black abysses to Cyclopean and many-columned Y'ha-nthlei..." - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Shadow over Innsmouth</u>
Name: Sunken Halls

Description: [action] If you control the purple key: Place it on Vault of Riches. Then, choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at any location. Automatically evade that enemy and move it to Vault of Riches. That enemy does not ready during the next upkeep phase. (Group limit once per game.)
Description2: Y'ha-nthlei enters play partially flooded (even while it is unrevealed).
Flavor2: "We shall swim out to that brooding reef in the sea and dive down through black abysses to Cyclopean and many-columned Y'ha-nthlei..." - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Shadow over Innsmouth</u>
Name: Vault of Riches

Description: [action] If you control the white key: Place it on Undersea Corridors. [fast] If the white key is on Undersea Corridors: Move. Move to a connecting location. (Limit once per round.)
Description2: Y'ha-nthlei enters play partially flooded (even while it is unrevealed).
Flavor2: "We shall swim out to that brooding reef in the sea and dive down through black abysses to Cyclopean and many-columned Y'ha-nthlei..." - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Shadow over Innsmouth</u>
Name: Undersea Corridors

Description: [action] If you control the blue key, place it on this location and investigators here spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Automatically evade each [[Ancient One]] enemy. Unflood this location. For the remainder of the game, this location cannot be flooded. (Group limit once per game.) Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating this location: Take 1 damage.
Description2: Y'ha-nthlei Sanctum enters play fully flooded (even while it is unrevealed).
Flavor2: "... in that lair of the Deep Ones we shall dwell amidst wonder and glory for ever." - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Shadow over Innsmouth</u>
Name: Statues in the Deep

Description:
Each [[Deep One]] enemy at this location gets +2 fight.
[action] If you control the green key, place it on this location and investigators here spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Automatically evade each [[Ancient One]] enemy. Unflood this location. For the remainder of the game, this location cannot be flooded. (Group limit once per game.)
Description2: Y'ha-nthlei Sanctum enters play fully flooded (even while it is unrevealed).
Flavor2: "... in that lair of the Deep Ones we shall dwell amidst wonder and glory for ever." - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Shadow over Innsmouth</u>
Name: Submerged Temple

Description: [action] If you control the red key, place it on this location and investigators here spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Automatically evade each [[Ancient One]] enemy. Unflood this location. For the remainder of the game, this location cannot be flooded. (Group limit once per game.) Forced - After any location's flood value is increased: Each investigator at this location takes 1 horror.
Description2: Y'ha-nthlei Sanctum enters play fully flooded (even while it is unrevealed).
Flavor2: "... in that lair of the Deep Ones we shall dwell amidst wonder and glory for ever." - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Shadow over Innsmouth</u>
Name: Syzygy Chamber

Description:
During the enemy phase, each ready [[Ancient One]] enemy can attack investigators here as if they were engaged.
[action] If you control the yellow key, place it on this location and investigators here spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Automatically evade each [[Ancient One]] enemy. Unflood this location. For the remainder of the game, this location cannot be flooded. (Group limit once per game.)
Description2: Y'ha-nthlei Sanctum enters play fully flooded (even while it is unrevealed).
Flavor2: "... in that lair of the Deep Ones we shall dwell amidst wonder and glory for ever." - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Shadow over Innsmouth</u>
Name: Onyx Guardians

Description: Lair of Dagon gets -1 shroud for each [[Sanctum]] location with a key on it. [fast] Check Campaign Log. If all 7 keys are on locations and the Order's ritual was disrupted: You dig deep into your memories to recall what happened the last time you were here. Read Flashback XIV in the Campaign Guide.
Flavor2: As you descend the familiar steps, something tugs at your memories. You've been here before, haven't you?
Name: Lair of Dagon

Description:
Lair of Hydra gets -1 shroud for each [[Sanctum]] location with a key on it.
[action] Place the black, purple, or white key on this location: Deal 3 damage to an [[Ancient One]] enemy that is not slumbering. (Group limit once per game.)
Flavor2: Amidst the sound of cascading waterfalls, the deep rumbling of something enormous stirring emanates from below. Each of the thing's breaths resounds throughout the city, shaking the walls, filling your heart with fear, and yet, calling to you.
Name: Lair of Hydra

Description: Dagon is slumbering. He cannot attack or engage, and is immune to investigator actions and player card effects. Forced - At the end of the investigation phase, if an investigator is in Lair of Dagon and Dagon is ready: Place 1 doom on him. [action]: Test [willpower] (4). If you succeed, either exhaust Dagon or remove 1 doom from him. If you fail by 3 or more, place 1 doom on him.
Name: Dagon

Description: Hydra is slumbering. She cannot attack or engage, and is immune to investigator actions and player card effects. Forced - At the end of the investigation phase, if an investigator is in Lair of Hydra and Hydra is ready: Place 1 doom on her. [action]: Test [willpower] (4). If you succeed, either exhaust Hydra or remove 1 doom from her. If you fail by 3 or more, place 1 doom on her.
Name: Hydra

Description:
Hunter.
While Aquatic Abomination is moving, fully flooded locations are considered to be connected to one another.
Aquatic Abomination cannot attack during the same phase it moved via its hunter keyword.
Name: Aquatic Abomination

Description: Spawn - Lair of Dagon or Gateway to Y'ha-nthlei (whichever is farther from you). Hunter. Forced - After Dagon's Brood engages you, if Dagon is in play: Either place 1 doom on Dagon, or Dagon attacks you.
Name: Dagon's Brood

Description: Spawn - Lair of Hydra or Gateway to Y'ha-nthlei (whichever is farther from you). Hunter. Forced - After Hydra's Brood engages you, if Hydra is in play: Either place 1 doom on Hydra, or Hydra attacks you.
Name: Hydra's Brood

Description: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Increase the flood level of your current location. - Discard assets from your play area with a total resource cost of at least X, where X is your location's shroud value.
Name: Treacherous Depths

Description: Peril. Revelation - Test [willpower] (2). This test gets +1 difficulty for each [[Sanctum]] location with a key on it. If you fail, you must either place 1 doom on the current agenda (this effect may cause the current agenda to advance), or the nearest [[Ancient One]] enemy in play attacks you.
Name: Conspiracy of Deep Ones

Description: Revelation - If no investigators are at flooded locations, Thalassophobia gains surge. Otherwise, each investigator at a partially flooded location takes 1 horror, and each investigator at a fully flooded location takes 1 direct horror that cannot be prevented.
Name: Thalassophobia

Description: You ignore the Forced ability on the current agenda. Forced - When any amount of damage would be placed on you: Place 1 of that damage on Diving Suit. Forced - When Diving Suit leaves play: Remove it from the game.
Name: Diving Suit

Description: Roland Bank deck only. Permanent. Regulation - You cannot fight more than twice each round. [fast] During a skill test while investigating, evading, or parleying, exhaust Directive: You get +2 skill value for this test for each enemy engaged with you.
Name: Directive

Description: Roland Bank deck only. Permanent. Regulation - You cannot play more than 2 cards each round. [reaction] When you play an [[Insight]] or [[Tactic]] event, exhaust this Directive: That event gains fast.
Name: Directive

Description: Roland Bank deck only. Permanent. Regulation - You cannot voluntarily assign damage or horror to [[Ally]] assets. You have 1 additional ally slot.
Name: Directive

Description: Roland Bank deck only. Permanent. Regulation - When your location has 1 or more clues, you cannot commit cards to skill tests unless you have discovered a clue this round. [reaction] After you discover a clue, if an enemy is at your location, exhaust this Directive: Draw 1 card.
Name: Directive

Description: Roland Bank deck only. Permanent. Regulation - You cannot move more than twice each round. You get +3 sanity.
Name: Directive

Description: Roland Banks deck only. Advanced. Uses (4 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack (if there are 1 or more clues on your location, you get +4 [combat], instead). This attack deals +1 damage. If this attack defeats an enemy and there are no clues on your location, place 1 ammo on Roland's .38 Special
Name: Roland's .38 Special

Description: Advanced. Revelation - Put Cover Up into play in your threat area, with 4 clues on it. [reaction] When you would discover 1 or more clues at your location: Discard that many clues from Cover Up instead. Forced - When the game ends, if there are any clues on Cover Up: You suffer 1 mental trauma.
Name: Cover Up

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the number of [[Cultist]] enemies in the victory display, to a maximum of 5.
[cultist]: -2. If a [[Cultist]] enemy is engaged with you, reveal an additional chaos token.
[tablet]: -3. Ready each [[Cultist]] enemy engaged with you.
[elder_thing]: -4. If you fail, Roland Banks takes 1 damage.
Description2:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is 1 plus the number of [[Cultist]] enemies in the victory display.
[cultist]: -3. If a [[Cultist]] enemy is engaged with you, reveal an additional chaos token.
[tablet]: -4. Ready each [[Cultist]] enemy engaged with you.
[elder_thing]: -5. If you fail, Roland Banks takes 1 damage.
Name: By the Book

Description: Forced - When a non-weakness [[Cultist]] enemy would be defeated: Heal damage from that enemy until it has 1 remaining health, instead. Forced - If Roland Banks is defeated: Proceed to (→R2) [action]: Resign. You don't want to miss your deadline, so you close the case.
Flavor: Mr. Grey is a powerful man with a lot of friends. Getting him behind bars is going to be tricky.
Name: A Covert Conspiracy

Description: Forced - When a non-weakness [[Cultist]] enemy would be defeated: Heal damage from that enemy until it has 1 remaining health, instead. Forced - If Roland Banks is defeated: Proceed to (→R2) [action]: Resign. You don't want to miss your deadline, so you close the case.
Description2: Remove a [[Cultist]] enemy in the victory display from the game (Mr. Grey, if able). (→R1).
Flavor: Your superiors are pressuring you to drop your investigation. Mr. Grey's influence, no doubt. Meanwhile, he and his lackies are doing everything in their power to quietly remove you from the equation, once and for all.
Flavor2:
"It's not enough," your superior scolds you. "I'm sorry, but it's just too contrived for me to believe. And if I don't believe it, the courts won't, either. I mean, honestly. Cults? Human sacrifices?"
You grit your teeth and slam your hand down on the myriad documents and evidence you've collected. It's all there, you insist.
"It's been weeks and you don't have a real case here. Just a lot of circumstantial mumbo-jumbo," he deflects. "And besides, Mr. Grey is a cornerstone of this community. That you would disparage him with these accusations..." The hint of derision towards you in his voice gives him away. Is he on Grey's payroll? Or worse? Either way, it's clear arguing won't get you anywhere. You know better than to make a fuss. You'll have to keep your head down and do things your own way if you want to make a difference in Arkham.
Name: Your Deadline Nears

Description: [fast] The investigators spend 1 [per_investigators] clues, as a group: Flip over a facedown conspirator at your location and put it into play engaged with you. [fast] Spend 1 resource: Exhaust a [[Cultist]] enemy engaged with you (it remains engaged). Only Roland Banks may trigger this ability.] Objective - Parley with as many conspirators as you can. If 10 [[Cultist]] enemies are in the victory display, advance.
Flavor: Taking down the culprits behind the sacrifices can only be done with proof, in a court of law. You'll have to do this fair and square.
Flavor2:
Mr. Grey paces the length of his cell, glaring at you from behind the bars. "You're going to regret this, Agent Banks," he snarls. "You'll be begging for my mercy when this is over."
You politely remind Mr. Grey that threatening a federal agent is a felony.
"There are worse things to be afraid of than the likes of you," he replies, before slumping into the corner of his cell, defeated.
The true culprit is behind bars, but you still don't know what his real purpose was in aiding the conspirators behind the murders. What could possibly compel one to take the lives of so many? You don't know - but you intend to find out.
Name: Capture the Conspirators

Description: Arkham Police Station is connected to Rivertown, Downtown, and Easttown, and vice versa. [fast]: Move to a connecting location. [fast] Choose a non-weakness [[Cultist]] enemy at this location and spend clues equal to its remaining health: Parley. Add that enemy to the victory display.
Description2: Arkham Police Station is connected to Rivertown, Downtown, and Easttown, and vice versa.
Flavor2: With Sheriff Engel and the rest of the officers dismissive of your suspicions, you set off to investigate the murders yourself.
Name: Arkham Police Station

Description:
Each asset you control with health gets +1 health.
Each asset you control with sanity gets +1 sanity.
[reaction] When the game begins, if The Star • XVII is in your opening hand: Put it into play.
Name: The Star • XVII

Description: Limit 1 per deck. [reaction] When you play a copy of Soothing Melody: Either change each "2" on it to a "3," or shuffle it into your deck instead of discarding it. Forced - After Hallowed Mirror enter play: Search your bonded cards for 3 copies of Soothing Melody. Add 1 to your hand and shuffle the other 2 into your deck.
Name: Hallowed Mirror

Description:
[fast] If you have 8 or more cards in your hand, exhaust The World • XXI: Draw 1 card.
[reaction] When the game begins, if The World • XXI is in your opening hand: Put it into play.
Name: The World • XXI

Description: Limit 1 per deck. [reaction] When you play a copy of Blood-Rite: Either change each "2" on it to a "3," or shuffle it into your deck instead of discarding it. Forced - After Occult Lexicon enters play: Search your bonded cards for 3 copies of Blood-Rite. Add 1 to your hand and shuffle the other 2 into your deck.
Name: Occult Lexicon

Description:
[reaction] When you would succeed at a skill test: You get +1 skill value for this test. You may discard Knight of Swords to get +3 instead.
[reaction] When the game begins, if Knight of Swords is in your opening hand: Put it into play.
Name: Knight of Swords

Description:
Limit 1 per investigator.
[fast] Exhaust Well Connected: You get +1 skill value for this skill test for every 4 resources you have.
[fast] Spend 2 resources: Ready Well Connected. (Limit once per round.)
Name: Well Connected

Description:
You have 1 additional arcane slot.
Your arcane slots can be used to hold cards that take up accessory slots, and vice versa.
[reaction] When the game begins, if The Hierophant • V is in your opening hand: Put it into play.
Name: The Hierophant • V

Description: Fast. You have 1 additional arcane slot, which can only be used to hold a [[Spell]] or [[Ritual]] asset. [reaction] After you activate an [action] ability on a [[Spell]] or [[Ritual]] asset, exhaust Sign Magick: Activate an [action] ability on a different [[Spell]] or [[Ritual]] asset you control (without paying its [action] cost).
Name: Sign Magick

Description:
[reaction] When you draw a non-weakness encounter card, exhaust Nine of Rods: Cancel all of that card's effects and shuffle it into the encounter deck. Then, draw another card from the top of the encounter deck.
[reaction] When the game begins, if Nine of Rods is in your opening hand: Put it into play.
Name: Nine of Rods

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Until the end of your turn, set the base value of each of your skills to 5, or the base value of one of your skills to 7.
Flavor: You never really know what you are capable of until something is trying to eat you.
Name: Trial by Fire

Description:
[reaction] When you play a card, exhaust The Fool • 0: Reduce that card's cost by 1.
[reaction] When the game begins, if The Fool • 0 is in your opening hand: Put it into play.
Name: The Fool • 0

Description:
You have 1 additional tarot slot.
Each non-weakness [[Tarot]] asset in your hand or committed to a skill test gains [wild] [wild].
[reaction] When the game begins, if Moon Pendant is in your opening hand: Put it into play.
Name: Moon Pendant

Description:
Permanent. Limit 1 per investigator.
Before setting up each game, draw 3 random cards from the tarot deck and choose 1. Place the chosen card in front of you, in the upright position. Each other investigator ignores its effects. Shuffle the rest back into the tarot deck.
Name: Observed

Description:
Permanent.
Before setting up each game, draw a random card from the tarot deck and place the chosen card in front of you, in the reverse position. Each other investigator ignores its effects.
Name: Damned

Description: You cannot play assets other than The Devil • XV while it is in your hand. If The Devil • XV is drawn in your opening hand during setup (before or after taking a mulligan), you cannot replace it. It must stay in your opening hand.
Name: The Devil • XV

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Circle Undone Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to Disappearance at the Twilight Estate shown here. (Continued on reverse side.)
Description2:
- Put the [[Spectral]] version of the Wine Cellar (card #28) into play.
For the duration of this scenario, the following additional rule applies: "While resolving The Watcher's Grasp treachery, The Spectral Watcher does not exhaust after it attacks.". Attach this card to the scenario reference card as a reminder.
Name: Return to Disappearance at the Twilight Estate

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Circle Undone Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to The Witching Hour shown here. - Remove Arkham Woods (Quiet Glade) from the game. (Continued on reverse side.)
Description2: - When choosing 5 Witch-Haunted Woods locations to put into play at random, include the 2 new Witch-Haunted Woods included in this encounter set, for a total of 9 possibilities. - Set each of the new Arkham Woods locations aside, out of play. (You may optionally gather the Arkham Woods locations included in the Return to The Devourer Below and set those aside, as well, if your collection includes them. This encounter set can be found in the Return to the Night of the Zealot expansion.) - When building the act deck, include both versions of act 4. When advancing to act 4a, put both act cards into play; the text on both cards is active.
Name: Return to The Witching Hour

Description: Objective - "Perhaps we can learn more from them..." If there are more than 1 [per_investigator] exhausted [[Witch]] enemies at the Witches' Circle, investigators at the Witches' Circle may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.
Flavor: For what purpose have these people gathered? Are they the cause of the disturbances in these woods? And if so, what is their true goal?
Flavor2:
The hooded figures stand down once they realize you are not fighting them or working to disrupt their ritual. "They are not the ones from before - the interlopers who interfered with our ritual," one of them says, pulling off her hood to reveal striking red hair that glows in the firelight. Embers dance around her fingers. "Are you of the same mind as us, then?" she asks.
"nNo, Erynn," the leader of the coven answers for you. "They are lost." She studies you with harsh eyes. "How came you here?"
You explain how you awoke in the woods, how you were attacked by terrible creatures, and how you came to the center of this circle to discover the truth behind your ordeal.
"Anette, I think someone delivered them here," the red-haired witch named Erynn whispers, mystified.
"We should finish here while the circle remains closed. There may be others in these woods. Come, sisters. Let us continue our work," Anette says.
Name: A Circle Unbroken

Description: [free] Take 1 direct damage and 1 direct horror: Choose an investigator at a different Witch-Haunted Woods. That investigator heals 1 damage and 1 horror. (Group limit once per round.)
Flavor2: The frigid wind howls around you as you venture deeper into the haunted woods beyond Arkham.
Name: Witch-Haunted Woods

Description: Forced - When you discover the last clue from this location: Draw the topmost [[Hex]] treachery in the encounter discard pile. (If you cannot, instead discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a [[Hex]] treachery is discarded, and draw it.)
Flavor2: The frigid wind howls around you as you venture deeper into the haunted woods beyond Arkham.
Name: Witch-Haunted Woods

Description: During the "enemy attacks" step of the enemy phase, instead of their standard attack, each ready [[Witch]] enemy at this location attacks each investigator in play. Attacks made in this way do not cause the enemy to exhaust.
Flavor2: Growing up, you were always warned to stay out of the woods at night. Now you know why.
Name: Arkham Woods

Description: While you are at this location, you cannot cancel or ignore card or game effects, and each encounter card you draw gains peril.
Flavor2: Growing up, you were always warned to stay out of the woods at night. Now you know why.
Name: Arkham Woods

Description: Forced - After you successfully investigate this location: Discard 1 card from the top of the encounter deck for each point you succeeded by. Forced - When the encounter deck runs out of cards: Each investigator at this location takes 2 damage.
Flavor2: Growing up, you were always warned to stay out of the woods at night. Now you know why.
Name: Arkham Woods

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Circle Undone Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to At Death's Doorstep shown here. (Continued on reverse side.)
Description2:
- Put the Senator Nathaniel Rhodes enemy into play in the Entry Hall, with 1 [per_investigator] clues on him. - Put the Wine Cellar location into play. - Set the [[Spectral]] version of the Wine Cellar aside, out of play. - Set the Unstable Realm encounter set aside, out of play, instead of the Realm of Death encounter set. Likewise, when act 1b instructs the players to shuffle the Realm of Death encounter set into the encounter deck, shuffle in the Unstable Realm encounter set instead.
For the duration of this scenario, the following additional rule applies: "While resolving The Watcher's Grasp treachery, The Spectral Watcher does not exhaust after it attacks." Attach this card to the scenario reference card as a reminder.
Name: Return to At Death's Doorstep

Description: Aloof. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] (2) to speak with the Senator. If you succeed, either take control of 1 of his clues, or flip 1 doom on him to its clue side. If you fail, flip one of his clues to its doom side.
Flavor: "Change is what the people demand, and change is what I aim to give them!"
Name: Senator Nathaniel Rhodes

Description: Spawn - The location with no other [[Silver Twilight]] enemies farthest from you. Forced - After Dmitri Konstantinov enters play: Place 2 doom on him. [reaction] After you evade Dmitri Konstantinov: For every 2 points you succeeded by, remove 1 doom from him.
Flavor: "Do you understand who you are meddling with?"
Name: Dmitri Konstantinov

Description: Victorian Halls is connected to Wine Cellar. [action]: You disturb the tranquility of this quiet place in search of evidence. Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a [[Monster]] enemy is discarded. Set that enemy aside, out of play. Then gain 2 clues (from the token pool). (Group limit once per game.)
Description2: Victorian Halls is connected to Wine Cellar.
Flavor2: A long, darkened stairway leads down into Josef Meiger's cellar. If you're careful, maybe you can take a gander at what he keeps down there...
Name: Wine Cellar

Description: Victorian Halls is connected to Wine Cellar. [reaction] After you successfully investigate the Wine Cellar: Either discover 1 additional clue, or remove 1 doom from a [[Silver Twilight]] enemy in play. Haunted - You must either place 1 doom on a [[Silver Twilight]] enemy in play, or take 1 direct horror.
Description2: Victorian Halls is connected to Wine Cellar.
Flavor2: The stench of blood and decaying wood emanates from behind the door at the bottom of the dark, dank staircase.
Name: Wine Cellar

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Circle Undone Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to The Secret Name shown here. (Continued on reverse side.)
Description2: - Before creating the "Unknown Places" deck, add the 4 new Unknown Places locations to the original 7 Unknown Places locations. Set the Witch House Ruins aside and randomly remove 4 Unknown Places locations from the game. Then, continue creating the Unknown Places deck as normal.
Name: Return to The Secret Name

Description: Forced - After you reveal Temple of R'lyeh: Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, draw the top card of the encounter deck. If you fail by 3 or more, that card gains surge.
Flavor2:
It was also possible that the inhabitants of a given dimensional realm could survive entry to many unknown and incomprehensible realms of additional or indefinitely multiplied dimensions - be they within or outside the given space-time continuum - and that the converse would be likewise true.
- H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dreams in the Witch House</u>
Name: Temple of R'lyeh

Description: [action]: Test [combat] (5) to topple the strange, eldritch statue. If you succeed, remove 1 doom from Nahab, even if she is out of play. (Group limit one success per game.) Haunted - Place 1 doom on Nahab (even if she is out of play).
Flavor2:
It was also possible that the inhabitants of a given dimensional realm could survive entry to many unknown and incomprehensible realms of additional or indefinitely multiplied dimensions - be they within or outside the given space-time continuum - and that the converse would be likewise true.
- H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dreams in the Witch House</u>
Name: The Price Manor

Description: [action]: Investigate. Investigate using [agility] instead of [intellect]. If you succeed, after discovering clues, you may move to any [[Extradimensional]] location. Haunted - You cannot leave The 9th Ward this round. During your turn, reduce the shroud value of The 9th Ward by 1.
Flavor2:
It was also possible that the inhabitants of a given dimensional realm could survive entry to many unknown and incomprehensible realms of additional or indefinitely multiplied dimensions - be they within or outside the given space-time continuum - and that the converse would be likewise true.
- H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dreams in the Witch House</u>
Name: The 9th Ward

Description: [action]: Test [willpower] (5) to search the library for arcane lore. If you succeed, deal 3 damage to Nahab, even if she is out of play. (Group limit one success per game.)
Flavor2:
It was also possible that the inhabitants of a given dimensional realm could survive entry to many unknown and incomprehensible realms of additional or indefinitely multiplied dimensions - be they within or outside the given space-time continuum - and that the converse would be likewise true.
- H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dreams in the Witch House</u>
Name: Library of Ebla

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Circle Undone Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to The Wages of Sin shown here. - Set the Erynn MacAoidh story asset aside, out of play. (Continued on reverse side.)
Description2:
- Check the Campaign Log. If Erynn wants to meet, when building the act deck, use the new Act 1a - "In Pursuit of Answers" instead of the original act 1, and include both versions of act 2. When advancing to act 2a, put both act cards into play; the text on both cards is active. - Randomly choose one of the two Hangman's Brook locations to use during this scenario's setup. Remove the other version from the game. - When randomly choosing 4 Heretic enemies to set aside, shuffle the 2 new Heretic enemies in with the original 6, for a total of 8 possibilities.
For the duration of this scenario, the following additional rule applies: "While resolving The Watcher's Grasp treachery, The Spectral Watcher does not exhaust after it attacks." Attach this card to the scenario reference card as a reminder.
Name: Return to The Wages of Sin

Description: Locations cannot be flipped to their [[Spectral]] side.
Description2:
Spawn 1 set-aside Heretic enemy at each of the following locations: The Gallows, Heretics' Graves, Chapel Attic, and Chapel Crypt. Add 2 [per_investigator] clues to each location.
Put the set-aside Erynn MacAoidh story asset into play at the Haunted Fields, under no player's control.
Each investigator puts into play 1 set-aside Spectral Web asset, under their control.
Flavor: You have come to Hangman's Hill to investigate reports over the last few nights of ghost sightings and strange activities in the woods. The witch named Erynn told you to meet her here...but for what purpose?
Flavor2: Soft chanting guides you to a gloomy clearing near the abandoned chapel. A circle of witchweed surrounds the clearing, swaying gently in the breeze. At the center of the clearing, a cloaked woman kneels before an unmarked grave, far from the rest of the graveyard. You watch in quiet for a few minutes while the woman sings an old, somber melody. It reminds you somewhat of a child's lullaby, with a dark gravity that betrays its purpose. As soon as the song ends, she turns to face you. You recognize Erynn by her crimson red hair and the dark circles that hang beneath her eyes. "You again." She rises. "Have you come here for answers, as I have?"
Name: In Pursuit of Answers

Description: [reaction] When you would "banish" a ghost: You may instead place it beneath Erynn MacAoidh, Heretic side faceup. [action] If you are at Erynn MacAoidh's location, spend 1 [per_investigator] clues: Parley. Choose a Heretic beneath her and place it beneath this act. Objective - Help Erynn find answers by placing Heretics beneath this act. If there are 3 beneath this act, advance.
Flavor: "The spirits of my kin are restless," Erynn explains. "But the knowledge they possess is too great to ignore. Please, help me learn from them."
Flavor2:
"I...I do not know what to make of this," Erynn says as you ruminate on the discoveries you've made. The spirits were indeed roused by the presence of the creature in the mist, but it almost seemed to be guiding them. Commanding them. You ask Erynn what kind of creature could do such a thing.
"She was one of us, once. The greatest of us. And perhaps the most dangerous." She sighs. It all makes sense now. There is only one witch you know of who would inspire such reverence and such fear: Keziah Mason.
"Now Anette grasps at the forbidden knowledge she once held. This ritual... I am no longer sure we should go through with it. I fear I have been a fool this whole time." Her dark gaze meets yours, unwavering. "Let me come with you. Perhaps together we can put a stop to this."
Name: In Pursuit of the Beyond

Description: [action]: Resign. "Whose bright idea was this, anyway?"
Flavor: Originating from a natural spring near the peak of Hangman’s Hill, the narrow, shallow brook fills the surrounding woods with a quiet, peaceful babbling. The brook winds down the hill southward, forming the western border of Arkham's Uptown district.
Name: Hangman's Brook

Description: Heretic gets +2 [per_investigator] health. While Heretic is at a non-[[Spectral]] location, it gains aloof and cannot be engaged or damaged. [free] Spend 1 clue: Parley. Look at Heretic's other side (without resolving its text). Forced - After Heretic is defeated: Flip it over and resolve the text on its other side.
Name: Heretic

Description: Heretic gets +2 [per_investigator] health. While Heretic is at a non-[[Spectral]] location, it gains aloof and cannot be engaged or damaged. [free] Spend 1 clue: Parley. Look at Heretic's other side (without resolving its text). Forced - After Heretic is defeated: Flip it over and resolve the text on its other side.
Name: Heretic

Description: Peril. Revelation - If Witchweed is drawn... - ...from the standard encounter deck, shuffle it into the spectral encounter deck. - ...from the spectral encounter deck, trigger each haunted ability on your location twice. You may give Witchweed surge to place it in the standard encounter discard pile. Otherwise, place it in the spectral encounter discard pile.
Name: Witchweed

Description:
Uses (3 secrets).
You get +1 [willpower].
[reaction] When you draw a non-weakness [[Curse]] or [[Power]] treachery, spend 1 secret and exhaust Erynn MacAoidh: Cancel that card's revelation effect.
Name: Erynn MacAoidh

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Circle Undone Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to For the Greater Good shown here. - Set the new Hidden Passageway and Sanctum Doorway locations aside, out of play. (Continued on reverse side.)
Description2:
- Choose 1 of the 2 Lounge locations at random. Put it into play along with the rest of the starting locations. Remove the other version of the Lounge from the game.
For the duration of this scenario, the following additional rules apply: "The Objective on Act 3a is optional. After all other ([skull]/[cultist]/[tablet]/[elder_thing]) keys have been put into play, if another effect would cause a set-aside key to be put into play, use another unused (+/-) chaos token instead of putting no key into play. At the end of the scenario, add each (+/-) chaos token controlled by an investigator to the victory display. Each one is worth Victory 1." Attach this card to the scenario reference card as a reminder.
Name: Return to For the Greater Good

Description: Forced - After the Lounge is revealed: Put the set-aside Vault and Library locations into play. [action] Investigators at the Lounge spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Put the set-aside Hidden Passageway location into play.
Flavor: The lounge is warm, cozy, and surprisingly empty. There's got to be something else here...right?
Flavor2: As you approach the staircase leading to the second floor of the mansion, you smell burning candle wax. It is quiet enough that you can hear the gentle crinkling of a page being turned.
Name: Lounge

Description: While an investigator controls the [skull] key, Relic Storage is connected to Lodge Catacombs, and vice versa. Forced - After Relic Storage is revealed: Place 1 random set-aside key on it.
Description2: Forced - When you enter Hidden Passageway: Test [agility] (3). If you fail, place 1 doom on the nearest [[Cultist]] enemy as they hear you shifting the bookcase.
Name: Relic Storage

Description: [action]: Choose a ([skull]/[cultist]/[tablet]/[elder_thing]) key on a card and test [willpower] or [intellect] (8). Reduce the difficulty of this test by 1 for each [[Silver Twilight]] enemy in play. If you succeed, swap the chosen key with another key in play or with a set-aside ([skull]/[cultist]/[tablet]/[elder_thing]) key.
Flavor2: Beyond a stone archway lies an unmarked iron door, mocking you with untold secrets and hidden truths.
Name: Shrouded Archive

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Circle Undone Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to Union and Disillusion shown here. (Continued on reverse side.)
Description2:
- When choosing which version of Acts 3 and 4 to use during setup, add the following bullet point above all the others: - If the investigator sided with the Lodge and Erynn joined the investigators, use the new Act 3 - "Beyond the Mist (v. V)" and Act 4 - "The Binding Rite."
For the duration of this scenario, the following additional rule applies: "While resolving The Watcher's Grasp treachery, The Spectral Watcher does not exhaust after it attacks." Attach this card to the scenario reference card as a reminder.
Name: Return to Union and Disillusion

Description: [free] During a circle action, spend 1 clue: Reduce the difficulty of this skill test by 2. Objective - If each Unvisited Isle location in play is revealed and the brazier on each of them is lit, advance.
Description2:
Reveal The Geist-Trap location. Move each investigator at an Unvisited Isle location to The Geist-Trap.
Spawn the set-aside Anette Mason at The Geist-Trap, with 2 [per_investigator] damage on her.
Flavor: You are close to the site of the binding ritual. You must light all the braziers to find the way. Then, all that is left to do is bait the watcher to the trap and bind it there.
Flavor2:
After nearly an hour spent searching through the dense mist, you finally arrive at the Lodge's ritual site to find it in chaos. Members of the Silver Twilight Lodge, in robes of blue and silver, are embroiled in battle with the witches. Anette turns her attention to you, shocked and angered at your arrival. "You! What are you doing here?" She calls to her coven: "Sisters! We must not let them interfere!"
"No, Anette," Erynn replies, standing by your side. "You have gone too far this time. It is you we must stop." Unsure who to follow, the rest of the witches stand down as the two face off.
"You must complete the ritual!" Carl Sanford commands you from across the clearing. "It is the only way!"
Name: Beyond the Mist (v. V)

Description: Revelation - Put Brazier Enchantment into play next to the agenda deck. Increase the difficulty of each skill test during circle actions on locations by 2. [action]: Circle. Test your lowest skill + your next lowest skill (6). If you succeed, discard Brazier Enchantment. If you fail, resolve each haunted ability on your location.
Name: Brazier Enchantment

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Circle Undone Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to In the Clutches of Chaos shown here. (Continued on reverse side.)
Description2: - Choose at random one of the three copies of each of the following locations: French Hill, Rivertown, Southside, Uptown, South Church, and Merchant District. Remove the chosen locations from the game. Use the rest throughout setup, as normal.
Name: Return to In the Clutches of Chaos

Description: [action]: Move any number of breaches from French Hill to the current act. Then, test [willpower] (X), where X is the number of breaches moved. For each point you fail by, take 1 horror.
Flavor2: One of the richest and most historical neighborhoods in Arkham, the many decaying mansions and estates of French Hill hold a lot of old wealth... and many more secrets.
Name: French Hill

Description: [action]: Move any number of breaches from Rivertown to the current act. Then, test [intellect] (X), where X is 1 more than the number of breaches moved. For each point you fail by, either take 1 horror or 1 damage.
Flavor2: These past few weeks, the warehouses and docks of Rivertown have been swathed in grey mist, making an already quiet district even more empty and desolate.
Name: Rivertown

Description: [action]: Evade. Use this ability on any enemy in play or in the encounter discard pile. If you fail, that enemy attacks you (even if it is not in play). If you succeed, instead of evading the chosen enemy, move all breaches from Southside to the current act.
Flavor2: If you didn’t know any better, you would think Southside was a ghost town. All of the residents have retreated into their homes and locked their doors. The only light you see seems to be coming from the Catholic church to the south.
Name: Southside

Description: [action]: Move any number of breaches from Uptown to the current act. Then, test [agility] (X), where X is the number of breaches moved. For each point you fail by, take 1 damage.
Flavor2: Typically a safe neighborhood, the cobbled streets of Uptown have taken a very different mood this night. Tendrils of mist reach out from the woods that border the town, stretching over Hangman’s Brook and crawling through the streets.
Name: Uptown

Description: [action] [action]: Move all breaches from South Church to the current act. [action]: Resign. You hide through the night.
Flavor: Many fearful citizens are seated at the church's wooden pews, praying and whispering amongst themselves.
Flavor2: The massive Romanesque building towers over the rest of Uptown, light shining from within its stained glass windows. Father Michael has made it a point to keep the church open at all hours, and despite the strange happenings throughout town, tonight is no different.
Name: South Church

Description: [action]: Move 1 breach from Merchant District to the current act. You may spend any number of charges, secrets, supplies, or ammo from any assets you control to move that many additional breaches.
Flavor2: The commercial center of Arkham, the Merchant District is usually bustling at all hours. But tonight, the dockhands and sailors have vanished, leaving you with a sense of unease. The mist over the dark waters of the Miskatonic River seems to take unnatural shapes as you watch from afar.
Name: Merchant District

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Circle Undone Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to Before the Black Throne shown here. (Continued on reverse side.)
Description2: - When building the act deck, replace the original version of act 3 with the new version included in this encounter set. Remove the original version from the game. - When building the Cosmos, include the 3 new Cosmos locations included in the Return to Before the Black Throne encounter set. - When the game begins, the investigators may remove 2 resources from the scenario reference card to have each investigator begin the game with a Nightgaunt Steed story asset in play. Remove each remaining Nightgaunt Steed from the game.
Name: Return to Before the Black Throne

Description: [action] Spend X clues: Draw the top X cards of the Cosmos. Choose one to put into play using its "Cosmos -" instructions, and move to it. Shuffle the rest back into the Cosmos. Objective - If the lead investigator is a The Black Throne and there are no clues on it, advance.
Description2: Check the Campaign Log. - If at least two of the following are true, you may proceed to (→R2): You accepted your fate, Mesmerizing Flute is listed under "Mementos Discovered," and Ritual Components is listed under "Mementos Discovered." - If at least two of the following are true, you may proceed to (→R3): You rejected your fate, Scrap of Torn Shadow is listed under "Mementos Discovered," and Wisp of Spectral Mist is listed under "Mementos Discovered." - If Strange Incantation and Bloody Tree Carvings are listed under "Mementos Discovered," you may proceed to (→R6) - Otherwise, (→R4).
Flavor: You are close now. You can feel the churning and twisting of aeons in the emptiness around you. Here, in the nucleus of all things - the very center of chaos itself - your objective, and your ultimate fate, lie at hand.
Flavor2: You stand on a precipice before the Black Throne and gaze up at the blind, voiceless monstrosity that is Azathoth. The mere sight of it causes your vision to blur and your body to shake uncontrollably. The monotonous piping is so loud now, it rattles your bones and causes blood to drip from your eyes and ears. Should Azathoth awaken, it will devour every world that ever was.
Name: What Must Be Done (v. II)

Description: Cosmos - Connect in a direction of your choice, but only onto a spot where an empty space exists. Remove that empty space from the game instead of shuffling it back into its owner's deck. Then, discard each other copy of that card from play and from each investigator's hand.
Flavor2:
The stars danced mockingly, almost shifting now and then to form pale signs of doom that one might wonder one had not seen and feared before; and ever the winds of aether howled of vague blackness and loneliness beyond the cosmos.
- H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dream-Quest of Unknown Kadath</u>
Name: Nightmare Breach

Description: Cosmos - Connect in the direction nearest to The Black Throne (or any direction if The Black Throne is not in play). While you are at Interstellar Abyss, you cannot spend clues.
Flavor2:
The stars danced mockingly, almost shifting now and then to form pale signs of doom that one might wonder one had not seen and feared before; and ever the winds of aether howled of vague blackness and loneliness beyond the cosmos.
- H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dream-Quest of Unknown Kadath</u>
Name: Interstellar Abyss

Description: Cosmos - Connect to the leftmost revealed location in a direction of your choice. You may choose not to move to Winding Gulf and instead place 1 doom on Azathoth. Haunted - Take 1 damage and 1 horror.
Flavor2:
The stars danced mockingly, almost shifting now and then to form pale signs of doom that one might wonder one had not seen and feared before; and ever the winds of aether howled of vague blackness and loneliness beyond the cosmos.
- H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dream-Quest of Unknown Kadath</u>
Name: Winding Gulf

Description: While you control Nightgaunt Steed, you may enter empty space as if it were a location. Forced - After you enter empty space, Nightgaunt Steed takes 1 direct damage. Forced - If Nightgaunt Steed leaves play, remove it from the game and move to the nearest revealed location.
Name: Nightgaunt Steed

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (2). This test gets +1 difficulty for each non-weakness treachery in your threat area. If you fail, take 2 damage or 2 horror.
Name: Trespasser!

Description: Revelation - Put Despoiled into play in your threat area. Forced - After you succeed at a skill test during your turn: Increase the difficulty of each subsequent test you perform this turn by 1. [action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Despoiled. If there is an exhausted [[Witch]] enemy at your location, this test is automatically successful.
Name: Despoiled

Description: Revelation - Put Maligned into play in your threat area. Increase the cost of each card you play by 1. [action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Maligned. If there is an exhausted [[Witch]] enemy at your location, this test is automatically successful.
Name: Maligned

Description: Peril. Revelation - You must either take 1 damage and 1 horror, or put Impending Evils into play next to the agenda deck and it gains surge. If there are 3 copies of Impending Evils next to the agenda deck, discard them and advance the current agenda.
Name: Impending Evils

Description: Revelation - Test [agility] (2). If you fail, take 2 damage. If you succeed, put Unavoidable Demise into play next to the agenda deck. While Unavoidable Demise is next to the agenda deck, each other copy of Unavoidable Demise gets +1 difficulty and deals +1 damage if its test is failed.
Name: Unavoidable Demise

Description: Revelation - If there is no other copy of Fate of All Fools in play, put Fate of All Fools into play in your threat area. Otherwise, an investigator with another copy of Fate of All Fools in their threat area draws the top card of the encounter deck. That card gains peril, its effects cannot be canceled, and cards cannot be committed to skill tests while resolving its revelation effect.
Name: Fate of All Fools

Description: Revelation - Attach to your location. Forced - After you leave attached location: Resolve each haunted ability on it. Forced - At the end of the round: If there are no investigators at attached location, discard Unstable Energies.
Name: Unstable Energies

Description: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). If you fail, resolve each haunted ability on your location (if you fail by 3 or more, resolve each of them twice, instead).
Name: From the Other Side

Description: Revelation - Attach Vice and Villainy to a non-permanent asset you control. Limit 1 per asset. Forced - When the encounter deck runs out of cards: Discard attached asset. Forced - When attached asset leaves play: Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, attach Vice and Villainy to a different non-permanent asset you control.
Name: Vice and Villainy

Description: Revelation - Test [agility] (5). For each point you fail by, discard the top card of the encounter deck. If a [[Curse]] treachery is discarded by this effect, deal 1 direct horror to your investigator and to each of your [[Ally]] assets.
Name: Unhallowed Land

Description: Revelation - Test [agility] (5). If you fail, choose and discard cards from your play area and/or from your hand with a total printed resource cost of at least X, where X is the amount you failed by.
Name: Supernatural Tempest

Description: Revelation - Attach to your location. Attached location gets +1 shroud. Forced - At the end of the round, if there are no clues on attached location: Move Mists from Beyond once towards the nearest location with 1 or more clues.
Name: Mists from Beyond

Description: Hunter. Forced - When you deal 1 or more damage to Screeching Banshee (except from a [[Spell]] or [[Relic]]): Resolve each haunted ability at its location.
Name: Screeching Banshee

Description: Revelation - Put Bloodthirsty Spirits into play in your threat area. While your location is haunted, as an additional cost for you to commit 1 or more cards to a skill test, you must resolve each haunted ability on your location. Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Bloodthirsty Spirits.
Name: Bloodthirsty Spirits

Description:
[reaction] After an enemy attacks you (except an attack of opportunity you provoked), even if that attack was canceled: Either deal 1 damage to that enemy, or automatically evade it.
[elder_sign] effect: +1. If you were attacked by an enemy this round, you automatically succeed, instead.
Description2: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Guardian cards ([guardian]) level 0, Survivor cards ([survivor]) level 1-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to 5 other Survivor cards ([survivor]) level 0. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Mechanic's Wrench, Mob Goons, 1 random basic weakness.
Flavor: "Relax, tough guy. I'll handle this. You stand over there and look pretty."
Flavor2: Daniela always figured she had a good life. She had a loving, boisterous family. She had a steady job that used her brains and her hands. She had enough money to spend on fast cars, pretty girls, and her motorcycle, Gabriel. Then her brother, Ramon, got caught up in some trouble. Her mother warned her to be careful, that darkness lay ahead. Daniela set a glass of water behind the door for her mother's sake, to catch evil spirits - just as she'd been taught as a child. When Daniela awoke to find it shattered, she was determined to figure out what happened and fix it. Just like she always did.
Name: Daniela Reyes

Description: Daniela Reyes deck only. [fast] Exhaust Mechanic's Wrench: Choose an enemy at your location. That enemy attacks you. [action]: Fight. Use this ability only against an enemy that has attacked you since the end of your last turn. You get +2 [combat] for this attack and deal +1 damage for this attack.
Name: Mechanic's Wrench

Description: Hunter. Prey - Daniela Reyes only. This enemy's attacks cannot be canceled. Damage/horror dealt by this enemy's attacks is treated as direct.
Flavor: Debt is a family affair.
Name: Mob Goons

Description: Play with the top card of your deck revealed. Once per round, you may play the top card of your deck as if it were in your hand, at -1 resource cost. Forced - After a weakness is revealed while on top of your deck: Draw it. [elder_sign] effect: +X. You may swap the top card of your deck with a card in your hand. X is the resource cost of the top card of your deck.
Description2: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0, Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 1-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to 5 other Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 0. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Livre d'Eibon, The Harbinger, 1 random basic weakness.
Flavor2: Nobody believes him, and why should they? How could six stars vanish from sight all at once, never to reappear? Astronomer and Miskatonic University professor Norman Withers had all but given up on regaining his colleagues' esteem when a protege of the renowned Albert Einstein comes to speak on campus. The visiting physicist, with unsettling theories about the curvature of space-time, may hold the key to helping Norman explain the phenomenon of the vanishing stars...
Name: Norman Withers

Description:
Norman Withers deck only.
[fast] Exhaust Livre d'Eibon: Swap the top card of your deck with a card in your hand.
[fast] Exhaust Livre d'Eibon: Commit the top card of your deck to an eligible skill test performed by an investigator at your location.
Name: Livre d'Eibon

Description: Revelation - Place this card on top of your deck. While The Harbinger is revealed and on top of your deck, cards in your deck cannot be searched, drawn, or manipulated in any way except by the below ability. [action] [action]: Discard The Harbinger. This ability may be activated while The Harbinger is on top of your deck, as if it were in your threat area.
Name: The Harbinger

Description:
[reaction] At the end of your turn, if you started this round 1 location away from your current location: Either gain 1 resource or draw 1 card (if you started this round 2 or more locations away, do both instead).
[elder_sign] effect: +1. If you started this round 1 or more locations away from your current location, gain 1 resource or draw 1 card.
Description2: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Rogue cards ([rogue]) level 0, Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 1-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to 5 other Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Trusty Bullwhip, Buried Secrets, 1 random basic weakness.
Flavor2: Young Jack traveled the world with his father's archaeological expeditions. Now a globe-trotting treasure hunter and an accomplished archaeologist in his own right, "Monterey" follows in his father's footsteps, securing the treasures of ancient civilizations and lost cultures. But after discovering a silver pendant with a familiar symbol on it, Monterey must explore his own past. Years ago, his father was found murdered with the very same sigil carved in his forehead. The image has haunted Monterey's dreams ever since. But he's getting close. He won't stop until he solves the mystery of his father's murder... no matter what it takes.
Name: Monterey Jack

Description: Fast. Monterey Jack deck only. [action]: Fight. This attack uses [agility] instead of [combat]. If this attack succeeds, you may exhaust Trusty Bullwhip to either automatically evade the attacked enemy or deal +1 damage for this attack.
Name: Trusty Bullwhip

Description: Revelation - Put Buried Secrets into play in your threat area. If your location can be investigated, you cannot move except by scenario card effects. [action]: Investigate. If you succeed, instead of discovering clues, discard Buried Secrets. If you fail, you may take 2 horror to shuffle it into your deck.
Name: Buried Secrets

Description:
You begin the game with each Discipline in your deck in play, [[Unbroken]] side faceup.
[elder_sign] effect: +2. After this test ends, flip a [[Broken]] Discipline you control to its [[Unbroken]] side.
Description2: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 0, Guardian cards ([guardian]) level 1-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to 5 other Guardian cards ([guardian]) level 0. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): 1 Burden of Destiny for each Discipline asset (see below), 1 random basic weakness. Deckbuilding Restrictions: No [[Firearm]] assets. Additional Requirements: At deck creation, choose a Discipline asset to add to your deck. It is considered part of your Deckbuilding Requirements. For every 15 experience you've earned in total, you may choose and add a different Discipline asset to your deck.
Flavor: "I have been preparing to confront this evil my entire life. My focus must be absolute."
Flavor2: Chen Li speaks rarely. When she does, her words are measured and wise. After a lifetime of disciplined training, every gesture is graceful, uncluttered by hesitation. The monks who raised her said that she was born for a special purpose, to face a great evil. Now, they believe that evil is at hand, and she is the only one who can stop it.
Name: Lily Chen

Description:
Lily Chen deck only. Permanent.
You get +1 [willpower].
[action]: Take 1 direct damage to heal 3 horror, or take 1 direct horror to heal 3 damage. Flip this asset over.
Name: Discipline

Description:
Lily Chen deck only. Permanent.
You get +1 [intellect].
[action]: If you have fewer than 5 cards in your hand: Draw cards until there are 5 cards in your hand. Flip this asset over.
Name: Discipline

Description:
Lily Chen deck only. Permanent.
You get +1 [combat].
[action]: You get +5 skill value for the next skill test you perform this turn. After that skill test ends, flip this asset over. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
Name: Discipline

Description:
Lily Chen deck only. Permanent.
You get +1 [agility].
[action]: One at a time, take up to 3 different fight or evade actions. Flip this asset over. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
Name: Discipline

Description: Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Flip a Discipline you control to its [[Broken]] side. It cannot be flipped back this round. - Take 1 damage and 1 horror.
Flavor: "How can I save them if I can't even save myself?"
Name: Burden of Destiny

Description:
At any time, an investigator at your location may reveal to you the [[Item]] assets in their hand.
You may take an additional action during your turn, which can only be used to play an [[Item]] asset from the hand of an investigator at your location, under their control. (Both investigators may spend resources to pay its cost).
[elder_sign] effect: +1 for each [[Item]] asset you control.
Description2: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Survivor cards ([survivor]) level 0, Rogue cards ([rogue]) level 1-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to 5 other Rogue cards ([rogue]) level 0. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Shrewd Dealings, Greed, 1 random basic weakness.
Flavor2: According to Bob, the secret to success as a salesman is persistence. People just need to be told what it is that they want. Repeatedly. Recently, Bob came into possession of a handful of "cursed" golden coins, and he hopes the same persistence he so famously advocates will help him to uncover their origin and purpose. If he plays his cards right, maybe this will be his big score. Maybe he'll finally be able to retire and buy that boat he's had his eye on and spend the rest of his days fishing in a tropical paradise. Or maybe Bob will finally come to see all that glitters is not gold.
Name: Bob Jenkins

Description:
Bob Jenkins deck only.
Reduce the cost of each [[Item]] asset you play by 1.
[reaction]: When you play an [[Item]] asset: Play it under the control of any investigator at your location.
Flavor: "You say the 'end of the world.' I hear 'business opportunity.'"
Name: Shrewd Dealings

Description: Revelation - Take 1 horror. If you have... - ...10 or fewer resources, take 1 additional horror. - ...5 or fewer resources, take 1 additional horror. - ...0 resources, take 1 additional horror.
Flavor: Worshipped by its own cult, one might say.
Name: Greed

Description: Permanent. Limit 1 per deck. Purchase at deck creation. Forced - When your first turn of the game begins: One at a time, play any number of [[Item]] assets from your hand, reducing the cost of each by 1. During this turn, you have 3 fewer actions to take.
Name: Geared Up

Description: Fight. This attack deals +1 damage and is automatically successful. As an additional cost to perform this attack, the chosen enemy makes an attack against you.
Flavor: Sometimes, the only way out is through.
Name: Toe to Toe

Description:
Fast. Play during any [fast] window.
Until the end of the phase, whenever an enemy would attack another investigator at your location, it attacks you instead, then engages you. Cancel 1 horror dealt by each attack made in this way.
Name: "Get behind me!"
