Behind it, the beast emerges: a whirlwind of mist; haunting , alien shapes; hideous effluvia. It sets its terrible gaze on your party and reaches for you with a tendril of miasma.
Name: Forbidden Peaks

Description: Forced - After you move to a location: Return all of your clues to the token pool.
Description2: If one or more investigators have resigned, proceed to (→R1). Otherwise, proceed to (→R2).
Flavor: The once-flurrying snow has become a tempest of wind and heavy snowfall. If you don’t make it across the peaks soon, you’ll be forced to take shelter...or spend the rest of eternity as a frozen corpse along the mountainside.
Flavor2: The snowfall is so thick now that you can no longer see your destination, nor can you hear your companions’ shouts over the howling wind. Every step takes the breath out of you. The air is so thin up here, it is a wonder you even have any breath to spare. You glance up at the blanket of white cast in an endless net overhead. Perhaps you were never close to the summit - just another trick of the eye, like everything else in this godforsaken place.
Name: Terror Descends

Description: [action]: Take control of an [[Expedition]] asset at your location. Objective – Get to the top of the mountain. If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.
Flavor: Carrying as much expedition gear as you can, you must climb the imposing mountainside to unlock the secrets that lie on the other side.
Flavor2: After a long and arduous journey up the mountainside, you’ve reached the forbidden peaks. You hope the pain and horror you’ve suffered along the way is behind you, but you fear that it will persist...and become relentless.
Name: Ascend the Mountain

Description: Forced – After you move to Deep Drifts from a location below it: Discard the top 3 cards of your deck. Draw each weakness discarded this way.
Description2: You cannot enter this location unless all of the clues on the location directly below it have been discovered.
Flavor2:
"The touch of evil mystery in these barrier mountains, and in the beckoning sea of opalescent sky glimpsed betwixt their summits, was a highly subtle and attenuated matter..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Deep Drifts

Description: Forced – After you move to White Bluff from a location below it: Test [agility] (X). X is 1 plus this location’s level. If you fail, lose control of an [[Expedition]] asset and place it at White Bluff.
Description2: You cannot enter this location unless all of the clues on the location directly below it have been discovered.
Flavor2:
"The touch of evil mystery in these barrier mountains, and in the beckoning sea of opalescent sky glimpsed betwixt their summits, was a highly subtle and attenuated matter..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: White Bluff

Description: Forced – After you move to Steep Incline from a location below it: Take 1 damage.
Description2: You cannot enter this location unless all of the clues on the location directly below it have been discovered.
Flavor:
"The last stage of our descent to the town was unusually steep and abrupt...."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Flavor2:
"The touch of evil mystery in these barrier mountains, and in the beckoning sea of opalescent sky glimpsed betwixt their summits, was a highly subtle and attenuated matter..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Steep Incline

Description: Forced – After you move to Narrow Ridge from a location below it: Take 1 horror.
Description2: You cannot enter this location unless all of the clues on the location directly below it have been discovered.
Flavor:
"...before noon we all felt a thrill of excitement at beholding a vast, lofty, and snow-clad mountain chain which opened out and covered the whole vista ahead."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Flavor2:
"The touch of evil mystery in these barrier mountains, and in the beckoning sea of opalescent sky glimpsed betwixt their summits, was a highly subtle and attenuated matter..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Narrow Ridge

Description: Forced – After you move to Rocky Ledge from a location below it: Shuffle the top card of the Tekeli-li deck into your deck without looking at it.
Description2: You cannot enter this location unless all of the clues on the location directly below it have been discovered.
Flavor:
"They had crossed the icy peaks on whose templed slopes they had once worshipped and roamed among the tree-ferns."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Flavor2:
"The touch of evil mystery in these barrier mountains, and in the beckoning sea of opalescent sky glimpsed betwixt their summits, was a highly subtle and attenuated matter..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Rocky Ledge

Description: Forced – After you move to Snow-Covered Crag from a location below it: Exhaust each asset you control.
Description2: You cannot enter this location unless all of the clues on the location directly below it have been discovered.
Flavor:
"The distribution of cryptical cave-mouths on the black snow- denuded summits seemed roughly even...."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Flavor2:
"The touch of evil mystery in these barrier mountains, and in the beckoning sea of opalescent sky glimpsed betwixt their summits, was a highly subtle and attenuated matter..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Snow-Covered Crag

Description: Forced – After Windswept Path is revealed: If it is at level 0, place 1 [per_investigator] clues on it (from the token pool). Forced – After you move to Windswept Path from a location below it: Place 1 clue on it (from the token pool).
Description2: You cannot enter this location unless all of the clues on the location directly below it have been discovered.
Flavor2:
"The touch of evil mystery in these barrier mountains, and in the beckoning sea of opalescent sky glimpsed betwixt their summits, was a highly subtle and attenuated matter..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Windswept Path

Description: Clues on The Summit can only be discovered by investigating. Forced – When The Summit is revealed: Add 1 [frost] token to the chaos bag. [action]: Resign. Add each [[Expedition]] asset you control to the victory display. Return all of your clues to the token pool.
Description2: You cannot enter this location unless all of the clues on the location directly below it have been discovered.
Flavor2:
"As we drew near the forbidding peaks, dark and sinister above the line of crevasse-riven snow and interstitial glaciers, we noticed more and more the curiously regular formations..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: The Summit

Description: Hunter. Massive. Terror of the Stars gets +3 [per_investigator] health. X is the level of your location (to a minimum of 1). Forced – At the end of the round: Move all investigators at Terror of the Stars’s location to the location directly below it.
Name: Terror of the Stars

Description:
Hunter.
X is the level of your location (to a minimum of 1).
While Constricting Elder Thing is engaged with you, you cannot move to locations above your location.
Name: Constricting Elder Thing

Description: Revelation – Place 2 clues on your location (from the token pool).
Flavor:
"...the still lower horizon-grazing southern sun of midnight poured its hazy reddish rays over the white snow, bluish ice and water lanes, and black bits of exposed granite slope."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Snowfall

Description: Revelation – If the level of your location is 1–4, move to the location directly below you. Then test [willpower] (X). X is the level of your location. If you fail, repeat this process. If you did not move by this effect, Avalanche gains surge.
Name: Avalanche

Description: Revelation – Test [agility] (3). If you fail, take 2 damage, lose control of each [[Expedition]] asset you control (placing it at your location), and move to the location directly below you.
Name: Hanging on the Edge

Description: Revelation – Test [willpower] (3). If the level of your location is 4 or 5, reveal 1 additional chaos token for this skill test. If you fail, either add 1 [frost] token to the chaos bag, or take 1 horror for each point you failed by.
Name: Hypothermia

Description:
Uses (4 charges).
[reaction] When you perform a successful attack, spend 1 charge and exhaust Green Soapstone: Deal +1 damage for that attack.
Name: Green Soapstone

Description:
[action] Exhaust Wooden Sledge: An investigator at this location searches the top 6 cards of their deck for up to 3 non-weakness [[Item]] or [[Supply]] cards and attaches them facedown to Wooden Sledge. Shuffle their deck.
While Wooden Sledge is under an investigator's control, facedown cards attached to it may be played as if they were in the hand of any investigator at its location.
Name: Wooden Sledge

Description:
Uses (2 supplies).
[action] Spend 1 supply and exhaust Dynamite: Choose either your location or a connecting location. Deal 3 damage to each enemy and investigator at the chosen location.
Name: Dynamite

Description:
Uses (3 charges).
[reaction] When an investigator at your location draws a Tekeli-li weakness, spend 1 charge: That investigator cancels the effects of that weakness, places it on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck, and draws 1 card.
Name: Miasmic Crystal

Description: Uses (3 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Investigate. Investigate with a base [intellect] skill of 5. Cancel each [frost] token revealed during this test. If you succeed, discover 1 additional clue at your location.
Name: Mineral Specimen

Description: Uses (3 supplies). You may trigger abilities on assets from the Expedition Team encounter set that are not in play, but whose names are not crossed off in the Campaign Log. Instead of paying that ability's non-[action] costs, exhaust Small Radio and spend 1 supply.
Name: Small Radio

Description:
Uses (3 supplies).
[fast] Spend 1 supply and exhaust Spare Parts: Add 1 supply to another asset at your location, or choose an investigator at your location to gain 1 resource.
Name: Spare Parts

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is the number of keys you control.
[cultist]: –2. If you fail, place a key you control on your location.
[tablet]: –3. If a [frost] token was revealed during this test, you automatically fail, instead.
[elder_thing]: –4. If you fail, the nearest enemy moves once toward you. If it is engaged with you, it attacks.
Description2:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is 2 plus the number of keys you control.
[cultist]: –2. Place a key you control on your location.
[tablet]: –4. If a [frost] token was revealed during this test, take 1 damage and you automatically fail, instead.
[elder_thing]: –5. If you fail, the nearest enemy moves once toward you. If it is engaged with you, it attacks.
Name: City of the Elder Things

Description:
[fast] During your turn, spend 1 clue: Look at the revealed side of a City Landscape in your column or row. (Limit once per round.)
[fast] During your turn, spend 3 clues: Move to any location in your column or row. (Limit once per round.)
Description2: Read Scenario Interlude: Gaze into Madness in the Campaign Log.
Flavor: The hidden alien city looms before you, ancient and enigmatic. What secrets - and terrors - lie in wait within?
Flavor2: The walls of the city call to you in surreptitious whispers, ethereal songs indecipherable to human ears, and yet somehow familiar all the same. You try your best to shut them out, to make believe it is just your imagination, but not all of your companions are as successful...
Name: Lurking Horrors

Description:
[fast] During your turn, spend 1 clue: Look at the revealed side of a City Landscape in your column or row. (Limit once per round.)
[fast] During your turn, spend 3 clues: Move to any location in your column or row. (Limit once per round.)
Flavor: Below the darkened ice, more of the city lies trapped, encased and frozen in time. This is but the tip of the iceberg...
Flavor2:
Your thoughts become convoluted, a tangle of fear, worry, and doubt. Danger lurks around every corner of this abominable place, but most dangerous of all is the growing feeling that you should not be here - that you should flee from this place and never return.
As the weather outside turns foul, you hole up in the relative safety of one of the city’s towering structures. It is too late to return to camp. Your only hope is to take shelter within the alien city, hoping your presence goes unnoticed by the denizens that still prowl through its streets and ancient halls.
Name: Doom from Below

Description: [action] Spend two [elder_thing] keys: Remember that the team "studied the history of the Elder Things." [action] Spend two [tablet] keys: Remember that the team "discerned the origin of the Shoggoths." Objective – If the team has "studied the history of the Elder Things" and "discerned the origin of the Shoggoths," advance.
Description2:
Shuffle the set-aside Shoggoths encounter set and the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.
You know the route into the undercity. Reveal the Hidden Tunnel.
Put the set-aside Terror of the Stars enemy into play at the Hidden Tunnel, exhausted.
Flavor: This is the discovery of a lifetime. Dyer’s report was true - all of it. You must explore this alien civilization in order to learn more...
Flavor2:
What you have found is almost too wild to believe. According to the murals and records within the city, the "Elder Things" were travelers from the stars. They colonized the Earth long before the time of humanity, settling far and wide. And deep in the undercity beneath the tallest mountain, they created monstrous creatures - "Shoggoths" - to be their servants. But the Shoggoths rebelled against them and soon their civilization collapsed...
Suddenly, a distant noise stops you and the other explorers in their tracks: a deep, bellowing roar that seems to come from somewhere far below. You dare not ponder what kind of monstrosity could have made such a hideous sound.
Name: Sprawling City (v. I)

Description: [action] Spend two [elder_thing] keys: Remember that the team "studied the history of the Elder Things." [action] Spend two [cultist] keys: Remember that the team "discovered a hidden power." Objective – If the team has "studied the history of the Elder Things" and "discovered a hidden power," advance.
Description2:
Shuffle the set-aside Creatures in the Ice encounter set and the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.
You know the route into the undercity. Reveal the Hidden Tunnel.
Add 1 [frost] token to the chaos bag.
Flavor: This is the discovery of a lifetime. Dyer’s report was true - all of it. You must explore this alien civilization in order to learn more...
Flavor2:
What you have found is almost too wild to believe. According to the murals and records within the city, the "Elder Things" were travelers from the stars. They colonized the Earth long before the time of humanity, settling far and wide. And deep in the undercity beneath the tallest mountain, they found a dormant, primordial power - something so terrifying, they built a gateway to seal it within. But eventually, it began to escape, and their civilization collapsed...
There must be even more preposterous secrets buried deep below. You have to learn the truth of this ancient power, and in order to do so, you must find the secret passageway that will lead you deeper into the heart of the mountain.
Name: Sprawling City (v. II)

Description: [action] Spend two [tablet] keys: Remember that the team "discerned the origin of the Shoggoths." [action] Spend two [cultist] keys: Remember that the team "discovered a hidden power." Objective – If the team has "discerned the origin of the Shoggoths" and "discovered a hidden power," advance.
Description2:
Shuffle the set-aside Shoggoths encounter set and the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.
You know the route into the undercity. Reveal the Hidden Tunnel.
In player order, each investigator draws 1 card from the top of the encounter deck.
Flavor: This is the discovery of a lifetime. Dyer’s report was true - all of it. You must explore this alien civilization in order to learn more...
Flavor2:
What you have found is almost too wild to believe. According to the murals and records within the city, a race of monstrous creatures known as "Shoggoths" were created to serve the masters of this city. The Shoggoths were sent deep into the undercity beneath the tallest mountain, where they would construct a gateway to seal some dormant, primordial power, something so terrifying even the Shoggoths’ masters feared it. But the Shoggoths rebelled against them and let the seal decay, leading to the collapse of this ancient civilization...
Suddenly, a distant noise stops you and the other explorers in their tracks: a deep, bellowing roar that seems to come from somewhere far below. You dare not ponder what kind of monstrosity could have made such a hideous sound.
Name: Sprawling City (v. III)

Description: [action] Spend two [cultist] keys: Each investigator may heal 1 damage, 1 horror, and 1 trauma. Objective – If each undefeated investigator is at the Hidden Tunnel and it has no clues, advance.
Flavor: Somewhere in this sprawling web of icy streets and cyclopean structures lies an ancient gateway leading to the undercity beneath the great mountain. You’ll have to find it if you wish to learn more...
Flavor2: The path, now clear, leads into a labyrinth of dark, treacherous tunnels. For good or ill, your rigorous journey is coming to an end. Taking a deep breath, you gather your courage and delve into the depths of the mountain.
Name: Pursuit of the Unknown (v. I)

Description: [action] Spend two [tablet] keys: Each investigator searches their deck for each Tekeli-li weakness, shuffles each of them into the Tekeli-li deck, then shuffles their deck. Objective – If each undefeated investigator is at the Hidden Tunnel and it has no clues, advance.
Flavor: Somewhere in this sprawling web of icy streets and cyclopean structures lies an ancient gateway leading to the undercity beneath the great mountain. You’ll have to find it if you wish to learn more...
Flavor2: The path, now clear, leads into a labyrinth of dark, treacherous tunnels. For good or ill, your rigorous journey is coming to an end. Taking a deep breath, you gather your courage and delve into the depths of the mountain.
Name: Pursuit of the Unknown (v. II)

Description: Forced – When a [[Shoggoth]] or [[Elite]] enemy enters a location: Defeat each [[Elder Thing]] enemy at that location. [action] Spend two [elder_thing] keys: Remove each [elder_thing] token from the chaos bag. Objective – If each undefeated investigator is at the Hidden Tunnel and it has no clues, advance.
Flavor: Somewhere in this sprawling web of icy streets and cyclopean structures lies an ancient gateway leading to the undercity beneath the great mountain. You’ll have to find it if you wish to learn more...
Flavor2: The path, now clear, leads into a labyrinth of dark, treacherous tunnels. For good or ill, your rigorous journey is coming to an end. Taking a deep breath, you gather your courage and delve into the depths of the mountain.
Name: Pursuit of the Unknown (v. III)

Description:
Clues on Hidden Tunnel cannot be discovered or moved to other locations.
[action]: Test a skill of your choice (4). You may spend a [skull] key to get +5 skill value for this test. If you succeed, return 1 clue on Hidden Tunnel to the token pool (2 clues instead if you spent a [skull] key).
Description2: The passageway into the undercity is hidden. You cannot enter the Hidden Tunnel.
Flavor2:
"...our study of the decadent sculptures brought about a change in our immediate objective. This of course had to do with the chiselled avenues to the black inner world, of whose existence we had not known before...."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Hidden Tunnel

Description: [action] Spend two "0" keys: Add one of the spent "0" keys to the chaos bag (as a chaos token) for the remainder of the campaign. Record in the Campaign Log the team photographed the astronomical charts.
Flavor2:
"Yet now the sway of reason seemed irrefutably shaken, for this Cyclopean maze of squared, curved, and angled blocks had features which cut off all comfortable refuge. It was, very clearly, the blasphemous city of the mirage in stark, objective, and ineluctable reality."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Ancient Planetarium

Description:
[action]: Test [combat] (4) or [agility] (4). If you succeed, discover 1 clue from Stone Bridge.
[action]: Move to another Stone Bridge location.
Flavor:
"All of these febrile structures seemed knit together by tubular bridges crossing from one to the other at various dizzy heights..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Flavor2:
"Yet now the sway of reason seemed irrefutably shaken, for this Cyclopean maze of squared, curved, and angled blocks had features which cut off all comfortable refuge. It was, very clearly, the blasphemous city of the mirage in stark, objective, and ineluctable reality."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Stone Bridge

Description: [action] Spend two "–2" keys: Draw 2 cards, gain 2 resources, and remove 2 [frost] tokens from the chaos bag. Record in the Campaign Log the team studied the mural carvings.
Flavor2:
"Yet now the sway of reason seemed irrefutably shaken, for this Cyclopean maze of squared, curved, and angled blocks had features which cut off all comfortable refuge. It was, very clearly, the blasphemous city of the mirage in stark, objective, and ineluctable reality."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Cylindrical Tower

Description: Each time a chaos token is revealed during a skill test at this location, double its modifier if a key matching that chaos token is on this location or under the control of an investigator at this location.
Flavor2:
"Yet now the sway of reason seemed irrefutably shaken, for this Cyclopean maze of squared, curved, and angled blocks had features which cut off all comfortable refuge. It was, very clearly, the blasphemous city of the mirage in stark, objective, and ineluctable reality."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Labyrinthine Chamber

Description: [action] Spend two "–3" keys: Choose 3 locations other than Hidden Tunnel and reveal them. Discover 1 clue from each of these locations. Record in the Campaign Log the team read the map.
Flavor2:
"Yet now the sway of reason seemed irrefutably shaken, for this Cyclopean maze of squared, curved, and angled blocks had features which cut off all comfortable refuge. It was, very clearly, the blasphemous city of the mirage in stark, objective, and ineluctable reality."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Map Room

Description: [action] Spend two "–1" keys: Either remove 1 doom from the agenda, or choose and discard from play 1 non-[[Elite]] enemy or treachery. Record in the Campaign Log the team discovered an ancient vault.
Flavor:
"...farther on there was a huge roofless rampart still complete in its gigantic five-pointed outline..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Flavor2:
"Yet now the sway of reason seemed irrefutably shaken, for this Cyclopean maze of squared, curved, and angled blocks had features which cut off all comfortable refuge. It was, very clearly, the blasphemous city of the mirage in stark, objective, and ineluctable reality."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Roofless Rampart

Description: Forced – After you reveal 1 or more [frost] tokens during a skill test at Ruinous Streets: Take 1 damage. [reaction] After you discover the last clue from Ruinous Streets: Discover 1 clue on a connecting location.
Flavor2:
"Yet now the sway of reason seemed irrefutably shaken, for this Cyclopean maze of squared, curved, and angled blocks had features which cut off all comfortable refuge. It was, very clearly, the blasphemous city of the mirage in stark, objective, and ineluctable reality."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Ruinous Streets

Description: [action]: Move 1 key on another location in this row to Cyclopean Spires. (Group limit once per game.)
Flavor:
"There were composite cones and pyramids either alone or surmounting cylinders or cubes or flatter truncated cones and pyramids, and occasional needle-like spires in curious clusters..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Flavor2:
"Yet now the sway of reason seemed irrefutably shaken, for this Cyclopean maze of squared, curved, and angled blocks had features which cut off all comfortable refuge. It was, very clearly, the blasphemous city of the mirage in stark, objective, and ineluctable reality."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Cyclopean Spires

Description: [action]: Move 1 clue from this location to an unrevealed location in this column or row.
Flavor:
"Had the coming of the ice been foreseen, and had a nameless population left en masse to seek a less doomed abode?"
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Flavor2:
"Yet now the sway of reason seemed irrefutably shaken, for this Cyclopean maze of squared, curved, and angled blocks had features which cut off all comfortable refuge. It was, very clearly, the blasphemous city of the mirage in stark, objective, and ineluctable reality."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Submerged Passageway

Description: Forced – After you reveal 1 or more [frost] tokens during a skill test at this location: Take 1 horror. [action] If there are no clues on Temple of the Elder Things: Choose 2 locations with keys on them. Swap each key on those locations. (Group limit once per game.)
Flavor2:
"Yet now the sway of reason seemed irrefutably shaken, for this Cyclopean maze of squared, curved, and angled blocks had features which cut off all comfortable refuge. It was, very clearly, the blasphemous city of the mirage in stark, objective, and ineluctable reality."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Temple of the Elder Things

Description:
Hunter. Massive.
Terror of the Stars gets +3 [per_investigator] health.
While Terror of the Stars is ready, investigators at its location cannot spend or take control of keys.
Name: Terror of the Stars

Description: Spawn – Any empty location. Benign Elder Thing enters play with 1 doom on it. Forced – When Benign Elder Thing is defeated: Place 1 doom on the agenda. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, remove Benign Elder Thing from the game.
Name: Benign Elder Thing

Description: Hunter. Forced – When this enemy engages you: Place a key you control on it. When it leaves play, place that key on its location. Forced – When an investigator at this enemy’s location takes control of a key: This enemy readies, engages, and attacks them.
Name: Reawakened Elder Thing

Description: Revelation – Test [willpower] (2). Increase the difficulty of this test by 1 for each key on your location or under your control. If you fail, take 2 horror (3 horror instead if you fail by 3 or more).
Name: Dawning of the Truth

Description: Revelation – Test [agility] (3). During this test, if you reveal a chaos token that matches a key on your location or under the control of an investigator at your location, you automatically fail. For each point you fail by, take 1 damage.
Name: Crumbling Ruins

Description: Revelation - Put Frostbitten into play in your threat area. Frostbitten can be healed as if it were a single point of damage on you (if it is healed, discard it). Forced - When you reveal a [frost] token during a skill test: You must either take 1 damage or you automatically fail this test. (Limit once per test.)
Name: Frostbitten

Description: Revelation - Put Possessed into play in your threat area. Possessed can be healed as if it were a single point of horror on you (if it is healed, discard it). Forced - When you reveal a [frost] token during a skill test: You must either take 1 horror or you automatically fail this test. (Limit once per test.)
Name: Possessed

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –1 (–3 instead if there is an [[Ancient One]] enemy at your location).
[cultist]: –1. If there is a seal at your location, or if your location is a Mist-Pylon, treat this token as a [frost] token, instead.
[tablet]: –3. If you fail, draw the top card of the Tekeli-li deck.
[elder_thing]: –4. If you fail by 3 or more, place 1 doom on the current agenda. This can cause the current agenda to advance.
Description2:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –2 (–4 instead if there is an [[Ancient One]] enemy at your location).
[cultist]: –1. If there is a seal at your location, or if your location is a Mist-Pylon, treat this token as a [frost] token in addition to its modifier.
[tablet]: –3. Draw the top card of the Tekeli-li deck.
[elder_thing]: –5. If you fail by 3 or more, place 1 doom on the current agenda. This can cause the current agenda to advance.
Name: The Heart of Madness

Description: [action]: Place an activated seal you control on The Gate of Y’quaa. [action]: Resign. You retreat, hoping you’ve done enough to seal away whatever lies beyond the gate. (If you control 1 or more seals, you retain control of them.)
Description2: A wall of churning miasma blocks the ancient gateway. Investigators and enemies cannot enter The Gate of Y’quaa. The Gate of Y’quaa cannot have attachments.
Flavor2: -the black pit - the carven rim - the proto-shoggoths - the windowless solids with five dimensions - the nameless cylinder - the elder pharos - the primal white jelly - the wings - the eyes in darkness - the moon-ladder - the original - the eternal - the undying-
Name: The Gate of Y’quaa

Description: [action] If you control the [seal_a] seal: Test [combat] (3). If you succeed, investigators at Geothermal Vent spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group, to activate the [seal_a] seal. Then, remove 1 [frost] token from the chaos bag.
Flavor2:
"Other apertures were undoubtedly connected with bygone mechanical facilities - heating, lighting, and the like - of a sort suggested in many of the carvings. Ceilings tended to be plain, but had sometimes been inlaid with green soapstone or other tiles, mostly fallen now."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Geothermal Vent

Description: [action] If you control the [seal_c] seal: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, investigators at Forsaken Temple spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group, to activate the [seal_c] seal. Then, look at the revealed side of each unrevealed location on the same spoke as Forsaken Temple.
Flavor2:
"Other apertures were undoubtedly connected with bygone mechanical facilities - heating, lighting, and the like - of a sort suggested in many of the carvings. Ceilings tended to be plain, but had sometimes been inlaid with green soapstone or other tiles, mostly fallen now."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Forsaken Temple

Description: [action] If you control the [seal_b] seal: Test [intellect] (3). If you succeed, investigators at Library of Kós spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group, to activate the [seal_b] seal. Then, look at the revealed side of each unrevealed location on the same ring as Library of Kós.
Flavor2:
"Other apertures were undoubtedly connected with bygone mechanical facilities - heating, lighting, and the like - of a sort suggested in many of the carvings. Ceilings tended to be plain, but had sometimes been inlaid with green soapstone or other tiles, mostly fallen now."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Library of Kós

Description: [action] If you control the [seal_d] seal: Test [agility] (3). If you succeed, investigators at Protoplasmic Pool spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group, to activate the [seal_d] seal. Then, deal 2 damage to each enemy in play.
Flavor2:
"Other apertures were undoubtedly connected with bygone mechanical facilities - heating, lighting, and the like - of a sort suggested in many of the carvings. Ceilings tended to be plain, but had sometimes been inlaid with green soapstone or other tiles, mostly fallen now."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Protoplasmic Pool

Description: [action] If you control the [seal_e] seal, investigators at Hall of the Sunless Sea spend 1 [per_investigator] clues and discard 2 [per_investigator] cards from their hands, as a group: Activate the [seal_e] seal.
Flavor2:
"Other apertures were undoubtedly connected with bygone mechanical facilities - heating, lighting, and the like - of a sort suggested in many of the carvings. Ceilings tended to be plain, but had sometimes been inlaid with green soapstone or other tiles, mostly fallen now."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Hall of the Sunless Sea

Description: Treat the modifier of the first [frost] token revealed during each skill test at Subnautical Sprawl as –3 instead of –1. (Limit once per round.)
Flavor2:
"Other apertures were undoubtedly connected with bygone mechanical facilities - heating, lighting, and the like - of a sort suggested in many of the carvings. Ceilings tended to be plain, but had sometimes been inlaid with green soapstone or other tiles, mostly fallen now."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Subnautical Sprawl

Description: [fast]: Choose another Vaulted Corridor and test [agility] (X). X is the number of locations away that Vaulted Corridor is from this one. If you succeed, move there. (Limit once per round.)
Flavor2:
"Other apertures were undoubtedly connected with bygone mechanical facilities - heating, lighting, and the like - of a sort suggested in many of the carvings. Ceilings tended to be plain, but had sometimes been inlaid with green soapstone or other tiles, mostly fallen now."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Vaulted Corridor

Description: Revelation – Test [willpower] (2). This test gets +1 difficulty for each location away from The Gate of Y’quaa you are. If you fail, take 2 horror.
Flavor:
"The sheer appalling antiquity and lethal desolation of the place were enough to overwhelm almost any sensitive person..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Primeval Terror

Description: Revelation – Test [agility] (2). This test gets +1 difficulty for each location away from The Gate of Y’quaa you are. If you fail, take 2 damage.
Flavor:
"The things once rearing and dwelling in this frightful masonry in the age of dinosaurs were not indeed dinosaurs, but far worse."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Roots of the Earth

Description: Forced – If two or more activated seals are controlled by investigators at the same location: The latent energy stored within the seals fuses together, and the ensuing chain reaction sets off an electrostatic detonation that destroys all life on Earth. (→R3)
Description2: Read Scenario Interlude: The Final Straw in the Campaign Guide.
Flavor: Five darkened paths lead away from the gateway, through icy caverns and down vaulted corridors of smooth black stone. Quiet dread fills the ancient, dormant structure.
Flavor2: A dark, primordial energy seeps forth from the walls, the very same miasma that has haunted your every step throughout this doomed journey. You freeze in your tracks and back away. You’ve seen the kinds of hideous shapes it can take. The kinds of memories it conjures- foul and fair alike. But not everyone sees the mirage for what it truly is...
Name: The Beating Heart

Description: Forced – If two or more activated seals are controlled by investigators at the same location: The latent energy stored within the seals fuses together, and the ensuing chain reaction sets off an electrostatic detonation that destroys all life on Earth. (→R3)
Description2:
Check the seals controlled by each investigator (if a seal is not controlled by an investigator, skip it).
The investigator who controls the [seal_a] seal takes 1 damage (2 instead if the seal is activated).
The investigator who controls the [seal_b] seal discards 2 random cards from their hand (4 instead if the seal is activated).
The investigator who controls the [seal_c] seal takes 1 horror (2 instead if the seal is activated).
The investigator who controls the [seal_d] seal loses 1 action (2 instead if the seal is activated).
The investigator who controls the [seal_e] seal loses 3 resources (6 instead if the seal is activated).
Flavor: Eldritch whispers and the dribbling of inky miasma permeates the once-silent ruins. Something is reaching out to you from within its walls. Calling to you.
Flavor2: The seals pulse with dangerous electrostatic energy, filling the icy chambers with bright blue light. You struggle to contain the power within each seal as you move quickly to put them in their proper place.
Name: The Miasma Beckons

Description: Forced – If two or more activated seals are controlled by investigators at the same location: The latent energy stored within the seals fuses together, and the ensuing chain reaction sets off an electrostatic detonation that destroys all life on Earth. (→R3)
Description2: Each remaining investigator is defeated and must either suffer 1 mental trauma or shuffle the top 3 cards of the Tekeli-li deck into their deck.
Flavor: The gateway stirs. Whatever is calling to you from within these walls, it hears your every word, your every footstep. It knows of your presence, of your hopes, of your fears. And it yearns to be free.
Flavor2: Before you can find and place all five seals, a tremendous noise fills the cavernous halls of the facility, and inky, prismatic miasma begins to seep from every inch of the walls and ceiling. Waves of creeping ichor and wafting black mist block every route but the one from which you came. You flee back to the gateway to escape or find another path forward, but by the time you reach the massive door, it is too late.
Name: Call of Madness

Description: Objective – If an activated seal is placed on The Gate of Y’quaa, advance.
Description2: Check which seal was just placed (do not remove it). If it was the [seal_a] seal, the investigator who placed it heals 1 damage. If it was the [seal_b] seal, the investigator who placed it draws 2 cards. If it was the [seal_c] seal, the investigator who placed it heals 1 horror. If it was the [seal_d] seal, the investigator who placed it may take an additional action this turn. If it was the [seal_e] seal, the investigator who placed it gains 3 resources.
Flavor: You have decided to explore the rest of this antediluvian complex in order to find the devices that fit this strange doorway.
Flavor2: As soon as you set the seal into place, it locks into the door with an audible click. The energy stored within the seal reaches out, coursing through channels and grooves along the doorway, and lighting the entire chamber with an eerie glow. Perhaps if you can activate and place the remaining four seals, you can put a stop to this madness.
Name: Dormancy

Description: Objective – Place as many activated seals as you can on The Gate of Y’quaa before whatever is inside escapes. If all five seals have been placed, advance.
Flavor: Placing the first of the five seals has awoken a strange power within the facility. You believe if you can find and activate the remaining seals, they will aid in containing the thing that dwells on the other side of this gate...
Flavor2: The final seal locks into place. With a hum, power flows through the facility. Small orbs embedded in the ceiling begin to light, one by one. The realization dawns on you that this sanctuary is far more advanced than you could have ever imagined.
Name: The Great Seal

Description: Forced – After Glacial Grotto is revealed: Place the dormant [seal_a] seal on it. [action]: Test [combat] (2) to shatter the ice. If you succeed, investigators at Glacial Grotto may spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group, for you to take control of the seal on it.
Flavor2:
"Other apertures were undoubtedly connected with bygone mechanical facilities - heating, lighting, and the like - of a sort suggested in many of the carvings. Ceilings tended to be plain, but had sometimes been inlaid with green soapstone or other tiles, mostly fallen now."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Glacial Grotto

Description: Forced – After Sculptured Crypt is revealed: Place the dormant [seal_b] seal on it. [action]: Test [intellect] (2) to decipher the alien script. If you succeed, investigators at Sculptured Crypt may spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group, for you to take control of the seal on it.
Flavor2:
"Other apertures were undoubtedly connected with bygone mechanical facilities - heating, lighting, and the like - of a sort suggested in many of the carvings. Ceilings tended to be plain, but had sometimes been inlaid with green soapstone or other tiles, mostly fallen now."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Sculptured Crypt

Description: Forced – After Undercity Altar is revealed: Place the dormant [seal_c] seal on it. [action]: Test [willpower] (2) to break the ancient ward. If you succeed, investigators at Undercity Altar may spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group, for you to take control of the seal on it.
Flavor2:
"Other apertures were undoubtedly connected with bygone mechanical facilities - heating, lighting, and the like - of a sort suggested in many of the carvings. Ceilings tended to be plain, but had sometimes been inlaid with green soapstone or other tiles, mostly fallen now."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Undercity Altar

Description: Forced – After Ichor-Laden Tunnels is revealed: Place the dormant [seal_d] seal on it. [action]: Test [agility] (2) to traverse the ichor. If you succeed, investigators at Ichor-Laden Tunnels may spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group, for you to take control of the seal on it.
Flavor2:
"Other apertures were undoubtedly connected with bygone mechanical facilities - heating, lighting, and the like - of a sort suggested in many of the carvings. Ceilings tended to be plain, but had sometimes been inlaid with green soapstone or other tiles, mostly fallen now."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Ichor-Laden Tunnels

Description: Forced – After Limestone Caverns is revealed: Place the dormant [seal_e] seal on it. [action] Investigators at Limestone Caverns spend 1 [per_investigator] clues and 3 [per_investigator] resources, as a group: Take control of the seal on Limestone Caverns.
Flavor2:
"Other apertures were undoubtedly connected with bygone mechanical facilities - heating, lighting, and the like - of a sort suggested in many of the carvings. Ceilings tended to be plain, but had sometimes been inlaid with green soapstone or other tiles, mostly fallen now."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Limestone Caverns

Description: Hunter. Spawn – Location farthest from you on the outer ring. Prey – Nearest investigator with a seal only. Forced – When the enemy phase ends, if an investigator controls an activated seal: Protoplasmic Mass readies and resolves the enemy phase again (it resolves its hunter keyword and attacks a second time). (Limit once per phase.)
Name: Protoplasmic Mass

Description: Surge. Revelation – Each investigator at the same location as a seal takes 1 horror, and 1 damage if that seal is activated
Name: Electrostatic Discharge

Description2:
Spawn 1 set-aside copy of The Nameless Madness enemy at the Mist-Pylon nearest to an investigator.
Check the Campaign Log. If the truth of the mirage eludes you:
You stare, dumbstruck, at the hideous phantasmagoria. The air shimmers with a dreamlike quality about its damnable form, an endless weave of intermingled nightmare and memory. The very sight of it drives you to your knees. It is the final truth. Reality was the mirage.
Each investigator searches their deck for each copy of Tekeli-li and draws them one at a time in a random order, without placing them on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck. After resolving all of them, shuffle each of them back into their bearer’s deck.
Flavor: Miasma has completely consumed this part of the facility. The walls and ceiling drip with polychromatic ooze, polar mist swirls through the halls, and the air shimmers with the insubstantial quality of a mirage. What manner of power is this? And how can you possibly hope to destroy it?
Flavor2: From the nameless depths at the very core of the Earth, the miasma’s true form emerges. It is a shapeless thing, a creature of whirling mist and putrid ichor that screams and whispers and crawls and flies. It seeps through the walls and up from the ice; it is everywhere; it is everything.
Name: The Seal Weakens

Description: Forced – When 1 or more doom would be put into play, if there are any copies of The Nameless Madness still set aside: Instead, spawn 1 set-aside copy of The Nameless Madness at the location nearest to an investigator without a copy of that enemy that is connected to a location with a copy of that enemy. Objective – At the end of the round, if all 15 copies of The Nameless Madness are in play and not every Mist-Pylon is collapsed, advance this agenda.
Description2:
For each Mist-Pylon that is collapsed, set 3 copies of The Nameless Madness aside.
Each investigator loses all of their clues.
Remove each location except The Gate of Y’quaa from the game. Investigators and copies of The Nameless Madness are not defeated by this effect. All other cards at these locations are discarded.
Put the 4 set-aside Titanic Ramp locations into play in a straight line to the right of The Gate of Y’quaa. Put the set-aside Hidden Tunnel location into play to the right of the rightmost Titanic Ramp. Place each investigator and each remaining copy of The Nameless Madness in play at the leftmost Titanic Ramp.
Remove the act deck from the game and advance to the set-aside The Final Mirage. It is both the current act and the current agenda.
Flavor: Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li!
Flavor2: It is too late. You cannot contain the creature that dwells beneath the mountain. All you can hope to do now is escape with your lives.
Name: That Which Has No Name

Description: Each revealed Mist-Pylon can be attacked as if it were an enemy. Its fight value is equal to its shroud value and its health is equal to its clue value. While it has no health remaining, it is collapsed (it remains in play). [reaction] When you discover 1 or more clues at a Mist-Pylon, spend those clues: Deal that much damage to that Mist-Pylon. Objective – At the end of the round, if each Mist-Pylon is collapsed, advance this act.
Description2:
Set all but 3 copies of The Nameless Madness aside.
Each investigator loses all of their clues.
Remove each location except The Gate of Y’quaa from the game. Investigators and copies of The Nameless Madness are not defeated by this effect. All other cards at those locations are discarded.
Put the 4 set-aside Titanic Ramp locations into play in a straight line to the right of The Gate of Y’quaa. Put the set-aside Hidden Tunnel location into play to the right of the rightmost Titanic Ramp. Place each investigator and each remaining copy of The Nameless Madness in play at the leftmost Titanic Ramp.
Remove the agenda deck from the game and advance to the set-aside The Final Mirage. It is both the current act and the current agenda.
Flavor: Five pylons hold this facility together. Your only hope is to destroy them - and everything else.
Flavor2: The facility shakes to its very core. Without the Mist-Pylons powering the structure, the nameless entity that resides within is free - and its days are numbered, as are yours. The mountain groans and trembles, threatening to collapse all around you.
Name: Collapse the Pylons

Description: [fast] If you control the [seal_a] seal, and it is activated: You unleash the seal’s power. Place the [seal_a] seal on this Mist-Pylon. For the remainder of the game, each time you deal damage to a Mist-Pylon, deal 1 additional damage.
Description2: As an additional cost for you to enter Mist-Pylon, investigators at your location must spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.
Flavor2:
"In the whole spectacle there was a persistent, pervasive hint of stupendous secrecy and potential revelation; as if these stark, nightmare spires marked the pylons of a frightful gateway..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Mist-Pylon

Description: [fast] If you control the [seal_d] seal, and it is activated: You unleash the seal’s power. Place the [seal_d] seal on this Mist-Pylon. For the remainder of the game, reduce the shroud value of each Mist-Pylon by 2.
Description2: As an additional cost for you to enter Mist-Pylon, investigators at your location must spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.
Flavor2:
"In the whole spectacle there was a persistent, pervasive hint of stupendous secrecy and potential revelation; as if these stark, nightmare spires marked the pylons of a frightful gateway..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Mist-Pylon

Description: [fast] If you control the [seal_c] seal, and it is activated: You unleash the seal’s power. Place the [seal_c] seal on this Mist-Pylon. For the remainder of the game, each investigator gets +1 to each of their skills while they are at a Mist-Pylon.
Description2: As an additional cost for you to enter Mist-Pylon, investigators at your location must spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.
Flavor2:
"In the whole spectacle there was a persistent, pervasive hint of stupendous secrecy and potential revelation; as if these stark, nightmare spires marked the pylons of a frightful gateway..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Mist-Pylon

Description: [fast] If you control the [seal_e] seal, and it is activated: You unleash the seal’s power. Place the [seal_e] seal on this Mist-Pylon. For the remainder of the game, whenever an investigator at a Mist-Pylon would be dealt 1 or more damage and/or horror, cancel 1 of that damage or horror.
Description2: As an additional cost for you to enter Mist-Pylon, investigators at your location must spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.
Flavor2:
"In the whole spectacle there was a persistent, pervasive hint of stupendous secrecy and potential revelation; as if these stark, nightmare spires marked the pylons of a frightful gateway..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Mist-Pylon

Description: [fast] If you control the [seal_b] seal, and it is activated: You unleash the seal’s power. Place the [seal_b] seal on this Mist-Pylon. For the remainder of the game, each enemy gets –2 fight and –2 evade while it is at a Mist-Pylon.
Description2: As an additional cost for you to enter Mist-Pylon, investigators at your location must spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.
Flavor2:
"In the whole spectacle there was a persistent, pervasive hint of stupendous secrecy and potential revelation; as if these stark, nightmare spires marked the pylons of a frightful gateway..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Mist-Pylon

Description: Alert. Massive. Retaliate. The Nameless Madness cannot take damage. Forced – After you successfully evade or attack The Nameless Madness: For each point you succeeded by, exhaust the nearest ready copy of The Nameless Madness.
Name: The Nameless Madness

Description: Spawn – The nearest Mist-Pylon that is not collapsed (or your location, if there are none in play). While Unsealed Phantasm is ready and at a Mist-Pylon, damage cannot be dealt to that Mist-Pylon. Forced – At the end of the enemy phase, if Unsealed Phantasm is ready: Move it once toward the Mist-Pylon nearest to it that is not collapsed.
Name: Unsealed Phantasm

Description: The Nameless Madness gains hunter. Forced – When 1 or more doom would be put into play: Instead, spawn 1 set-aside copy of The Nameless Madness at the leftmost investigator’s location. Objective – Run.
Description2: Check the Campaign Log. - If all 5 Mist-Pylons were collapsed and Dr. Kensler has a plan, proceed to (→R1). - If all 5 Mist-Pylons were collapsed and the truth of the mirage eludes you, proceed to (→R2). - Otherwise, proceed to (→R3).
Flavor2: You emerge from the tunnel, daylight blinding you as the sun peeks out from behind the jagged mountaintops in the distance. Behind you, the entity rushes toward the exit. You prepare yourself for the end, the wall of mist, miasma, and madness feeling much like an oncoming train.
Name: The Final Mirage

Description:
Titanic Ramp is connected to the locations to its left and right.
As an additional cost for you to leave Titanic Ramp, test [agility] (4). If you fail, cancel the effects of the move. Any investigator at your location or a connecting location may spend 1 clue to have you automatically succeed at this test.
Description2: Titanic Ramp is connected to the locations to its left and right.
Flavor2:
"...over our former trail back to the city, along ice-sunken megalithic corridors to the great open circle, and up that archaic spiral ramp in a frenzied automatic plunge for the sane outer air and light of day."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Titanic Ramp

Description:
Titanic Ramp is connected to the locations to its left and right.
As an additional cost for you to leave Titanic Ramp, test [agility] (3). If you fail, cancel the effects of the move. Any investigator at your location or a connecting location may spend 1 clue to have you automatically succeed at this test.
Description2: Titanic Ramp is connected to the locations to its left and right.
Flavor2:
"...over our former trail back to the city, along ice-sunken megalithic corridors to the great open circle, and up that archaic spiral ramp in a frenzied automatic plunge for the sane outer air and light of day."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Titanic Ramp

Description:
Titanic Ramp is connected to the locations to its left and right.
As an additional cost for you to leave Titanic Ramp, test [agility] (2). If you fail, cancel the effects of the move. Any investigator at your location or a connecting location may spend 1 clue to have you automatically succeed at this test.
Description2: Titanic Ramp is connected to the locations to its left and right.
Flavor2:
"...over our former trail back to the city, along ice-sunken megalithic corridors to the great open circle, and up that archaic spiral ramp in a frenzied automatic plunge for the sane outer air and light of day."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Titanic Ramp

Description:
Titanic Ramp is connected to the locations to its left and right.
As an additional cost for you to leave Titanic Ramp, test [agility] (1). If you fail, cancel the effects of the move. Any investigator at your location or a connecting location may spend 1 clue to have you automatically succeed at this test.
Description2: Titanic Ramp is connected to the locations to its left and right.
Flavor2:
"...over our former trail back to the city, along ice-sunken megalithic corridors to the great open circle, and up that archaic spiral ramp in a frenzied automatic plunge for the sane outer air and light of day."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Titanic Ramp

Description: Hidden Tunnel is connected to the location to its left. Objective – If each undefeated investigator is at the Hidden Tunnel, advance the act.
Description2: Hidden Tunnel is connected to the location to its left.
Flavor:
"...not even the fear of collapse could make us pause before reaching the normal outer realm of sun and sky."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Flavor2:
"Thank heaven we did not slacken our run. The curling mist had thickened again, and was driving ahead with increased speed; whilst the straying penguins in our rear were squawking and screaming..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Hidden Tunnel

Description: Hunter. Retaliate. Forced – When you deal any amount of damage to Primordial Evil: Shuffle the top card of the Tekeli-li deck into your deck without looking at it (if you cannot, Primordial Evil attacks you).
Name: Primordial Evil

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (4). For each point you fail by, shuffle the top card of the Tekeli-li deck into your deck without looking at it (for each card you cannot shuffle, take 1 horror).
Name: The Madness Within

Description: Hunter. Forced – When Manifestation of Madness attacks you: Shuffle the top 2 cards of the Tekeli-li deck into your deck without looking at them (for each card you cannot shuffle, Manifestation of Madness deals +1 damage and +1 horror for this attack).
Name: Manifestation of Madness

Description: Forced – At the end of the enemy phase, if Glacial Phantasm is ready: Move it once toward the location with the most investigators. In player order, each investigator at Glacial Phantasm’s location or a connecting location shuffles the top card of the Tekeli-li deck into their deck without looking at it (each investigator who cannot takes 1 horror).
Name: Glacial Phantasm

Description: Revelation – Attach to the nearest location without a copy of Kindred Mist attached. Forced – When 1 or more cards from the Tekeli-li deck would be shuffled into your deck while you are at attached location: Draw them instead, placing them on the bottom of your deck instead of the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck. Discard Kindred Mist at the end of this round.
Name: Kindred Mist

Description: Revelation – Attach to the nearest location without a copy of Antarctic Wind attached. Investigators at attached location cannot play cards or draw cards from their deck. Forced – At the end of the round: Discard Antarctic Wind.
Name: Antarctic Wind

Description: Revelation – Attach to your location. Each investigator at attached location gets –1 [willpower], –1 [intellect], –1 [combat], and –1 [agility]. Forced – At the end of the round: Discard Whiteout.
Name: Whiteout

Description: Revelation – Attach to your location. Forced – When you end your turn at attached location: Each card you control with health (including your investigator) takes 1 direct damage. Forced – At the end of the round: Discard Polar Vortex.
Name: Polar Vortex

Description: Hunter. Forced – After Elder Thing Scavenger attacks you: Discard the top 3 cards of your deck. Draw each weakness discarded this way.
Flavor:
"Of the life of the Old Ones, both under the sea and after part of them migrated to land, volumes could be written."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Elder Thing Scavenger

Description: Hunter. Forced – When you deal damage to Guardian Elder Thing: For each point of damage dealt, discard the top card of your deck. Draw each weakness discarded this way.
Name: Guardian Elder Thing

Description: Revelation – Find the topmost [[Elder Thing]] enemy in the encounter discard pile and spawn it engaged with you. Each [[Elder Thing]] enemy currently engaged with you gets +1 fight and +1 evade until the end of the round. If Rise of the Elder Things put no enemies into play, it gains surge.
Name: Rise of the Elder Things

Description: Revelation – Test [agility] (3). For each [frost] token revealed during this test, take 1 damage. If you fail, take 2 damage.
Flavor: One false step...
Name: Ice Shaft

Description: Revelation – Attach to the nearest location without a copy of Through the Ice attached. As an additional cost for you to enter or leave attached location (except by a scenario card effect), test [agility] (2). If you fail, cancel the effects of the move, take 1 damage and 1 horror, and discard Through the Ice.
Name: Through the Ice

Description: Spawn – Any location (empty, if able). Lost Researcher enters play with 1 doom on it. Forced – When Lost Researcher is defeated: Move each doom on it to its location. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (3). If you succeed, take control of 1 doom on Lost Researcher and flip it to its clue side. Then, if there is no doom on Lost Researcher, discard it.
Name: Lost Researcher

Description: Frenzied Explorer enters play with 1 doom on it. Forced – When Frenzied Explorer is defeated: Move each doom on it to its location. [reaction] After you successfully evade Frenzied Explorer by 2 or more: Take control of 1 doom on Frenzied Explorer and flip it to its clue side. Then, if there is no doom on Frenzied Explorer, discard it.
Name: Frenzied Explorer

Description: Revelation – Attach to the nearest [[Possessed]] enemy and place 1 doom on that enemy. If there are no [[Possessed]] enemies in play, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Possessed]] enemy, draw it, and attach Abandoned to Madness to it (shuffle the encounter deck). Increase the difficulty to fight, evade, or parley with attached enemy by 1.
Name: Abandoned to Madness

Description: Revelation – Shuffle the top card of the Tekeli-li deck into your deck without looking at it. Then, put Blasphemous Visions into play in your threat area. Resolve the effects of each Tekeli-li weakness you draw an additional time. [action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Blasphemous Visions.
Name: Blasphemous Visions

Description: Peril. Revelation – Draw the top card of the Tekeli-li deck (and resolve its effects). Shuffle it into any investigator’s deck instead of placing it on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck. If no Tekeli-li weakness is drawn by this effect, Glimpse the Unspeakable gains surge.
Name: Glimpse the Unspeakable

Description: Peril. Revelation – You must either (choose one): - Lose 2 actions. - Shuffle the top 2 cards of the Tekeli-li deck into your deck without looking at them.
Name: Nightmarish Vapors

Description: Revelation – If you control a partner asset, exhaust them and attach Miasmatic Torment to them. Otherwise, Miasmatic Torment gains surge. Attached asset cannot ready. Forced – At the end of your turn: Attached asset takes 1 damage or 1 horror. [action]: Test [willpower] or [intellect] (3). If you succeed, discard Miasmatic Torment.
Name: Miasmatic Torment

Description: Revelation – Attach to your location. Forced – When you end your turn at attached location: Each card you control with sanity (including your investigator) takes 1 direct horror. Forced – At the end of the round: Discard Nebulous Miasma.
Name: Nebulous Miasma

Description:
Aloof.
As an additional cost for you to enter or leave this enemy’s location, you must spend 1 action.
Flavor:
"...it was only a penguin - albeit of a huge, unknown species larger than the greatest of the known king penguins, and monstrous in its combined albinism and virtual eyelessness."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Giant Albino Penguin

Description: Revelation – Find the Giant Albino Penguin enemy farthest from you. You must either move it to your location or place 1 doom on it. If there are no Giant Albino Penguins in play, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Giant Albino Penguin, draw it, and shuffle the encounter deck.
Name: Wuk! Wuk! Wuk!

Description: Hunter. Forced – After Forgotten Shoggoth engages you: Draw the top card of the Tekeli-li deck (if you cannot, Forgotten Shoggoth attacks you).
Flavor:
"...shoggoths and their work ought not to be seen by human beings or portrayed by any beings."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Forgotten Shoggoth

Description: Hunter. Massive. Rampaging Shoggoth gets +2 [per_investigator] health. Forced – At the end of the enemy phase: Deal 2 damage to each investigator and non-[[Shoggoth]] enemy at Rampaging Shoggoth’s location. Each of those investigators draws the top card of the Tekeli-li deck.
Name: Rampaging Shoggoth

Description: Revelation – Attach to the nearest location with at least 1 clue, and without a copy of Polar Mirage attached. Forced – After you discover or take control of 1 or more clues at attached location: Discard each non-weakness card in your hand. Discard Polar Mirage.
Name: Polar Mirage

Description: Revelation – Test [willpower] (3). For each [frost] token revealed during this test, take 1 horror. If you fail, take 2 horror.
Flavor:
"The phosphorescent organisms supplied light with vast effectiveness, and doubtless atoned for the loss of the familiar polar auroras of the outer-world night."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
Name: Dark Aurora

Description:
Partner. Uses (3 secrets).
[action] Spend 1 secret and exhaust Professor William Dyer: Heal 2 horror from an investigator or another [[Ally]] asset at your location.
Flavor: "Doubt of the real facts, as I must reveal them, is inevitable." - H.P. Lovecraft, At the Mountains of Madness
Name: Professor William Dyer

Description:
Partner. Uses (5 secrets).
[reaction] After an investigator at your location resolves a Tekeli-li weakness, exhaust Danforth and spend 1 secret: That investigator draws 2 cards.
Flavor: "Danforth was a great reader of bizarre material..." - H.P. Lovecraft, At the Mountains of Madness
Name: Danforth

Description: Partner. Uses (3 secrets). [action] Spend 1 secret and exhaust Eliyah Ashevak: Evade. Attempt to evade with a base [agility] skill of 5. If you succeed, you may move to a connecting location.
Flavor: "Anyu's got the scent. Haven't you, girl?"
Name: Eliyah Ashevak

Description:
Partner. Uses (3 supplies).
[action] Spend 1 supply and exhaust Dr. Mala Sinha: Heal 2 damage from an investigator or another [[Ally]] asset at your location.
Flavor: "Want to survive the trip? Good. Then don't get on my bad side."
Name: Dr. Mala Sinha

Description:
Partner. Uses (5 supplies).
[reaction] When an investigator at your location reveals a [frost] token during a skill test, exhaust Avery Claypool and spend 1 supply: Cancel that token and reveal a new one.
Flavor: "Weather is turning foul again. I would tell you to turn back, but I gather you would refuse - right?"
Name: Avery Claypool

Description: Partner. Uses (3 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo and exhaust James "Cookie" Fredericks: Fight. Fight with a base [combat] skill of 5. If you succceed and the attacked enemy is non-[[Elite]], it cannot attack for the remainder of the round.
Flavor: "No I ain't leavin' my damn gun back at camp!"
Name: James "Cookie" Fredericks

Description: Partner. Uses (3 secrets). [action] Spend 1 secret and exhaust Dr. Amy Kensler: Investigate. Investigate with a base [intellect] skill of 5. If you succceed, look at the top card of any investigator's deck or the encounter deck. You may discard that card.
Flavor: "All of this is so fascinating! Do you not agree?"
Name: Dr. Amy Kensler

Description:
Partner. Uses (5 supplies).
[fast] During an investigator's turn, exhaust Roald Ellsworth and spend 1 supply: Choose a treachery attached to any location. Treat that treachery's text box as if it were blank until the end of this turn.
Flavor: "I have been all over the world. Please, just trust me."
Name: Roald Ellsworth

Description:
Partner. Uses (9 resources).
[action] Exhaust Takada Hiroko: Move up to 3 resources from Takada Hiroko to your resource pool.
Flavor: "Nobody knows these machines better than I do."
Name: Takada Hiroko

Description: Revelation - Take 1 horror. Place Tekeli-li on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck.
Flavor:
"Still came that eldritch, mocking cry - 'Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li!'"
 - H.P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness.</u>
Name: Tekeli-li

Description: Revelation - Take 1 damage. Place Tekeli-li on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck.
Flavor:
"Still came that eldritch, mocking cry - 'Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li!'"
 - H.P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness.</u>
Name: Tekeli-li

Description: Revelation - Discard 1 card at random from your hand. Place Tekeli-li on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck.
Flavor:
"Still came that eldritch, mocking cry - 'Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li!'"
 - H.P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness.</u>
Name: Tekeli-li

Description: Revelation - Lose 2 resources. Place Tekeli-li on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck.
Flavor:
"Still came that eldritch, mocking cry - 'Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li!'"
 - H.P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness.</u>
Name: Tekeli-li

Description: Revelation - If it is your turn, lose 1 action. Otherwise, lose 1 action during your next turn. Place Tekeli-li on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck.
Flavor:
"Still came that eldritch, mocking cry - 'Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li!'"
 - H.P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness.</u>
Name: Tekeli-li

Description: Revelation - Place 1 of your clues on your location. Place Tekeli-li on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck.
Flavor:
"Still came that eldritch, mocking cry - 'Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li!'"
 - H.P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness.</u>
Name: Tekeli-li

Description: Revelation - Discard an asset you control. Place Tekeli-li on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck.
Flavor:
"Still came that eldritch, mocking cry - 'Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li!'"
 - H.P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness.</u>
Name: Tekeli-li

Description:
Fast.
[reaction] When you reveal a [frost] token during a skill test you are performing, deal 1 damage to Claypool's Furs: Cancel that chaos token and return it to the bag. Reveal a new chaos token.
Name: Claypool's Furs

Description:
Uses (3 charges).
[action] Spend 1 charge: Choose an investigator at your location to search the top 6 cards of their deck for each copy of Tekeli-li and place each of them on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck. Shuffle that investigator's deck. That investigator draws 1 card.
Name: Collected Works of Poe

Description: Fast. Uses (2 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. Either fight with a base [combat] skill of 5, or get +2 [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage.
Name: Cookie's Custom .32

Description:
Fast. Play during any [fast] window.
Draw 3 cards.
Flavor: Professor Dyer kept many sketches depicting the creatures he encountered.
Name: Dyer's Sketches

Description:
Limit 1 [[Footwear]] per investigator.
[reaction] After the last clue is discovered from your location, exhaust Ellsworth's Boots: Move to a connecting location, or discard Ellsworth's Boots to move to any revealed location.
Name: Ellsworth's Boots

Description: Fast. Uses (2 secrets). [action] Spend 1 secret: Investigate. Either investigate with a base [intellect] skill of 5, or get +2 [intellect] for this investigation. If you succeed, you discover 1 additional clue at your location.
Name: Kensler's Log

Description:
Uses (3 supplies).
[fast] Exhaust Sinha's Medical Kit and spend 1 supply: Heal 1 damage or 1 horror from an investigator or [[Ally]] asset at your location.
Name: Sinha's Medical Kit

Description:
Fast. Play during any [fast] window.
Gain 3 resources and draw 1 card. Remove Takada's Cache from the game.
Flavor: Takada left these spare supplies behind. Maybe you can make use of them.
Name: Takada's Cache

Description: [fast] Exhaust Anyu: Choose one, or discard Anyu to choose up to three, in any order - - Move to a connecting location. - You get +2 skill value for your next skill test this round. - Evade. Attempt to evade with a base [agility] skill of 4.
Name: Anyu

Description:
Add Tidal Memento to your deck.
[reaction] After you successfully evade a non-[[Elite]] enemy: Seal either 1 [bless] or [curse] token from the chaos bag, or any [bless] or [curse] tokens revealed from the chaos bag during this test, on that enemy.
[elder_sign] effect: +2. Search the chaos bag for up to 2 [bless] and/or [curse] tokens and reveal them, ignoring their effects.
Description2: Deck Size: 30. [[Trait]] Choice: At deck creation, choose [[Blessed]] or [[Cursed]], or choose both and gain +5 Deck Size. Deckbuilding Options: Survivor cards ([survivor]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, cards of your chosen trait(s) 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Wendy's Amulet, Abandoned and Alone, 1 random basic weakness.
Flavor: "The little things are important. Grown-ups don't see that."
Flavor2: Mama used to let Wendy play with her necklace when she was small. Mama would tell her stories, and Wendy would spin the necklace and watch as it glittered. Then, word came that her father had been lost at sea, and Mama started acting strange, drawing unusual symbols in chalk all over the house. They took Mama to the asylum, and Wendy went to the orphanage. Before they took her away, Mama gave her the necklace, to "protect her." Wendy stayed in the orphanage for several years before running away, deciding that she could take better care of herself on her own.
Name: Wendy Adams

Description:
Wendy Adams deck only. Permanent.
[reaction] When an enemy would ready or doom would be placed on it, release a [bless] or [curse] token sealed on that enemy: Cancel that effect.
[reaction] During a skill test you are performing, when a chaos token would be revealed from the chaos bag: Resolve a [bless] or [curse] token sealed on an enemy instead.
Name: Tidal Memento

Description: Wendy Adams deck only. Advanced. You may play any event in your discard pile as if it were in your hand. Forced - After you play an event or discard an event from play: Place it on the bottom of your deck instead of in your discard pile.
Name: Wendy's Amulet

Description: Advanced. Revelation - Remove all non-weakness cards in your discard pile from the game. If no cards were removed by this effect, shuffle this card back into your deck. Otherwise, take 3 direct horror.
Flavor: I don't need them. I don't need anyone.
Name: Abandoned and Alone

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is half the number of [[Suspect]] and [[Hideout]] cards in the victory display (rounded up).
[cultist]: -2. (-4 instead if you are parleying with a [[Suspect]] enemy or investigating a [[Hideout]] location).
[tablet]: -3. If you succeed, look at the top card of the Leads deck. You may choose to shuffle the Leads deck.
[elder_thing]: -1. If you fail, shuffle the top card of the encounter deck into the Leads deck.
Description2:
Hard / Expert
skull]: -X. X is the number of [[Suspect]] and [[Hideout]] cards in the victory display.
[cultist]: -3. (-5 instead if you are parleying with a [[Suspect]] enemy or investigating a [[Hideout]] location).
[tablet]: -4. If you succeed, look at the top card of the Leads deck. You may choose to shuffle the Leads deck.
[elder_thing]: -2. If you fail, shuffle the top card of the encounter deck into the Leads deck.
Name: Red Tide Rising

Description: Forced - When this agenda would advance by reaching its doom threshold: Instead, remove all doom in play and shuffle a random set-aside [[Monster]] enemy into the [[Leads]] deck. Then, if there are no set-aside [[Monster]] enemies, advance to agenda 1b.
Description2:
Spawn the set-aside Angry Mob enemy at Innsmouth Square, exhausted.
Place 1 [per_investigator] clues on each [[Suspect]] enemy and [[Hideout]] location in play.
Flavor: You arrive in Innsmouth and immediately set to work asking the townspeople if they’ve seen your Dad, the place in the photograph, or the man in the derby who dropped off the photo.
Flavor2: You’re used to people turning you down and pushing you away, but for some reason, the locals here are even more upset at your prying questions than you could have expected. The last person you speak to is a man who reeks of fish, with pale, sickly skin and strange ridges across his neck. Next thing you know, you are being followed everywhere you go, and the lot of them don’t look all too friendly.
Name: The New Girl

Description:
Angry Mob cannot be defeated.
[reaction] After Wendy Adams evades Angry Mob: She may discover 1 clue from its location.
Each [[Suspect]] enemy loses aloof and enters play with +1 [per_investigator] clues.
Each [[Hideout]] location gets +1 [per_investigator] clue value.
Flavor: The longer you stick around and the more questions you ask, the more danger seeks you out. The locals eye you with anger and suspicion, and worse: strange winged creatures prowl about the rooftops, searching for prey...
Flavor2: You hide behind a sour-smelling pile of trash and wait for the pounding of heavy steps as the mob searches relentlessly for you. You don’t know why they’re after you—you were only asking questions!—but it’s clear you can’t stay here any longer. In Arkham, everyone’s gaze passes right over street urchins like you. Suddenly, you wish that were the case here, too.
Name: Trail Goes Cold

Description: [[Suspect]] and [[Hideout]] cards cannot be added to the victory display except using Mysterious Photo. Forced – If there are no [[Suspect]] or [[Hideout]] cards in play: Wendy Adams must draw cards from the top of the Leads deck until she draws a [[Suspect]] or [[Hideout]] card. Objective – Search for Dad using Mysterious Photo. The fewer cards that remain in the Leads deck, the better. If it is empty, advance.
Flavor: To say that this town is less friendly than even Arkham would be an understatement.
Flavor2:
It’s no use. Maybe Dad was in Innsmouth at some point, but he’s long gone now. And the townsfolk here don’t seem too keen on anybody asking about him. Might be they know more than they’re letting on, or it might just be they’re protecting other, unrelated secrets. Either way, it’s no longer safe to stick around.
But just as you are ready to give up and head back to the bus stop to return to Arkham, you spot a man in a familiar outfit: a long wool coat and a brown derby.
Name: Searching for Dad

Description: [fast] Exhaust Mysterious Photo: Either take a parley action on a [[Suspect]] enemy or flip Mysterious Photo over. [fast] If there is a [[Suspect]] enemy with no clues on it at your location, investigators at your location spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group (2 [per_investigator] clues instead if it is agenda 2): “Have you seen my dad?” Add that enemy to the victory display.
Name: Mysterious Photo

Description: [fast] Exhaust Nikola Tesla: Parley. Test [intellect] (1). If you succeed, either gain 1 clue (from the token pool), draw 2 cards, or gain 3 resources. (Max once per game per option.)
Flavor: The high-voltage demonstrations performed by Tesla throughout America and Europe were truly awe-inspiring.
Name: Nikola Tesla

Description:
[fast] During any investigator's turn, exhaust Ezra Graves and spend 1 resource: Immediately take an action as if it were your turn.
[action]: Choose an [[Ally]] asset in your discard pile and put it into play under your control (Max once per game.)
Name: Ezra Graves

Description:
Uses (2 charges).
[fast] During your turn, exhaust Dimensional Beam Machine and spend 1 charge: Move an investigator or a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location to any revealed location.
Name: Dimensional Beam Machine

Description:
Easy / Standard - Act 1
[skull]: -X. X is your location's column number.
[cultist]: -1. Place 1 resource on this card, as a scrap.
[tablet]: -2. If you fail, remove 1 scrap from this card.
[elder_thing]: -5. Remove 1 switch from this card.
Description2:
Easy / Standard - Act 2
[skull]: -X. X is your location's column number.
[cultist]: -2. Place 1 resource on this card, as a switch.
