[tablet]: -3. If you fail, move the Mine cart once.
[elder_thing]: -4. If you fail, remove 1 switch from this card.
Name: Written in Rock

Description:
Hard / Expert - Act 1
[skull]: -X. X is twice your location's column number.
[cultist]: -3. If you succeed, place 1 resource on this card, as a scrap.
[tablet]: -4. Remove 1 scrap from this card.
[elder_thing]: -5. Take 1 damage.
Description2:
Hard / Expert - Act 2
[skull]: -X. X is twice your location's column number.
[cultist]: -3. If you succeed, place 1 resource on this card, as a switch.
[tablet]: -4. Move the Mine Cart once.
[elder_thing]: -5. Take 1 damage.
Name: Written in Rock

Description:
Uses (4 brilliance).
[reaction] When a scenario card effect would discard any number of cards from your hand, exhaust Prismatic Shard and spend 1 brilliance: Ignore that effect and draw that many cards, instead.
Name: Prismatic Shard

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is your current floor number (to a minimum of 1).
[cultist]: -1. If your location is an enemy, exhaust it.
[tablet]: -3. If you fail, heal 1 damage from the nearest enemy-location.
[elder_thing]: -4. If you fail, and it is agenda 2a or 3a, after this test resolves, remove this token from the chaos bag and add it to the predation bag.
Description2:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is twice your current floor number (to a minimum of 2).
[cultist]: -2. If you succeed and your location is an enemy, exhaust it.
[tablet]: -4. If you fail, heal 1[per_investigator] damage from the nearest enemy-location.
[elder_thing]: -5. If it is agenda 2a or 3a, after this test resolves, remove this token from the chaos bag and add it to the predation bag.
Name: Hemlock House

Description:
East / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is half the number of revealed [[Cave]] locations in play (rounded up).
[cultist]: -1. If you succeed, heal 1 horror.
[tablet]: -2. If you are at a [[Cave]] location, treat this token's modifier as -4 instead.
[elder_thing]: -2. If an [[Abomination]] enemy is at your location, reveal another token.
Description2:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X the number of revealed [[Cave]] locations in play.
[cultist]: -1. If you succeed by 2 or more, heal 1 horror.
[tablet]: -4. If you are at a [[Cave]] location, treat this token's modifier as -6 instead.
[elder_thing]: -3. If an [[Abomination]] enemy is at your location, this test automatically fails instead.
Name: The Lost Sister

Description: [reaction] When Little Sylvie is discarded from your hand or deck: Play it (paying its cost). [reaction] When a scenario card effect would discard a card from your hand or deck, exhaust Little Sylvie: Place that card on top of your deck, instead.
Name: Little Sylvie

Description:
East / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is half the number of [[Insect]] enemies in play and in the victory display (rounded up).
[cultist]: -1. You may shuffle a non-[[Elite]] enemy in the victory display into the encounter deck.
[tablet]: -3. If you fail, choose an [[Insect]] enemy at your location. It engages you and makes an immediate attack.
[elder_thing]: -2. If you are a [[Lair]] location, reveal another token.
Description2:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X the number of [[Insect]] enemies in play and in the victory display.
[cultist]: -3. If you succeed, you may shuffle a non-[[Elite]] enemy in the victory display into the encounter deck.
[tablet]: -5. Ready the nearest [[Insect]] enemy. It moves and attacks as if it were the enemy phase.
[elder_thing]: -4. If you are a [[Lair]] location, you automatically fail.
Name: The Silent Heath

Description:
East / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is half the number of [[Sunken]] locations in play (rounded up).
[cultist]: -1. You may remove 1 sinkhole from the nearest [[Bog]] location.
[tablet]: -3. If you fail, place 1 damage on the nearest [[Bog]] location, as a sinkhole.
[elder_thing]: -4. If you fail, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Grasping Tendril enemy and draw it, ignoring its surge keyword.
Description2:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X the number of [[Sunken]] locations in play (rounded up).
[cultist]: -3. If you succeed, you may remove 1 sinkhole from the nearest [[Bog]] location.
[tablet]: -5. Place 1 damage on the nearest [[Bog]] location, as a sinkhole.
[elder_thing]: -5. Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Grasping Tendril enemy and draw it, ignoring its surge keyword.
Name: The Thing in the Depths

Description:
East / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the current darkness level.
[cultist]: -1. Heal 1 damage from your investigator.
[tablet]: -3. If you fail, find the enemy in pursuit with the highest evade. Spawn it at your location.
[elder_thing]: -4. If you fail, take 1 horror.
Description2:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is twice the current darkness level.
[cultist]: -3. If you succeed, heal 1 damage from your investigator.
[tablet]: -4. Find the enemy in pursuit with the highest evade. Spawn it at your location.
[elder_thing]: -5. Take 1 horror.
Name: The Twisted Hollow

Description:
East / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is half the number of doom in play (rounded up).
[cultist]: -2. Place 1 barrier at your location.
[tablet]: -1. Reveal another token. If you fail, the nearest enemy readies, moves, and attacks as if it were the enemy phase.
[elder_thing]: -4. If you fail, remove 1 barrier, decoy, or trap at your location.
Description2:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is the number of doom in play.
[cultist]: -3. If you succeed, place 1 barrier at your location.
[tablet]: -4. The nearest enemy readies, moves, and attacks as if it were the enemy phase.
[elder_thing]: -5. Remove a barrier, decoy, or trap at your location.
Name: The Longest Night

Description:
Your first action each round does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
[action] Exhaust Ajax: Move. Either move twice, or choose any [[Field]] location and move to it.
[action] If Ajax is at your location: Take control of him. Any player at Ajax's location may trigger this ability.
Name: Ajax

Description:
East / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is 1 more than the current act number.
[cultist]: -4. If you fail, discard 1 card at random from your hand.
[tablet]: -5. You may place 1 doom on your investigator card to treat this token's modifier as 0, instead.
[elder_thing]: -2. If this is a fight or evasion attempt against a Cosmic Emissary, reveal another token.
Description2:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is the number of [[Colour]] enemies in play.
[cultist]: -6. Discard 1 card at random from your hand.
[tablet]: -8. You may place 1 doom on your investigator card to treat this token's modifier as -3, instead.
[elder_thing]: -5. If this is a fight or evasion attempt against a Cosmic Emissary, you automatically fail instead.
Name: Fate of the Vale

Description: Massive. Cannot make attacks of opportunity. Forced – When you successfully fight or evade this enemy: Instead of damaging or exhausting it, this enemy does not attack during the enemy phase this round.
Name: Cosmic Emissary

Description: Massive. Retaliate. Cannot make attacks of opportunity. Forced – When you successfully fight or evade this enemy: Instead of damaging or exhausting it, this enemy does not attack during the enemy phase this round.
Name: Cosmic Emissary

Description: Massive. Alert. Cannot make attacks of opportunity. Forced – When you successfully fight or evade this enemy: Instead of damaging or exhausting it, this enemy does not attack during the enemy phase this round.
Name: Cosmic Emissary

Description: Massive. Cannot make attacks of opportunity. Forced – When you successfully fight or evade this enemy: Instead of damaging or exhausting it, this enemy does not attack during the enemy phase this round.
Name: Cosmic Emissary

Description: This skill's icons subtract from your skill value instead of adding to it. If this skill test fails, discard each card in your hand. Forced - At the end of your turn, if The Hemlock Curse is in your hand: Discard 1 card at random from your hand.
Name: The Hemlock Curse

Description: While you control Mother Rachel, you have 1 additional arcane slot. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower](2). If you succeed, ([codex] 1). Forced - After Mother Rachel is defeated: Set her aside, out of play. In your Campaign Log, decrease her Relationship Level.
Name: Mother Rachel

Description: While you control Leah Atwood, you get +1 [combat]. [action]: Parley. Test [combat](2). If you succeed, ([codex] 2). Forced - After Leah Atwood is defeated. Set her aside, out of play. In your Campaign Log, decrease her Relationship Level.
Name: Leah Atwood

Description: While you control Simeon Atwood, you get +1 [agility]. [action]: Parley. Test [agility](2). If you succeed, ([codex] 3). Forced - After Simeon Atwood is defeated: Set him aside, out of play. In your Campaign Log, decrease his Relationship Level.
Name: Simeon Atwood

Description: While you control William Hemlock, you get +1 [intellect]. [action]: Parley. Test [intellect](2). If you succeed, ([codex] 4). Forced - After William Hemlock is defeated. Set him aside, out of play. In your Campaign Log, decrease his Relationship Level.
Name: William Hemlock
River Hawthorne

Description: While you control Gideon Mizrah, you have 1 additional accessory slot. [action] [action]: Parley. ([codex] 6). Forced - After Gideon Mizrah is defeated: Set him aside, out of play. In your Campaign Log, decrease his Relationship Level.
Name: Gideon Mizrah

Description: While you control Judith Park, you may take an additional action during your turn, which can only be used to fight. [action] Spend X resources, where X is the current day number: Parley. ([codex] 7). Forced - After Judith Park is defeated: Set her aside, out of play. In your Campaign Log, decrease her Relationship Level.
Name: Judith Park

Description: While you control Theo Peters, you may take an additional action during your turn, which can only be used to move. [action] Choose and discard X cards from your hand, where X is the current day number: Parley. ([codex] 8). Forced - After Theo Peters is defeated: Set him aside, out of play. In your Campaign Log, decrease his Relationship Level.
Name: Theo Peters

Description: While you control Bertie Musgrave, you get +1 health and + 1 sanity [fast] Take either 1 damage or 1 horror and exhaust Bertie Musgrave: Parley. Draw 1 card ([codex] Ω). Forced - After Bertie Musgrave is defeated: Set him aside, out of play.
Name: Bertie Musgrave

Description: While you control Dr. Rosa Marquez, you get +1 [intellect] and +1 [agility]. [reaction] After you discover the last clue at your location ([codex] Ω).
Flavor: "If it's survival of the fittest, I intend to survive."
Name: Dr. Rosa Marquez

Description: (Day [day]) you get +1 [combat]. (Night [night]) you get +1 [agility]. [reaction] After you enter a location, exhaust Helen Peters and deal 1 damage to her: Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location and automatically evade it.
Flavor: "Change is inevitable. The question is how we weather it."
Name: Helen Peters

Description:
East / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the current day number.
[cultist]: +1. If this is a parley attempt, you automatically succeed.
[tablet]: -2. If you have fewer than 3 cards in hand, treat this token's modifier as 0 instead.
[elder_thing]: -1. If this is a parley attempt, reveal another token.
Description2:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is 1 more than the current day number.
[cultist]: -1. If this is a parley attempt, treat this token's modifier as a +1, instead.
[tablet]: -4. If you have fewer than 2 cards in hand, treat this token's modifier as -2 instead.
[elder_thing]: -3. If this is a parley attempt, reveal another token.
Name: The Vale

Description:
Fast.
[reaction] When a scenario card effect discards Worry Rock from your hand: Draw 3 cards. (Limit once per game.)
Flavor: The stone is worn and smooth.
Name: Worry Rock

Description:
Fast. Uses (3 wishes).
[reaction] When a [skull] or [tablet] token is revealed at your location, spend 1 wish and exhaust Corn Husk Doll: Treat that token as a [cultist] token instead.
Flavor: A traditional Abenaki doll made to look like Mother Rachel.
Name: Corn Husk Doll

Description: (Day [day]) You get +1 [intellect]. (Night [night]) You get +1 [willpower]. [reaction] After an investigator at your location draws a [[Blight]] or [[Power]] card from the encounter deck, exhaust The Pearl Diary: That investigator draws 1 card.
Name: The Pearl Diary

Description:
You may take an additional action during your turn, which can only be used on the below [action] ability.
[action]: Choose another investigator at your location. They immediately take an action as if it were their turn. (Limit once per round for each investigator.)
[elder_sign] effect: +0. Draw 1 card. You may resolve this effect anytime another investigator at your location resolves their [elder_sign] effect.
Description2: Deck Size: 30. Secondary Class Choice: At deck creation, choose Seeker ([seeker]), Mystic ([mystic]), or Survivor ([survivor]). Deckbuilding Options: Guardian cards ([guardian]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to 10 level 0-1 events and/or skills of your chosen secondary class. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): 2 copies of "As you wish", Selfless to a Fault, 1 random basic weakness.
Flavor2: Carson Sinclair has served three generations of the Webb family in Arkham. Always proper, Carson watched with disapproval as his most recent employer, Hercule Webb, began bringing bizarre artifacts and profane tomes into the house, aided in these endeavors by Webb's business manager, Dupuis. When Mr. Webb was swallowed by a dimensional rift, no one believed Carson's description of the harrowing event. Carson has devoted himself to proving Dupuis's guilt, and to restoring the children as the rightful heirs to the Webb fortune.
Name: Carson Sinclair

Description:
Carson Sinclair deck only.
Commit only to a skill test being performed by another investigator.
If this test succeeds, the performing investigator draws 1 card. If this test fails, you draw 1 card.
Name: "As you wish"

Description: Revelation - Put Selfless to a Fault into play in your threat area. Forced - At the end of your turn, if you did not commit at least 1 card to a skill test performed by another investigator this turn: Take 1 horror and shuffle Selfless to a Fault into your deck.
Name: Selfless to a Fault

Description:
[reaction] After one of your card effects heals damage from an investigator or an investigator's [[Ally]] asset: Add one of your set-aside On the Mend skills to that investigator's hand.
[elder_sign] effect: +1. You may heal 1 damage from an investigator or [[Ally]] asset at your location.
Description2: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0-3, Neutral cards level 0-5, cards that "heal damage" level 0-5, up to 15 other Guardian and/or Survivor cards level 0-1 ([guardian] and/or [survivor]). Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Bonesaw, 1 [per_investigator] copies of On the Mend, Wounded Bystander, 1 random basic weakness. Additional Setup: You begin each game with 1 [per_investigator] copies of On the Mend set aside, out of play.
Flavor: "I will find the answers, even if it kills me."
Flavor2: After the third or fourth mutilated body showed up during his time at St. Mary’s Hospital in Arkham, Vincent Lee began to suspect that these were not mere wild animal attacks. When a young man died screaming in his sleep from a burst heart, Vincent knew for a fact that dark times were ahead. Taking a leave of absence from his position at the hospital, he has set out to ease the suffering of those afflicted by the spreading chaos, hoping that the trail of bodies will lead him to the answers he craves.
Name: Vincent Lee

Description: Vincent Lee deck only. [action]: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. If this attack is successful, you may take 1 damage to deal +1 damage for this attack. [action]: Heal 5 damage from an investigator at your location. Test [intellect] (4). If you fail, that investigator suffers 1 physical trauma. (Max once per game.)
Name: Bonesaw

Description: Limit 1 On the Mend in your hand. Commit only to a test you are performing. Forced - When On the Mend would be discarded from anywhere: Set it aside, out of play, instead.
Name: On the Mend

Description: Revelation - Put Wounded Bystander into play in your play area with 3 damage on it. It cannot leave play while it has damage (unless it is defeated). If it has no damage, discard it. Forced - When you take non-direct damage: At least 1 of it must be assigned to Wounded Bystander, if able. Forced - If Wounded Bystander is defeated: You suffer 1 mental trauma.
Name: Wounded Bystander

Description:
[fast]: Engage an exhausted enemy at your location.
[reaction] When you attempt to evade an exhausted non-[[Elite]] enemy: Add your [intellect] to your skill value for this attempt. If you succeed by at least X, discard that enemy. X is that enemy's remaining health.
[elder_sign] effect: +1. If there is an exhausted enemy at your location, you automatically succeed instead.
Description2: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Rogue cards ([rogue]) level 0-5, [[Tool]] cards level 0-4, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Grappling Hook, Agent Fletcher, 1 random basic weakness. Bonus Experience: You begin the campaign with 5 additional experience (does not affect the number of weaknesses you must take in Standalone Mode).
Flavor: "This doesn't belong to you."
Flavor2: When the Taíno artifacts went missing from the Miskatonic Museum, Kymani was hired to assess the museum's liability. Of course, Kymani already knew who the thief was - it has been their own heist, all along. But Kymani had no interest in selling the relics. As far as Kymani was concerned, they weren't the one who really stole them. No; Kymani had sent the historical artifacts back home, where they truly belonged. The museum and the insurance company see only a villain to catch, but Kymani is faster, smarter, and better.
Name: Kymani Jones

Description:
Kymani Jones deck only.
Actions performed using Grappling Hook do not provoke attacks of opportunity.
[action][action] Exhaust Grappling Hook: Take up to 3 different basic actions from the following list, in any order (engage, evade, investigate, or move). If you investigate, use your [agility] instead of your [intellect].
Name: Grappling Hook

Description: Alert. Hunter. Prey - Kymani Jones only. While Kymani Jones is evading Agent Fletcher, reduce their [intellect] value to 0.
Flavor: "I know who you really are, Jones."
Name: Agent Fletcher

Description:
[reaction] When you play an asset: Reduce its resource cost by 3. It enters play with 1 doom on it. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] effect: +2. You may move all doom from a card at your location to another card at your location.
Description2: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, [[Charm]] cards level 0-4. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Word of Woe, Word of Weal, Deafening Silence, 1 random basic weakness.
Flavor: "What is it trying to tell me?"
Flavor2: A refugee from French-occupied Algeria, Amina arrived in Arkham with nothing more than she could carry. Six years later, Amina's sharp mind and technical skill placed her at the switchboard for the Miskatonic Valley Telephone Company. Soon after, she began to catch snippets of something strange while at work - distorted words in an unrecognizable language, out-of-place noises, calls that connected to nowhere at all and dropped almost immediately. As the phantom calls grew in frequency, Amina sought answers. She found the right extension, connected to the line, and listened in. Despite not understanding a word of the alien language on the other side, she could tell the eldritch words held real power.
Name: Amina Zidane

Description: Amina Zidane deck only. Fast. Play only during your turn. Place 1 doom on an asset you control to resolve an [action] ability on it, ignoring all costs (including its [action] cost). Then, if Word of Weal is in your discard pile, you may shuffle it into your deck.
Name: Word of Woe

Description:
Amina Zidane deck only.
Fast. Play when you perform a skill test on an asset with 1 or more doom on it.
Add your [willpower] to your skill value for this test. Then, if Word of Woe is in your discard pile, you may shuffle it into your deck.
Name: Word of Weal

Description: Revelation - Move 1 doom from an asset you control to the current agenda. This may cause the current agenda to advance. If no doom is moved in this way, shuffle Deafening Silence back into your deck.
Flavor: "UNINTELLIGIBLE SQUIGGLES"
Name: Deafening Silence

Description:
You begin the game with Darrell's Kodak in play.
[fast] During a skill test at your location, spend 1 evidence from an asset you control: Reduce the difficulty of this test by 2. (Limit once per test.)
[elder_sign] effect: +1. Place 1 evidence on an asset you control.
Description2: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Survivor cards ([survivor]) level 0-5, Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0-2, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Darrell's Kodak, Ruined Film, 1 random basic weakness.
Flavor: "The truth is darker than any of us know."
Flavor2: Even while growing up in Arkham, Darrell always knew that there was something not quite right about the strange little town. After graduating from high school, he went to work for the Arkham Advertiser as a photographer, and in the years since, he's scoured every inch of the city. But on one fateful night, he saw something truly indescribable - a horror that shook his world to the core. His editor says he was just seeing things, but he knows the truth. With his trusty camera in tow, he will not rest until he has captured photographic evidence of the horrors that dwell in the shadows of his hometown and beyond. Just one good shot is all he needs.
Name: Darrell Simmons

Description: Darrell Simmons deck only. [reaction] After an enemy or treachery enters play, exhaust Darrell's Kodak: Place 1 resource (from the token pool) on that enemy or treachery, as evidence. [reaction] After you discover any number of clues: Move that many evidence on enemies or treacheries at that location (or not at any location) to Darrell's Kodak.
Name: Darrell's Kodak

Description: Revelation - Remove 4 evidence from cards you control. For each evidence you cannot remove in this way, take 1 horror.
Flavor: Irrefutable proof, reduced to nothing by the light of day.
Name: Ruined Film

Description:
You have 3 additional ally slots.
[fast] During a skill test you are performing, exhaust an [[Ally]] asset you control: For this test, you get +1 skill value, plus an additional +1 for each skill icon that [[Ally]] asset has that matches this test's type.
[elder_sign] effect: +3. Ready an [[Ally]] asset at your location.
Description2: Deck Size: 30. Class Choices: At deck creation, choose 2 classes ([guardian], [seeker], [rogue], [mystic], or [survivor]). Deckbuilding Options: [[Ally]] cards level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, cards from your chosen classes level 0-2. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Bonnie Walsh, Burden of Leadership, 1 random basic weakness.
Flavor: "It can be arranged. It's just a matter of acceptable terms."
Flavor2: Charlie Kane promised the people of Arkham a safer future. He made a lot of promises - lower taxes, better schools, less crime. It was part of the job, after all. And although he sometimes had to do things he wasn't proud of, Charlie always did work for the greater good. So when he started hearing the reports, he put the people first. Of course, he couldn't tell anyone. Widespread panic would not serve the public good. Besides, who'd believe him? Still, Charlie has always had connections in town. So he made a few calls, put a task force together, and went to work.
Name: Charlie Kane

Description:
Charlie Kane deck only.
[reaction] After you exhaust Bonnie Walsh: Ready another [[Ally]] asset you control. (Limit once per round.)
Flavor: "Don't forget you have a 9 p.m. appointment with Mr. Sanford. Shall I book your usual table at La Bella Luna? Also, you bought me a wristwatch for my birthday. Thank you very much."
Name: Bonnie Walsh

Description: Revelation - If you control no [[Ally]] assets, shuffle Burden of Leadership back into your deck. Otherwise, for each [[Ally]] asset you control, you must either exhaust it or deal it 1 direct damage and 1 direct horror.
Flavor: "I tell myself it was for the greater good. Was it, Bonnie?"
Name: Burden of Leadership

Description: Customizable.
Flavor: You cobbled this suit together yourself from the remnants of ancient armor, mixed with more modern "bulletproof" plating used in the Great War. It's not much, yet. But with some improvements, maybe it'll be enough.
Name: Hunter's Armor

Description: Customizable. Uses (4 charges). Replenish 1 of these charges at the start of each round. [action]: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack. Before this attack, you may spend any number of charges to imbue the axe with that many different inscriptions - - Accuracy - You get an additional +2 [combat] for this attack. - Power - This attack deals +1 damage.
Name: Runic Axe

Description:
Customizable.
Attach to a [[Firearm]] asset you control. Limit 1 per asset.
[reaction] When you reveal a non-[auto_fail] chaos token attacking with attached asset, exhaust Custom Modifications: Cancel that chaos token, return it to the chaos bag, and reveal a new one.
Flavor: It's like an old friend in your grip.
Name: Custom Modifications

Description:
Obsidian Bracelet may only be assigned damage and/or horror dealt by treachery effects.
Obsidian Bracelet may be assigned damage and/or horror dealt to other investigators at your location.
Flavor: You're not about to question why it works. All you know is that you're never taking it off again.
Name: Obsidian Bracelet

Description: Evade. Attempt to evade using [combat] instead of [agility]. If you succeed and the enemy is non-[[Elite]], attach Bolas to it. Attached enemy gets -1 evade value. Forced. - After attached enemy moves: Exhaust it.
Name: Bolas

Description:
Test [combat] (1). If you succeed, attach Breach the Door to your location with 1 resource on it for each point you succeeded by, as leads.
Reduce attached location's shroud by 1 for each lead on Breach the Door.
Flavor: "Let's see those hands!"
Name: Breach the Door

Description: Fast. Play after you successfully attack a non-[[Elite]] enemy using a [[Melee]] asset. Attach Grievous Wound to the attacked enemy. Forced - At the end of the round: Deal 1 damage to attached enemy.
Flavor: This is gonna hurt.
Name: Grievous Wound

Description: Parley. Choose an investigator at your location. That investigator may play an [[Ally]] asset from their hand, reducing its cost by 3.
Flavor:
"Think they bought it?"
"They certainly do not suspect the world is ending, Mr. Kane."
Name: Motivational Speech

Description:
Fast. Play at the end of an attack or effect that spends the last ammo from a [[Firearm]] asset you control.
Add 1 ammo to that asset. You get +3 skill value for your next attack with that asset this round.
Name: One in the Chamber

Description:
Commit only to a skill test during an attack or evasion attempt.
You can commit this skill to an investigator's test at any location.
Flavor: "Aim and pull the damned trigger. It ain't hard, kid."
Name: Fighting Lessons

Description:
You may commit Helping Hand to any type of test. Max 1 committed per test.
While Helping Hand is committed to a skill test, double the skill icons of each other card committed to that test.
Name: Helping Hand

Description:
Uses (4 charges).
[fast] During a skill test performed by an investigator at your location or a connecting location, spend 1 charge: Commit a non-weakness card from your hand to that skill test, treating all of its skill icons as [wild]
Name: Bestow Resolve

Description:
You get +1 [intellect].
[fast] Exhaust Field Agent and deal 1 horror to it: Discover 1 clue at your location.
Flavor: Day 15. The entities appear to be feeding. On what, I cannot imagine. I dare not approach further.
Name: Field Agent

Description: [fast] Exhaust Guard Dog: Engage an enemy at your location. That enemy attacks you. [reaction] When an enemy attack deals damage and/or horror to Guard Dog: Deal 1 damage to the attacking enemy. Card design by the Council-in-Exile at Arkham Nights 2020.
Name: Guard Dog

Description: Fast. [action] If Handcuffs is not attached to an enemy: Evade. Use only on a [[Humanoid]] enemy. This evasion attempt uses [combat] instead of [agility]. If you succeed, remove all doom from the just-evaded enemy and attach Handcuffs to it. If the attached enemy is non-[[Elite]], it cannot ready and doom cannot be placed on it.
Name: Handcuffs

Description: Choose an investigator at your location. That investigator search the top 9 cards of their deck for a [[Weapon]] asset, adds it to their hand or plays it (paying its resource cost), and shuffles their deck.
Name: Prepared for the Worst

Description:
You get +1 skill value while resolving revelation abilities on encounter cards.
[reaction] After another investigator at your location draws a non-peril encounter card, before resolving that card's effects, exhaust Martyr's Vambrace: You are considered to have drawn that encounter card, instead.
Name: Martyr's Vambrace

Description:
Girish Kadakia may be assigned damage and/or horror dealt to other investigators at your location.
[fast] During a skill test being performed by an investigator at your location, exhaust Girish Kadakia: That investigator gets +2 skill value for this test. If this test is successful, heal 1 damage or horror from Girish Kadakia.
Name: Girish Kadakia

Description: One at a time, investigators at your location, as a group, may play up to 4 assets in total from their hands, reducing the resource cost of each by 1.
Flavor:
He had to give Logan credit:
the man knew how to gear up for Armageddon.
Name: Ever Vigilant

Description:
Customizable. Uses (3 supplies).
[action] Spend 1 supply: Choose an investigator at your location and test [intellect] (1). If you succeed, that investigator performs one of the following options -
- Draw 2 cards.
- Gain 2 resources.
Name: Alchemical Distillation

Description: Customizable. Limit 1 per investigator. Forced - At the start of the round: Choose one of the following criteria for this round - You fail a test by 2 or more. - You succeed at a test by 3 or more. When the chosen criteria is met, you may exhaust Empirical Hypothesis to add 1 evidence to it. [fast] Spend 1 evidence: Draw 1 card.
Name: Empirical Hypothesis

Description:
Customizable. When you purchase The Raven Quill, name a [[Tome]] or [[Spell]] asset and record that name on its upgrade sheet.
Attach to a named asset you control.
[reaction] When you resign or the game ends: Either mark a checkbox on The Raven Quill's upgrade sheet, or reduce the experience cost to upgrade the attached asset before the next scenario by 1.
Name: The Raven Quill

Description: [reaction] After an enemy at your location is defeated: Place 1 resource (from the token pool) on this card, as evidence. While Dissection Tools has... - ... 1 or more evidence, you get +1 [agility]. - ... 2 or more evidence, you get +1 [combat]. - ... 3 or more evidence, you get +1 sanity.
Name: Dissection Tools

Description: Uses (4 secrets). [action] Spend 1 secret: Investigate. You get +2 [intellect] for this investigation. If you succeed by 2 or more, you may draw 1 card.
Flavor: What follows is a true account. Would that it were not so.
Name: Grim Memoir

Description:
[reaction] After a player card ability places 1 or more of your clues on your location: Place that many resources on Research Notes, as evidence.
[action]: Test [intellect] (0). For each point you succeed by, you may spend 1 evidence to discover 1 clue at your location.
Name: Research Notes

Description: Place 1 of your clues on your location. Then, heal 3 damage from an investigator or [[Ally]] asset at your location.
Flavor: Unconventional ailments require unconventional treatments.
Name: Bizarre Diagnosis

Description: Search the top 6 cards of your deck. You may place up to 3 of your clues on your location. For each clue placed in this way, choose and add 2 of the searched cards to your hand. Shuffle your deck.
Flavor:
"Don't you realize what this means?"
"Why don't you calm down and tell me very slowly?"
Name: Captivating Discovery

Description: Investigate. Add your [willpower] or [agility] to your skill value for this investigation. If you succeed, instead of discovering clues at this location, attach Map the Area to it. Limit 1 per location. Reduce the difficulty of all skill tests at attached location by 1.
Name: Map the Area

Description: After revealing a chaos token for this skill test, you may place 1 of your clues on your location to cancel that chaos token, return it to the chaos bag, and reveal a new one. (You may do this any number of times.)
Name: Analysis

Description: [reaction] When you would fail a skill test on a [seeker] card by 1 or less, exhaust Lab Coat: You succeed by 0, instead.
Flavor: It makes you feel like you know what you're doing, even when you're in way over your head.
Name: Lab Coat

Description:
Uses (4 secrets).
[fast] Spend 1 secret: Choose any non-weakness treachery not attached to an [[Elite]] enemy. Until the end of the round, treat that card's printed text box as if it were blank (except for [[Traits]]).
Name: Orphic Theory

Description: Parley. Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location and test [willpower] or [intellect] (8). This test gets -1 difficulty for each other card in your hand. If you succeed, automatically evade the chosen enemy and attach Existential Riddle to it. Attached enemy gains aloof.
Name: Existential Riddle

Description: Choose another investigator at your location who has yet to take their turn this round. During their turn this round, the chosen investigator gets +1 to each of their skills, and may take an additional action. Playing Guidance does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
Name: Guidance

Description: [reaction] When any investigator draws an encounter card from the encounter deck, exhaust Dr. William T. Maleson and place 1 of your clues on your location: That investigator draws another card from the top of the encounter deck, chooses one of those 2 cards to resolve, and cancels and discards the other.
Name: Dr. William T. Maleson

Description: [reaction] After you spend 1 or more clues or place 1 or more clues on your location, exhaust Press Pass: You may take an additional action during this turn (or your next turn if it is not currently your turn).
Flavor: It's amazing how differently everyone treats you while you're wearing one.
Name: Press Pass

Description:
Uses (4 supplies).
[reaction] When one of your card effects heals damage from an investigator, spend 1 supply: Either that effect heals 1 additional damage, or you draw 1 card and heal 1 horror.
[action] [action]: Heal 3 damage from an investigator or [[Ally]] asset at your location.
Name: Surgical Kit

Description: Uses (3 supplies). [action] Exhaust Fingerprint Kit and spend 1 supply: Investigate. You get +2 [intellect] for this investigation. If you succeed, you discover 2 additional clues at your location.
Name: Fingerprint Kit

Description:
[action]: Choose a card at your location and test [intellect] (1). For each point you succeed by, choose one -
- The next time that card would be healed this round, heal +1 damage/horror (to a maximum of +3).
- The next time that card would be dealt damage this round, deal +1 damage (to a maximum of +3).
Name: Gray's Anatomy

Description: Customizable. Uses (3 evidence). [action] Exhaust Damning Testimony and choose an enemy at any location: Investigate (your location). If you succeed, you may spend 1 evidence to discover 1 additional clue at the chosen enemy's location.
Name: Damning Testimony

Description:
Customizable. When you purchase Friends in Low Places, choose and record a [[Trait]] on its upgrade sheet.
Look at the top 6 cards of your deck. For each looked-at card with the chosen [[Trait]](s), you may spend 1 resource to add that card to your hand. Shuffle the remaining cards into your deck.
Flavor: "Pleasure doing business with you, Ms. O'Bannion."
Name: Friends in Low Places

Description:
Customizable. Fast. Play this card only after one of the following conditions is met:
- The agenda or act advances.
- You succeed at a skill test by 3 or more.
Immediately take an action as if it were your turn (Max once per round).
Name: Honed Instinct

Description: Uses (4 supplies). [action] Spend 1 supply: Evade. You get +2 [agility] for this evasion attempt. If you succeed and the evaded enemy is non-[[Elite]], it does not ready during the next upkeep phase.
Name: Disguise

Description: [fast] Exhaust Embezzled Treasure: Move up to 2 resources from your resource pool to Embezzled Treasure (to a maximum of 10 resources on it). Forced - When you resign or the game ends: For every 2 resources on Embezzled Treasure, an investigator of your choice begins the next scenario of the campaign with 1 additional resource in their resource pool.
Name: Embezzled Treasure

Description: Uses (6 supplies). [action] Spend 1 supply: Investigate. You may use [agility] instead of [intellect] for this investigation. If you succeed, gain 1 resource.
Flavor: "Why do I keep these on me? Why, to be better informed regarding the unsavory methods of art thieves, of course."
Name: Thieves' Kit

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Attach to a [[Clothing]] or [[Armor]] asset you control.
Attached asset gains: "You have 1 additional hand or accessory slot (your choice), which can only be used to hold an [[Illicit]] asset."
Flavor: "Thanks! It has pockets!"
Name: Hidden Pocket

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Put an [[Ally]] asset from your hand into play. At the end of your turn, if that asset is still in play, return it to your hand.
Flavor: "Impeccable timing, Mr. Fergus."
Name: Hit and Run

Description:
Fast. Play when you successfully evade a [[Humanoid]] enemy or successfully investigate.
Play an [[Item]] asset from your hand, reducing its cost by X, where X is the amount you succeeded by. Attach "I'll take that!" to that asset. Attached asset gains [[Illicit]].
Name: "I'll take that!"

Description: Search the top 9 cards of the encounter deck for a non-[[Elite]] enemy and spawn it engaged with you (instead of its normal spawn location). Then, discover 1 clue at your location and gain X resources, where X is that enemy's health value. Shuffle the encounter deck.
Name: Kicking the Hornet's Nest

Description: Fast. Play when an enemy attacks you. Evade. Attempt to evade the attacking enemy. If you succeed, cancel that enemy's attack.
Flavor: It's out of sight, but never out of mind.
Name: Quick Getaway

Description: Max 1 committed per skill test. Commit only to a test you are performing of any type, and only if it is your turn. Calculated Risk gains [wild] for each action you performed this turn (including this one). After this test ends, end your turn.
Name: Calculated Risk

Description: [reaction] When you gain 1 or more resources during your turn via another player card effect, exhaust Stylish Coat: Gain 1 additional resource.
Flavor: "Dress for the job you want, you say. What if the job I want is yours?"
Name: Stylish Coat

Description:
[reaction] When you play a [[Tactic]] or [[Trick]] event, exhaust Chuck Fergus: Choose one -
- That event gains fast.
- That event costs 2 fewer resources to play.
- You get +2 skill value while performing a skill test during the resolution of that event.
Name: Chuck Fergus

Description:
Limit 1 per investigator.
While attacking, parleying, or attempting to evade an exhausted enemy, you get +2 skill value.
[reaction] After you evade an enemy, exhaust Dirty Fighting: Take a fight action against that enemy. Ignore the aloof keyword for this attack.
Name: Dirty Fighting

Description: Investigate. Add your [agility] value to your skill value for this investigation. If you succeed by 1 or more, you may automatically evade an enemy at this location. If you succeed by 3 or more, return Breaking and Entering to your hand at the end of your turn. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
Flavor: If you're careful, it's just "entering."
Name: Breaking and Entering

Description: Uses (6 supplies). [action] Spend 1 supply: Investigate. For this investigation, you may use [agility] instead of [intellect], and you get +1 skill value. If you succeed, gain 1 resource (2 resources instead if you succeed by 2 or more).
Flavor: "...okay, fine, they're mine."
Name: Thieves' Kit

Description: [reaction] After Trigger Man enters play: Attach an [[Illicit]] asset from your hand to Trigger Man (it is considered to be in play and under your control). [fast] Exhaust Trigger Man and spend 1 resource: Resolve an [action] ability on attached asset, without paying its [action] cost. Resolve that ability with a base skill value of 4.
Name: Trigger Man

Description:
Permanent. Exceptional. You get +10 deck size.
[reaction] Before drawing your opening hand, choose 10 [[Illicit]] cards from your deck: Shuffle them together and place them next to Underworld Market, as your market deck.
[reaction] At the start of your turn: Reveal the top 2 cards of your market deck. You may spend 1 resource to draw 1 of them. Place the rest on the bottom, in any order.
Name: Underworld Market

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
For each exhausted non-swarm enemy at your location, choose a different option:
- Gain 2 resources.
- Deal 2 damage to that enemy.
- Discover 1 clue at your location.
- Draw 1 card.
Name: Clean Sneak

Description:
Customizable. When you purchase Living Ink, choose a skill and circle it on its upgrade sheet.
Uses (3 charges).
Remove 1 charge from Living Ink at the start of each of your turns. If Living Ink has no charges, discard it.
You get +1 to the chosen skill(s).
Name: Living Ink

Description:
Customizable. As an additional cost to play Summoned Servitor, you must discard another asset you control.
Summoned Servitor enters play at your location. It can take 1 action during each of your turns, which can only be used to take the following action:
- Move Summoned Servitor to a connecting revealed location.
Name: Summoned Servitor

Description: Customizable. Fast. Play only during your turn. Attach to a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location. [action] If attached enemy is at your location: Parley. Give it a command (limit once per round per command) - - "Go." This enemy moves once in a direction of your choice. - "Cower." This enemy exhausts.
Name: Power Word

Description: [action]: Fight. Either use your [willpower] or get +1 [combat] for this attack. When you initiate this ability, choose one - - Exhaust Ceremonial Sickle and place 1 doom on it to get +1 skill value and deal +1 damage for this attack. - If this attack defeats an enemy, remove 1 doom from Ceremonial Sickle.
Name: Ceremonial Sickle

Description: [action]: Investigate. Either use your [willpower] or get +1 [intellect] for this investigation. When you initiate this ability, choose one - - Exhaust Dowsing Rod and place 1 doom on it to move to a connecting location. - If this investigation discovers the last clue at a location, remove 1 doom from Dowsing Rod.
Name: Dowsing Rod

Description:
[action]: Choose an investigator at your location and either (choose one) -
- Exhaust Hallowed Chalice and place 1 doom on it to heal 2 damage or 2 horror from that investigator.
- Heal 1 damage or 1 horror from that investigator. If you heal the last damage or horror from that investigator, remove 1 doom from Hallowed Chalice.
Name: Hallowed Chalice

Description: [action]: Evade. Either use your [willpower] or get +1 [agility] for this evasion attempt. When you initiate this ability, choose one - - Exhaust Onyx Pentacle and place 1 doom on it to target any enemy at your location or a connecting location, and get +1 skill value for this evasion attempt. - If you succeed by 2 or more, remove 1 doom from Onyx Pentacle.
Name: Onyx Pentacle

Description: For each arcane slot you have, draw 1 card (max 5). For each filled arcane slot you have, choose and discard 1 card from your hand.
Flavor:
By both light and shadow /
may dusk beget dawn;
May the turning of the world /
lead to power everlasting.
Name: Eldritch Initiation

Description:
Before you play Explosive Ward, you may discard any number of cards from your arcane slots.
Deal X damage to a non-[[Elite]] enemy engaged with you. X cannot be greater than the number of empty arcane slots you have. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
Name: Explosive Ward

Description: Parley. Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location and either (choose one): - Automatically evade that enemy and place 1 doom on it. It cannot take damage for the remainder of the round. Discover 1 clue at your location. - If that enemy has 1 or more doom on it, defeat it. Gain 1 resource for each doom that was on it.
Name: String of Curses

Description:
You get +1 arcane slot for each enemy beneath Binder's Jar.
[reaction] After a non-[[Elite]] enemy is defeated at your location: Place that enemy facedown beneath Binder's Jar (limit 2 enemies beneath it).
[reaction] When an enemy attacks you, discard an enemy beneath Binder's Jar that shares a [[Trait]] with the attacking enemy: Cancel that attack.
Name: Binder's Jar

Description:
After you commit Ghastly Possession to a skill test on an asset, choose one:
- Place 1 doom on that asset. Ghastly Possession gains [wild][wild].
- If this test is successful, either remove 1 doom from this asset, or replenish half of its uses (rounded down).
Name: Ghastly Possession

Description:
For each of your arcane slots that are empty, you have one additional hand slot.
You may take an additional action during your turn, which can only be used to play an asset into one of your hand slots.
Name: Astral Mirror

Description:
You get +1 skill value while resolving a skill test on an attached asset.
1 doom on each attached asset does not count towards the agenda's doom threshold.
[fast] Exhaust Elle Rubash: Choose an asset in your play area with 1 or more doom on it. Attach it to Elle Rubash, or switch it with an attached asset. (Limit 2 attached assets).
Name: Elle Rubash

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Remove all doom from a non-[[Elite]] card at your location.
Flavor: "In the name of the moon..."
Name: Moonlight Ritual

Description:
Permanent. Exceptional.
[fast] Exhaust Sin-Eater: Move 1 doom from an asset you control to Sin-Eater. Then, either ready that asset or place 1 charge on it.
[action]: Remove all doom from Sin-Eater.
Name: Sin-Eater

Description: You may discard a [[Spell]] or [[Ritual]] asset you control. Play a [[Spell]] or [[Ritual]] card from your hand or discard pile, reducing its resource cost by 3.
Flavor:
The power seized her, made her shudder and spasm.
Its energy united with hers, and then,
she opened her eyes…
Name: Uncage the Soul

Description: [action]: Fight. Either use your [willpower] or get +1 [combat] for this attack. When you initiate this ability, choose one - - Exhaust Ceremonial Sickle and place 1 doom on it to get +3 skill value and deal +1 damage for this attack. - If this attack defeats an enemy, ready Ceremonial Sickle and remove all doom from it.
Name: Ceremonial Sickle

Description: [action]: Investigate. Either use your [willpower] or get +1 [intellect] for this investigation. When you initiate this ability, choose one - - Exhaust Dowsing Rod and place 1 doom on it to move to a connecting location and get +2 skill value for this investigation. - If this investigation discovers the last clue at a location, ready Dowsing Rod and remove all doom from it.
Name: Dowsing Rod

Description: [action]: Evade. Either use your [willpower] or get +1 [agility] for this evasion attempt. When you initiate this ability, choose one - - Exhaust Onyx Pentacle and place 1 doom on it to target any enemy at your location or a connecting location, and get +3 skill value for this evasion attempt. - If you succeed by 2 or more, ready Onyx Pentacle and remove all doom from it.
Name: Onyx Pentacle

Description:
Customizable. Limit 1 per investigator.
[fast] During a skill test you are performing, exhaust Pocket Multi Tool: You get +1 skill value for this test.
Flavor: But wait - there's more!
Name: Pocket Multi Tool

Description: Customizable. Uses (2 time). If Makeshift Trap has no time, discard it. Attach to your location. Each non-[[Elite]] enemy at attached location get -1 fight and -1 evade. Forced - At the end of the round: Remove 1 time from Makeshift Trap.
Name: Makeshift Trap

Description: Customizable. When you purchase Grizzled, choose and record two [[Traits]] on its upgrade sheet. If this is a skill test on or against an encounter card (including fighting, evading, or parleying), Grizzled gains [wild][wild] for each of the chosen traits that encounter card possesses.
Name: Grizzled

Description: [reaction] When you are dealt damage and/or horror, exhaust Idol of Xanatos and discard up to 3 cards from your hand: Cancel that much damage/horror.
Flavor: The weight of it was reassuring, the metal warm against her skin.
Name: Idol of Xanatos

Description: Improvised Shield can only be played from your discard pile. Forced - When Improvised Shield is defeated: Shuffle it into your deck instead of discarding it.
Name: Improvised Shield

Description:
Fast. Play during your turn only if the final agenda is in play.
Draw 1 card, gain 1 resource, and gain 1 additional action. Remove End of the Road from the game.
Flavor: "So... should we turn around?"
Name: End of the Road

Description:
Fast. Play before revealing a chaos token during an attack or evasion attempt you are performing, and only if the difficulty of this test is currently 0.
This test automatically succeeds. Instead of this test's normal effects, discard the attacked or evaded enemy (if it is [[Elite]], automatically evade it and deal it 3 damage instead).
Name: Exploit Weakness

Description: Max 2 [[Dilemma]] per round. Revelation - Choose two skills ([willpower], [intellect], [combat], or [agility]). Until the end of the investigation phase, each investigator gets +1 to each of the chosen skills, and -1 to each other skill.
Flavor: There is a certain clarity in the grim mathematics of survival.
Name: Making Preparations

Description: Max 2 [[Dilemma]] per round. Revelation - If there are no enemies in play, draw 1 card. Otherwise, you must decide (choose one): - Each unengaged enemy moves once toward the nearest investigator. - Each investigator disengages from each enemy engaged with them and moves once away from the nearest enemy.
Name: Predator or Prey

Description:
Fast. Play before revealing a chaos token during an investigation you are performing, and only if the difficulty of this test is currently 0.
This test automatically succeeds. You discover 1 additional clue at this location and 1 additional clue at any location.
Name: Shed a Light

Description: Max 2 [[Dilemma]] per round. Revelation - Choose an investigator and decide (choose one): - The chosen investigator must immediately take an action as if it were their turn, then discards 1 card at random from their hand. - The chosen investigator loses 1 action during their next turn, then draws 3 cards.
Name: At a Crossroads

Description:
Max 1 per turn.
Fast. Play when an investigator's turn would end.
That investigator may take X additional actions during their turn. X is the number of skill tests they failed during their turn. Exile Lifeline.
Name: Lifeline

Description: Max 2 [[Dilemma]] per round. Revelation - Reveal the top 3 cards of the encounter deck. Choose an investigator to draw 1 of the revealed cards and discard the rest. Then, choose an investigator to discover 1 clue at any revealed location.
Name: Nature of the Beast

Description:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
You may commit Gumption to any type of skill test.
While Gumption is committed to a skill test, that test gets -2 difficulty.
Flavor: "Now you listen here, mister!"
Name: Gumption

Description: [action]: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage. If a [skull] or [auto_fail] symbol is revealed during this attack, either (choose one): - Return Baseball Bat to your hand after this attack. - This attack deals an additional +1 damage. Discard Baseball Bat after this attack.
Name: Baseball Bat

Description:
[reaction] When you draw a non-weakness card from the top of your deck, before resolving any of its effects, exhaust Katja Eastbank: Place that card facedown beneath her (limit 5 cards beneath her). Draw a new card to replace it.
[action]: Draw any card beneath Katja Eastbank.
Flavor: "Let's bookmark that for later."
Name: Katja Eastbank

Description: Max 2 [[Dilemma]] per round. Revelation - Reveal the top card from each investigator's deck and place them in a pile. Repeat this two more times. Choose one of the three piles. Each investigator draws each of their cards from that pile. Shuffle each weakness in each other pile into its owner's deck. Remove each other revealed card from the game.
Name: Heed the Dream

Description: Choose an [[Item]] asset in your discard pile. Either (choose one): - Remove that asset from the game and gain resources equal to its cost. - Play that asset (paying its cost).
Flavor: You feel a bit discarded, too.
Name: Salvage

Description: Uses (3 keys). If there are no keys on Old Keyring, discard it. [action]: Investigate. Your location gets -2 shroud for this investigation. If you succeed, remove 1 key from Old Keyring, and if this test's difficulty is 0, you discover 1 additional clue.
Name: Old Keyring

Description: Max 2 [[Dilemma]] per round. Revelation - You must decide (choose one): - Place 1 doom on the current agenda. Each investigator heals 3 damage and 3 horror. - Remove 1 doom from the current agenda. Each investigator takes 1 direct damage and 1 direct horror. Remove Fickle Fortune from the game.
Name: Fickle Fortune

Description: Customizable. Uses (4 aether). If Hyperphysical Shotcaster has no aether, discard it. [action] Spend 1 aether: Resolve the Manifest ability of the Hyperphysical Shotcaster's current form. [fast] Exhaust Hyperphysical Shotcaster: Change its form (to one you have unlocked on its upgrade sheet).
Name: Hyperphysical Shotcaster

Description:
Each attached asset takes up no slots and its text box is treated as if it were blank (except for [[Traits]]).
[fast] Exhaust Tool Belt: Choose one - attach a [[Tool]] asset in your play area to Tool Belt, switch a [[Tool]] asset in your play area with an attached asset, or detach an attached asset.
Name: Tool Belt

Description:
As an additional cost to play Refine, spend an action.
Immediately mark a checkbox on an upgrade sheet for a customizable card you own, even if it is not in play.
Max once per game for each investigator.
Name: Refine

Description: Uses (4 supplies). [reaction] When you perform a skill test while investigating or attempting to evade, spend 1 supply: This test gets -2 difficulty. Card design by the Council-in-Exile at Arkham Nights 2020.
Name: Flashlight

Description:
Permanent. Exceptional.
For every point of damage and/or horror you heal in excess of an investigator's current damage/horror, place 1 resource on Soul Sanctification, as an offering. This still counts as healing.
[fast] Spend 1 offering: You get +2 skill value for this test. (Limit twice per test.)
Name: Soul Sanctification

Description: [guardian] investigator only. Hunter. Spawn - Any connecting location. Lurker in the Dark can only be attacked or damaged using [[Weapon]] assets or [[Tactic]] events, and takes 1 fewer damage from each source.
Name: Lurker in the Dark

Description: [seeker] investigator only. As an additional cost to play Quantum Paradox, you must choose and discard 4 other cards from your hand. Forced - If Quantum Paradox is in your hand at the end of your turn: Reveal it and take 1 horror.
Name: Quantum Paradox

Description: [rogue] investigator only. As an additional cost to play Pay Your Due, you may spend any number of additional actions. Reduce its cost by 5 for each additional action spent. Forced - If Pay Your Due is in your hand at the end of your turn: Reveal it and take 1 damage.
Name: Pay Your Due

Description:
[mystic] investigator only.
Hunter.
The first time you reveal a chaos token while attacking or attempting to evade Ectoplasmic Horror, reveal an additional token for each empty arcane slot you have.
Name: Ectoplasmic Horror

Description:
[survivor] investigator only.
Play only if Underprepared is the only card in your hand and you have exactly 1 resource in your resource pool.
While Underprepared is in your hand, each card you commit to skill tests is considered to have 1 fewer matching skill icon.
Name: Underprepared

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –1 (-3 instead if you have 2 or more clues).
[tablet]: –1. If there is a concealed mini-card at your location, reveal another chaos token.
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, you must either spend 1 clue or place 1 doom on an enemy in the shadows.
Description2:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –2 (-4 instead if you have 2 or more clues).
[tablet]: –2. If there is a concealed mini-card at your location, reveal another chaos token.
[elder_thing]: -4. If you fail, you must either spend 1 clue or place 1 doom on an enemy in the shadows.
Name: Riddles and Rain

Description: Forced - When this agenda advances: Move all doom on it to the next agenda.
Description2: Each investigator takes 1 horror. Put the set-aside Kensington Gardens, Westminster Abbey, and Big Ben locations into play. The lead investigator draws the set-aside The Red-Gloved Man enemy and resolves his concealed keyword. (Spawn The Red-Gloved Man in the shadows. Take his mini-card and 1 [per_investigator] decoys, shuffle them facedown, and put them into play divided as evenly as possible among the locations nearest to the lead investigator.) Each investigator loses each of their clues. Advance the act directly to act 2a (do not resolve act 1b).
Flavor: Arriving in London, you patiently await your contact... but none arrives. Inspector Flint - or one of his proxies - was supposed to meet you at a quiet teahouse tucked away in a narrow storefront just outside Trafalgar Square. Wondering what could have gone wrong, and suspecting the worst, you set off to investigate.
Flavor2: Eventually, you notice the tail. The figure stalks you through the rainy streets, pretending to have some other pressing task at hand. For once, you believe your paranoia may have paid off. But there is only one way to know for sure. So you test your theory - walking faster, moving aimlessly through the streets, and doubling back to see what they do. Every time, there they are. Watching you. It's a tail, all right. You flip the script and begin to give chase, instead. If they work for the man with the red gloves, you are going to find out.
Name: When It Rains...

Description: Forced - When this agenda advances: Move all doom on it to the next agenda.
Description2: Mark 1 time in your Campaign Log. Set The Red-Gloved Man enemy and each concealed mini-card aside, out of play. Put the set-aside Tower Bridge and Tower of London locations into play. Shuffle the encounter discard pile and the set-aside Crimson Conspiracy and Outsiders encounter sets into the encounter deck. Each investigator loses each of their clues. Advance the act directly to act 3a (do not resolve act 2b).
Flavor: Your mind must be playing tricks on you. Misshapen figures dance through the dense London fog whenever the rain lets up. Are these distortions, like the one in the photograph Inspector Flint showed you? Or is it your quarry hiding in the mist and gloom?
Flavor2: Through the rainy streets and dense fog you give chase, but no matter what you do, the man you seek constantly eludes your grasp. All you catch is the barest hint of the color red as he slips out of view once more. Then, fast as a flash of lightning and gone just as swiftly, a formless shape ducks out of view. A chunk of a nearby telephone booth goes along with it. After a moment of trepidation, you inch forward and examine what remains of the booth. All that remains is an ectoplasmic substance, appearing like the negative of an undeveloped photo. It takes you a while to pick up the trail once more. When you do, you find that your quarry has fled to the east, where the Tower Bridge looms over the skyline.
Name: Figures in the Fog

Description2:
The lead investigator must decide (choose one):
- Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Coterie Agent enemy and draw it. Shuffle the encounter deck.
- Each investigator takes 1 damage and 1 horror.
Flavor: It is clear now that Inspector Flint's hunches were correct. The man in the red gloves is not operating alone, and whatever he is up to, it has something to do with the recent vanishings. You could wait to report what you have seen, but by then the man and his cohorts may have already put into motion whatever scheme the planning. No - you have only one choice. You must find the man with the red gloves, at all costs.
Flavor2:
As the night grows deeper and the rain becomes a torrent, you flinch at every moving shadow, every sound, every shape. You wonder if perhaps this investigation is getting the best of you.
Or maybe there are more of them than you thought, watching you. Lying in wait for the perfect opportunity to strike.
Name: The Connection

Description2:
If it is act 1, 2, or 3:
Despite your best efforts, the trail has gone cold. You cannot find any sign of the man with the red gloves or his cohorts. What's worse, you have no idea what their goal was in London to begin with. You have no choice but to report back to Inspector Flint with what little you have learned.
(→R4) (page 8) If it is act 4:
Your search for the man with the red gloves has led you into a hidden section of the tower prison. You duck under stone archways and sneak through dank, forgotten halls until finally, you find him: the man with the red gloves. He has lifted the lid from a stone crypt and is studying the corpse inside. The moment he sees you enter, he pulls a small ruby marble from the eyesocket of the unfortunate soul, then slips back into the shadows.
(→R3) (page 8)
Flavor: Deep fog blots out the moonlight, bathing the city in utter darkness. From the rooftops, ravens watch your progress with inhuman intelligence. Every moving shadow sets your mind racing. If you don't find the man with the red gloves and stop his plans, who knows what he will do next?
Name: Plots and Panic

Description: Objective – As a group, spend the requisite number of clues to advance before the agenda advances.
Description2: Put the set-aside Kensington Gardens, Westminster Abbey, and Big Ben locations into play. The lead investigator draws the set-aside The Red-Gloved Man enemy and resolves his concealed keyword. (Spawn The Red-Gloved Man in the shadows. Take his mini-card and 1 [per_investigator] decoys, shuffle them facedown, and put them into play divided as evenly as possible among the locations nearest to the lead investigator.) Advance the agenda directly to agenda 2a (do not resolve agenda 1b).
Flavor: You draw your umbrella closer, using it to obscure your identity. Each person you pass on the street could be your contact... or be out to get you.
Flavor2:
You spot the figure on the other side of the street just as a bright red bus approaches. You are certain whoever was there was staring directly at you. The bus cuts a swath through the foggy street, and when it has passed, the figure is gone.
Perhaps it is just your paranoia at work, but it cannot be a coincidence. It must have either been your contact, or one of their foes. Perhaps even the reason they are missing. Steeling yourself for any possibility, you set off in chase.
Name: Clues and Capers

Description: Objective – Chase down the mysterious figure before the agenda advances. If an investigator engages The Red-Gloved Man, advance.
Description2: Set The Red-Gloved Man aside, out of play. Put the set-aside Tower Bridge and Tower of London locations into play. Shuffle the set-aside Crimson Conspiracy and Outsiders encounter sets into the encounter deck, along with the encounter discard pile. Advance the agenda directly to agenda 3a (do not resolve agenda 2b).
Flavor: You chase a shadow shrouded by night. It might as well be a needle in a haystack. But still you search, hoping for any clue that may lead you to the truth...
Flavor2: After much toil and pursuit, you finally catch up to the figure you've been chasing. A feeling of vindication washes over you as you spot the red gloves the man wears. It was no phantom you chased; this is the one you have sought all along. You corner him in a narrow alleyway, sheets of rain and fog masking your approach. Several more figures flank the man- a meeting, perhaps? To your surprise, he casts an expressionless glance in your direction. Then, fast as a flash of lightning and gone just as swiftly, a formless shape ducks out of view. A chunk of a nearby building goes along with it. When you turn to question your quarry about what happened, they have all fled east. You inch forward and examine the partially-excised wall, covered in an ectoplasmic substance, like the negative of an undeveloped photo.
Name: The Game is Afoot!

Description: Objective – Only investigators at the Tower of London may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.
Description2:
Put the set-aside Tower Prison location into play. Attach the set-aside The Eye of Ravens key to the Tower Prison, not controlled by anyone.
Move all concealed mini-cards in play to the Tower Prison.
Draw the set-aside The Red-Gloved Man enemy and resolve his concealed keyword, putting all of those concealed mini-cards into play at the Tower Prison.
Flavor: Your gaze turns eastward, in the direction you last saw the man heading. Over the Tower Bridge lies the famed Tower of London, where even more eyes watch your approach, these belonging to a conspiracy of dark and brooding ravens. For what reason could he be heading there...?
Flavor2:
Quietly and cautiously, you follow the figure from a distance. With measured haste, he darts to and fro inside the ominous tower. Searching for something.
Finally, while you watch from the shadows, the man with the red gloves finds what he is looking for: a loose brick along one of the candlelit hall's many columns. He casually rotates the stone back into place with the kind of nonchalance as if he were dealing with a piece of misplaced laundry. To your surprise, a section of the nearby wall rotates in turn, revealing a secret passageway. He ascends into darkness, and you follow in secret.
Name: Eyes in the Tower

Description: The Red-Gloved Man gains: "[action]: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (5) to interrogate The Red-Gloved Man. If you succeed, place 1 resource on him." Objective – - Stop The Red-Gloved Man from stealing The Eye of Ravens. If he is defeated, or if there are 1 [per_investigator] resources on him, advance.
Description2:
If you defeated The Red-Gloved Man:
The figure reels backward, grasping at his wound. Something small clatters to the ground. The man says nothing - only glares at you fromthe darkness. His gloves seem to ripple around his hands, like the disturbed surface of a deep crimson pool, and after a moment, he straightens himself. Then, blending into the shadows, he tips his hat and is gone.
Add The Red-Gloved Man to the victory display. (→R1) (page 7) If there are 1 [per_investigator] resources on The Red-Gloved Man:
The man stops and faces you, seemingly intrigued by your line of questioning, although in the darkness you cannot study his expression. "... interesting," he whispers. "Very interesting." His voice has a strange, uneven quality, like he is testing the tone of each word. Like one unaccustomed to speaking.
Add The Red-Gloved Man to the victory display. (→R2) (page 7)
Flavor: Somewhere in these forgotten crypts, the man with the red gloves is searching for something... but for what purpose?
Name: Caught Red-Handed

Description: Rainy London Streets gets +X shroud. X is the current act number. Forced - If there are no clues on Rainy London Streets: Add clues to it until it has 1 [per_investigator] clues on it. [action]: Resign. "We should wait for Inspector Flint..."
Flavor2: Cold rain pelts the dreary streets in a rhythmic pitter-patter. Despite the hour, the square is bustling with automobiles, carriages, and pedestrians. Somewhere in this crowded city is the man you seek…. or are you already too late?
Name: Rainy London Streets

Description: [fast]: Choose a concealed mini-card at Big Ben or a connecting location and test [agility] (2). If you succeed, look at the revealed side of that concealed mini-card (without exposing it). If you fail, take 1 horror. (Limit once per turn.)
Flavor2: A fixture of the London skyline, the clock tower at the north end of the Palace of Westminster looms over the city, its face like the eye of a watchful guardian.
Name: Big Ben

Description: [action]: Parley. Choose a location and test [willpower] (1) to ask around the abbey. For each point you succeed by, look at the revealed side of a concealed mini-card at the chosen location (without exposing it). (Group limit once per game.)
Flavor2: The Gothic abbey near the palace is both a place of religious significance and a traditional burial site for English royals. Lights flicker in the windows as the gentle rain turns to an ominous downpour. You would not be the first to seek guidance on such hallowed ground, but you wonder what else may be at work within its aged walls.
Name: Westminster Abbey

Description: [reaction] After you expose a decoy at Kensington Gardens: Heal 1 horror. Forced - After you expose an enemy at Kensington Gardens: Take 1 horror.
Flavor2: The night's unusually somber mood is enough to drown out even the beauty of the royal park. The Round Pond threatens to flood as the downpour continues. This place has been a popular meeting ground for many years- perhaps the man with the red gloves and his cohorts are here?
Name: Kensington Gardens

Description: [action]: "Maybe there is another way in..." Test [willpower] or [intellect] (5). If you succeed, put the set-aside Traitors' Gate location into play.
Flavor: Stories have been told of the prisoners who were brought to the Tower of London by barge along the River Thames. Perhaps you could follow their morbid example.
Flavor2: Spanning the River Thames, the newly built Tower Bridge has quickly become a cultural icon, connecting Central London with the East End, which has seen much growth in recent years. To the north, just over the bridge, a dark cloud encircles the Tower of London.
Name: The Tower Bridge

Description: [action]: Test [combat] or [agility] (5). If you succeed, reveal the Tower of London. If you fail, take 1 damage.
Flavor: Finding a way in through here will be tricky, but if your hunch is right, you might be able to slip in without anyone suspecting your approach. You prepare yourself for an underwater excursion, hoping the gate wasn't fully blocked off...
Flavor2: Although the original entrance to the water gate has long since been bricked up, you commandeer a small vessel and make your way along the river anyway. Perhaps there is still a secret route one might take from here to infiltrate the Tower of London.
Name: Traitors' Gate

Description: Forced - After you end your turn at the Tower of London: You must either lose 2 resources, or each enemy in the shadows attacks you.
Description2: The main gate into the Tower is locked and securely guarded. As an additional cost to enter the Tower of London, investigators at The Tower Bridge must spend 2 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.
Flavor2: A conspiracy of ravens circle ominously over the castle walls. Far too many to be a coincidence.
Name: Tower of London

Description: [fast] While an investigator at Tower Prison is performing a skill test, spend 1 clue: That investigator gets +2 skill value for this test. Forced - When a concealed mini-card would enter play anywhere other than Tower Prison: Put it into play at Tower Prison, instead.
Description2: Forced - When a concealed mini-card would enter play anywhere other than Tower Prison: Put it into play at Tower Prison, instead.
Flavor2: What could the man with the red gloves possibly want in this place?
Name: Tower Prison

Description: Concealed 1 [per_investigator]. Retaliate.
Flavor: "The only detail I could remember was his gloves; red, red as blood."
Name: The Red-Gloved Man

Description: Shift - During a skill test at your location, the performing investigator sets their base skill value for this test to 6. Flip this key to its [[Unstable]] side.
Flavor: File #5-A19 / Subject Class: Yellow / Key appears as small red marble found lodged in eyesocket of deceased Coterie operative. Paradimensional capabilities unknown.
Name: The Eye of Ravens

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –1 for every 1 [per_investigator] civilians slain.
[cultist]: -4. If you fail, choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location. That enemy readies and attacks you.
[tablet]: –1. You may take 1 damage. If you do not, a civilian at your location is slain.
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, choose and discard 1 card from your hand.
Description2:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –2 for every 1 [per_investigator] civilians slain.
[cultist]: -6. Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location. That enemy readies and attacks you.
[tablet]: –2. Take 1 damage. A civilian at your location is slain.
[elder_thing]: -4. If you fail, discard 1 card from your hand at random.
Name: Dead Heat

Description: Each [[Risen]] enemy and each [[Ghoul]] enemy gains "Spawn - Random location."
Description2:
For every 1 [per_investigator] civilians slain, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Risen]] or [[Ghoul]] enemy and spawn it at a random location. Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.
Each investigator decides (choose one):
- Heal 2 damage from each [[Elite]] enemy in play.
- 1 civilian at your location is slain.
Flavor: Everywhere you go, you have the distinct feeling of being followed, as though the shadows themselves move of their own accord. In nearby alleyways and backroads, you hear the gnashing of teeth and the tearing of meat. The palpable sense of unease only grows stronger as night falls.
Flavor2: As night falls, your sense of being followed only grows. Turning around, you see a trio of tall, lanky figures moving slowly. The shadows obscure their features, but a glint of light reflects on wet, red jaws and hollow eyes. When you quicken your pace, they quicken theirs. As the group bears down on you, you duck into a nearby alleyway and sprint away from them. After several minutes of running, you hear a rasping, gutteral howl followed by a sound like ripping cloth behind you.
Name: Gnashing Teeth

Description: Each [[Risen]] enemy and each [[Ghoul]] enemy gains hunter and "Spawn - Random location."
Description2: Each investigator suffers 1 physical trauma. Check which enemies are in play. - If Razin Farhi is in play, proceed to (→R1) (page 13). - Otherwise, proceed to (→R2) (page 13).
Flavor: The city grows quieter as more and more civilians disappear each night. The soul-deadening heat of the day sees more hollow-eyed figures walk the streets. Once a thriving oasis of life and culture, Marrakesh now feels like an empty echo of its former self.
Flavor2:
A crimson sunrise casts the ruined city in an awful glow: cars overturned, stalls rared, cobblestones covered in blood smears. What few civilians remain cower behind boarded up windows, fearfully praying for their lives. Whatever terrible thing Amaranth aimed to do here, she has succeeded. The city's ruin is a grim testament to her awful power.
Heart heavy with the weight of such great loss, you make a path through the devastation. A pack of the hungering dead catch wind of your scent and pursue you relentlessly to the city limits, picking at you with sharp, hungry claws. You barely escape with your life.
Name: Empty Streets

Description: Objective - At the end ot the round, investigators at a [[Ritual Site]] location may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.
Description2: Spawn the set-aside Amaranth enemy at Bahia Palace Gardens, (Lurking Corruption) side faceup, and attach the set-aside The Last Blossom key to her. Put the set-aside Save the Civilians story card into play next to the agenda deck. Shuffle the set-aside Khalid enemy into the encounter deck.
Flavor: Strange happenings are afoot. A tomb robbery of an ancient philosopher. Rumors of the dead walking the streets. A string of disappearances. If you can gather information on Amaranth's whereabouts, you may be able to get to the bottom of things.
Flavor2:
Showing the photograph of Amaranth to several locals, they direct you to the verdant Bahia Palace Gardens. Approaching carefully, you find the woman with the red flower standing at the edge of a ritual circle, candles lit at each point, with gleaming offerings gathered around a corpse laid on an altar in the center. On either side of the corpse, two dead warriors are laid on the ground, bedecked in ancient finery.
"Soon, my love," Amaranth strokes the cheek of the corpse as the blossom in her hair unfurls. Tenebrous vines radiate out from the circle and creep across the garden. The grass and greenery shrivel under their touch, and eerie green light shimmers up the black vines, drinking the life around it. "It appears we have guests," Amaranth smirks.
Name: Find Amaranth

Description: Forced - After a civilian is slain, if 4[per_investigator] or more civilians have been slain: Advance this act. Objective - If Amaranth would be defeated, advance.
Description2:
If this act advanced because of its forced ability:
"Razin, my love!" exclaims Amaranth. The body in the ritual circle rises to stand, along with two newly-resurrected warriors. Amaranth embraces the ancient philosopher, the two of them entwined with awful black tendrils. She speaks softly: "Let me make this place a paradise for you, my love. A true paradise."
Spawn the set-aside Razin Farhi enemy at Bahia Palace Gardens. Shuffle both copies of the set-aside Ancient Raider enemy into the encounter deck.
If this act advanced because Amaranth would be defeated:
Your final blow knocks Amaranth back, toppling an ancient brazier. As hungry flames consume the remnants of the ritual and the corpses, she screeches in anguish. "Do you have any idea what you have done? Razin, my love..."
Flip Amaranth to her (Corruption Revealed) side, keeping all tokens and attachments on her, and move her to a random location with no investigators. Shuffle both copies of the set-aside Ancient Raider enemy into the encounter deck.
Flavor: A network of necrous vines has grown through the city, spurred on by Amaranth. The woman with the red flower is conducting strange rites upon a stolen corpse in the Bahia Palace Gardens. You must stop her at any cost.
Name: Ritual of Life and Death

Description: Objective - If neither Amaranth nor Razin Farhi are in play, advance.
