Description2: Check your Campaign Log. - If the cell knows Amaranth's real name, proceed to (→R3) (page 13). - Otherwise, proceed to (→R4) (page 13).
Flavor: Unnatural vines choke the city streets as Amaranth pursues you, drunk with power. The blossom in her hair stretches wide like a garnet maw as she laughs cruelly.
Flavor2:
Amaranth's tortured cry resounds through the streets as she collapses. A heady wind picks up, whipping the dust in the street into a frantic dervish as the hot sun beats down overhead. Black ichor pools around Amaranth's body as the nexus of vines begins to wither and dessicate around you. The hordes of risen dead stop in their tracks, as if waiting for your move. You can see the remaining civilians of Marrakesh flee the city beyond them.
Standing over the beautiful, terrible woman, you feel a pang of pity. As you turn her over, you notice the voluptuous flower behind her ears has wilted in the heat. She lets out a primal scream as you pull the blossom from her ear: the stem is several inches longer than you expected, and sticky with blood.
Name: Queen of Nothing at All

Description: [fast]: Move (to a connecting location). (Group limit once per turn.) [action]: Resign. You flee the city. (Note: If there are no investigators in play, all remaining civilians in play will be slain.) Forced - If Marrakesh Railway Station has no civilians on it: Swap it with its set-aside [[Abandoned]] version.
Description2: Forced - If Marrakesh Railway Station has no civilians on it: Swap it with its set-aside [[Abandoned]] version.
Flavor2: Your initial impression of Marrakesh seems pleasant, from the gentle, dry heat to the striking Moorish architecture and colorful tilework. However, you also sense an unspoken fear among those around you.
Name: Marrakesh Railway Station

Description: [action] If 1 or more civilians are on this location: Reveal the top 6 cards of your deck. You may play an asset from among those cards (paying its cost). Shuffle the rest into your deck. (Limit once per game.) Forced - If Jemaa el-Fnaa Square has no civilians on it: Swap it with its set-aside [[Abandoned]] version.
Description2: Forced - If Jemaa el-Fnaa Square has no civilians on it: Swap it with its set-aside [[Abandoned]] version.
Flavor2: The center of commerce in Marrakesh, this huge open-air market is the go-to place for acquiring food and supplies. The air is thick with the music of buskers and the smell of spices and roasted meats.
Name: Jemaa el-Fnaa Square

Description: Saadian's Tombs gets +1 shroud for each civilian on it. Forced - When a non-[[Elite]] enemy enters or spawns at Saadian's Tombs, before it engages any investigators: Exhaust it. Forced - If Saadian's Tombs has no civilians on it: Swap it with its set-aside [[Abandoned]] version.
Description2: Forced - If Saadian's Tombs has no civilians on it: Swap it with its set-aside [[Abandoned]] version.
Flavor2: The royal necropolis of the Saadian dynasty, this is the final resting place for much of Morocco's 16th-century royalty. Some of its beautiful tilework was destroyed with the recent theft.
Name: Saadian's Tombs

Description: [fast] Choose a [[Risen]] enemy from the encounter discard pile and spawn it engaged with you: Place clues on Tanneries (from the token pool) equal to that enemy's health. Forced - If Tanneries has no civilians on it: Swap it with its set-aside [[Abandoned]] version.
Description2: Forced - If Tanneries has no civilians on it: Swap it with its set-aside [[Abandoned]] version.
Flavor2: You have heard reports of strange disappearances near the tanneries, where leather is processed in large vats of pungent chemicals and dyes.
Name: Tanneries

Description: [reaction] After you rescue a civilian on Bahia Palace Gardens: Heal 1 damage or 1 horror. Forced - If Bahia Palace Gardens has no civilians on it: Swap it with its set-aside [[Abandoned]] version.
Description2: Forced - If Bahia Palace Gardens has no civilians on it: Swap it with its set-aside [[Abandoned]] version.
Flavor2: The sprawling and opulent palace draws many admirers. The jewel of the palace is its courtyard garden: an oasis of lush vegetation amidst a harsh desert.
Name: Bahia Palace Gardens

Description: As an additional cost for you to move out of Marrakesh Railway Station, you must spend 1 resource. [action]: Resign. You run for your life. (Note: If there are no investigators in play, all remaining civilians in play will be slain.)
Flavor2: The once-bustling station is now quiet and lonely. The attendants in charge have delayed the train until tomorrow; news of what is happening in Marrakesh seems to have spread quickly.
Name: Marrakesh Railway Station

Description: While you are at Jemaa el-Fnaa Square, increase the cost of each asset you play by 2.
Flavor: Stalls and tables are tipped over and merchandize is ruined. The entire square is devoid of both patrons and merchants. You won't be buying anything here anytime soon.
Flavor2: Wind whistles through the empty square, accompanied by the sound of slow footsteps and low groans of the risen.
Name: Jemaa el-Fnaa Square

Description: Forced - When a non-[[Elite]] enemy enters Saadian's Tombs, before it engages any investigators: Heal all damage from it.
Flavor: Do the risen throngs still fear the tombs? Or do they merely resent death?
Flavor2: This once-holy place is now desecrated and overrun with figures that reek of death and fresh blood.
Name: Saadian's Tombs

Description: Each [[Risen]] enemy at Tanneries gets +1 fight and +1 evade.
Flavor: You watch the risen intentionally submerge themselves into pools of chemicals and swallow great mouthfuls of the foul liquid. Amaranth's power can only stave off decomposition so long. Perhaps this strange ritual preserves their rotting tissue.
Flavor2: For some reason, the risen dead have been especially active near the old tanneries. Why congregate here?
Name: Tanneries

Description: Forced - When you end your turn at Bahia Palace Gardens: Take 1 damage or 1 horror.
Flavor: "Man selects only for his own good: Nature only for that of the being which she tends." -- Charles Darwin, The Origin of Species
Flavor2: The once-vibrant gardens are choked with black, thorned vines. The remaining trees are frail and flake under your touch, and the fountains run dry.
Name: Bahia Palace Gardens

Description: The civilians of Marrakesh are under attack! By getting them out of harm's way, you may be able to avert a massacre. (Note: Civilians still on locations are neither rescued nor slain.) [action] Spend 1 clue: Rescue a civilian from your location (place it on this card). Forced - When the game ends: flip this card (keep all tokens on it).
Flavor: A piercing howl resounds through the dusty streets, accompanied by the sound of feeding. Bystanders flee packs of the hungry dead as you traverse the city. All around you is the scent of rot and blood. Only you can save the people of this city from a terrible fate.
Name: Save the Civilians

Description: Hunter. Forced - When damage or horror from Amaranth's attack is assigned to an asset: Defeat that asset and Amaranth shifts each of her attached keys.
Flavor: "Many say they would do anything for love. But I actually mean it."
Name: Amaranth

Description: Alert. Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - After any key is shifted: If Razin Farhi is exhausted, read him. Otherwise, he makes an immediate attack against the engaged investigator.
Flavor: "I have not crossed vast oceans of time only to be defeated by the likes of you!"
Name: Razin Farhi

Description:
The first copy of Thrall drawn each round gains surge.
[fast] During your turn: Attempt to evade Thrall. It gains alert for this evasion attempt. (Limit once per turn).
Flavor: With dim light and thick clothing they can clumsily pass for living, but by daylight their unnatural pallor, glassy eyes, and gruesome wounds are impossible to hide.
Name: Thrall

Description: Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - After Ancient Raider attacks you: 1 civilian at your location is slain.
Flavor: The former vanguard of Razin Farhi, these soldiers now serve Amaranth with an unnatural fervor.
Name: Ancient Raider

Description: Hunter. Forced - After Khalid enters play: Move each other non-[[Elite]] enemy and civilian from its location to a connecting location (distributed as evenly as possible).
Flavor: "They say cats have nine lives, but my sweet Khalid is already on his tenth."
Name: Khalid

Description: Revelation - Put Famine into play next to the agenda deck. Increase the cost of each card you play by 1. Forced - At the end of the round: Discard Famine from play.
Flavor: Those that ate the blighted crop died even faster than those who chose to starve.
Name: Famine

Description: Revelation - Test [combat] (3). If you fail, either (choose one): - 1 civilian at your location is slain. - Take 1 damage for each point you fail by.
Flavor: Although the risen move slowly, they hunt like wolves, surrounding their prey before they pounce.
Name: Cornered!

Description: Shift - Heal 1 damage and 1 horror from each investigator at your location. Flip this key to its [[Unstable]] side.
Flavor: File #11-B31 / Subject Class: Red / Key appears as flora of extraterrestrial origin, with long, black prehnsile vines that attach intravenously with host.
Name: The Last Blossom

Description: Easy / Standard [skull]: –X. X is the number of targets on this card. [cultist]: –5. If you fail by 2 or more, shuffle each concealed mini-card at your location and at each connecting location facedown, then place them at random in the positions they were in. [tablet]: –1. Cancel the effects and icons of each card committed to this skill test. [elder_thing]: -2. If you fail, you must either place 1 doom on the current agenda, or the nearest [[Coterie]] enemy attacks you (even if its in the shadows).
Description2: Hard / Expert [skull]: –X. X is 1 more than the number of targets on this card. [cultist]: –7. If you fail by 2 or more, shuffle each concealed mini-card at your location and at each connecting location facedown, then place them at random in the positions they were in. [tablet]: –2. Cancel the effects and icons of each card committed to this skill test. [elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, you must either place 1 doom on the current agenda, or the nearest [[Coterie]] enemy attacks you (even if its in the shadows).
Name: Sanguine Shadows

Description: Forced - At the start of the game, or after the agenda deck resets: Set the amount of doom on this agenda to 1 [per_investigator]. Forced - After you expose a decoy: La Chica Roja attacks you. (Hint - when this agenda advances, La Chica Roja will collect one of the pieces she seeks!)
Description2: Reveal each concealed mini-card in play and set each decoy aside, out of play. Find the location with a target on it nearest to La Chica Roja (or her mini-card). La Chica Roja collects that target (place it on her). If there are 3 targerts on La Chica Roja, proceed to (→R3). Otherwise, resolve La Chica Roja's concealed keyword, distributing each of those concealed mini-cards as evenly as possible among each location with a target. Reset the act and agenda decks to agenda 1 and act 1. Add clues to each location until it has clues equal to its clue value.
Flavor: La Chica Roja is stealing pieces divided up from an old art collection, which you believe are parts of an ancient Key.
Flavor2: Hot on the thief's heels, you bust through the door leading to her current target, only to find her already leaving with a piece of the statuette. She gives you a mischievous smirk before escaping through a nearby window.
Name: Where is She...?

Description: Objective – Expose the thief's whereabouts. If an investigator engages La Chica Roja, advance.
Description2:
If this is the first time this act has been advanced:
Following all of your leads, you manage to beat La Chica Roja to her target and lie in ambush. She arrives soon after and sets to work, but it's not long before she realizes something is wrong. She hums a jazzy improvisation and saunters around the room, scanning for something. "Come on out," she says at last, a smirk on her lips. You reveal yourself and tell her to stop what she is doing. "Or what?" she grins. "You gonna make me?"
Otherwise:
Once again, you beat your rival to the punch, and she spots you immediately. "You again?" she says dismissively. "Don't you have anything better to do? I'm quite busy, as you can see."
Flavor: Thanks to Officer Bolívar, you believe you know which buildings might hold the pieces La Chica Roja is after. All that is left is to catch her in the act.
Name: The Scarlet Shadow

Description: La Chica Roja gains: "[action] Parley. Test [intellect] or [agility] (6) to outsmart the thief. You may spend 1 clue to reduce this test's difficulty by 2. If you fail, La Chica Roja attacks you." Objective – If La Chica Roja would be defeated, instead advance. Objective - If an investigator successfully parleys with La Chica Roja, advance.
Description2:
Find the location with a target on it nearest to La Chica Roja. Place that target on the scenario reference card. Then, if there are 3 targets on the scenario reference card, skip the rest of this act and instead proceed to Scenario Interlude: Cast a Light. Otherwise, continue reading the following.
"Fine, you can have this one," the mysterious thief calls to you as she makes her escape. "There's more where that came from, anyway!" Before you can catch her, with a twirl of her stark red coat, she vanishes into the shadows without a trace.
Heal all damage from La Chica Roja, return her to the shadows, and resolve her concealed keyword, distributing each of those concealed mini-cards as evenly as possible among each location with a target. Reset the act and agenda decks to agenda 1 and act 1. Each investigator loses each of their clues. Add clues to each location until it has clues equal to its clue value.
Flavor: You finally have her in your sights!
Name: In the Searchlight

Description: If your difficulty level is... - ...Easy, X is 2. - ...Standard, X is 3. - ...Hard, X is 4. - ...Expert, X is 5. [action]: Resign. Looks like La Chica Roja wins this game.
Flavor2: You step out onto the broad avenue, eyes darting to every alleyway and rooftop. This street connects with the Plaza de Mayo and many of the buildings which Officer Bolívar marked as potential targets for La Chica Roja's campaign of thievery. It's as good a place as any to start your search.
Name: Avenida de Mayo

Description: [action] Spend 1 clue: Test [intellect](4) to observe the staff. You may spend 1 additional clue to reduce the difficulty of this test by 2. If you succeed, look at the revealed side of a concealed mini-card at this location (without exposing it). For every 2 points you succeed by, look at an additional mini-card at this location.
Flavor2: Serving as the office of the President of Argentina, the Rose House is also home to several antiques and curios inherited from past leaders. One might be a piece of the Key your quarry seeks.
Name: Casa Rosada

Description: [action] Spend 1 clue: Test [agility](4) to watch the rooftops of the cathedral. You may spend 1 additional clue to reduce the difficulty of this test by 2. If you succeed, look at the revealed side of a concealed mini-card at this location (without exposing it). For every 2 points you succeed by, look at an additional mini-card at this location.
Flavor2: Overlooking the Plaza de Mayo looms the impressive façade of the Metropolitan Cathedral. In addition to the usual trappings of the church, Bolívar has informed you that it houses many magnificent pieces of art, as well as a mausoleum. It seems a likely target for La Chica Roja.
Name: Catedral Metropolitana

Description: [action] Spend X clues and take X horror: Look at the revealed side of X concealed mini-cards at this location (without exposing them).
Flavor2: Robbing the dead has long been a crime reserved for only the foulest of thieves, so naturally, Officer Bolívar believes Recoleta Cemetery is on the list of potential targets. Who knows what valuables may be locked with the dead in the cemetery's countless marble vaults and mausoleums?
Name: Cementario de la Recoleta

Description: [action] Spend 1 clue: Test [combat](4) to break into the mansion. You may spend 1 additional clue to reduce the difficulty of this test by 2. If you succeed, look at the revealed side of a concealed mini-card at this location (without exposing it). For every 2 points you succeed by, look at an additional mini-card at this location.
Flavor2: This privately-owned mansion contains many pieces of art that fit the profile of your mark's past robberies. Judging from the ornate architecture, its owners must be important high society types. You're unlikely to be allowed to patrol the area, so you'll have to resort to La Chica Roja's own methods if you play on watching for her here.
Name: Palacio Errázuriz

Description: [fast]: Look at the revealed side of a concealed mini-card at this location (without exposing it). Then, draw the top card of the encounter deck. You may spend 2 clues to cancel this card's effects and discard it.
Flavor2: Officer Bolívar has marked this public administrative building as a potential target for La Chica Roja. Steeped in history, the Cabildo de Buenos Aires likely houses artifacts from the city's colonial era. Perhaps one is a piece of the Key she is assembling?
Name: The Cabildo

Description: Spend X clues and thrice as many resources: Look at the revealed side of X concealed mini-cards at this location (without exposing them).
Flavor2: While you know La Chica Roja isn't after money, Officer Bolívar insists that the largest bank in the city is a prime target.
Name: Banco de la Provincia

Description: [action] Spend 1 clue: Test [willpower](4) to stake out the rafters of the opera house. You may spend 1 additional clue to reduce the difficulty of this test by 2. If you succeed, look at the revealed side of a concealed mini-card at this location (without exposing it). For every 2 points you succeed by, look at an additional mini-card at this location.
Flavor2: Many prolific figures of opera, including the famed Arturo Toscanini, have laid their mark on this gorgeous opera house - easily one of the best in the world. Bolívar can provide you with tickets to the current showing of Aida, but you're probably going to stand out like a sore thumb.
Name: Teatro Colón

Description: Concealed 5. Forced - When an investigator engaged with La Chica Roja moves: Disengage her from that investigator.
Flavor: "Think out your plan like a woman of action. Then act out your plan like a woman of thought."
Name: La Chica Roja

Description:
Hunter.
While attacking Bound Nightgaunt, double the negative modifier of each revealed chaos token.
Flavor: "He had learned that they are bound by solemn treaties..."-H. P. Lovecraft, "The Dream-Quest of Unknown Kadath"
Name: Bound Nightgaunt

Description: Peril. Surge. Revelation - If there is a concealed mini-card at your location, you may expose it. If an enemy's mini-card would be exposed by this effect, instead flip it back over and shuffle it facedown with the concealed mini-cards at your location.
Name: Cat and Mouse

Description: Revelation - Attach to a location without a target, and without a copy of Calling Card attached. While Calling Card is in play, clues cannot be spent (at any location). [reaction] After you successfully investigate attached location by 2 or more: Discard Calling Card. Look at the revealed side of a concealed mini-card at any location (without exposing it).
Name: Calling Card

Description: Revelation - Test [intellect](4). If you fail, you must decide (choose one): - Place 1 doom on the current agenda. This effect can cause the agenda to advance. - The nearest [[Coterie]] enemy attacks you.
Flavor: "Better luck next time!"
Name: Outsmarted

Description: Forced - After a decoy is exposed: Place 1 doom on this agenda. Forced – When this agenda would advance by reaching its doom threshold: Each investigator is defeated and suffers 1 mental trauma. Objective - If the Sanguine Watcher is defeated, advance.
Flavor: Scarlet light drowns the city. Somewhere, La Chica Roja's rival lies in wait, hoping to claim the final pieces of the Key for himself.
Flavor2:
It has taken much investigative work and even more toil, but you and your new ally have finally managed to confront the Coterie elder known only as The Sanguine Watcher. The spell protecting his body has faltered, and he is at your mercy. Heartless, empty eyes gaze back at you from behind his ruby spectacles. "I knew we never should have let you into our fold," he scolds the girl in red. "You are young and insolent. A jester who dons the clothes of a queen. A mockery of our great circle."
"You are the one who gives us a bad name," she barks back. "We are supposed to protect humanity, not torment it. If it were up to me, you would be driven out."
"We shall see." He pulls his ruby glasses down, revealing dark empty sockets where his eyes should be. Scarlet light bounces off the ominous rims resting on the tip of his nose. "Watch your step, girl. Not even your tricks can save you from me." Then, with a thrashing of dark, nightmarish wings, he is snatched from above and carried into the night.
Name: Seeing Red

Description: Retaliate. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if The Sanguine Watcher is ready: Each investigator must either take 2 damage or 2 horror.
Flavor: "You dare get in my way, girl?"
Name: The Sanguine Watcher

Description: Concealed 4. Forced - After Apportioned Ka is exposed: Deal 5 damage to the Sanguine Watcher. Return Apportioned Ka to the shadows and resolve its concealed keyword, distributing those concealed mini-cards as evenly as possible among each non-[[Central]] location without a target.
Name: Apportioned Ka

Description: Shift - Discover 1 clue at your location or a connecting location. Flip this key to its [[Unstable]] side.
Flavor: File #16-D25 / Subject Class: Green / Once assembled, Key appears as small statuette of unidentified woman, weeping trandimensional, red flue ("tears?") of unknown origin.
Name: The Weeping Lady

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is the highest number of clues on a [[Cultist]] enemy in play, to a maximum of 3. (If it is act 3, X is 3.)
[cultist]: –5. You may place 1 doom on the nearest [[Cultist]] enemy to change this token's modifier to a -1.
[tablet]: –3. If you fail, place 1 of your clues on your location.
[elder_thing]: -2. If you fail, place 1 doom on the nearest [[Cultist]] enemy.
Description2:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is the total number of clues on [[Cultist]] enemies in play, to a maximum of 4. (If it is act 3, X is 4.)
[cultist]: –7. You may place 1 doom on the nearest [[Cultist]] enemy to change this token's modifier to a -3.
[tablet]: –4. If you fail, place 1 of your clues on your location.
[elder_thing]: -2. Place 1 doom on the nearest [[Cultist]] enemy.
Name: Dealings in the Dark

Description: Each non-weakness [[Cultist]] enemy gains concealed 1. Forced - After you evade a [[Cultist]] enemy, return it to the shadows and resolve its concealed keyword: Take control of 1 of its clues.
Description2: In player order, each investigator must choose: Either place 1 clue (from the token pool) on Clues Unveiled, or search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Cultist]] enemy and draw it; it gains concealed 1 (if no [[Cultist]] enemy is found, place 1 clue on Clues Unveiled, instead). Shuffle the encounter deck if it is searched. For each eclipse that was on the agenda when it advanced, an investigator must resolve the above effect an additional time. Flip this agenda back over, adding 1 resource to it, as an eclipse. (It keeps each other eclipse it had, as well.)
Flavor: The cult operating in Istanbul is secretive and deadly, with eyes everywhere and ears in every dark corner of the city.
Flavor2: The daylight dims, and you strain your eyes to examine why. A strange, black shape has begun to crawl its way over the outline of the sun. An eclipse? Whatever the cult is up to, you better stop it soon...
Name: Agents of the Dark

Description: Objective - Find the talisman before the cult does! If either the cult, or investigators at any location(s), possess the requisite number of clues as a group, advance. (Do not spend any clues when you advance.)
Description2:
If the investigators reached the clue threshold first:
You discover what you believe to be the talisman's resting place and scramble to find the Key before your adversaries find you. But to your surprise, inside is only an ancient manuscript.
If the cult reached the clue threshold first:
You discover what you believe to be the talisman's resting place and find it already torn apart. Resting on the ground nearby is a torn-up manuscript, which you hastily begin to restore.
In either case: Resolve the concealed keyword on each non-weakness [[Cultist]] enemy not already in the shadows (as granted by agenda la). Shuffle the encounter discard pile and the set-aside Umbral Harbinger and Emissary from Yuggoth enemies into the encounter deck. Proceed to Act 2 Setup in the Campaign Guide.
Flavor: According to Ms. Şahin, the talisman has been hidden somewhere in the city for many hundreds of years. You must not let it fall into the cult's hands!
Name: Search for the Manuscript

Description: Objective - Find the talisman before the cult does! If either the cult, or investigators at the location designated as the east gate, possess the requisite number of clues as a group, advance. (Do not spend any clues when you advance.)
Description2:
If the investigators reached the clue threshold first, attach The Twisted Antiprism key to any investigator at the east gate.
If the cult reached the clue threshold first, attach The Twisted Antiprism key to the [[Cultist]] enemy with the most clues.
Reveal each concealed mini-card in play. For each enemy's mini-card, move that enemy from the shadows to that location. Set each concealed mini-card aside, out of play.
Put the locations from act 1 that were previously set aside back into play, with Hagia Sophia to the left of the entrance to the Grand Bazaar. These two locations are connected to one another for the rest of the scenario. Put Galata Docks into play.
If the cult reached the clue threshold first, for every 1 [per_investigator] more clues they had than the investigators, move the [[Cultist]] enemy with The Twisted Antiprism once toward Galata Docks.
Each investigator and [[Cultist]] enemy loses each of their clues. Flip The Unveiling story card over to its other side, removing all clues from it. Advance the act and agenda deck directly to "The Chase." It is both the current act and the current agenda.
Flavor: According to the manuscript, the talisman was discovered somewhat recently by a third party, and brought to the Grand Bazaar as a valuable item to be sold. You can't let that happen!
Name: Search for the Talisman

Description: Objective - "Get this thing out of here!" If an investigator with The Twisted Antiprism is at Galata Docks, you may proceed to (→R1) (page 25). Objective - "Don't let them get away with the Key!" If an enemy with The Twisted Antiprism is at Galata Docks, or if the investigator with The Twisted Antiprism is defeated, proceed to (→R6) (page 25).
Description2: Each enemy in play moves and attacks as if it were the enemy phase (without exhausting). If there are fewer enemies in play than the number of investigators, in player order, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a [[Cultist]] enemy is discarded, and draw it (shuffling the encounter discard pile to form a new encounter deck if necessary). Repeat this until there are enemies in play equal to the number of investigators. Flip this card back over.
Flavor2: In the dark light of an alien moon, your enemies work tirelessly to escape with the talisman in their possession.
Name: The Chase

Description: Forced - After 1 or more doom is placed on a [[Cultist]] enemy: Flip them to their clue side. If an enemy has more than 3 clues on it, move the clues in excess of 3 to Clues Unveiled, below. The number of clues possessed by the cult is equal to the total number of clues on [[Cultist]] enemies in play plus the number of clues on Clues Unveiled, below.
Name: The Unveiling

Description: You can only enter Galata Docks from Galata. As an additional cost for you to do so, you must discard any combination of cards from your hand or assets from your play area with at least 3 matching skill icons.
Description2: You can only enter Galata Docks from Galata. As an additional cost for you to do so, you must discard any combination of cards from your hand or assets from your play area with at least 3 matching skill icons.
Flavor: With the Foundation's travel documents, you should be able to charter a ship out of the city with ease.
Flavor2: The Galata Bridge spans over the Golden Horn, separating the piers from the rest of the city.
Name: Galata Docks

Description: [fast] Spend 3 resources: Parley. Expose a concealed mini-card at any location. (Group limit once per round.)
Flavor2: The ancient Galata Tower looms over this well-traveled district, where tourists and residents intermingle. You pass several embassies, warehouses, and commercial buildings for businesses both local and foreign. One of the district's older buildings may have once hid the talisman. Perhaps even the famed Galata Tower itself?
Name: Galata

Description: Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating the Obelisk of Theodosius: Move 1 of your clues to the nearest [[Cultist]] enemy.
Flavor2: Originally brought to the city from Egypt by the Romans, the Obelisk looms ominously over Sultanahmet Square. Its inscription commemorates the triumphs of conquerors past.
Name: Obelisk of Theodosius

Description: [action]: Test [willpower] or [intellect] (6). If you succeed, take control of 1 clue on Clues Unveiled. (Max one success per game.)
Flavor2: Housing faculties of theology, arts, mathematics, and science, as well as other recent additions, the newly reconstituted university is as prestigious as its campus is beautiful. If there's anywhere in the city you'll be able to find information regarding relics from its past, it's here.
Name: Istanbul University

Description: Hagia Sophia gets +3 shroud for each study token on it. [action]: Place 1 [per_investigator] clues on Hagia Sophia (from the token pool). Place 1 resource on Hagia Sophia (also from the token pool), as a study token.
Flavor2: Originally built as a cathedral, the Hagia Sophia Grand Mosque is one of the most iconic buildings in the entire world and the epitome of Byzantine architecture. Having survived the city's numerous transformations throughout the ages, this holy place may contain a wealth of information pertinent to your investigation, if you know where to look.
Name: Hagia Sophia

Description: Increase the difficulty to fight or evade each concealed mini-card at this location by 2.
Flavor2: The bustling streets of the bazaar's domed interior are dense with stalls and traders selling all manner of goods, from jewelry and clothes to carpets and furniture. Somewhere in this labvrinthine market lies the Key you and your enemies search tor... but where?
Name: Grand Bazaar

Description: While you are at this location, treat the text box of each [[Weapon]] asset you control as if it were blank (except for [[Traits]]).
Flavor2: The bustling streets of the bazaar's domed interior are dense with stalls and traders selling all manner of goods, from jewelry and clothes to carpets and furniture. Somewhere in this labvrinthine market lies the Key you and your enemies search tor... but where?
Name: Grand Bazaar

Description: [fast]: Parley. Take control of 1 clue from a [[Cultist]] enemy at this location. Then, return that enemy to the shadows and resolve its concealed keyword. (Limit once per round.)
Flavor2: The bustling streets of the bazaar's domed interior are dense with stalls and traders selling all manner of goods, from jewelry and clothes to carpets and furniture. Somewhere in this labvrinthine market lies the Key you and your enemies search tor... but where?
Name: Grand Bazaar

Description: Forced - After you expose a decoy at this location: Move 1 clue from this location to the nearest [[Cultist]] enemy.
Flavor2: The bustling streets of the bazaar's domed interior are dense with stalls and traders selling all manner of goods, from jewelry and clothes to carpets and furniture. Somewhere in this labvrinthine market lies the Key you and your enemies search tor... but where?
Name: Grand Bazaar

Description: Forced - When you would move out of this location: Test [agility] (3). If you fail, you must either lose 1 action or cancel the effects of the move.
Flavor2: The bustling streets of the bazaar's domed interior are dense with stalls and traders selling all manner of goods, from jewelry and clothes to carpets and furniture. Somewhere in this labvrinthine market lies the Key you and your enemies search tor... but where?
Name: Grand Bazaar

Description: [reaction] After you move to this location from a connecting location: Test [agility] (4). If you succeed, move again. Forced - After an enemy moves to this location via hunter or patrol: Resolve that keyword again.
Flavor2: The bustling streets of the bazaar's domed interior are dense with stalls and traders selling all manner of goods, from jewelry and clothes to carpets and furniture. Somewhere in this labvrinthine market lies the Key you and your enemies search tor... but where?
Name: Grand Bazaar

Description: [action]: Investigate. If you succeed, instead of discovering clues, you may play a [[Charm]] or [[Relic]] asset from your hand, reducing its cost by 1 for each point you succeeded by (to a minimum of 0).
Flavor2: The bustling streets of the bazaar's domed interior are dense with stalls and traders selling all manner of goods, from jewelry and clothes to carpets and furniture. Somewhere in this labvrinthine market lies the Key you and your enemies search tor... but where?
Name: Grand Bazaar

Description: [fast] Exhaust Ece Şahin: Look at the top card of any investigator's deck. If it is not a weakness, you may place it facedown beneath Ece Sahin (limit 5 cards beneath her). Forced - After any key is shifted: The owner of each card beneath Ece Şahin draws that card.
Flavor: "Why do you suppose the keys have not been erased?"
Name: Ece Şahin

Description: Hunter. Forced - When Umbral Harbinger is dealt damage: Place 1 doom on the [[Cultist]] enemy nearest to it.
Flavor:
"Trouble with memory. I see things I never knew before. Other worlds and other galaxies….. Dark. The lightning seems dark and the darkness seems light.
-- H. P. Lovecraft, "The Haunter of the Dark"
Name: Umbral Harbinger

Description: Alert. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Sinister Aspirant is ready: Place 1 doom on it.
Flavor:
I have seen the dark universe yawning
Where the black planets roll without aim.
-- H. P. Lovecraft, "The Haunter of the Dark"
Name: Sinister Aspirant (A)

Description: Alert. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Sinister Aspirant is ready: Place 1 doom on it.
Flavor:
I have seen the dark universe yawning
Where the black planets roll without aim.
-- H. P. Lovecraft, "The Haunter of the Dark"
Name: Sinister Aspirant (B)

Description: Alert. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Sinister Aspirant is ready: Place 1 doom on it.
Flavor:
I have seen the dark universe yawning
Where the black planets roll without aim.
-- H. P. Lovecraft, "The Haunter of the Dark"
Name: Sinister Aspirant (C)

Description: Revelation - If there are no [[Cultist]] enemies in play, take 1 horror and Shadowed gains surge. Otherwise, find the [[Cultist]] enemy nearest to you. Place 1 doom on that enemy and test [willpower] (X), where X is that enemy's fight value. If you fail, take 2 horror.
Name: Shadowed

Description: Revelation - If there are no [[Cultist]] enemies in play, take 1 damage and Accosted gains surge. Otherwise, find the [[Cultist]] enemy nearest to you. Place 1 doom on that enemy and test [agility] (X), where X is that enemy's evade value. If you fail, take 2 damage.
Name: Accosted

Description: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Place 1 doom on the [[Cultist]] enemy in play with the highest evade. - Take 1 damage and 1 horror. If the investigators possess more clues than the cult, or if it is act 3, resolve this revelation ability a second time.
Name: Light Out of Void

Description: Shift - Look at the top 3 cards of your deck. Draw 1 of those cards and shuffle the rest back into your deck. Flip this key to its [[Unstable]] side.
Flavor: File #21-F30 / Subject Class: Red / Key is a trapezohedron-shaped crystal of unknown mineral, roughly 19 cm in length, impervious to both matter and light.
Name: The Twisted Antiprism

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is the number of enemies in the shadows (max 3).
[cultist]: –4. If you fail, put a decoy into play at your location, flip it over, and shuffle each concealed mini-card at your location facedown.
[tablet]: –3. If you fail, set each non-weakness card committed to this test aside, out of play, as a hollow.
[elder_thing]: –1. If there is a concealed mini-card at your location, either take 1 damage or treat this token's modifier as –3.
Description2:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is the number of enemies in the shadows (max 5).
[cultist]: –6. If you fail, put a decoy into play at your location, flip it over, and shuffle each concealed mini-card at your location facedown.
[tablet]: –3. Set each non-weakness card committed to this test aside, out of play, as a hollow.
[elder_thing]: –1. If there is a concealed mini-card at your location, either take 2 damage or treat this token's modifier as –5.
Name: Dancing Mad

Description: Forced – If there are 5 [per_investigator] or more set-aside hollows: Choose and remove 3 [per_investigator] of them from the game and place 1 doom on this agenda. This effect may cause this agenda to advance.
Description2: The lead investigator must decide (choose one): - Search the encounter deck and discard pile for an enemy with the concealed keyword and draw it (resolving its concealed keyword). Shuffle the encounter deck. - Reveal the top card of each investigator's deck. Each investigator draws each weakness they revealed in this way. Set each other revealed card aside, out of play, as a hollow.
Flavor: A gentle patter of rain gives the moonless night a somber, moody ambience. Distant music and conversation drift on the wind, accompanied by a light drizzle.
Flavor2: A flash of lightning draws your attention to the sky. Or, is it even lightning at all? Clouds and distorted space roll through the gloom of night. A shimmer. A blur. A blemish. And then one of the roiling clouds simply vanishes. Perhaps it was just your imagination. But something feels... strange. Is it possible the creatures you spotted in London could devour even the sky itself?
Name: Silence Speaks

Description: Forced – If there are 4 [per_investigator] or more set-aside hollows: Choose and remove 2 [per_investigator] of them from the game and place 1 doom on this agenda. This effect may cause this agenda to advance.
Description2: The lead investigator must decide (choose one): - Search the encounter deck and discard pile for an enemy with the concealed keyword and draw it (resolving its concealed keyword). Shuffle the encounter deck. - Reveal the top card of each investigator's deck. Each investigator draws each weakness they revealed in this way. Set each other revealed card aside, out of play, as a hollow.
Flavor: Being hunted by the Coterie was bad enough; now you worry any random object you pass on the street, or even the sky itself, could simply swallow you whole, never to be seen or heard from again.
Flavor2: As if possessed by a strange compulsion, your eyes continuously drift to the clouds obscuring the starless night sky. Every now and again, one cloud haunts your sight. The same cloud, every time. Its shape burns into your retina. Are you going mad? Your eyes trace around its outline. It cannot be the same. You saw the flash that caused that cloud to vanish. Didn't you?
Name: Easy Prey

Description: Forced – If there are 3 [per_investigator] or more set-aside hollows: Choose and remove 1 [per_investigator] of them from the game and place 1 doom on this agenda. This effect may cause this agenda to advance.
Description2: Remove each hollow from the game. Gather each hollow that was removed from the game throughout this scenario. Each investigator finds their hollow with the highest experience cost and exiles it. In the Campaign Log, record erased from existence: and next to this, record the names of each unique card exiled in this way. For the rest of the campaign, players cannot include any copies of those cards (by title) in their decks (immediately remove any copies from each investigator's deck). (→R2) (page 31)
Flavor: The city is alive. Not alive in its usual sense - music and revelry and glamor - but truly, disturbingly alive. The streets shift under your feet, walls undulating as though breathing, windows glaring at you from afar. Sweat beads on your forehead. Is this all real? Or just paranoia?
Flavor2:
You stop in your tracks, taking stock of your surroundings. The joyous noise of Havana has returned. A stillness has settled over the city. No more eyes in the shadows. No more familiar clouds. Stars twinkle above, mocking your suspicion with their charming beauty. Desi and his crew are nowhere to be found. And, worse...
There are sudden gaps in your memory.
Name: A Betrayal of Eyes

Description: [action]: Resign. "The deal's off!" You leave Desi and his crew to their fate. Forced - If Desiderio Delgado Álvarez leaves play: Set him aside, out of play. Each investigator takes 1 horror.
Description2: If the Desiderio Delgado Álvarez story asset is in play, set him aside, out of play (removing all tokens and attachments from him). Find the set-aside Desiderio Delgado Álvarez enemy with the encounter card back. The lead investigator draws that enemy, resolving his concealed keyword. One at a time, in player order, each other investigator chooses a different set-aside [[Coterie]] enemy and draws it, resolving its concealed keyword. Shuffle the encounter discard pile and the remainder of the Crimson Conspiracy and Cleanup Crew encounter sets into the encounter deck.
Flavor: You and Desi are looking into the disappearances taking place in Havana. It has to be the work of the creatures you were investigating back in London. But they haven't been forgotten yet - maybe there is a way to bring them back?
Flavor2: "There's something off about all of this..." Desi remarks as you patrol the rainy streets of Havana. "I swear, I keep seeing something following us, but when I look-" Fate must have a sense of cosmic irony, as the moment Desi turns around, a formless shape not unlike a distortion in reality opens its gaping maw and swallows him whole. You shout his name in terror... but to your surprise, the distortion reshapes itself in his image. The imposter gives you a sinister grin before vanishing into the shadows, taking the real Desi with him.
Name: False Step (v. I)

Description: [reaction] When an investigator would resolve an enemy's concealed X keyword, spend X clues, as a group: Spawn it engaged with that investigator instead. [action]: Resign. You leave Desi and his crew to their fate. Objective - If there are no enemies in the shadows, investigators may spend the requisite clues to advance.
Description2: Ready the Desiderio Delgado Álvarez enemy, remove all tokens from him, and discard all attachments from him. Find the previously set-aside Desiderio Delgado Álvarez story asset, flip him to his enemy side, and spawn him at the same location as the one in play, randomizing them so you do not know which is which.
Flavor: Wait - what in the world just happened? That entity touched Desi and assumed his form. Is that what has been happening to Desi's crew? You have to find him before it finishes the job!
Flavor2:
It's clear now what has been happening to Desi's crew. They are being snatched by the very same entities you and Flint had been investigating and replaced by deadly imposters. But their true objective seems to be eliminating the evidence of their mimicry. Are they trying to infiltrate the Coterie from within? Are these creatures truly intelligent enough for such a scheme?
Whatever the case may be, you've tracked down the imposter. Desi is in danger of being erased from existence, or worse. You're not sure you can trust him, but you have to do something to help.
Name: False Colors (v. I)

Description: Forced – At the end of the enemy phase: Deal X total damage to investigators at Café Luna, divided as they wish. X is the number of enemies in the shadows. [reaction] After a [[Coterie]] enemy takes any amount of damage: Discover half that many clues at Café Luna (rounded down).
Description2:
Shuffle the encounter discard pile and each set-aside [[Outsider]] enemy into the encounter deck.
If Desiderio Delgado Álvarez is not in the shadows, return him to the shadows and resolve his concealed keyword.
Put each set-aside [[Havana]] location into play.
Take each concealed mini-card in play, shuffle them, and randomly distribute them as evenly as possible among each location other than Café Luna.
Flavor: Negotiations didn't go so well after all.
Flavor2: With a bit of stealth, a bit of speed, and a lot of luck, you manage to make your way out the club's back entrance and into the streets of Havana. The gunfire continues for a few seconds, then ceases once your attackers realize you're no longer inside. Over the pounding of your heart in your chest, you listen closely for voices and hear Desi's, broken and uneven, on the other side of the building. "Find them — and when you do — end them," he orders. The sound of his voice grates against your mind. "They must not be allowed — to escape." Footsteps pound on the pavement as they split up in search of you.
Name: False Step (v. II)

Description: [action] As a group, investigators at your location place clues they control on a [[Coterie]] enemy at your location equal to that enemy's remaining health: Parley. You gain some insight into the situation. Remove all doom from that enemy and automatically evade it. [action]: Resign. "I thought we had a deal!" You get out of the city while you still can. Objective – Discover why your contacts are after you. If there are 4 [per_investigator] total clues among enemies in play, advance.
Description2:
Reveal each concealed mini-card in play. For each enemy's mini-card, move that enemy from the shadows to that location. Then, set each concealed mini-card aside, out of play.
Ready the Desiderio Delgado Álvarez enemy, remove all tokens from him, and discard all attachments from him. Spawn the other set-aside Desiderio Delgado Álvarez enemy at the same location as the one in play, randomizing them so you do not know which is which.
Remove all clues from each enemy in play. For each clue removed from an enemy in this way, heal 1 damage from that enemy.
Flavor: Desi and his crew are pursuing and attacking you everywhere you go! But why?
Flavor2: From your encounters with Desi's crew, you believe you've made a startling discovery. Their mannerisms don't appear to be their own, and their hostility is feral, alien. But it is the very slight distortion that occasionally follows in their wake that leads to your realization. The people who attacked you weren't Desi and his crew at all. They were taken by the entities you and Flint had been investigating and replaced by deadly imposters. But perhaps the real Desi is still out there, somewhere. If so, he's definitely in danger!
Name: False Colors (v. II)

Description: Each copy of Desiderio Delgado Álvarez loses concealed X, loses hunter, gains aloof, and gains the following ability: "[action]: Parley. Check the Campaign Log. If the cell knows Desi's past, you ask a question only he can answer. Look at the other side of this enemy." Objective – If either copy of Desiderio Delgado Álvarez is defeated, advance. (Do not look at its other side.)
Description2: For the remainder of the campaign, do not look at the other sides of either copy of Desiderio Delgado Álvarez until you are instructed to do so. Find the copy of Desiderio Delgado Álvarez that is in play (if both copies are in the victory display, return one to play). Store this copy of Desiderio Delgado Álvarez in a safe place where you may refer to it later in the campaign. (→R1) (page 31)
Flavor: You arrive just in time to see two exact replicas of Desiderio embroiled in a deadly battle for the fate of his identity. In the midst of this chaos, it's impossible to tell which is which. There is no time to study their mannerisms. You have to act!
Flavor2: Your intervention gives the Desi you suspect is real just enough time to gain the advantage. While you had been pulling your punches, Desi has no such qualms. He shoves his firearm in his imposter's stomach and pulls the trigger. The other Desi collapses, lifeless, to the floor. Blood pools from his bullet wound and soaks his body crimson. Desi spits on the corpse of the mimic. "Púdrete en el infierno," he mutters under his breath. Then he clasps your shoulder and gives you a grin. "Thanks. I really owe you one." From what you can tell, his mannerisms seem perfectly natural. You breathe a sigh of relief.
Name: False Light

Flavor: Desi's bar offers a variety of drinks and a rich, wild nightlife for both locals and tourists from the States looking to escape the tight grip of Prohibition... or, at least, it used to, before he and his guns shot the place to hell. What in the world is going on here?
Name: Café Luna

Description: [reaction] After you expose a decoy at El Malecón: Expose another concealed mini-card at El Malecón. (Group limit once per round.)
Flavor: A patter of drizzling rain sets a somber mood as you scour the Malecón for any trace of Desi's crew.
Flavor2: The broad roadway along Havana's northern seawall is a perfect place for both public gatherings and clandestine meetings. Could the Coterie have agents posted there?
Name: El Malecón

Description: [reaction] After you successfully investigate Jardines de la Tropical by 3 or more: Choose a set-aside hollow. Its owner draws it. Forced – After you fail by 3 or more while investigating Jardines de la Tropical: Choose a non-weakness card in your hand and set it aside, out of play, as a hollow.
Flavor2: When it comes to high society in Havana, nothing is more iconic than this outdoor venue. But if this is one of Desi's haunts, there has to be something else at work here.
Name: Jardines de la Tropical

Description: [fast] During your turn, spend 2 resources: Reduce Gran Teatro de La Habana's shroud by 2 until the end of your turn. (Limit once per turn.)
Flavor2: Nobody else seems to notice the presence swirling above the Teatro Nacional, but you've seen it before, in London. And where such creatures roost, the Coterie is sure to be present, as well. Perhaps you should get tickets and see for yourself.
Name: Gran Teatro de La Habana

Description: [action]: Investigate. Instead of discovering clues, look at the revealed side of a concealed mini-card at Miramar Yacht Club. For every 2 points you succeed by, look at the revealed side of an additional concealed mini-card at Miramar Yacht Club.
Flavor: Desi's crew sure know how to live it up.
Flavor2:
If Desi is a member of the Club, chances are, it's no coincidence. Wherever he and his crew show up, those things are sure to follow. Or is it the other way around?
Only one way to find out for sure.
Name: Miramar Yacht Club

Description: [fast] Take 1 horror: Look at the revealed side of a concealed mini-card at Plaza Hotel or at a connecting location (without exposing it). (Group limit once per round.)
Flavor2: Recently renovated, the famed Plaza Hotel offers all of the modern amenities, and has hosted a variety of famous guests. But recent gossip of living shadows and otherworldly figures prowling its halls at night have you thinking there's more at play here after dark.
Name: Plaza Hotel

Description: Alert. Concealed 1 [per_investigator]. Hunter. Retaliate. Desiderio Delgado Álvarez gets +2 [per_investigator] health. Forced – When Desiderio Delgado Álvarez takes damage during act 1 or 2: Instead, automatically evade him. [reaction] After Desiderio Delgado Álvarez is evaded by 2 or more and there is another copy of him at your location, that copy deals this one 2 damage.
Name: Desiderio Delgado Álvarez

Description: Alert. Concealed 1 [per_investigator]. Hunter. Retaliate. Desiderio Delgado Álvarez gets +2 [per_investigator] health. Forced – When Desiderio Delgado Álvarez takes damage during act 1 or 2: Instead, automatically evade him. [reaction] After Desiderio Delgado Álvarez is evaded by 2 or more and there is another copy of him at your location, that copy deals this one 2 damage.
Name: Desiderio Delgado Álvarez

Description: Revelation – Test [willpower] (4). If you fail, choose an [[Ally]] or [[Item]] asset you control and set it aside, out of play, as a hollow (if you cannot, take 2 horror instead).
Flavor: A false facsimile? Or a paradimensional plot?
Name: Body Snatched

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is the number of [[Hazard]] treacheries in play.
[cultist]: -4. If you fail, choose a non-weakness card in your hand and set it aside, out of play, as a hollow.
[tablet]: –2 (-5 instead if Void Chimera is at your location).
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, look at the top card of your deck. If it is not a weakness, set it aside, out of play, as a hollow.
Description2:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is 1 more than the number of [[Hazard]] treacheries in play.
[cultist]: -5. Choose a non-weakness card in your hand and set it aside, out of play, as a hollow.
[tablet]: –3. If Void Chimera is at your location, you automatically fail, instead.
[elder_thing]: -4. Look at the top card of your deck. If it is not a weakness, set it aside, out of play, as a hollow.
Name: On Thin Ice

Description2: Each investigator chooses an [[Ally]] or [[Item]] asset in their hand or play area and sets it aside, out of play, as a hollow.
Flavor: The prospector's journal described a horrifying predator. Some call the thing stalking the woods a beast, some call it a spirit, and others know it as a shapeshifter. Describing the thing seems to fill each witness with a primal, unspeakable terror.
Flavor2: The frigid landscape fills you with a kind of numbness. At first, you dismiss the feeling as purely physical, a side effect of the cold. It is only when you stop and consider the feeling itself that it dawns on you: the numbness is a result of some strange influence. You are forgetting small moments. Memories of the surrounding area. It is as though your mind itself is being hunted and fed upon.
Name: Lost and Forgotten

Description2: Each investigator chooses an [[Ally]] or [[Item]] asset in their hand or play area and sets it aside, out of play, as a hollow.
Flavor: As you explore the region, you cannot shake the feeling that you are being watched. It as though a thousand eyes are staring directly at you... or perhaps through you. The surrounding forest is filled with a deafening silence.
Flavor2:
During your exploration, you stop and look up at the majestic vista of a nearby mountain range. One of the mountains appears strangely damaged, as though a great fist has punched a hole in the mountainside. Although it is covered in a layer of snow, there is something ominous about the deep, empty pit gouged into the side of the rock. You wonder what horrible thing burst out of the heart of the mountain.
As you stare at the impossible destruction around you, a faint buzzing in the back of your mind sets you on edge. You have a creeping feeling that you have forgotten something, or someone...
Name: Eyes of the Void

Description2: Remove each hollow from the game. Gather each hollow that was removed from the game throughout this scenario. Each investigator finds their hollow with the highest experience cost and exiles it. In the Campaign Log, record erased from existence: and next to this, record the names of each unique card exiled in this way. For the rest of the campaign, players cannot include any copies of those cards (by title) in their decks (immediately remove any copies from each investigator's deck). (→R4) (page 35)
Flavor: The landscape around you is being actively devoured, stolen from existence and memory. A feeling of numbness spreads through you as you stare at the fading wilderness. An uncanny sense that you are losing your grip on reality nags at the edge of your mind.
Flavor2: Suddenly, a horde of blurred figures coalesces around you. An obscene numbness overtakes your senses as sight blurs and sense splinters. The numbness gives way to bliss as you slip under whatever awful influence has been changing this place. You struggle to hold onto reality, but your awareness drifts to unconsciousness, and you are dragged into a deep, forgetful slumber.
Name: Annihilation

Description: Objective – Only investigators at the Condemned Gold Mine may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.
Description2:
If it is agenda 1:
Ignoring signs warning that the mine is condemned and dangerous, you trace a path to the branch Landry wrote about in his journal and find the Sable Glass buried in the rock. When you emerge, however, you are not alone.
If it is agenda 2 or 3:
As you approach the condemned mine, you see from the broken barricades and tracks in the snow that Thorne and the Coterie have already arrived. Before you can backtrack, two guards emerge from the shadows brandishing shotguns. "Don't move," one of them says.
In either case: Read Scenario Interlude: Raw Deal in the Campaign Guide.
Flavor: Thorne may have a head start in their search for the Sable Glass, but you have something they don't: Rhett Landry's journal. If you can reach the prospector's gold mine before the Coterie, you may be able to keep the Key out of their hands.
Name: Quest for the Sable Glass

Description: [action] If your location has the [[Wilderness]] trait and investigators at your location spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Place 1 resource on your location, as a scouting report. (Limit 1 scouting report per [[Wilderness]] location.) Objective - You may advance at the end of any round. (Hint: You will lure out the predator when you advance. Advance when you believe you are prepared.)
Description2: Spawn Void Chimera (True Form) in the shadows and resolve its concealed keyword, distributing each of those concealed mini-cards as evenly as possible among each [[Wilderness]] location in play. For each location with a scouting report on it, you may look at the revealed side of the concealed mini-card just placed at that location.
Flavor: Thorne said they were trying to track the predator in these woods. Although the beast leaves no trace, you can surely scout the surrounding area before luring it out.
Flavor2: After making what preparations you can, you wait around a campfire. Your very presence in this territory makes you a prime lure for whatever awful predator stalks these woods. Soon enough, you hear a twig snap and see a multitude of glowing eyes watching you from the trees.
Name: If It Bleeds...

Description: Objective – After Void Chimera (True Form) is exposed, advance the act.
Flavor: The shifting, chimeric form of the paradimensional beast flits in and out of view. It is playing games with you, much like a cat plays with a mouse. If you can expose its true form, perhaps you can turn the game on its head and banish it once and for all.
Name: Prowling Nightmare

Description: The location where Void Chimera (True Form) was exposed is connected to Outsiders' Lair (but not vice versa.) Objective – If Void Chimera (True Form) is defeated, advance the act.
Description2: Check which version of Thorne is in play: - If the Thorne story asset is in play, (→R1) (page 35). - If the Thorne enemy is in play, (→R2) (page 35). - If Thorne is not in play, (→R3) (page 35).
Flavor: Your prey has trapped you in its own lair. The alien beast unveils itself in all its otherworldly grandeur, looming over you in myriad, amorphous forms.
Flavor2: As you land a final blow, the shifting, violent thing collapses into itself with a noisome cacophony and a sudden suction of air. As its form crumbles, the strange otherworld around you also begins to disintegrate, and you find yourself drawn back to reality in a rush of static and ozone.
Name: Last Stand

Description: [action]: Choose a set-aside hollow. Its owner draws it. (Limit once per round.) [action]: Resign. "I thought Alaska was supposed to be nice this time of year!"
Flavor2: Anchorage bustles with excitement brought on by the gold rush. Almost every street you walk down has a new façade under construction. The sheer number of rugged pioneer folk walking the streets makes you feel out of place in your everyday clothes.
Name: Anchorage

Description: [reaction] When an investigator at Fairbanks draws a [[Hazard]] treachery: Spend 2 resources to cancel that treachery's effects and discard it.
Flavor:
All around me I sensed a queer coldness in the demeanor of my neighbors, my friends.
 - Virgil Gray, "In the Court of the Outsiders"
Flavor2: Fairbanks is the perfect place to replenish your supplies and research routes to the gold mine.
Name: Fairbanks

Description: Forced - After you enter Mountain Stream: Test [intellect] or [agility] (1). If you fail, take 1 damage. Forced - After the last clue is discovered from Mountain Stream: Put the 3 set-aside Outer Wilderness locations into play adjacent to it.
Flavor: Crossing the cracking ice is incredibly dangerous, but you have little other choice.
Flavor2: The bleak splendours of these remote and lonely forests rather overwhelmed him with the sense of his own littleness. - Algernon Blackwood, The Wendigo
Name: Mountain Stream

Description: Forced - After an investigator at this location reveals a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], or [elder_thing] symbol during a skill test they are performing: They must either choose and discard 1 card from their hand, or take 1 horror.
Flavor2: The bleak splendours of these remote and lonely forests rather overwhelmed him with the sense of his own littleness. - Algernon Blackwood, The Wendigo
Name: Frozen Lake

Description: The first [[Hazard]] treachery revealed by an investigator at this location each round gains surge.
Flavor: The silence of the vast listening forest stole forward and enveloped them. - Algernon Blackwood, The Wendigo
Flavor2: The bleak splendours of these remote and lonely forests rather overwhelmed him with the sense of his own littleness. - Algernon Blackwood, The Wendigo
Name: Isolated Road

Description: [action]: Draw 3 cards. (Limit once per game.)
Flavor: While hardly large enough to qualify as a town, this small settlement feels like a bastion of comfort after days on end of trying wilderness.
Flavor2: In the draughts of night that poured their silent tide from the depths of the forest, with messages from distant ridges and from lakes just beginning to freeze, there lay already the faint, bleak odors of coming winter. - Algernon Blackwood, The Wendigo
Name: Forgotten Outpost

Description: Forced - When you reveal Hunter's Lodge: Test [willpower] or [intellect] (3) to talk the hunter down. If you fail, take 1 damage. Forced - When a [[Monster]] enemy enters this location: Deal 1 damage to it.
Flavor: And here you thought the Outsiders were the dangerous ones.
Flavor2: In the draughts of night that poured their silent tide from the depths of the forest, with messages from distant ridges and from lakes just beginning to freeze, there lay already the faint, bleak odors of coming winter. - Algernon Blackwood, The Wendigo
Name: Hunter's Lodge

Description: [action]: Reveal 1 random chaos token from the chaos bag plus 1 additional token for each depletion token on Condemned Gold Mine. If you did not reveal any [skull], [cultist], [tablet], or [elder_thing] symbols in this way, gain 4 resources and place 1 resource (from the token pool) on Condemned Gold Mine, as a depletion token.
Flavor2: In the draughts of night that poured their silent tide from the depths of the forest, with messages from distant ridges and from lakes just beginning to freeze, there lay already the faint, bleak odors of coming winter. - Algernon Blackwood, The Wendigo
Name: Condemned Gold Mine

Description: Hunter. Retaliate. Thorne gets +2 [per_investigator] health. Forced - After a [[Hazard]] treachery is drawn: Thorne shifts each of their attached keys. Forced - When Thorne is defeated: If The Sable Glass is attached to Thorne, attach it to any investigator, under that investigator's control.
Name: Thorne

Description: Concealed 4. Massive. You cannot expose any concealed mini-cards while one of Void Chimera's other forms is in play. Forced - After you expose one of Void Chimera's decoys: Find the set-aside version of Void Chimera with the matching subtitle and spawn it at your location.
Name: Void Chimera

Description: Patrol ([[Wilderness]] location with the most investigators). Retaliate. Void Chimera (Fellbeak) gets +1 [per_investigator] health.
Flavor: The beast's exquisite plumage is quite literally stunning.
Name: Void Chimera

Description: Alert. Hunter. Void Chimera (Earsplitter) gets +1 [per_investigator] health.
Flavor: The beast's carapace rattles with an unsettling hiss. While much of the sound lies beyond the scope of your hearing, its eerie resonance shakes you to your core.
Name: Void Chimera

Description: Hunter. Void Chimera (Gorefeaster) gets +1 [per_investigator] health. Forced - After Void Chimera (Gorefeaster) attacks you: Look at the top card of your deck. If it is not a weakness, set it aside, out of play, as a hollow, and heal damage from Void Chimera (Gorefeaster) equal to that hollow's printed cost.
Name: Void Chimera

Description: Hunter. Void Chimera (Fellhound) gets +1 [per_investigator] health. While you are attacking or attempting to evade Void Chimera (Fellhound), if you own any set-aside hollows, it gains alert and retaliate.
Name: Void Chimera

Description: Hunter. Retaliate. Spawn - Nearest [[Wilderness]] location. Ravenous Grizzly cannot enter non-[[Wilderness]] locations. While Ravenous Grizzly is moving, it skips over connecting non-[[Wilderness]] locations.
Name: Ravenous Grizzly

Description: Revelation - Put Cracking Ice into play next to the agenda deck. Then, if there are 3 or more copies of Cracking Ice next to the agenda deck, discard them all and each investigator at a [[Wilderness]] location tests [agility] (4). Each investigator who fails must take 1 damage, take 1 horror, or lose 1 action for each point they failed by.
Name: Cracking Ice

Description: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). If you fail, you and each asset with health you control takes 1 direct damage.
Flavor: If you hear that soft roar approaching, it's already too late.
Name: Snowslide

Description: Shift - Look at the revealed side of each concealed mini-card at your location (without exposing them). Flip this key to its [[Unstable]] side.
Flavor: File #33-K31 / Subject Class: Green / Subject is a warped lens of indeterminate translucent material. Layer appears as window to other layers when viewed through lens.
Name: The Sable Glass

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –1 (-3 instead if you are at a location with a Key Locus).
[cultist]: –3. If you fail, either take 1 damage and 1 horror, or place 1 doom on the nearest Key Locus or [[Locus Site]] location.
[tablet]: –2. If this is an attack against an enemy with patrol, after this attack, it disengages and resolves its patrol keyword.
[elder_thing]: -2. For each point you fail by, lose 1 resource (max 3).
Description2:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –2 (-4 instead if you are at a location with a Key Locus).
[cultist]: –5. If you fail, either take 1 damage and 1 horror, or place 1 doom on the nearest Key Locus or [[Locus Site]] location.
[tablet]: –2. If this is an attack against an enemy with patrol, after this attack, it attacks you, disengages, and resolves its patrol keyword.
[elder_thing]: -3. For each point you fail by, lose 1 resource.
Name: Dogs of War

Description: Each enemy loses hunter and gains patrol (nearest location with a Key Locus). While there are no other Key Locuses in play, The Claret Knight counts as a Key Locus for the purpose of card abilities. When checking the doom threshold, doom on cards other than this agenda subtract from the total doom in play instead of adding to it. Objective - Defend the Knight! If The Claret Knight is defeated, advance this agenda.
Description2:
If this agenda advanced by reaching its doom threshold:
The storm rages on. Doors batter and foundations shake. The Key Locuses dim. You've stood your ground for as long as you can. Weary and terrified that you have chosen an impossible course, you and your unlikely Coterie allies retreat to the Claret Knight's office as a last line of defense. The mood is tense and quiet. Any moment you suspect the Beast or its devotees will tear down the door and turn this chamber into a bloodbath...
Advance the act.
If The Claret Knight was defeated:
The storm rages on. Doors batter and foundations shake. The Key Locuses have failed. You've stood your ground for as long as you could. Weary and terrified that you have chosen an impossible course, you are forced to lay low for a moment to lick your wounds. That is when the Beast strikes...
(→R3) (page 42)
Flavor: The Beast is coming to claim its due...
Name: Brewing Catastrophe (v. I)

Description: While there are no other Key Locuses in play, The Bourse counts as a Key Locus for the purpose of card abilities.
Description2:
The investigators must decide (choose one):
- Each surviving investigator immediately takes 1 direct damage and suffers 1 physical trauma. Flip this agenda back over and place 10 doom on it.
- Each surviving investigator immediately resigns.
Flavor: You've refused the offer of the Coterie agent who appears to control things in Alexandria, and instead teamed up with a local Foundation operative, Hossam Sirry, who hopes to see the Coterie ousted from the city. With any luck, you can claim the Key here for yourself as well, killing two birds with one stone.
Flavor2: The storm rages on. Doors batter and foundations shake. You have tried your damnedest, but the Claret Knight - and thus the last of the Key Locuses preventing you from acquiring your prize - still stands. With the supernatural storm growing more and more potent, and the rest of the Coterie mobilizing for all-out war with one another, you don't think you'll get another chance like this. Perhaps it would be better to retreat and lay low.
Name: Brewing Catastrophe (v. II)

Description: While there are no other Key Locuses in play, Catacombs of Kom el Shoqafa counts as a Key Locus for the purpose of card abilities.
Description2:
The investigators must decide (choose one):
- Each surviving investigator immediately takes 1 direct damage and suffers 1 physical trauma. Flip this agenda back over and place 10 doom on it.
- Each surviving investigator immediately resigns.
Flavor: In your pursuit of Alexandria's Key, you are on the trail of the Beast in a Cowl of Crimson, a Coterie member so dangerous and chaotic, even the rest of the Coterie fears its wrath. Its bloody rampage has sent the entire city into a state of terror.
Flavor2: The storm rages on. Doors batter and foundations shake. You have tried your damnedest, but the Beast in a Cowl of Crimson is too dangerous and too agile to pin down. So long as its lair remains undisturbed - and thus the last of the Key Locuses still standing - you cannot reclaim the creature's Key. With teh supernatural storm growing more and more potent and the Beast's devotees growing bolder and stronger by the hour, you don't think you'll get another chance like this. Perhaps it would be beter to retreat and lay low.
Name: Brewing Catastrophe (v. III)

Description: During the "enemies attack" step of the enemy phase, in addition to their standard attacks, each ready enemy attacks each Key Locus at its location as if it were an engaged investigator. Horror dealt by these attacks is dealt as damage, instead. Objective - Defend the Key and hold out for as long as you can. (The agenda represents how long you must defend it. You will be instructed when to advance.)
Description2: Add The Beast in a Cowl of Crimson to the victory display. Add each Key Locus in play to the victory display. (→R1) (page 42)
Flavor: You've agreed to help The Claret Knight and his enforcers defend his Key from another member of the Coterie - the Beast in a Cowl of Crimson.
Flavor2: ...But when the storm passes, you still stand, and the Light of Pharos is safe. Your host orders several of his agents to track down the Beast's whereabouts, and you are surprised to find that it has fled the city. "We're safe," one of them says, letting out a held breath. "We're finally safe."
Name: Rabbits Who Run (v. I)

Description: Objective - If The Claret Knight is defeated, or if an investigator controls The Light of Pharos, advance.
Description2:
If the investigators took control of the Light of Pharos:
You safely enter the office where you met with the Coterie earlier and crack open the vault. The light inside shines on undisturbed. You snatch the Key from its resting place and abscond before the rest of the knight's enforcers catch up to you.
(→R2) (page 42) If the investigators defeated The Claret Knight:
"Fools," the knight utters, clutching his side. "Do you not understand? We are the last guardians of humanity. Without us..." Cutting him off, several of his bodyguards suddenly rushing into the chamber, but they are too late to stop you. Rather than confront you, they pull their leader to safety. "You will pay for this," the elderly man shouts through a barrage of coughs as he is escorted off the premises. "We will pay for this."
(→R2) (page 42)
Flavor:
"The Bourse is their base of operations," Agent Sirry summarizes what you know before you put your plan into action. "If we're going to confront the Coterie, we have to first destroy the Key Locuses scattered around the city. Otherwise, we don't stand a chance."
You nod, recalling what the Claret Knight told you earlier. If you can find and destroy these locuses, you can enter The Bourse once more.
Name: Rabbits Who Run (v. II)

Description: Objective - If The Beast in a Cowl of Crimson is defeated, or if an investigator controls The Light of Pharos, advance.
Description2:
If the investigators took control of the Light of Pharos:
You sneak carefully through the catacombs, searching for the place where the Beast has hidden the Light of Pharos. Eventually, you find a hidden passage leading to a tomb much deeper beneath the city. Inside, a telltale glow emanates from the cracks of an ancient sarcophagus. You push off the stone lid and claim the Key from within, fleeing before the Beast realizes what you have done.
If the investigators defeated the Beast in a Cowl of Crimson:
The Beast lets out a sinister growl and retreats, leaving a trail of ichorous blood in its wake. You could pursue it, but your prize lies deeper in the catacombs, and besides, you worry how dangerous such a creature might become when cornered...
In either case: Check the Campaign Log: - If the cell made a deal with the Claret Knight, (→R5) (page 43) - If the cell is assisting Agent Sirry, (→R6) (page 43)
Flavor: Somewhere in the city, the Beast dwells in its lair, sending its devotees to the streets to spill blood and kidnap victims to feast upon. If you are to stop this bloodbath, you'll have to first destroy the Key Locuses scattered around the city which protect the Beast's lair. Only then can you retrieve the Key it has stolen and drive the Beast from Alexandria.
Name: Rabbits Who Run (v. III)

Description:
Unless The Claret Knight is the only Key Locus in play, enemies cannot enter The Bourse (if an enemy would spawn here, spawn it at a connecting location instead).
[action] Investigators at The Bourse spend 1[per_investigator] clues, as a group: Remove 1 doom from any location or from an asset you control. Any player may trigger this ability.
Description2: The entrance to the offices is secure. Unless The Claret Knight is the only Key Locus in play, enemies cannot enter The Bourse (if an enemy would spawn here, spawn it at a connecting location instead).
Flavor2: The stock exchange building in Alexandria is more than just a place of business, it seems - it is also the Claret Knight's chosen hiding place for the Key you are searching for.
Name: The Bourse

Description: [action]: Test [willpower] or [agility] (4). If you succeed, investigators at this location may spend 1 [per_investigator] clues as a group, to place 1 resource on the Light of Pharos. Then, if there are 3 resources on the Light of Pharos, choose an investigator at this location to take control of it.
Description2: The entrance to the offices is guarded. You cannot enter The Bourse unless it is the only Key Locus in play.
Flavor2: It seems the Coterie has set up shop in Alexandria's stock exchange building. What better place to hide than in plain sight?
Name: The Bourse

Description: [action]: Investigate. If you succeed, instead of discovering clues, gain 4 resources. You may reduce the difficulty of this test by 2. If you do, gain 2 fewer resources if you succeed. (Group limit once per round.)
Flavor2: The Bourse is the site of Alexandria's stock exchange, cementing the city as a major economic center for Egypt. It is a bustling place during the day, with many carriages and automobiles parked nearby at all hours, and dozens of people entering and exiting.
Name: The Bourse

Description:
While you are at Windsor Palace Hotel...
- ...if there is a Key Locus here, increase the cost of each [[Item]] or [[Ally]] asset you play by 1.
- ...if there is no Key Locus here, reduce the cost of each [[Item]] or [[Ally]] asset you play by 1.
Flavor2: Established along the coast, the Windsor Palace is one of the finest hotels in the city, serving its elite. If there is anywhere Coterie envoys might be hiding, this is it. According to your intel, it's also the hiding place of one of the Claret Knight's supposed "loci."
Name: Windsor Palace Hotel

Description: [reaction] When you would draw exactly 1 card from your deck while you are at Victoria College: Instead, look at the top 2 cards of your deck, choose 1 to draw, and shuffle the other back into your deck. (Limit once per round.)
Flavor2: Founded just two decades ago, the college is home to many importand and well-to-do students. Your intel indicates that one of the Claret Knight's loci might have moved recently - it wouldn't be a surprise to you if this was the chosen site.
Name: Victoria College

Description: Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating Qaitbay Citadel: You cannot discover clues or expose concealed mini-cards at Qaitbay Citadel for the remainder of the round.
Flavor2: One of the most important historical strongholds along the Mediterranean, the Citadel was built on the site of the ancient and famed Lighthouse of Alexandria.
Name: Qaitbay Citadel

Description: Forced - After The Corniche is successfully investigated: Increase the difficulty of each other test performed at The Corniche this round by 2.
