Flavor2: Waves crash against the road that runs along Alexandria's coast, spilling water into the streets. A hub of activity, many streets intersect with the Corniche along its lengthy route - perhaps the perfect hiding place for a Key Locus?
Name: The Corniche

Description: Forced - When you fight an enemy while at Zen'et el Settat: You must either spend 1 action or increase that enemy's fight by 2 for this attack.
Flavor2: This busy, crowded marketplace is known for its twisting streets, bustling shops, and grisly past. You can't help but dart your eyes between the many alleys and hiding places along these narrow streets as you search for the Key Locus tucked away here.
Name: Zen'et el Settat

Description: [action]: Test [willpower] or [agility] (4). If you succeed, investigators at this location may spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group, to place 1 resource on the Light of Pharos. Then, if there are 3 resources on the Light of Pharos, choose an investigator at this location to take control of it.
Description2: The way into the catacboms is hidden. You cannot enter the Catacombs of Kom el Shoqafa unless it is the only Key Locus in play.
Flavor2: The necropolis is home to several prominent dead, but is also the lair of something far more terrifying.
Name: Catacombs of Kom el Shoqafa

Description: [action]: Test [willpower] (6). If you succeed, automatically evade The Beast in a Cowl of Crimson (regardless of its current location). (Group limit once per game.)
Description2: The way into the catacboms is blocked. You cannot enter the Catacombs of Kom el Shoqafa. The Beast in a Cowl of Crimson cannot leave Catacombs of Kom el Shoqafa. Forced - If there is 6 or more doom on the current agenda: Reveal Catacombs of Kom el Shoqafa.
Flavor: The interior of the necropolis is covered in scorch marks and lined with streaks of dried blood. What in the hell happend here....?
Name: Catacombs of Kom el Shoqafa

Description: [action]: Investigate. If you succeed, instead of discovering clues, draw 3 cards. You may reduce the difficulty of this test by 2. If you do, draw 1 fewer card if you succeed. (Group limit once per round.)
Flavor2: Kom el Shoqafa - meaning Mound of Shards - is the site of many tombs, statues and other ancient relics, a conflux of Egyptian, Roman, and Greek influencers. It is now partially underwater and closed to the public. Who knows what other secrets lie buried within?
Name: Catacombs of Kom el Shoqafa

Description: You may attack Key Locus as if it were an enemy with 4 fight. [action] Spend 1 clue: Deal 2 damage to Key Locus. Forced - If Key Locus is defeated: Add it to the victory display.
Name: Key Locus

Description: Forced - After you fail a skill test while at The Claret Knight's location, if he is ready: He shifts each of his attached keys.
Flavor: "I do not involve myself in the matters of mice."
Name: The Claret Knight

Description: Patrol (nearest location with a Key Locus). Retaliate. Forced - When The Beast in a Cowl of Crimson would be defeated: Instead, heal all damage from it, exhaust it, and move it to Catacboms of Kom el Shoqafa, unengaged.
Name: The Beast in a Cowl of Crimson

Description:
Alert. Hunter. Retaliate.
Scarlet Beast gets +2 fight and -2 evade while it is at a [[Locus Site]] location.
Flavor: A creature of crimson, fueled by blood and instinct. It snarls and eyes you as one might a delicious meal.
Name: Scarlet Beast

Description: Aloof. Patrol (nearest location with a Key Locus). Spawn - Nearest location with a Key Locus. While Coterie Provocateur is ready, investigators at its location cannot attack anything with a title other than Coterie Provocateur.
Name: Coterie Provocateur

Description: Revelation - Attach Locus Pulse to the nearest location with a Key Locus. Each investigator at that location takes 1 damage and 1 horror. Forced - If there is no Key Locus at attached location: Discard Locus Pulse.
Name: Locus Pulse

Description: Shift - Play a card from your hand, at -3 cost. Flip this key to its [[Unstable]] side.
Flavor: File #38-N31 / Subject Class: Yellow / Subject is a crystalline container filled with rippling liquid of unknown origin. Key emits sapphire light and is warm to the touch.
Name: The Light of Pharos

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is half the number of charges on The Shade Reaper, rounded up (X cannot be greater than 6).
[cultist]: -4. If you fail by 2 or more, place 1 charge on The Shade Reaper.
[tablet]: –1. If you are at a location with a [[Geist]] enemy, reveal an additional chaos token.
[elder_thing]: -4. You may place 1 charge on The Shade Reaper to treat this token's modifier as 0 instead.
Description2:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is the number of charges on The Shade Reaper.
[cultist]: -5. Place 1 charge on The Shade Reaper.
[tablet]: –3. If you are at a location with a [[Geist]] enemy, you automatically fail.
[elder_thing]: -6. You may place 1 charge on The Shade Reaper to treat this token's modifier as -3 instead.
Name: Shades of Suffering

Description2: Each investigator loses all of their clues. The lead investigator must decide (choose one): - Discard the [[Ally]] asset in play with the highest printed cost. Test [willpower] (X), where X is that asset's printed cost. If you fail, place charges on The Shade Reaper equal to the discarded asset's printed cost. - Place 1 doom on Tzu San Niang. If it is act 1, advance the act (to act 1b).
Flavor: The city buzzes with spiritual activity. Empty halls resound with footsteps, phantom knocks, voiceless whispers. Some deep pain in this city longs to be known. A wordless dread fills the silence and pervades every moment.
Flavor2: Amidst the throng of a busy street, you see the woman with the red parasol flit past a food stall down a narrow back alley. Following her, you step into an alley filled with a hazy, silvery light. A strange feeling comes over you, and your head swims with alien whispers.
Name: Painful History

Description: If there is only one investigator in the game, this agenda gets +1 doom threshold. Forced - When you engage Tzu San Niang: Investigators at your location must spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group. If they cannot, draw the top card of the encounter deck instead. (Hint: When this agenda advances, Tzu San Niang will harvest a nearby spirit if her location is unknown!)
Description2:
If Tzu San Niang is in play at any location: Tzu San Niang attacks each investigator at her location. Return her to the shadows and resolve her concealed keyword, distributing each of those concealed mini-cards as evenly as possible among each location with a non-weakness [[Geist]] enemy. Flip this card back to agenda 2a.
If Tzu San Niang is in the shadows: Reveal all concealed mini-cards in play and set each decoy aside, out of play. Swap the Tzu San Niang enemy with her concealed mini-card. Place each non-weakness [[Geist]] enemy at her location facedown beneath her, then place 4 charges on The Shade Reaper. If there are no non-weakness [[Geist]] enemies in play, advance the act to act 2b. Otherwise, return Tzu San Niang to the shadows and resolve her concealed keyword, distributing each of those concealed mini-cards as evenly as possible among each location with a non-weakness [[Geist]] enemy. Flip this card back to agenda 2a.
Flavor: The sense that you are not alone grows, and the spirits' wordless screams fill your mind. An oily fog rolls in to choke the streets of Kuala Lumpur in a ghostly aura.
Name: Restless Dead

Description: Each [[Geist]] enemy gain hunter and retaliate and cannot be flipped over. Forced - When doom is placed on this agenda: Remove 1 [[Geist]] enemy from beneath Tzu San Niang and spawn it faceup at her location.
Description2: Each investigator is defeated and suffers 1 mental trauma. (→R3)
Flavor: Tzu San Niang smiles sweetly as she bears down on you. Behind her, a massive shadow moves of its own accord, writhing in fulminant patterns on the wall. "This will be quick," she coos.
Flavor2: Tzu San Niang corners you in a narrow alley, her face heavily shadowed in the harsh evening light. "Don't be afraid," her voice worms its way into your mind. "I do not wish you hard. Quite the opposite, I think we should be friends." She grins and snaps her parasol shut, pointing it directly at you. "Well, 'friend' is a little too kind. You're my new <u>pet</u>." The tip dances with crackling, silvery light, and a torrent of energy tears through the air toward you. As waves of pain wash over you, you fall to your knees, wracked with agony. Tzu San Niang laughs as you lose consciousness.
Name: Fear The Reaper

Description: Objective – Find Tzu San Niang before the agenda advances. When you engage Tzu San Niang, investigators must spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance. If they cannot, return her to the shadows and resolve her concealed keyword.
Description2: Put the set-aside Melati's Shop location into play and reveal it. Disengage each investigator from each enemy engaged with them and move each investigator to Melati's Shop. Read Scenario Interlude: The Bomoh (page 47).
Flavor: The figure holding a red parasol melts into the bustle of the city, but is she aware of your presence? If you can track her to her destination, you may better understand her aims in Kuala Lumpur.
Flavor2: After what feels like hours of searching, you catch the trail of the Lady with the Red Parasol. You follow her down a narrow side-street to the worn façade of an old shop, which she steps inside. Uncertain of the risk she might pose, you wait for her to emerge rather than follow her into a potential trap. However, after some time passes, you grow impatient and step into the shop.
Name: The Lady with the Red Parasol

Description: [[Geist]] enemies cannot leave [[Haunted]] locations. Objective – Quell the restless spirits before they are consumed by Tzu San Niang! At the end of the round, if there are no non-weakness [[Geist]] enemies in play, advance.
Description2:
If there are no enemies facedown beneath Tzu San Niang:
A petite figure emerges from the yellow haze. Tzu San Niang points at you accusingly. "How dare you! You have no right to interfere with my work," she seethes. The parasol in her hand glows with strange energy.
Reveal all concealed mini-cards and remove them from the game. Flip Tzu San Niang to her (Out for Blood) side and spawn her at the location where her mini-card was. Advance the agenda directly to agenda 3a (do not resolve agenda 2b).
If there is at least 1 enemy facedown beneath Tzu San Niang:
A petite figure emerges from the yellow haze. Tzu San Niang smirks as she twirls her parasol overhead. "What is it? You're still thirsty?" she coos, speaking to something you can't see. "They're ready to harvest." The parasol in her hand glows with strange energy.
The lead investigator exposes all concealed mini-cards. Flip Tzu San Niang to her (Out for Blood) side and heal all damage from her. She engages the lead investigator. Advance the agenda directly to agenda 3a (do not resolve agenda 2b).
Flavor: Melati spoke of the great suffering Tzu San Niang has brought to this city. Perhaps by entreating the spirits and laying them to rest, you can stop her from reaping the pain she has sown.
Name: Ghost Light

Description: [reaction] When you are dealt damage and/or horror from Tzu San Niang's forced effect, investigators at your location may spend any number of clues: Cancel that much damage/horror. Objective – If Tzu San Niang is defeated, advance.
Description2: The investigators must decide (choose one): - Use the parasol against her. (→R1) - Let her go. (→R2)
Flavor: The Lady with the Red Parasol has shifted her attention to you. She sings a haunting song as she stalks through the streets. Under any other circumstance, you might find the melody beautiful.
Flavor2:
As Tzu San Niang fires another eldritch beam of crackling light at you, you charge forward, ignoring the pain, and wrest the parasol from her grip. She fights back with all the fury of a cornered animal. Countless souls, all bound in torment to the Key, cry out at once. The woman lets out an ear-piercing scream as the red parasol is wrenched away from her. You step back, brandishing her own weapon.
"A hollow victory," she says haughtily. "I know you don't have the nerve to use my shade against me." She turns to walk away.
Name: Harvester of Woe

Description: [fast] During your turn, pay 2 resources: Move (to a connecting location). (Limit once per turn.) [action] Discard an asset you control from play: Gain resources equal to half the discarded asset's printed cost, rounded down, and remember that you "traded for a kitten." (Group limit once per game.)
Flavor2: This busy railway stop brings in travelers from all over the world, near and far. The recently completed platform now connects Kuala Lumpur to Singapore and Siam.
Name: Kuala Lumpur Station

Description: [action]: Resign. "There's nothing more we can do here." You hastily book passage out of the city. [action] Investigators at this location spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Heal 2 horror. Remember that you "found a cheap memento."
Flavor2: The western wing of the station is veiled in a heavy fog. Glimmering shapes flit to and fro in the haze.
Name: Kuala Lumpur Station

Description: Each investigator at Selangor Club does not collect resources during the upkeep phase. [action] Spend 2 resources: Parley. You enjoy a pleasant meal and drinks. Heal 1 damage and 1 horror from an investigator or [[Ally]] asset at your location. (Limit once per round.)
Flavor2: The Selangor Club attracts all the city's wealthiest clientele, but especially caters to the British imperialists that run much of the export business.
Name: Selangor Club

Description: [action]: Parley. Test [combat] (4) to join the games. If you fail, remember that you "embarrassed the consulate." If you succeed, gain 3 resources. (Max one success per round.)
Flavor: The tight-lipped expatriates become much more trusting once you help their team achieve victory.
Flavor2: The large padang, or square, is a well-manicured lawn used for all sorts of sporting events, from cricket to rugby. Spectators watch the games from either side of the square or from inside the clubhouse.
Name: Selangor Club Padang

Description: [action] Investigators at Melati's Shop spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Remember that you "peered beyond." Look at the revealed side of a concealed mini-card or the other side of a [[Geist]] enemy in play.
Flavor: "When I quiet my mind, I can hear them clearly."
Flavor2: The bomoh's shop is primarily an apothecary, with shelf after shelf filled with dried bundles of herbs and flowers, some ground up in little jars or in alcohol tinctures. Other supplies for the bomoh's practice rest on a bookshelf behind the counter: lime, resin, and a dagger in a wooden sheath.
Name: Melati's Shop

Description:
X is equal to half the charges on The Shade Reaper, rounded up (to a max of 8).
[action] Investigators at Wayang Kulit Theater spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Heal 2 damage. Remember that you "shared a deep pain."
Flavor2: The elaborate shadow puppet shows that take place on stage make this theater a popular attraction. The distinctive puppets are made to cast stylized silhouettes on a backlit screen. The effect gives the impression that the screen is a veil between reality and some shadowy other world.
Name: Wayang Kulit Theater

Description: [action]: Test [agility] (6). Investigators at Tin Mine may spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group, to automatically succeed. If you succeed, draw 2 cards and remember that you "found hidden bones." (Group limit once per game.) Forced - After you fail a skill test while at Tin Mine: Take 1 damage.
Flavor2: Large pits yawn like open mouths in the earth: some are filled with rainwater, some flicker like shuttering eyes in the low light. The supports that hold up the rickety scaffolding that spans the pits are temporary, at best.
Name: Tin Mine

Description: Uncanny Shadow gets +1 [per_investigator] health. [action] Discard 1-3 cards from your hand at random: Parley. Test [willpower] (6). Reduce the difficulty of this test by 1 for each card you discarded as part of this action's cost. If you succeed, flip this card and resolve the text on its other side. Forced - When Uncanny Shadow would be defeated: Flip it over and resolve the text on its other side.
Name: Uncanny Shadow

Description: Uncanny Shadow gets +1 [per_investigator] health. [action] Discard 1-3 cards from your hand at random: Parley. Test [willpower] (6). Reduce the difficulty of this test by 1 for each card you discarded as part of this action's cost. If you succeed, flip this card and resolve the text on its other side. Forced - When Uncanny Shadow would be defeated: Flip it over and resolve the text on its other side.
Name: Uncanny Shadow

Description: Buried Miner gets +1 [per_investigator] health. [action] Take 1-3 horror: Parley. Test [combat] (6). Reduce the difficulty of this test by 1 for each horror you took as part of this action's cost. If you succeed, flip this card and resolve the text on its other side. Forced - When Buried Miner would be defeated: Flip it over and resolve the text on its other side.
Name: Buried Miner

Description: Buried Miner gets +1 [per_investigator] health. [action] Take 1-3 horror: Parley. Test [combat] (6). Reduce the difficulty of this test by 1 for each horror you took as part of this action's cost. If you succeed, flip this card and resolve the text on its other side. Forced - When Buried Miner would be defeated: Flip it over and resolve the text on its other side.
Name: Buried Miner

Description: Slain Foreman gets +1 [per_investigator] health. [action] Discard an asset you control: Parley. Test [intellect] (6). Reduce the difficulty of this test by the printed cost of the asset discarded as part of this action's cost. If you succeed, flip this card and resolve the text on its other side. Forced - When Slain Foreman would be defeated: Flip it over and resolve the text on its other side.
Name: Slain Foreman

Description: Slain Foreman gets +1 [per_investigator] health. [action] Discard an asset you control: Parley. Test [intellect] (6). Reduce the difficulty of this test by the printed cost of the asset discarded as part of this action's cost. If you succeed, flip this card and resolve the text on its other side. Forced - When Slain Foreman would be defeated: Flip it over and resolve the text on its other side.
Name: Slain Foreman

Description: Revelation - Place 1 charge on The Shade Reaper. Test [willpower] (3) (6 instead if there are 8 or more charges on The Shade Reaper). If you fail, you must either discard 1 card from your hand for each point you fail by, or take 2 damage.
Flavor: "Your pain feeds me."
Name: Excruciate

Description: Peril. Revelation - Either (choose one): - Each investigator takes 1 damage and 1 horror. - Tzu San Niang shifts The Shade Reaper and then places 2 charges on it.
Name: Spirit Harvest

Description: Concealed 2. Forced - When Tzu San Niang would be defeated: Instead, heal all damage from her, remove all doom from play, return her to the shadows, and resolve her concealed keyword, distributing each of those concealed mini-cards as evenly as possible among each location with a non-weakness [[Geist]] enemy.
Name: Tzu San Niang

Description: Shift - Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location. You may move that enemy to a connecting location. You may force that enemy to attack another enemy at its location, dealing its horror as damage. Flip this key to its [[Unstable]] side.
Flavor: File #46-Q27 / Subject Class: Red / Key unknown
Name: The Shade Reaper

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is half the number of locations in play, rounded down.
[cultist]: –4. If you fail, the nearest [[Outsider]] enemy readies, moves once toward you, and attacks you if it is at your location.
[tablet]: –X. X is the number of set-aside hollows you own (max 5).
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, choose a non-weakness card in your hand and set it aside, as a hollow.
Description2:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is the number of locations in play.
[cultist]: –6. If you fail, the nearest [[Outsider]] enemy readies, moves once toward you, and attacks you if it is at your location.
[tablet]: –X. X is 1 plus the number of set-aside hollows you own.
[elder_thing]: -3. Choose a non-weakness card in your hand and set it aside, as a hollow.
Name: Without a Trace

Description: As an additional cost to enter an unrevealed location, investigators at your location must spend 1[per_investigator] clues, as a group. [reaction] After you expose a location: Move to that location (from an adjacent location).
Description2:
Shuffle the set-aside Apocalyptic Presage and Protoplasmic Reassembler enemies into the encounter deck.
The investigators must choose two options, as a group:
- Each investigator takes 1 damage and 1 horror.
- Each investigator chooses a non-weakness card they control in their hand or play area and sets it aside, out of play, as a hollow.
- Shuffle all concealed mini-cards facedown, then place them at random in the positions they were in.
Flavor: Beyond our reality, in the dimension known only to the forgotten and the forsaken, lies the preposterous City of Remnants - the home world of the Outsiders themselves.
Flavor2: Whirlwinds of cosmic dust swirl throughout the alien sky, threads of radiant starlight and tempests of gravity-defying rubble shifting, churning, rearranging. Every inch of this place is a deliberate act of insanity, a premeditated manipulation of your mind, designed to make you lose your sense of self.
Name: Otherworldly Horror

Description: As an additional cost to enter an unrevealed location, investigators at your location must spend 1[per_investigator] clues, as a group. [reaction] After you expose a location: Move to that location (from an adjacent location).
Description2:
The investigators must choose two options, as a group:
- Each investigator takes 1 damage and 1 horror.
- Each investigator chooses a non-weakness card they control in their hand or play area and sets it aside, out of play, as a hollow.
- Shuffle all concealed mini-cards facedown, then place them at random in the positions they were in.
Flavor: The longer you stay in this realm, the more your grip on the world you came from begins to slip. Faces, names, and places all fall through the gaps in your memory. You realize with horror that the power of the Outside goes both ways. Simply being in this realm, even of your own volition, is enough to lose yourself.
Flavor2: The weight of an infinite, dimensionless universe forces you to your knees. You imagine Taylor's "layer cake," layer upon layer upon layer, worlds upon worlds upon wolrds, and yours is the thinnest of all. You are hurtling through barriers humanity was never meant to cross, and if you remain here any longer, you won't even remember where you came from.
Name: Otherworldly Lambs

Description: As an additional cost to enter an unrevealed location, investigators at your location must spend 1[per_investigator] clues, as a group. [reaction] After you expose a location: Move to that location (from an adjacent location). [fast] Take 1 direct damage or 1 direct horror: Look at the revealed side of a concealed mini-card (without exposing it). (Group limit oncer per round.)
Description2:
Each investigator who has not resigned is driven insane, and is never seen or heard from again. All memory of their existence is purged from reality.
If any investigators resigned, those investigators may immediately advance to act 3b.
Flavor: ---- what --- here ---
Flavor2: ---- nothing; ---- forgotten, ----- memory; ---- a promise, ------ drops ever --- ever ---- ever ------ time; -------- all -- once, ----
Name: Otherworldly Slaughter

Description: Objective - Find the heart of the Outsiders' domain. When the Outsiders' Lair is revealed, advance.
Description2: Spawn the set-aside Mimetic Nemesis enemy at Outsiders' Lair, exhausted. Each investigator chooses 2 non-weakness cards in their discard pile and sets them aside, out of play, as hollows. Find the set-aside The Red-Gloved Man story asset and place him with the other set-aside hollows, as a hollow. He is considered to be owned by all of the investigators. If he is the bearer of any keys, do not attach those keys to him.
Flavor: Somewhere in this strange otherworld lies a secret so vital, an ages-old member of the Red Coterie was willing to reach out to you personally to have you help her find this place - the world where all things stolen from memory end up. If the truth is anywhere, it must be here.
Flavor2: As the dark, beating heart of the City of Remnants is a mess of a structure, all black onyx stone and jagged, twisting glass. Hanging throughout the horrid lair is a jumbled nest of chains, fencewire, and alien cables. One of the entities floats in the center of the chamber: a ball of twisted, distorted space with two tendrils of shimmering plasmic light. The tendrils reach down to a humanoid figure in tattered cloth, touching its unconscious mind and pumping something out of it. You step closer and realize with horror that you recognize the covered figure upon the altar - or, at least, you recognize its stark red gloves.
Name: Traversing the Outside

Description: The Red-Gloved Man cannot be discarded or drawn. [action] If Mimetic Nemesis is at your location, spend 1 clue: Deal 2 damage to it. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity from Mimetic Nemesis. Objective - When The Red-Gloved man enters play, advance.
Flavor: You don't truly know what's going on, but you know it can't be good. You have to stop whatever process is happening here - only then can you learn the truth from the man in the red gloves.
Flavor2:
You finally manage to pry the body of the Red-Gloved Man away from the creature's flashing tendrils and drag him off of the altar. He drifts in and out of consciousness as you carry him out of the entity's lair, speaking only nonsense words in an unearthly language. The moment his eyelids open before the alien skies of the Outside, he shudders awake in agony, letting out gasping, pained breaths and clutching the very spot on his forehead where the creature had latched onto him.
You give him a moment to recover before asking him how he got here and what it was doing to him. To his credit, the man does not take long to return to his usual stoic demeanor, adjusting the cuffs of his suit and lowering the brim of his hat to obscure the sweat dripping down his forehead. "Not here," he says. As if on cue, the structure of glass and onyx shudders into ruin and the entity emerges, its tendrils unfolding into a massive, eldritch shape of luminous distortion. "I don't suppose you know a way out of here?" the man asks.
Name: Red Ruin

Description: Each [[Outsider]] enemy loses aloof. Forced - If The Red-Gloved Man is defeated: Remove him from the game. Objective - Time to get the hell out of here! If each surviving investigator has resigned, advance.
Description2: Check which [[Conspirator]] assets are in the victory display. - If both The Red-Gloved Man and Aliki Zoni Uperetria are in the victory display, proceed to (→R1) (page 57). - If The Red-Gloved Man is in the victory display, proceed to (→R2) (page 58). - If Aliki Zoni Uperetria is in the victory display, proceed to (→R3) (page 58). - If neither The Red-Gloved Man nor Aliki Zoni Uperetria are in the victory display, proceed to (→R4) (page 58).
Flavor: The Red-Gloved Man is on your side and answers are finally within reach. But first you must find a way back home... because if you can't, this might become your new home.
Flavor2: You stand at the edge of the platform upon which you arrived in this realm, wondering how to return to your own. There is no sign whatsoever of the ship that fell into the pit below. Perhaps it made its way back. Or perhaps its still falling. You have no way to know for sure, but very few alternatives. Holding your breath, you look away from the bottomless pit, and take a leap of faith...
Name: Escaping the Otherworld

Description: [action]: Resign. Test [willpower] or [agility] (4). If you succeed, you resign, adding each [[Conspirator]] asset you control to the victory display. If you fail, you remain trapped here, and this test gets -1 difficulty until the end of your turn. If each surviving investigator has resigned, immediately advance to act 3b.
Flavor2: Before you lies an otherworldly landscape unlike anything you have ever seen - the twisting, jumbled structures, the alien flora and strange effigies, all of it against a backdrop of familiar architecture and gadgetry both modern and ancient. The ship that led you here teeters on the brink of this eldritch platform for a moment, and then, with a deafening ruckus, plunges into the endless oblivion below.
Name: Court of the Outsiders

Description:
Each [[Outsider]] enemy at this location loses aloof and gets +1 fight and +1 evade.
[fast] If The Red-Gloved Man is the only set-aside hollow: Put him into play under the control of any investigator at Outsiders' Lair.
Description2: Concealed 1. Forced - When you expose this location: - If it is in the left position in the shadows, take 1 damage. - If it is in the middle position in the shadows, choose a non-weakness card in your hand and set it aside, out of play, as a hollow. - If it is on the right position in the shadows, take 1 horror.
Name: Outsiders' Lair

Description: Alert. Hunter. Massive. Retaliate. Forced - When you would deal damage to this enemy: Instead, choose and discard that many set-aside hollows. Forced - At the end of the round: Each investigator at this enemy's location must either choose a non-weakness card in their hand and set it aside, as a hollow, or this enemy attacks them.
Name: Mimetic Nemesis

Description: Massive. Spawn - Location farthest from all investigators. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if this enemy is ready: Spawn the top card of the nearest investigator's deck facedown at its location as a Golem enemy. Golems have: "[[Monster. Outsider.]]\ Hunter. 1 fight, 1 health, 1 evade, 1 damage value. If Golem is defeated, set it aside, out of play, as a hollow."
Name: Protoplasmic Reassembler

Description: [reaction] After you successfully fight or evade an [[Outsider]] enemy by 2 or more, exhaust The Red-Gloved Man: Deal 1 damage to that enemy and discover 1 clue at your location.
Flavor: "The final shift - has it told you what it means?"
Name: The Red-Gloved Man

Description: [reaction] After a concealed mini-card is exposed, exhaust Aliki Zoni Uperetria: Choose a set-aside hollow. Its owner draws it.
Name: Aliki Zoni Uperetria

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is the current act number.
[cultist]: –5. You may flip a [[Stable]] key you control to its [[Unstable]] side to treat this token's modifier as –2, instead.
[tablet]: –2. If this is an attack against a ready [[Outsider]] enemy, you automatically fail, instead.
[elder_thing]: –3. Cancel the effects and icons of each card committed to this test and set each of them aside, out of play, as hollows.
Description2:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is 1 more than the current act number.
[cultist]: –7. You may flip a [[Stable]] key you control to its [[Unstable]] side to treat this token's modifier as –4, instead.
[tablet]: –2. If there is a ready [[Outsider]] enemy at your location, you automatically fail, instead.
[elder_thing]: –4. Cancel the effects and icons of each card committed to this test and set each of them aside, out of play, as hollows.
Name: Congress of the Keys

Description: Forced – When this agenda advances, if it is act 2, 3, or 4: Skip the "b" side of this agenda and proceed directly to agenda 2a.
Description2:
If the current act is Secrets and Lies (v. I):
Leylines of paradimensional energy surround you, threatening to tear you apart.
Each enemy shifts each of their attached keys. Immediately resolve an additional enemy phase (then resume the current phase).
If the current act is Secrets and Lies (v. II):
The portal the red-gloved man opened is almost shut! With no time left to prepare, you leap inside just before it closes.
Place 4 doom on agenda 2a. Advance the act.
If the current act is Secrets and Lies (v. III):
Extradimensional entities surround you, threatening to erase your very existence.
Flip 1 [per_investigator] keys from their [[Stable]] side to their [[Unstable]] side. Immediately resolve an additional enemy phase (then resume with the current phase).
Flavor: A coded message...
Name: Conflux of Consequence

Description2:
Flip each decoy over. Shuffle all concealed mini-cards in play, then place them at random in the positions they were in.
Each investigator takes 2 damage and 2 horror but may either (choose one, or neither):
- Shift an [[Unstable]] key they control without flipping it to its [[Stable]] side to cancel all of the damage and horror just dealt to them by the above effect.
- Flip any number of [[Stable]] keys they control to their [[Unstable]] side to cancel that much damage/horror just dealt to them by the above effect.
Flavor: A coded message...
Flavor2: A peal of thunder resounds across dimensions. In the deep recesses of your mind, the building pressure of infinite forgotten worlds crushes your every sense. Your keys, surging with paradimensional energy, rattle and hum in your hands. Without them, you could scarcely withstand the strain of this realm.
Name: The World Unbidden

Description2: Each investigator is defeated.
Flavor: A coded message...
Flavor2: A coded message...
Name: Running Red

Description: The Red-Gloved Man gains concealed 1 [per_investigator] and cannot be damaged. Objective – At the end of the round, if each investigator is at the same location as The Red-Gloved Man, they may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.
Description2: Remove each location from the game. (Investigators are not defeated during this process. Other enemies and attachments at those locations are discarded, and concealed mini-cards are set aside.) Put The Knotted Tower, Gravity-Defying Climb, and The Towering Vertex locations into play in a straight vertical line, with The Towering Vertex at the top and The Knotted Tower at the bottom. Take the top 3 locations in the Otherworld deck and place them in the shadows, arranged in a line from left to right. Take the 3 City of Remnants mini-cards, shuffle them facedown, and arrange them around The Knotted Tower as follows: One to its left, one to its right, and one below. Place each investigator at The Knotted Tower and The Red-Gloved Man enemy at the Towering Vertex. Remove the encounter deck and encounter discard pile from the game, replacing them with the second encounter deck.
Flavor: You have to find the man with the red gloves and discover what his plan is, but the remainder of the Red Coterie stands in your way. Don't they realize the true threat here?
Flavor2: Finally, you spot the man with the red gloves just before he ducks into a shimmering, extradimensional portal. There is no time to lose — it's now or never! You follow swiftly as the portal closes...
Name: Secrets and Lies (v. I)

Description: Do not draw cards from the encounter deck during the mythos phase. Objective – Prepare for your journey into the Outside, and proceed when you are ready. At the end of any round, if each investigator is at the same location, they may advance. The sooner, the better. (Hint — You will also be forced to advance automatically when the agenda advances.)
Description2: Remove agenda 1a from the game, moving all of its doom to agenda 2a. Remove each location from the game. (Investigators are not defeated during this process. Other enemies and attachments at those locations are discarded, and concealed mini-cards are set aside.) Put The Knotted Tower, Gravity-Defying Climb, and The Towering Vertex locations into play in a straight vertical line, with The Towering Vertex at the top and The Knotted Tower at the bottom. Take the top 3 locations in the Otherworld deck and place them in the shadows, arranged in a line from left to right. Take the 3 City of Remnants mini-cards and X decoys, where X is the amount of doom on agenda 2a, shuffle them facedown, and distribute them as evenly as possible around The Knotted Tower to its left, right, and below. Place each investigator at The Knotted Tower and The Red-Gloved Man enemy at the Towering Vertex. Shuffle each other set-aside [[Coterie]] enemy into the encounter deck. (Note: From now on, draw cards from the encounter deck during each mythos phase, as normal.)
Flavor: You have one last chance to explore the Red Coterie's hideout before you depart. But time is of the essence!
Flavor2: You step through the portal, uncertain if you will ever return...
Name: Secrets and Lies (v. II)

Description: The Red-Gloved Man gains concealed 1 [per_investigator] and cannot be damaged. Objective – At the end of the round, if each investigator is at the same location as The Red-Gloved Man, they may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.
Description2: Remove each location from the game. (Investigators are not defeated during this process. Other enemies and attachments at those locations are discarded, and concealed mini-cards are set aside.) Put The Knotted Tower, Gravity-Defying Climb, and The Towering Vertex locations into play in a straight vertical line, with The Towering Vertex at the top and The Knotted Tower at the bottom. Take the top 3 locations in the Otherworld deck and place them in the shadows, arranged in a line from left to right. Take the 3 City of Remnants mini-cards, shuffle them facedown, and arrange them around The Knotted Tower as follows: One to its left, one to its right, and one below. Place each investigator at The Knotted Tower and The Red-Gloved Man enemy at the Towering Vertex.
Flavor: Outsiders have attacked the Red Coterie's hideout! Only one among them has the answers you seek. You must find the "Red-Gloved Man" — or the entity that wears his face — and follow it back to the world whence it came.
Flavor2: Finally, you spot the man with the red gloves just before he ducks into a shimmering, extradimensional portal. There is no time to lose — it's now or never! You follow swiftly as the portal closes...
Name: Secrets and Lies (v. III)

Description: Locations and concealed mini-cards cannot be placed adjacent to [[Tower]] locations. Objective – Find a way into the tower where the infiltrator lies in wait. If an investigator enters the Gravity-Defying Climb, advance.
Description2:
Set each concealed mini-card aside, out of play. Remove each City of Remnants in the shadows and the remainder of the Otherworld deck from the game.
Take the 3 City of Remnants concealed mini-cards and 1 [per_investigator] decoys, shuffle them facedown, and arrange them around Gravity-Defying Climb in a random order.
Flavor: Beyond all of known reality, in the dimension known only to the forgotten and the forsaken, lies the preposterous City of Remnants — the home world of the Outsiders themselves. Looming before you, a terrifying, twisted tower of jumbled architecture is a nexus of roiling mist and clouds across an alien sky.
Flavor2: Seven forgotten locks grant entry to the tower, each one a piece of history from a realm long since erased from time. You forget they exist the moment the gates open. On the other side, steps course their way up the spire's baffling length. Winding, perplexing, and seemingly infinite, the ascent to the apex of the tower that binds this world together is paradoxical, a Gordian knot twisted far too many times. Even if you make it to the top, you doubt you will ever find a way back.
Name: To the Tower

Description: Objective – Ascend. If an investigator enters The Towering Vertex, advance.
Description2:
Set each concealed mini-card aside, out of play.
Swap the set-aside Mimetic Nemesis enemy with The Red-Gloved Man enemy at The Towering Vertex.
Take the Mimetic Nemesis's mini-card and 2 [per_investigator] decoys, shuffle them facedown, and arrange them around The Towering Vertex in a random order.
Flavor:
A terrible feeling of vertigo washes over you as you begin to scale the cyclopean, Escheresque steps.
Only one way to go now.
Flavor2: With herculean effort, you practically crawl from the final step to the tower's pinnacle. Twisting clouds of crimson and violet clash in a multidimensional sky, infinite gateways to infinite worlds, all of them oblivious, all of them blind, all of them theirs for the taking. You look out upon the world of the Outsiders with both awe and pity, upon the countless worlds' worth of ruin they have collected, discarded, forsaken, lost to all time. It is a garbage heap of cosmic proportions. At the very center lies your foe who has orchestrated humanity's erasure. Its body only scarcely resembles that of the Red-Gloved Man now. With no human face to wear, its gaze is empty, its expression unknowable.
Name: The Ascent

Description: [action] Flip a [[Stable]] key you control to its [[Unstable]] side: Remove an exposed decoy from the game. Objective – If Mimetic Nemesis is defeated, advance.
Flavor: You brandish the keys you have collected and brace yourself. If you cannot expel this entity and collapse this dimension, it will be the end of you all — and none will ever be the wiser. This is it. Your last chance before there is nothing of you left. nothing of you left nothing
Flavor2:
The entity collapses upon itself, its wordless screech washing over the world and worlds beyond, reverberating through your skull, tearing you apart molecule by molecule. You remain tethered to reality only by the energy of your keys, which endure even as all else implodes around you. There is a sensation of tugging at the back of your skull, a feeling of being yanked by a fishhook out of ravaged waters.
Then, darkness.
Name: The Final Err

Description: [fast] Exhaust a [[Conspirator]] asset you control: Move (to a connecting location).
Flavor: Perhaps if you had a guide, these labyrinthine halls would not be so perplexing.
Flavor2: The halls of the Red Coterie's secret hideout celebrate its long history of meddling with humanity, its walls adorned with ancient relics from past civilizations, scarlet-red tapestries, and numerous portraits of important-looking people, all clad in red.
Name: Scarlet Halls

Description: Forced – After you enter Scarlet Halls: For the remainder of your turn, as an additional cost for you to move from Scarlet Halls to a connecting location, you must either exhaust a [[Conspirator]] asset you control or spend an additional action.
Flavor2: The halls of the Red Coterie's secret hideout celebrate its long history of meddling with humanity, its walls adorned with ancient relics from past civilizations, scarlet-red tapestries, and numerous portraits of important-looking people, all clad in red.
Name: Scarlet Halls

Description: [action] Exhaust a [[Conspirator]] asset you control: Search the top 6 cards of your deck for an asset, draw it, and shuffle the rest into your deck.
Flavor: The ceremonial chamber where your trial took place is dominated by an enormous table and lit by candlelight. Extravagant decorations adorn the walls, crimson in color.
Flavor2: The Red Coterie's inner sanctum is steeped in ancient tradition and ceremony, welcoming and sinister all at once.
Name: Congress Chamber

Description: While there is a ready [[Coterie]] enemy at Congress Chamber, increase the cost of each asset played by each investigator at Congress Chamber by 2.
Flavor: The ceremonial chamber where your trial took place is dominated by an enormous table and lit by candlelight. Extravagant decorations adorn the walls, crimson in color.
Flavor2: The Red Coterie's inner sanctum is steeped in ancient tradition and ceremony, welcoming and sinister all at once.
Name: Congress Chamber

Description: [action]: Reduce the cost of the next asset you play this round by 2. You may exhaust a [[Conspirator]] asset to treat this ability as a [fast] ability instead of an [action] ability for this activation.
Flavor: A treasure trove of aged books, preserved scrolls and dusty tomes fills this ancient hall, centuries of knowledge hidden away for only the Coterie to see.
Flavor2: The Red Coterie's inner sanctum is steeped in ancient tradition and ceremony, welcoming and sinister all at once.
Name: Coterie Library

Description: Forced – After you fail a skill test while investigating Coterie Library: The nearest [[Coterie]] enemy with an attached key shifts each of their attached keys.
Flavor: A treasure trove of aged books, preserved scrolls and dusty tomes fills this ancient hall, centuries of knowledge hidden away for only the Coterie to see.
Flavor2: The Red Coterie's inner sanctum is steeped in ancient tradition and ceremony, welcoming and sinister all at once.
Name: Coterie Library

Description: [reaction] After you successfully investigate The Key Reliquary: Instead of discovering clues, choose an unempowered key attached to an investigator at your location. Place a resource (from the token pool) on that key, as an empowerment; that key is empowered (if it is shifted, its controller may spend the empowerment instead of flipping it to its [[Unstable]] side).
Flavor2: The Red Coterie's inner sanctum is steeped in ancient tradition and ceremony, welcoming and sinister all at once.
Name: The Key Reliquary

Description: The Key Reliquary gets +2 shroud for each [[Unstable]] key in play.
Flavor: How many Keys have been tucked away here for years, lost to history? How many more were used as tools of oppression?
Flavor2: The Red Coterie's inner sanctum is steeped in ancient tradition and ceremony, welcoming and sinister all at once.
Name: The Key Reliquary

Description: [reaction] After a location is placed adjacent to The Knotted Tower: Move to that location (from The Knotted Tower).
Flavor:
And o'er it all loomed the blasphemous effigy,
a ruinous testament to conquered worlds.
 – Virgil Gray, "In the Court of the Outsiders"
Flavor2: In the nexus of this jumbled otherworld rises the tower: a sinister structure of assorted materials climbing out of the tangled city, looming countless stories over you like a skyscraper of forgotten architecture. An otherworldly mist snakes around the tower's length, flanked on all sides by barren, jagged peaks.
Name: The Knotted Tower

Description: Forced – When a concealed mini-card around Gravity-Defying Climb is exposed: If it is... - ...the next in the sequence listed on The Towering Vertex, it remains in play and exposed, and you may expose another concealed mini-card. - ...any other mini-card, flip it and each other concealed mini-card facedown (without shuffling them).
Description2: The gate to Gravity-Defying Climb is sealed and forgotten. As an additional cost to enter Gravity-Defying Climb, investigators at The Knotted Tower must spend 4 [per_investigator] clues.
Name: Gravity-Defying Climb

Description: Forced – When a concealed mini-card around The Towering Vertex is exposed: If it is... - ...the Mimetic Nemesis's mini-card, deal the Mimetic Nemesis 3 damage, then flip all concealed mini-cards facedown and shuffle them facedown. - ...a decoy, it remains in play and exposed.
Description2: The Red-Gloved Man cannot be defeated. The way to The Towering Vertex is impossibly perplexing. In order for an investigator to enter The Towering Vertex, concealed mini-cards around Gravity-Defying Climb must be exposed in the following sequence: First, City of Remnants (L); second, City of Remnants (M); third, City of Remnants (R).
Name: The Towering Vertex

Description: Massive. Cannot make attacks of opportunity. Mimetic Nemesis gets +3 [per_investigator] health. Forced – When Mimetic Nemesis would take 1 or more damage from an attack or player card: Choose and reveal a concealed mini-card. If it is a decoy, cancel all damage just dealt (the decoy remains in play and faceup). Otherwise, the damage is dealt as normal, then flip all revealed mini-cards facedown and shuffle them.
Name: Mimetic Nemesis

Description: Concealed 2. Forced - After Coterie Agent enters the shadows: Place 1 doom on it. [reaction] When Coterie Agent is exposed: Discard it.
Flavor: A flash of red and a fleeting shadow.
Name: Coterie Agent (A)

Description: Concealed 2. Forced - After Coterie Agent enters the shadows: Place 1 doom on it. [reaction] When Coterie Agent is exposed: Discard it.
Flavor: A flash of red and a fleeting shadow.
Name: Coterie Agent (B)

Description: Concealed 2. Forced - After Coterie Agent enters the shadows: Place 1 doom on it. [reaction] When Coterie Agent is exposed: Discard it.
Flavor: A flash of red and a fleeting shadow.
Name: Coterie Agent (C)

Description: Revelation - Place 1 doom on an enemy in the shadows. If there are no enemies in the shadows, search the encounter deck and discard pile for an enemy with the concealed keyword and draw it. Shuffle the encounter deck.
Flavor: The moment she described his outfit, the line went dead.
Name: Conspiracy in Red

Description: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): Spend 1 clue or choose and discard half of the non-weakness cards in your hand (rounded up).
Flavor: "Flint, are you seeing what I am seeing?"
Name: Pinch in Reality

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). For each point you fail by, you must either take 1 horror, or place 1 of your clues on your location.
Flavor: They mostly come out when it rains. Mostly.
Name: Heavy Rain

Description:
Aloof. Patrol (nearest location with a concealed mini-card and no Coterie Envoy)
While Coterie Envoy is ready, concealed mini-cards at its location cannot be exposed.
[reaction] After you defeat Coterie Envoy: Look at the revealed side of any concealed mini-card in play.
Name: Coterie Envoy

Description: Revelation - Attach to an enemy in the shadows without a copy of In Plain Sight attached. If you cannot, In Plain Sight gains surge. Forced - After you expose attached enemy: That enemy attacks you and gets +2 fight until the end of the round. Discard In Plain Sight.
Name: In Plain Sight

Description: Revelation - Put Knives in the Dark into play in your threat area if there is no copy of it in your threat area. Otherwise, this card gains surge. Forced - After you expose a decoy: Take 2 damage. (Limit once per round.) Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [agility] (3). If you succeed, discard Knives in the Dark.
Name: Knives in the Dark

Description: Revelation - If there are no enemies in the shadows, Undercover gains surge. Otherwise, test [intellect] or [agility] (4). If you fail, place a decoy at the location with the most concealed mini-cards, flip it facedown, and shuffle each concealed mini-card at that location.
Name: Undercover

Description: Revelation - Put Seeing Shadows into play in your threat area. Forced - After you fail a skill test while at a location with a concealed mini-card: Take 1 horror. [action][action]: Discard Seeing Shadows.
Name: Seeing Shadows

Description: Peril. Revelation - If there are no enemies in the shadows, Figures in the Dark gains surge. Otherwise, you must decide (choose one): - Each enemy in the shadows attacks you. - Each investigator loses an action.
Name: Figures in the Dark

Description: Concealed 1. Forced - After you expose an enemy in the shadows not named Coterie Enforcer, if Coterie Enforcer is in the shadows: It attacks you.
Flavor: "You know what to do."
Name: Coterie Enforcer (A)

Description: Concealed 1. Forced - After you expose an enemy in the shadows not named Coterie Enforcer, if Coterie Enforcer is in the shadows: It attacks you.
Flavor: "You know what to do."
Name: Coterie Enforcer (B)

Description: Concealed 1. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Coterie Assassin is in the shadows: It attacks each investigator at each location with 1 or more concealed mini-cards.
Flavor: By any means necessary.
Name: Coterie Assassin (A)

Description: Concealed 1. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Coterie Assassin is in the shadows: It attacks each investigator at each location with 1 or more concealed mini-cards.
Flavor: By any means necessary.
Name: Coterie Assassin (B)

Description: Revelation - If there are no [[Coterie]] enemies in play, Swift Retreat gains surge. Otherwise, find the nearest [[Coterie]] enemy and test [agility] (3). If you fail, that enemy attacks you. If you fail and that enemy is not in the shadows, resolve its concealed keyword (if able).
Name: Swift Retreat

Description: Revelation - If there are no [[Coterie]] enemies in play, Bound in Red gains surge. Otherwise, attach it to the [[Coterie]] enemy with the highest printed health. Attached enemy gets +1 fight, +1 evade, +1 damage, and +1 horror. [action]: Flip a [[Stable]] key you control to its [[Unstable]] side. Then, discard Bound in Red. An investigator at any location may trigger this ability.
Name: Bound in Red

Description: Surge. Revelation - Each [[Coterie]] enemy shifts each key attached to it.
Flavor:
My vision blurred as they manipulated the tool with some daemonic purpose...
- Virgil Gray, "In the Court of the Outsiders"
Name: Key Charge

Description: Hunter. Forced - When Paracausal Entity engages you: Look at the top card of your deck. If it is not a weakness, set it aside, out of play, as a hollow.
Flavor: File #AT-1S1 / Subject appears as hyperphysical distortion devoid of mass. Capable of "hollowing" contacted matter (see file #AV-245). Containment impossible.
Name: Paracausal Entity

Description: Forced - When Apocalyptic Presage enters play: Each investigator chooses a non-weakness card they control in their hand or play area and sets it aside, out of play, as a hollow. [reaction] When Apocalyptic Presage is defeated: Instead of adding it to the victory display, discard it and choose up to 3 set-aside hollows. Add them to their owners' hands.
Name: Apocalyptic Presage

Description: Revelation - For each set-aside hollow you own, if there are 1 or more copies of that hollow in your play area and/ or hand, discard those copies and take 1 damage and 1 horror. If no cards are discarded by this effect, choose a non-weakness card you control in your hand or play area and set it aside, out of play, as a hollow.
Flavor: File #AV-245, supplemental / No energy conversion observed. What happens to hollowed matter?
Name: Substance Dissimulation

Description: Aloof. Hunter. Forced - If Otherworldly Mimic is ready, when an investigator at its location plays, commits, or triggers an ability on a copy of a set-aside hollow: It attacks that investigator.
Flavor: File #AV-261, supplemental / Subject appears to have returned to normal state of matter.
Name: Otherworldly Mimic

Description: Revelation - Put Memory Variant into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - After an event is played: Instead of discarding it, set it aside, out of play, as a hollow. [action]: Test [willpower] (4). If you succeed, discard Memory Variant. Any investigator may trigger this ability.
Name: Memory Variant

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). For each point you fail by, choose a non-weakness card in your hand and set it aside, out of play, as a hollow. If you succeed by 2 or more, you may take 1 horror to choose a set-aside hollow and add it to its owner's hand.
Name: Secrets Lost

Description: Aloof. Hunter. Forced - After you end your turn at Paradigm Effacer's location: Look at the top card of your deck. If it is not a weakness, set it aside, out of play, as a hollow. Then, if you own 3 or more set-aside hollows, Paradigm Effacer attacks you.
Name: Paradigm Effacer

Description: Revelation - Attach to an [[Outsider]] enemy without a copy of Matter Inversion attached. If you cannot, Matter Inversion gains surge. Attached enemy loses aloof, gains retaliate, and gets +1 fight and +1 evade. Forced - After attached enemy is successfully evaded: Discard Matter Inversion and draw 1 of your set-aside hollows.
Name: Matter Inversion

Description: Concealed 2. Hunter. Massive. Forced - After you discover a clue at a location with 1 or more concealed mini-cards, if Emissary from Yuggoth is in the shadows: It attacks you.
Name: Emissary from Yuggoth

Description: Revelation - Put Tenebrous Eclipse into play next to the agenda deck. No more than 1 concealed mini-card can be exposed by each investigator each round. Forced - At the end of the round: Discard 1 copy of Tenebrous Eclipse from play. (Max once per round.)
Name: Tenebrous Eclipse

Description: Revelation - Attach Splintered Space to your location and test [agility] (3). If you fail, take 1 damage for each [[Hex]] treachery attached to your location. After this test ends, if there are exactly 3 copies of Splintered Space in play, discard them.
Name: Splintered Space

Description: Revelation - Attach Beyond the Pale to your location and test [willpower] (3). If you fail, take 1 horror for each [[Hex]] treachery attached to your location. After this test ends, if there are exactly 3 copies of Beyond the Pale in play, discard them.
Name: Beyond the Pale

Description: Revelation - Attach to your location. Forced - After you end your turn at attached location: Choose a non-weakness card in your hand and set it aside, out of play, as a hollow. [action][action]: Discard Warped Reality.
Name: Warped Reality

Description: Revelation - Place 1 doom on the asset you control with the highest printed resource cost. If no doom was placed by this effect, Touch of the Beyond gains surge.
Flavor:
I felt a curious humming from deep within, as though I were being called elsewhere.
- Virgil Gray, "In the Court of the Outsiders"
Name: Touch of the Beyond

Description: Revelation - Put Compulsion into play in your threat area. Forced - When your turn begins: Reveal a random chaos token from the chaos bag. If it is a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], or [elder_thing] token, the first action you perform during this turn must be the below ability, if able. [action][action]: Discard Compulsion.
Name: Compulsion

Description: Revelation - Put Distorted Reasoning into play in your threat area. You cannot perform the same type of action twice in a row. (Types include activate, engage, evade, fight, investigate, move, play, resource, and draw.) Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Distorted Reasoning.
Name: Distorted Reasoning

Description: Increase the difficulty to fight or evade each concealed mini-card at Rambling Route by 2. [action] Spend X resources: Choose a concealed mini-card adjacent to a location X connections away. Look at its revealed side (without exposing it). (Group limit once per game.)
Description2: Concealed 1. Forced - When you expose this location: - If it is in the left position in the shadows, take 1 damage. - If it is on the right position in the shadows, take 1 horror.
Name: Rambling Route

Description: Increase the difficulty to fight or evade each concealed mini-card at Rambling Route by 2. [action] Spend X resources: Choose a concealed mini-card adjacent to a location X connections away. Look at its revealed side (without exposing it). (Group limit once per game.)
Description2: Concealed 1. Forced - When you expose this location: - If it is in the left position in the shadows, lose 2 resources. - If it is in the middle position in the shadows, lose 1 action.
Name: Rambling Route

Description: Increase the difficulty to fight or evade each concealed mini-card at Rambling Route by 2. [action] Spend X resources: Choose a concealed mini-card adjacent to a location X connections away. Look at its revealed side (without exposing it). (Group limit once per game.)
Description2: Concealed 1. Forced - When you expose this location: - If it is in the middle position in the shadows, choose a non-weakness card in your hand and set it aside, out of play, as a hollow. - If it is in the right position in the shadows, set an asset you control aside, out of play, as a hollow.
Name: Rambling Route

Description: Forced - When you move from Alien Frontier to a connecting location to its left or right, test [agility] (5). If you fail, take 2 damage. [action] Take 1 horror: Look at the revealed side of either a location in the shadows, or the top card of the Otherworld deck. (Group limit once per game.)
Description2: Concealed 1. Forced - When you expose this location: - If it is in the left position in the shadows, take 1 damage. - If it is on the right position in the shadows, take 1 horror.
Name: Alien Frontier

Description: Forced - When you move from Alien Frontier to a connecting location above or below it, test [agility] (5). If you fail, take 2 damage. [action] Take 1 horror: Look at the revealed side of either a location in the shadows, or the top card of the Otherworld deck. (Group limit once per game.)
Description2: Concealed 1. Forced - When you expose this location: - If it is in the left position in the shadows, lose 2 resources. - If it is in the middle position in the shadows, lose 1 action.
Name: Alien Frontier

Description: Forced - After you reveal Weald of Effigies: Look at the top card of your deck. If it is not a weakness, set it aside, out of play, as a hollow. [fast] If there are no clues on Weald of Effigies: Either swap the positions of 2 concealed mini-cards adjacent to locations, or swap the positions of 2 locations in the shadows. (Group limit once per game.)
Description2: Concealed 1. Forced - When you expose this location: - If it is in the left position in the shadows, lose 2 resources. - If it is in the middle position in the shadows, lose 1 action.
Name: Weald of Effigies

Description: Forced - After you reveal Weald of Effigies: Look at the top card of your deck. If it is not a weakness, set it aside, out of play, as a hollow. [fast] If there are no clues on Weald of Effigies: Either swap the positions of 2 concealed mini-cards adjacent to locations, or swap the positions of 2 locations in the shadows. (Group limit once per game.)
Description2: Concealed 1. Forced - When you expose this location: - If it is in the middle position in the shadows, choose a non-weakness card in your hand and set it aside, out of play, as a hollow. - If it is in the right position in the shadows, set an asset you control aside, out of play, as a hollow.
Name: Weald of Effigies

Description: Forced - After you reveal Cliffs of Insanity: Move each concealed mini-card adjacent to it so they are arranged as evenly as possible in empty spots adjacent to locations not named Cliffs of Insanity.
Description2: Concealed 1. Forced - When you expose this location: - If it is in the left position in the shadows, take 1 damage. - If it is in the middle position in the shadows, choose a non-weakness card in your hand and set it aside, out of play, as a hollow. - If it is on the right position in the shadows, take 1 horror.
Name: Cliffs of Insanity

Description: Peril. Revelation - You must decide (choose one): - Flip each decoy over. Shuffle all concealed mini-cards in play, then place them facedown at random in the positions they were in. - Each investigator takes 1 damage and 1 horror.
Name: Paradimensional Terror

Description: Retaliate. Forced - After you flip a key from its [[Unstable]] side to its [[Stable]] side: The Red-Gloved Man attacks you. Then, the Red-Gloved Man shifts each of his attached keys.
Flavor: "So vou--remember. The final-err."
Name: The Red-Gloved Man

Description: Aloof. Spawn - Location farthest from you. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if La Chica Roja is unengaged: Move 1 resource from each investigator to her. She shifts each of her attached keys. [reaction] After La Chica Roja is defeated: Distribute her resources among the investigators, as you wish.
Name: La Chica Roja

Description: Hunter. Forced - When you defeat The Sanguine Watcher: He shifts each of his attached keys twice.
Flavor: "I have a hypothesis. Would you care to let me test it with you?"
Name: The Sanguine Watcher

Description: Hunter. Spawn - Location farthest from you. Forced - After you fail a skill test while at The Beast in a Cowl of Crimson's location, if it is ready: It shifts each of its attached keys.
Name: The Beast in a Cowl of Crimson

Description: Spawn - Location farthest from you. Each other [[Coterie]] enemy gets +2 fight. Forced - After another [[Coterie]] enemy is discarded from play: The Claret Knight shifts each of his attached keys.
Flavor: "Dispose of these irrelevant rats!"
Name: The Claret Knight

Description: Hunter. Forced - After Thorne enters play: They shift each of their attached keys. [fast] Choose a key attached to your investigator and remove it from the game: Add Thorne to the victory display. Thorne is now the bearer of the chosen key. (Update the Campaign Log.)
Name: Thorne

Description: Patrol (nearest location with at least one other [[Coterie]] enemy). Forced - When another [[Coterie]] enemy at Desiderio Delgado Álvarez's location would take 1 or more damage: Deal that damage to him, instead. Then, he shifts each of his attached keys.
Flavor: "I look out for my own."
Name: Desiderio Delgado Álvarez

Description: Hunter. Forced - When Amaranth attacks: She shifts each of her attached keys. If damage and/ or horror from this attack is assigned to an asset, defeat that asset.
Flavor: "You won't be coming back."
Name: Amaranth

Description: Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - When you succeed at a skill test by 2 or more while fighting or attempting to evade Tzu San Niang: She shifts each of her attached keys.
Flavor: "Shhh... soon, my shade, soon."
Name: Tzu San Niang

Description: Aloof. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase: Each investigator looks at the top card of their deck. Set each non-weakness card looked at in this way aside, out of play, as a hollow. If there is already a copy of that card set aside as a hollow, Aliki Zoni Uperetria shifts each of her attached keys.
Name: Aliki Zoni Uperetria

Description: [reaction] When you expose a decoy, exhaust Inspector Flint: Cancel the exposing of that decoy, flip it facedown and either draw 1 card or choose a different concealed mini-card at that location to expose.
Flavor: If you know both yourself and your enemy, you can win a hundred battles without a single loss. - Sun Tzu
Name: Inspector Flint

Description:
While there is a concealed mini-card at your location, you get +1 [intellect], +1 [combat], and +1 [agility].
[reaction] After you expose a card in the shadows, exhaust Agent Ari Quinn: Draw 1 card.
Flavor: "The truth is out there."
Name: Agent Ari Quinn

Description:
You get +1 [willpower].
[fast] Exhaust Dr. Dewi Irawan: Either reveal a card from your hand to shuffle each copy of that card that is set-aside as a hollow into its owner's deck, or discard a card from your hand to shuffle any set-aside hollow into its owner's deck. In either case, gain 1 resource for each card shuffled in this way.
Name: Dr. Dewi Irawan

Description: Permanent. While embarking to a new destination on the map, you may exile Expedited Ticket and mark 1 time in your Campaign Log to travel anywhere on the map.
Name: Expedited Ticket

Description: Foundation Intel cannot leave your hand.
Flavor: This dossier, while filled with important findings, isn't related to your situation in the slightest. You should probably drop it off at the sanctum Taylor indicated at your earliest convenience.
Name: Foundation Intel

Description: Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Immediately shift an [[Unstable]] key you control. - Flip each [[Stable]] key you control to its [[Unstable]] side.
Name: Paradimensional Understanding

Description: Shift - Deal 2 damage to an enemy at your location, or 1 damage to all enemies at your location. Flip this key to its [[Unstable]] side.
Flavor: File #52-U13 / Subject Class: Red / Subject is glasslike shard 26 cm in length and less than 3 mm at thinnest edge, sharp enough to cut through any known material.
Name: The Mirroring Blade

Description: Shift - Add 1 ammo, charge, secret, supply, or evidence to an asset controlled by an investigator at your location. Fliip this key to its [[Unstable]] side.
Flavor: File #54-W14 / Subject Class: Green / Subject appears to be mechanical apparatus of unknown design. Engineering purpose eludes any known school of science.
Name: The Bale Engine

Description: Shift - Automatically evade all enemies at your location. Flip this card to its [[Unstable]] side.
Flavor: File #45-P15 / Subject Class: Yellow / Subject appears as small bell made of black metallic substance. Despite lack of clapper, subject resounds with paradimensional acoustics when disturbed.
Name: The Ruinous Chime

Description:
Reduce the resource cost of the first [[Tool]] asset you play each round by 1.
You get +1 skill value during skill tests on [[Tool]] assets.
[elder_sign] effect: +0. You may swap a [[Tool]] asset in your play area with a [[Tool]] asset in your hand with equal or lower printed cost.
Description2: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: [[Tool]] cards level 0-5, Guardian cards ([guardian]) level 0-4, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to 5 other [[Improvised]] and/or [[Upgrade]] cards level 0-1. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Ad Hoc, Hasty Repairs, 1 random basic weakness.
Flavor2: Wilson takes pride in always having the right tool for the job. Leaky plumbing? Pipe wrench. Fallen tree? Hand saw. Interior remodeling? Sledgehammer. But recently his jobs in and around Arkham have taken on a certain strangeness. Creaky floorboards give way to labyrinthine tunnels. A broken roof shows signs of bursting outward instead of collapsing inward. It's Wilson's job to fix problems, and when those problems involve bizarre and horrifying creatures and unexplained phenomena, well, then it's time to get creative with what he's got.
Name: Wilson Richards

Description:
Wilson Richards deck only.
Attach Ad Hoc to a [[Tool]] or [[Weapon]] asset you control.
[reaction] After resolving an [action] ability on attached asset, exhaust Ad Hoc and discard a [[Tool]] or [[Weapon]] asset from your hand: Resolve an [action] ability on the discarded asset, ignoring all costs.
Flavor: "This is one heckuva job."
Name: Ad Hoc

Description: Revelation - Put Hasty Repairs into play in your threat area. While triggering abilities on assets you control, set your base skill value to 0. [action] [action]: Discard Hasty Repairs.
Name: Hasty Repairs

Description: You begin the game with Flux Stabilizer (Inactive) side faceup. [fast]: Move 1 clue from Kate Winthrop to a [[Science]] or [[Tool]] asset you control with no clues on it. Forced - When an asset you control with a clue on it leaves play: Place its clue on your location. [elder_sign] effect: +0. You may move I clue from an asset you control back to Kate Winthrop.
Description2: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0-5, [[Science]] cards level 0-4, [[Insight]] cards level 0-1, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Flux Stabilizer, Failed Experiment, 1 random basic weakness.
Flavor2: Kate Winthrop has spent years researching in the basement of Miskatonic University's science building, passing up funding and academic prestige in pursuit of progress. Her single-minded focus finally paid off with the invention of the Flux Stabilizer: a powerful device capable of channeling a new form of energy. However, the price of progress is steep. The first successful test of this groundbreaking invention took the life of her friend and mentor Professor Young. Since then, Kate has worked tirelessly to understand these alien currents, in hopes that she find a way to reverse their effects.
Name: Kate Winthrop

Description: Permanent. Kate Winthrop deck only. Forced - After a clue is placed on Flux Stabilizer: Search your bonded cards or discard pile for 1 copy of Aetheric Current and shuffle it into your deck. Flip Flux Stabilizer (keeping all tokens and attachments).
Name: Flux Stabilizer

Description: Bonded (Flux Stabilizer). Play only if Flux Stabilizer is on its (Active) side. Fight. Move all clues on assets you control to Kate Winthrop. For this attack, you may use [intellect] instead of [combat]. If you succeed and the attacked enemy is non-[[Elite]], you may exhaust it and move it to any location. Draw 1 card. Flip Flux Stabilizer (keeping all tokens and attachments).
Name: Aetheric Current

Description: Bonded (Flux Stabilizer). Play only if Flux Stabilizer is on its (Active) side. Evade. Move all clues on assets you control to Kate Winthrop. For this evasion attempt, you may use [intellect] instead of [agility]. If you succeed and the target of this evasion is non-[[Elite]], shuffle it into the encounter deck. Draw 1 card. Flip Flux Stabilizer (keeping all tokens and attachments).
Name: Aetheric Current

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). This test gets +1 difficulty for each asset you control with a clue on it. For each point you fail by, you must either take 1 horror or place 1 of your clues on your location.
Flavor: "I've made a huge mistake."
Name: Failed Experiment

Description:
You may take an additional action during your turn, which can only be used to parley.
[elder_sign] effect: +2. If you succeed, choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location or at a revealed connecting location. Automatically evade that enemy.
Description2: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Rogue cards ([rogue]) level 0-5, cards with "parley" level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): 3 copies of Beguile, Zamacona, 1 random basic weakness.
Flavor: "I love a good party."
Flavor2: Alessandra's life of carefree luxury enables her to hop from a stately gala in New York City to a banquet with the Maharaja of India with ease. The Countess has sampled every dish, drink, and dame from Marrakesh to Chicago. The regal title is just an act, however: behind the scenes, Alessandra uses her cover to pilfer from art galleries, banks, and the hearts and pocketbooks of the rich and frivolous. Her silver tongue has gotten her into and out of plenty of trouble. A new job with the shadowy Zamacona brought Alessandra to Arkham, Massachusetts, where the Countess learned that more lurks beyond the suggestible rich and frivolous excess than she previously thought.
Name: Alessandra Zorzi

Description: Alessandra Zorzi deck only. Fast. Play only during your turn. Attach Beguile to a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location. [action]: Parley. Either move attached enemy to a revealed connecting location, or perform a basic investigate or evade action at its location. If you fail a skill test while resolving this ability, discard Beguile. You may activate this ability from any location.
Name: Beguile

Description: Elusive. Spawn - Nearest empty location, if able. Alessandra Zorzi cannot parley with Zamacona. Forced - The first time Alessandra Zorzi parleys each round: Place 1 doom on Zamacona.
Name: Zamacona

Description: [reaction] At the start of your turn: Either add 1 [bless] token or 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag, whichever there are fewer of (in case of a tie, you choose), or remove 2 [bless] tokens and 2 [curse] tokens from the chaos bag to take an additional action this turn. [elder_sign] effect: +2. Add 1 [bless] and 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag.
Description2: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: [[Blessed]] cards level 0-5, [[Cursed]] cards level 0-5, [[Occult]] cards level 0, Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 0-3, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Book of Living Myths, Weeping Yurei, 1 random basic weakness.
Flavor: "Why not greet the unknown with wonder rather than fear?"
Flavor2: Everyone in the Arkham Historical Society recognizes Kōhaku's booming laughter, and the haunting tales he tells of both the yōkai from his childhood home outside Tokyo and the strange creatures that haunt the Arkham Woods. The eccentric folklorist tells everyone that the chronicling and publication of these phenomena's existence will be his greatest work. It is only when he is home with his partner Gabriel that he hears the cries of the same spirit who haunted his father, and fears that his "greatest work" will never allow him a night's sleep.
Name: Kōhaku Narukami

Description: Kōhaku Narukami deck only. [reaction] When a chaos token would be revealed at your location, exhaust Book of Living Myths: Search the chaos bag for a [bless] or [curse] token, whichever there are more of (in case of a tie, you choose), and resolve it instead.
Name: Book of Living Myths

Description: Aloof. Elusive. Hunter. Prey - Kōhaku Narukami only. Forced - After an investigator reveals a [bless] token or [curse] token during a skill test at Weeping Yurei's location, if it is ready: Weeping Yurei attacks that investigator. (Limit once per test).
Name: Weeping Yurei

Description:
You may be assigned damage/horror dealt to [[Ally]] assets or other investigators at your location.
[reaction] When you would be defeated by damage and/or horror: Instead, heal all of your damage and horror and swap this card with its bonded [[Resolute]] version, either side faceup.
[elder_sign] effect: +1.
Description2: Deck Size: 35. Deckbuilding Options: Survivor cards ([survivor]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to 10 other [[Innate]] and/or [[Spirit]] cards level 0-2. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Stouthearted, "Where's Pa?", 1 random basic weakness.
Flavor2: Growing up on a farm, Hank Samson did all the chores Ma and Pa told him to do, including taking care of his brothers and sisters. When Pa showed him the strange animals in the city stockyard, Hank felt uneasy, but he did as he was told. When Pa told him to wait, he waited. And when Pa didn't come back, Hank went to find him. Pa taught him that family is everything, and you don't just leave family behind.
Name: Hank Samson

Description:
Hank Samson deck only.
Fast. Play when you engage a non-[[Elite]] enemy.
Move up to 2 damage and/or horror from Hank Samson to that enemy, as damage.
Flavor: Everyone is a hero to someone.
Name: Stouthearted

Description: Revelation - Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded. Attach "Where's Pa?" to that enemy and spawn it at a connecting location, if able. Attached enemy gains elusive. Forced - At the end of the round: Hank Samson takes 1 direct horror.
Name: "Where's Pa?"

Description: [reaction] After you defeat an enemy, exhaust Ancestral Token: Add [bless] tokens to the chaos bag equal to that enemy's printed health (max 5).
Flavor: Never forget those who came before.
Name: Ancestral Token

Description:
Uses (3 supplies).
Supplies on Cleaning Kit may be spent as if they were supplies or ammo on assets you control.
Flavor:
"It cleans! It fixes! It picks, plucks, shines, and swishes!"
-Schoffner's Catalogue, Winter 1924 ed.
Name: Cleaning Kit

Description: [action]: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this test. If you succeed by exactly 2, you may exhaust Katana to deal +2 damage for this attack. [fast]Exhaust Katana: Fight. Use [agility] instead of [combat] for this attack.
Name: Katana

Description:
Uses (1 charge). Replenish this charge the first time a [bless] token is revealed at your location each round.
[fast] Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location and spend 1 charge: That enemy loses the alert, aloof, elusive, and retaliate keywords until the end of the round.
Name: Ofuda

Description:
Limit 1 [[Mask]] per investigator.
Uses (2 offerings). Replenish 1 of these offerings after you engage an enemy.
