[fast] Spend 1 offering: You get +2 [combat] or +2 [agility] for this skill test. (Limit once per test.)
Name: Wolf Mask

Description:
Reveal 3 random tokens from the chaos bag, along with X additional tokens.
For each non-symbol token revealed, add 1 [bless] token to the chaos bag. For each [bless] token revealed, heal 1 horror from an investigator or [[Ally]] asset at your location.
Name: Absolution

Description: Investigate. You may use [willpower] instead of [intellect] for this investigation. Before revealing chaos tokens for this test, add 2 [bless] tokens to the chaos bag. If a [bless] or [elder_sign] token is revealed during this skill test, discover 1 additional clue at your location.
Name: Guided by Faith

Description: Parley. Choose an enemy at your location and an [[Item]] asset in your hand. Perform a fight action against the chosen enemy. If you succeed, instead of dealing damage, play the chosen asset, reducing its cost by each point you succeeded by.
Flavor: "H-hands where I can see 'em!"
Name: Hold Up

Description:
As an additional cost to play Task Force, spend an action. One at a time, in any order, choose an investigator at your location to...
- ...resolve an [action] ability on an asset they control without paying its [action] cost.
- ...move to a connecting location.
- ...discover 1 clue at their location.
Name: Task Force

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Attach Tinker to a [[Tool]] asset in your play area. Limit 1 per asset.
Attached asset takes up 1 fewer hand or accessory slot.
Flavor: "You still call that a wrench?!"
Name: Tinker

Description:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
You may commit Purified to any type of test.
If this test is successful, for each point you succeeded by (to a maximum of 5), add 1 [bless] token or remove 1 [curse] token from the chaos bag.
Name: Purified

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Resolve an [action] ability on a [[Tool]] or [[Weapon]] asset you control without paying its [action] cost.
Flavor: Keep your eyes on the target.
Name: Hand-Eye Coordination

Description: While Strong-Armed is committed to an attack using a [[Melee]] or [[Ranged]] asset, this attack deals +1 damage. After revealing chaos token(s) for this skill test, you may take 1 damage to cancel that chaos token, return it to the chaos bag, and reveal a new one. (You may do this any number of times.)
Name: Strong-Armed

Description:
Play only as your first action.
Heal 2 damage (3 damage instead if you drew a treachery this round). Draw 1 card.
Name: Second Wind

Description:
Uses (4 supplies).
Supplies on Cleaning Kit may be spent as if they were supplies or ammo on assets you control.
[reaction] When a supply is spent from Cleaning Kit, exhaust it: The performing investigator gets +2 skill value for this test.
Name: Cleaning Kit

Description: [action]: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. If this attack is successful, it deals +1 damage. Return each [bless] token revealed during this attack to the chaos bag. Before revealing chaos token(s) for this attack, you may exhaust Blessed Blade to add 2 [bless] tokens to the chaos bag.
Name: Blessed Blade

Description: [action]: Parley. Choose an enemy at your location. Until the end of the round, each investigator gets +1 skill value while fighting, evading, or parleying with the chosen enemy. Place 1 resource on Eyes of Valusia, as a charge. [fast]: Search your bonded cards for Blade of Yoth and swap it with Eyes of Valusia, moving all charges from Eyes of Valusia to Blade of Yoth.
Name: Eyes of Valusia

Description: Bonded (Eyes of Valusia). [action] Spend 1-3 charges: Fight. For this attack, you may use [willpower] instead of [combat]. You get +2 skill value and deal +1 damage for each charge spent as part of this action's cost. [fast]: Search your bonded cards for Eyes of Valusia and swap it with Blade of Yoth, discarding all charges.
Name: Blade of Yoth

Description: Play only if you control a [[Melee]] asset. As an additional cost to play Flurry of Blows, spend an action. Fight. Choose a [[Melee]] asset you control and take an immediate fight action with that asset (without paying its [action] cost). You may repeat this effect up to three times. After the final attack resolves, if it is your turn, end your turn.
Name: Flurry of Blows

Description:
Fast. Play after 1 or more [bless] tokens are revealed during a skill test at your location.
Search your bonded cards for Evanescent Ascension and put it into play. Place up to X resources on it, as wishes (to a maximum of the number of [bless] tokens revealed). Remove Miracle Wish from the game.
Name: Miracle Wish

Description: Bonded (Miracle Wish). If Evanescent Ascension has no wishes, set it aside, out of play. [reaction] When an investigator at your location would fail a skill test, spend 1 wish and exhaust Evanescent Ascension: Resolve that investigator's [elder_sign] effect (in addition to all other tokens revealed during this test).
Name: Evanescent Ascension

Description: [action] Exhaust Chemistry Set: Investigate. If you... - ...fail by exactly 2, discard Chemistry Set. - ...succeed by exactly 0, gain 2 resources. - ...succeed by exactly 2, draw 1 card. - ...succeed by exactly 4, discover 1 additional clue at your location.
Name: Chemistry Set

Description:
You have 1 additional hand slot, which can only be used to hold a [[Tool]] asset.
[reaction] After you successfully investigate by exactly 1 or 3, exhaust Dr. Charles West III: Deal 1 damage to an enemy at your location.
Name: Dr. Charles West III

Description: [reaction] After an enemy at your location is successfully evaded or defeated, exhaust Microscope: Place 1 resource on Microscope, as evidence. [action] [action]: Investigate. You get +1 [intellect] for this investigation for each evidence on Microscope (max +3 [intellect]). If you succeed, you may spend up to 2 evidence to discover that many additional clues at your location.
Name: Microscope

Description:
Limit 1 [[Mask]] per investigator.
Uses (2 offerings). Replenish 1 of these offerings after you reveal a location or put a new location into play.
[fast] Spend 1 offering: You get +2 [willpower] or +2 [intellect] for this skill test. (Limit once per test.)
Name: Mouse Mask

Description:
Limit 1 per deck.
[action]: Search your bonded cards for Uncanny Growth and add it to your hand.
[action] If Ravenous Myconid has 3 or more growth on it: Move each growth to your resource pool, as resources. Record in your Campaign Log that "you have classified a new species."
Name: Ravenous Myconid

Description: Bonded (Ravenous Myconid). Investigate. After this test resolves, place 1 resource on Ravenous Myconid, as growth, for each point you succeed by. Set Uncanny Growth aside, out of play. If you fail, return Uncanny Growth to your hand.
Name: Uncanny Growth

Description:
Fast. Play after an investigator reveals a [curse] token during a skill test at your location.
Discover 1 clue at your location.
Flavor: "There was a solution which he injected into the veins of dead things, and if they were fresh enough they responded in strange ways." -H.P. Lovecraft, Herbert West - Reanimator
Name: Control Variable

Description: As an additional cost to play Testing Sprint, spend an action. Investigate. One at a time, investigate your location and each connecting location once each in ascending order of shroud, until you either fail to investigate or successfully investigate each eligible location.
Name: Testing Sprint

Description: As an additional cost to play Thorough Inquiry, spend an action. Investigators at your location draw a combined total of 5 cards (you decide how many cards each investigator draws).
Flavor: The truth is often hidden in plain sight.
Name: Thorough Inquiry

Description: Fight. Choose a [[Tome]] asset you control. You get +X [combat] for this attack, where X is that asset's printed cost. If you succeed, you may either automatically evade the attacked enemy, or after the attack ends, you may resolve an [action] or [fast] ability on the chosen asset (ignoring its [action] cost, if any).
Flavor: "Kid, you... you took that a lot more literally than I expected you to."
Name: "Throw the Book at Them!"

Description: Evade. You may use [intellect] instead of [agility] for this evasion attempt. If you succeed and the enemy is non-[[Elite]], attach Transmogrify to it. Attached enemy gains: "Massive. Cannot move. [reaction] After you evade this enemy: Discover 1 clue at its location. (Limit once per round.)"
Flavor: "I said 'blow it up,' not '<u>blow</u> it up!"
Name: Transmogrify

Description: While you control a [[Science]] or [[Tool]] asset, Well-Funded gains [wild] (while you control 3 or more [[Science]] and/or [[Tool]] assets, Well-Funded gains [wild] [wild], instead).
Flavor: Every cent of that research grant counts.
Name: Well-Funded

Description:
You get +1 [intellect].
[reaction] At the start of your turn, add 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag: Draw 1 card.
Flavor: "Helping you is easier than teaching my students geometry."
Name: Gabriel Carillo

Description:
Limit 1 per investigator.
[reaction] When you would succeed at a skill test, exhaust Steady-Handed: You either succeed by 1 more or 1 less. If you succeeded by exactly 2, heal 1 horror.
Flavor: A nick can be the difference between life and death.
Name: Steady-Handed

Description:
Attach to a [[Tool]] or [[Science]] asset you control. Limit 1 per asset.
[reaction] After attached asset exhausts, exhaust Fine Tuning: Ready attached asset.
Flavor: "I assure you there's nothing to fear!"
Name: Fine Tuning

Description: After this skill test ends, add 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag for each point the performing investigator either succeeded or failed by.
Flavor: Rumor has it the university's last phrenology professor enjoyed an unnaturally long tenure.
Name: Esoteric Method

Description: [action] Add 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag: Investigate. You get +2 skill value for this investigation. If a [curse] token is revealed during this investigation, you may exhaust Prismatic Spectacles to discover 1 additional clue at your location.
Name: Prismatic Spectacles

Description: Parley. Choose an enemy at your location. Test [intellect] (X), where X is the chosen enemy's evade value. If you succeed, discover 2 clues at your location. Then, if the chosen enemy is non-[[Elite]], automatically evade it. It does not ready during the next upkeep phase.
Flavor: "It'll never work, Herbert."
Name: Confound

Description: [reaction] After an enemy at your location is successfully evaded or defeated: Place 1 resource on Microscope, as evidence. [action] [action]: Investigate. You get +2 [intellect] for this investigation for each evidence on Microscope (max +6 [intellect]). If you succeed, you may spend up to 3 evidence to discover that many additional clues at your location.
Name: Microscope

Description:
Researched. Limit 1 per deck.
[fast]: Search your bonded cards for Uncanny Growth and add it to your hand. (Limit once per round.)
[reaction] When an investigator draws a non-weakness treachery card, if their locations shroud is equal to or less than Ravenous Myconid's growth: Cancel that treachery's effects and discard it. Remove all growth from Ravenous Myconid.
Name: Ravenous Myconid

Description:
Researched. Limit 1 per deck.
[fast]: Search your bonded cards for Uncanny Growth and add it to your hand. (Limit once per round.)
[fast] Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location with equal or fewer remaining health than the amount of growth on Ravenous Myconid: Defeat that enemy. Remove all growth from Ravenous Myconid.
Name: Ravenous Myconid

Description:
Researched. Limit 1 per deck.
[fast]: Search your bonded cards for Uncanny Growth and add it to your hand. (Limit once per round.)
[fast] Remove all growth from Ravenous Myconid: Either heal that much damage/horror from Ravenous Myconid, or move that much damage/horror from investigators or [[Ally]] assets at your location to Ravenous Myconid.
Name: Ravenous Myconid

Description: Limit 1 per deck. Uses (10 resources). [action] Exhaust Bianca "Die Katz": Parley. Move X resources from Bianca "Die Katz" to your resource pool. X cannot be more than 5. Test [agility] (X). If you fail, remember "you owe Bianca X resources." Then, search your bonded cards for the Bianca "Die Katz" enemy and spawn her at your location. Remove this card from the game.
Name: Bianca "Die Katz"

Description: Bonded (Bianca "Die Katz"). Hunter. Prey - Bearer only. [action] If "you owe Bianca X resources," spend X resources: Parley. Add Bianca "Die Katz" to the victory display. Forced - When Bianca "Die Katz" leaves play (except by the above ability): Shuffle her into your deck.
Name: Bianca "Die Katz"

Description: [action] Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location: Parley. Test [willpower] (X), where X is that enemy's printed health value. If you succeed, that enemy disengages from each investigator and gains aloof until the end of the round.
Name: Blackmail File

Description: Uses (3 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You may use [agility] instead of [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage. [reaction] After you fail a skill test while parleying with an enemy: Put British Bull Dog into play from your hand.
Name: British Bull Dog

Description: [action] Choose an enemy at your location and exhaust Fake Credentials: Parley. Test [intellect] (1). This test gets +1 difficulty for each suspicion on Fake Credentials. If you succeed, discover 1 clue at your location and place 1 resource on Fake Credentials, as suspicion. If you fail, you must either discard Fake Credentials, or the chosen enemy attacks you.
Name: Fake Credentials

Description:
Limit 1 [[Mask]] per investigator.
Uses (2 offerings). Replenish 1 of these offerings after you move out of a location with an enemy.
[fast] Spend 1 offering: You get +2 [intellect] or +2 [agility] for this skill test. (Limit once per test.)
Name: Fox Mask

Description: [action] Add 1-3 [curse] tokens to the chaos bag and exhaust Scrimshaw Charm: Gain 1 resource. For each token added, gain 1 additional resource.
Flavor: "Let faith oust fact; let fancy oust memory; I look deep down and do believe." - Herman Melville, <u>Moby-Dick</u>
Name: Scrimshaw Charm

Description:
As an additional cost to play Bank Job, spend an action.
Investigators at your location gain a total of 8 resources, distributed as you wish.
Flavor:
"No names, Skids."
"Sorry, Finn."
Name: Bank Job

Description: Parley. Choose an enemy at your location and play a [[Weapon]] asset from your hand, reducing its cost by 1. You may then take a fight action with that weapon against the chosen enemy, using [agility] instead of the skill indicated.
Flavor: "You'd have made a pretty good cowboy."
Name: False Surrender

Description: Parley. Choose an enemy at your location and test [agility] (0). For each point you succeed by, gain 1 resource (to a maximum of 6). If you fail, that enemy attacks you.
Flavor:
"Look! A dumb bird!"
"I don't see a bird."
"I do."
Name: Grift

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Choose another investigator at your location. Move all resources from that investigator's resource pool to your resource pool. At the end of the round, move all resources from your resource pool to that investigator's resource pool.
Name: "I'll Pay You Back!"

Description: Parley. Choose an enemy at your location and test [intellect] (X), where X is the chosen enemy's combined damage and horror values. If you succeed, deal 2 damage to each enemy at your location. If you succeed by 2 or more, after this effect resolves you may disengage from each enemy and move to a connecting location.
Flavor: "He <u>did</u> say something about your hair..."
Name: Stir the Pot

Description: Parley. Choose an enemy at your location and test any skill (3). If you succeed and you tested... - ...[willpower], remove 1 doom from that enemy. - ...[intellect], discover 1 clue at your location. - ...[agility], automatically evade that enemy. If it is non-[[Elite]], move it to a connecting location. - ...[combat], deal 2 damage to that enemy.
Name: Vamp

Description: When you reveal a [curse] token during a skill test you are performing, you may commit Diabolical Luck to that skill test from your hand. If you do, Diabolical Luck gains [wild][wild][wild].
Flavor: "Shoggoths. Why did it have to be shoggoths?"
Name: Diabolical Luck

Description: If this skill test is successful during an evasion attempt, you may automatically evade another enemy at your location.
Flavor: "I never ran from anything like that devil tonight, though. Hope I never have to again." -Rita Young, Investigators of Arkham Horror
Name: Lightfooted

Description: Uses (3 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You may use [agility] instead of [combat] for this attack and you get +2 skill value. This attack deals +1 damage. Ignore the aloof keyword for this attack. [reaction] After you fail a skill test while parleying with an enemy: Put British Bull Dog into play from your hand.
Name: British Bull Dog

Description:
Fast. Play after you succeed at a skill test while parleying.
Discover 2 total clues from among your location and connecting locations.
Flavor: "I shouldn't be telling you this, but since you seem trustworthy..."
Name: Snitch

Description:
Permanent. Exceptional.
[reaction] Before you draw your opening hand: Search your deck for up to 3 different [[Trick]] cards, and attach them facedown to Bewitching. Shuffle your deck.
[reaction] When you engage an enemy, exhaust Bewitching: Either draw 1 attached card, or search the top 9 cards of your deck for a copy of an attached card, draw it, and shuffle your deck.
Name: Bewitching

Description: As an additional cost to play Dirty Deeds, spend an action. Search your deck for an [[Illicit]] asset and play it, paying its cost. Then, you may resolve an [action] or [fast] ability on that asset, ignoring all costs (including its [action] cost, if any). Playing this card does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
Name: Dirty Deeds

Description: Parley. Choose an enemy at your location and any number of skills. One at a time, in any order, test each chosen skill (2). For each test you succeeded, if it was... - ...[willpower], remove 1 doom from that enemy. - ...[intellect], discover 1 clue at that enemy's location. - ...[agility], automatically evade that enemy. Move it to a connecting location if it is non-[[Elite]]. - ...[combat], deal 2 damage to that enemy.
Name: Vamp

Description: [action] Choose an enemy at your location: Parley. Test [intellect](0). This test gets +1 difficulty for each suspicion on Fake Credentials. If you succeed, discover 1 clue at your location or a connecting location. If you did not succeed by 2 or more, place 1 resource on Fake Credentials, as suspicion. If you fail, return Fake Credentials to your hand.
Name: Fake Credentials

Description: Parley. Choose an enemy at your location and test [intellect] (X), where X is the chosen enemy's combined damage/horror values. If you succeed, deal X damage to each enemy at your location. After this effect resolves, you may disengage from each enemy and move to a connecting location.
Flavor: "...and I heard he called you stupid too!"
Name: Stir the Pot

Description:
Limit 1 [[Mask]] per investigator.
Uses (2 offerings). Replenish 2 of these offerings after doom is placed on a card with no doom.
[fast] Spend 1 offering: You get +2 [willpower] or +2 [combat] for this skill test. (Limit once per test.)
Name: Cat Mask

Description:
Limit 1 per deck.
[fast] Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at any location and exhaust Rod of Carnamagos: Reveal 5 random chaos tokens from the chaos bag. If a [curse] token is revealed, search your bonded cards for a random [[Rot]] event and attach it to that enemy.
Name: Rod of Carnamagos

Description: Bonded (Rod of Carnamagos). Attached enemy cannot attack. Forced - When attached enemy leaves play: Set Abyssal Rot aside, out of play.
Name: Abyssal Rot

Description: Bonded (Rod of Carnamagos). Forced - When attached enemy is defeated: Gain resources equal to its printed health (to a maximum of 5). Forced - When attached enemy leaves play: Set Aember Rot aside, out of play.
Name: Aember Rot

Description: Bonded (Rod of Carnamagos). Attached enemy gets -1 fight and -1 evade. Forced - When attached enemy leaves play: Set Putrescent Rot aside, out of play.
Name: Putrescent Rot

Description: Bonded (Rod of Carnamagos). Forced - At the end of the round: Attached enemy takes 1 damage. Forced - When attached enemy leaves play: Set Scarlet Rot aside, out of play.
Name: Scarlet Rot

Description: Bonded (Rod of Carnamagos). Attached enemy cannot move. Forced - When attached enemy leaves play: Set Virescent Rot aside, out of play.
Name: Virescent Rot

Description: Uses (6 offerings). [action] Spend any number of offerings: Parley. Choose a [[Spell]] or [[Ritual]] event in your discard pile and reveal tokens from the chaos bag equal to the number of offerings spent. If at least 1 [skull] or [curse] token was revealed, return the chosen event to your hand.
Name: Speak to the Dead

Description: [action] Add 1-3 [curse] tokens to the chaos bag: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack for each [curse] token added as part of this action's cost. If this attack defeats an enemy, replenish 1 charge or offering on an asset you control.
Name: Wicked Athame

Description:
As an additional cost to play Antediluvian Hymn, spend an action.
Reveal the top 5 cards of the encounter deck. For each card revealed, you may add 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag to place that card on the bottom of the encounter deck. Return the rest to the top of the encounter deck in any order.
Name: Antediluvian Hymn

Description: Parley. Choose an enemy at your location and test [willpower](X), where X is the chosen enemy's fight value. If you succeed, move 1 damage from your investigator to the chosen enemy (up to 2 damage instead if the chosen enemy is non-[[Elite]]).
Flavor: What was yours is now mine.
Name: Drain Essence

Description: When you commit Accursed to a skill test, add up to 3 [curse] tokens to the chaos bag. During this skill test, treat the modifier of each [curse] token revealed as 0.
Flavor: Not all who wander are lost.
Name: Accursed

Description: While this card is committed to a skill test, the performing investigator may ignore all keyword or location effects that would trigger during this test.
Flavor: The dreaming mind is as deep as any sea.
Name: Mesmeric Influence

Description: [reaction] When you would reveal a chaos token, exhaust Olive McBride: Reveal 4 chaos tokens instead of 1. Choose 2 of those tokens to resolve, and ignore the rest.
Flavor: You must invest yourself in every spell. Sometimes literally.
Name: Olive McBride

Description: [fast] Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at any location and exhaust Rod of Carnamagos: Reveal 5 random chaos tokens from the chaos bag. For each [curse] token revealed, you may search your bonded cards for a [[Rot]] event and attach it to that enemy.
Name: Rod of Carnamagos

Description:
As an additional cost to play Call the Beyond, add 3 [curse] tokens to the chaos bag.
Choose an asset you control with "uses (charges)" or "uses (secrets)". Replenish all of that asset's charges or secrets. Then, you may resolve an [action] or [fast] ability on that asset without paying its [action] cost, if any.
Name: Call the Beyond

Description: Evade. Add your [willpower] value to your skill value for this evasion attempt. If you succeed, disengage from each other enemy engaged with you, and for the remainder of the round, you are ethereal (enemies cannot engage or be engaged with you, and you cannot attack or deal damage to enemies). If a symbol was revealed during this evasion attempt, return Ethereal Form to your hand at the end of your turn.
Name: Ethereal Form

Description: Investigate. Add your [willpower] value to your skill value for this investigation. You may ignore any effect or keyword on your location which would trigger during this investigation. If you succeed, discover 1 additional clue at this location. If a symbol was revealed during this investigation, return Read the Signs to your hand at the end of your turn.
Name: Read the Signs

Description: Fight. Add your [willpower] value to your skill value for this attack. Immediately before this attack, you may engage the attacked enemy. This attack deals +1 damage (+2 damage instead if the enemy is non-[[Elite]]). If a symbol was revealed during this attack, return Spectral Razor to your hand at the end of your turn.
Name: Spectral Razor

Description:
As an additional cost to play Ethereal Weaving, spend an action.
Reveal up to 3 different [[Spell]] events from your hand. One at a time, play each revealed event, reducing its cost by 1. While resolving each of these events, you get +2 skill value.
Name: Ethereal Weaving

Description:
[fast] If there are more [bless] than [curse] tokens in the chaos bag, remove 1 [bless] token from the chaos bag and exhaust The Key of Solomon: Heal up to 2 damage and/or horror from an investigator or [[Ally]] asset at your location.
[fast] If there are more [curse] than [bless] tokens in the chaos bag, remove 1 [curse] token from the chaos bag and exhaust The Key of Solomon: Gain 2 resources.
Name: The Key of Solomon

Description:
Fast. Play after a skill test at your location ends in which at least 2 [curse] tokens or 2 [bless] tokens were revealed.
If 2 [curse] tokens were revealed, search your bonded cards for 1 copy of Servant of Brass and put it into play. If 2 [bless] tokens were revealed, search your bonded cards for Keeper of the Key and put it into play. If 2 [curse] tokens and 2 [bless] tokens were revealed, do both instead. Remove Seal of the Elders from the game.
Name: Seal of the Elders

Description: Bonded (Seal of the Elders). [reaction] When a [bless] token is revealed during a skill test at your location: Deal 1 horror to Keeper of the Key and discover 1 clue at your location or a connecting location. Forced - When Keeper of the Key would leave play: Set it aside, out of play.
Name: Keeper of the Key

Description: Bonded (Seal of the Elders). [reaction] When a [curse] token is revealed during a skill test at your location: Deal 1 damage to Servant of Brass and 2 damage to an enemy at your location or a connecting location. Forced - When Servant of Brass would leave play: Set it aside, out of play.
Name: Servant of Brass

Description:
Uses (3 supplies). If Matchbox has no supplies, discard it.
[fast] During any investigator's turn, exhaust Matchbox and spend 1 supply: Your location gets -1 shroud until the end of this turn.
Name: Matchbox

Description:
While Pelt Shipment is in your hand, your maximum hand size is reduced by 3.
[reaction] When the game ends or you resign, if Pelt Shipment is in your hand: Reduce the experience cost of the next new card you purchase before the next scenario by 1.
Name: Pelt Shipment

Description: [action]: Fight. You get +1 [combat] and deal +2 damage for this attack. If this attack is successful, lose control of Pitchfork and attach it to your location. Your location gains: "[action]: Take control of Pitchfork. Any investigator at Pitchfork's location may trigger this ability."
Name: Pitchfork

Description:
Limit 1 [[Mask]] per investigator.
Uses (2 offerings). Replenish 1 of these offerings after you take 1 or more damage and/or horror.
[fast] Spend 1 offering: You get +2 [willpower] or +2 [agility] for this skill test. (Limit once per test.)
Name: Sparrow Mask

Description: As an additional cost to play Elaborate Distraction, spend an action. Playing Elaborate Distraction does not provoke attacks of opportunity. For each enemy at your location and at each connecting location (choose one): - Automatically evade that enemy if it is non-[[Elite]]. - Deal 1 damage to that enemy.
Name: Elaborate Distraction

Description: Choose a [[Weapon]] or [[Tool]] asset in your discard pile. Resolve an [action] ability on that asset, ignoring all costs (including its [action] cost). After this effect resolves, shuffle the chosen asset into your deck. Playing this card does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
Name: Pushed to the Limit

Description: Parley. Choose an enemy at your location. Test [willpower] (X), where X is the chosen enemy's fight or evade value, whichever is lower. If you succeed, exhaust the chosen enemy (but do not disengage from it). If it is non-[[Elite]], it does not ready during the next upkeep phase. If you fail, return Stall for Time to your hand.
Name: Stall for Time

Description:
As an additional cost to play Wrong Place, Right Time, spend an action.
Move up to 5 damage and/or horror from your investigator to assets controlled by investigators at your location. For each asset defeated by this effect, draw 1 card. Remove Wrong Place, Right Time from the game.
Name: Wrong Place, Right Time

Description:
You may commit Long Shot to a fight or evasion test against an enemy at your location or a connecting location.
If this test is successful, deal 1 damage to that enemy.
Name: Long Shot

Description: [action]: Fight. Add your [agility] to your skill value for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage. If this attack defeats an enemy, discard Hatchet. Otherwise, lose control of Hatchet and attach it to the attacked enemy. Attached enemy gains: "[reaction] When attached enemy is defeated: Take control of Hatchet. Any investigator at Hatchet's location may trigger this ability."
Name: Hatchet

Description: You may commit Persistence to a skill test from your discard pile. If you do, shuffle it into your deck after this test ends.
Flavor: "Anyone but a stolid farmer would have fainted or gone mad..." - H.P. Lovecraft, <u>The Colour Out of Space</u>
Name: Persistence

Description: Forced - When your turn begins: Move 1 damage from your investigator to "Devil". Forced - When "Devil" is defeated: Deal 2 damage to each enemy and investigator at your location.
Flavor: I will guide thy hand.
Name: "Devil"

Description: Fast. [action]: Fight. If you have no resources in your resource pool, this attack deals +1 damage. [free] During an attack using Fire Axe, spend 1 resource: You get +2 [combat] for this skill test. (Limit three times per attack.)
Name: Fire Axe

Description:
[fast] Exhaust Hunting Jacket: Choose 1 non-weakness card in your hand and attach it facedown to Hunting Jacket (max 3 cards attached). Then, gain 1 resource for each attached card.
[reaction] When Hunting Jacket is defeated: Draw each attached card.
Name: Hunting Jacket

Description: [action] Exhaust Mariner's Compass: Investigate. If you fail, ready Mariner's Compass. If you succeed and have no resources in your resource pool, discover 1 additional clue at your location. [fast] During an investigation using Mariner's Compass, spend 1 resource: You get +1 [intellect] for this skill test. (Limit three times per investigation.)
Name: Mariner's Compass

Description:
[fast] Choose a card you own that is attached to your location and exhaust Survival Technique: Add that card to your hand.
[fast] During a skill test on a location or on a treachery attached to your location, exhaust Survival Technique: You get +2 skill value for this test.
Name: Survival Technique

Description:
Fast. Play during any [fast] window.
Add 4 [bless] tokens to the chaos bag.
Flavor: Those who walk in faith need not fear the dark.
Name: Keep Faith

Description: If this skill test is successful, add 1 [bless] token to the chaos bag for each damage or horror on you (whichever is less).
Flavor: Courage is your best defense against whatever horrors lurk beyond.
Name: Providential

Description: [reaction] After a skill test ends in which 1 or more [curse] or [auto_fail] tokens were revealed, exhaust Token of Faith: Add that many [bless] tokens to the chaos bag. If this skill test failed, after resolving all effects from the failed test, the performing investigator may attempt that test again. (Max once per test.)
Name: Token of Faith

Description:
Permanent. Limit 1 per deck.
During the upkeep phase, you may choose to not gain resources.
While you have no resources in your resource pool, you get +1 [willpower], +1 [intellect], +1 [combat], and +1 [agility].
Name: Dark Horse

Description:
Uses (4 charges).
You may play events with "parley" from your discard pile as if they were in your hand. As an additional cost to play an event this way, spend 1 charge from Eldritch Tongue. After that event resolves, remove it from the game.
Name: Eldritch Tongue

Description:
As an additional cost to play Bide Your Time, spend an action.
During your next turn, you may take two additional actions.
Flavor: It's half past midnight, and you're starting to wonder if the whole thing's a ruse.
Name: Bide Your Time

Description: While Well-Dressed is committed to a skill test during a parley action, it gains [wild] [wild] [wild].
Flavor: The fine clothes do all the talking.
Name: Well-Dressed

Description:
Fast. Play after revealing chaos tokens during a skill test at your location.
Ignore the modifiers of each [curse] token revealed during this test. For each [curse] token ignored, deal 1 damage to an enemy at your location.
Flavor: Only the strongest spirit can sunder the dark.
Name: Dawn Star

Description:
Permanent. Limit 1 per deck.
You have 1 additional hand, accessory, or arcane slot, which can only be used to hold a [[Blessed]] or [[Cursed]] asset.
Flavor: "The price is but a pittance for what you will gain."
Name: Occult Reliquary

Description:
Limit 1 per deck. Limit 1 [[Mask]] per investigator.
[reaction] After a skill test at your location ends in which both a [bless] and [curse] token were revealed: Place 1 resource on this card, as an offering. Then, if there are 3 offerings on this card, search your bonded cards for Twilight Diadem and swap it with this card, moving all offerings from this card to Twilight Diadem.
Name: Broken Diadem

Description:
Bonded (Broken Diadem). Limit 1 [[Mask]] per investigator.
[reaction] When you reveal either a [bless] or [curse] token during a skill test, spend 1 offering and exhaust this card: Treat the revealed token as an [elder_sign] token instead, returning it to the chaos bag. Then, if this card has no offerings, search your bonded cards for Broken Diadem and swap it with this card.
Name: Twilight Diadem

Description: Revelation - You must either put Maimed Hand into play in your threat area, or take 1 damage and shuffle it into your deck. It cannot leave play except by the [action] [action] ability below. You get -1 health. [action] [action]: Discard Maimed Hand.
Name: Maimed Hand

Description: Revelation - You must either put Back Injury into play in your threat area, or take 1 damage and shuffle it into your deck. It cannot leave play except by the [action] [action] ability below. You get -1 health. [action] [action]: Discard Back Injury.
Name: Back Injury

Description: Revelation - You must either put The Silver Moth into play in your threat area, or take 1 horror and shuffle it into your deck. It cannot leave play except by the [action] [action] ability below. You get -1 sanity. [action] [action]: Discard The Silver Moth.
Name: The Silver Moth

Description: Revelation - You must either put Vow of Drzytelech into play in your threat area, or take 1 horror and shuffle it into your deck. It cannot leave play except by the [action] [action] ability below. You get -1 sanity. [action] [action]: Discard Vow of Drzytelech.
Name: Vow of Drzytelech

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is half your alarm level (rounded up).
[cultist]: Reveal another token. If you fail, raise your alarm level by 1.
[tablet]: -3. If you fail, the nearest enemy moves once toward you.
[elder_thing]: -5. You may raise your alarm level by 1 to automatically succeed, instead.
Description2:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is your alarm level.
[cultist]: Reveal another token. If you fail, raise your alarm level by 1.
[tablet]: -4. The nearest enemy moves once toward you.
[elder_thing]: -6. You may raise your alarm level by 1 to automatically succeed, instead.
Name: Fortune and Folly

Description: Forced - At the start of the enemy phase: Each investigator who is at the same location as a ready [[Casino]] enemy raises their alarm level by 1. Forced - After an investigator defeats a [[Casino]] enemy: Raise that investigator's alarm level by 1.
Description2: If the investigators, as a group, possess 10 [per_investigator] or more resources, remember that you "cleaned out the house." (→R1)
Flavor: You have arrived at Défis de la Roulette. If you are to recover the Wellspring, you must learn all that you can about this casino and the cult that operates it.
Flavor2: The stray glances that you have started attracting from the dealers and guards have become more frequent. In a shadowed corner, a group of uniformed security gathers together in conversation. As you watch them, one looks at you and points in your direction. They begin to head your way...
Name: The House Always Watches

Description: Forced - At the start of the enemy phase: Each investigator who is at the same location as a ready [[Casino]] enemy raises their alarm level by 1. Forced - After an investigator defeats a [[Casino]] enemy: Raise that investigator's alarm level by 1.
Description2: Spawn the set-aside Dimensional Shambler at the Roulette Wheel. Shuffle the encounter discard pile and the set-aside Plan in Shambles encounter set into the encounter deck. Raise each investigator's alarm level by 1.
Flavor: Défis de la Roulette is bustling on this busy night — the perfect cover for you and your crew. You hope that your long days of planning will pay off.
Flavor2: A voice from the roulette tables cuts clearly through the din of the entire casino: "Red 19!" Someone nearby shouts in excitement. A few moments later, the same voice calls out once more: "Red 19 hits again!" You hear murmurings around you. Such an event is highly improbable. For a moment, you feel a small crackling in the air, but you shrug it off. Then, just when normalcy seems to have reasserted itself, the voice calls out once more in disbelief: "Red 19 a third time!" The crackling is unmistakable this time and begins to intensify until everything seems to blur for a moment. When your vision clears, a terrible creature beyond all imagining stands in the middle of the crowded casino, towering above the humans surrounding it. With a sinking feeling, you remember Isamara's warning that the relic's presence might invite disaster. If that wasn't bad enough, said disaster will fall on those who are not favored by the bearer of the Wellspring.
Name: Opening Hand

Description: Forced - At the start of the enemy phase: Each investigator who is at the same location as a ready [[Casino]] enemy raises their alarm level by 1. Forced - After an investigator defeats a [[Casino]] enemy: Raise that investigator's alarm level by 1.
Description2:
Shuffle the 3 set-aside Fortune's Disfavor story cards and select 1 of them at random, resolving its text.
Raise each investigator's alarm level by 1.
Flavor: The heist has become more complicated than you could have ever imagined. Terrifying monsters have appeared on the casino floor. The patrons, however, seem to be in a daze, while the staff continue to watch for suspicious activity. Can they not see the danger they are all in?
Flavor2: Just when it seems like things couldn't get any worse, there is a strange transformation in the atmosphere of the casino, the calm before a storm. Then, like the last gasp before drowning, the storm of misfortune breaks...
Name: The Turn

Description: Forced - At the start of the enemy phase: Each investigator who is at the same location as a ready [[Casino]] enemy raises their alarm level by 1. Forced - After an investigator defeats a [[Casino]] enemy: Raise that investigator's alarm level by 1.
Description2: Each investigator who did not resign is defeated and suffers 1 physical trauma. (→R3)
Flavor: The cult is against you. Creatures from beyond time and space are against you. Now fortune itself is against you. No one said this would be easy.
Flavor2: You try desperately to escape, but your luck has run out at last. Several cultists wearing familiar coin medallions block your way out. Behind you, the horrifying creatures that were summoned by the Wellspring's power rampage through the casino. Chaos erupts around you. It is only then the crowds and the casino security seem to finally notice the horrible truth lurking within the casino. You try your best to fend off both the creatures and the cultists, and you barely escape with your life.
Name: All Bets Down

Description: [reaction] After you trigger the [action] ability on a [[Game]] location: Remove 1 clue from The Wellspring of Fortune (2 clues instead if you gained resources from the [[Game]] location's ability). Objective - Accomplish as many tasks as you can and get out before you are noticed! If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.
Description2: Each investigator who was defeated raises their alarm level by 2. If the investigators, as a group, possess 10 [per_investigator] or more resources, remember that you “cleaned out the house.” (→R2)
Flavor: You must tread carefully, as arousing suspicion may ruin your plans before they have even begun.
Flavor2: With one last parting glance, you exit the casino. You're confident that none of the dealers or security suspected you for anything other than what you pretended to be: just another hopeful gambler. Regardless of any money that you made or lost tonight, your real winnings will be the information that you were able to gather. You hope that it will be enough to prepare you for the improbable scheme that you must now concoct and pull off.
Name: Casing the Joint

Description: [reaction] After you trigger the [action] ability on a [[Game]] location: Remove 1 clue from The Wellspring of Fortune (2 clues instead if you gained resources from the [[Game]] location's ability). Objective - If an investigator controls The Wellspring of Fortune, advance.
Description2:
If Abarran Arrigorriagakoa is still in play...
Just as you are ready to celebrate victory, a voice calls from the door behind you. "You come into my casino and steal from me?" Abarran stands there, shaking with fury. "You'll ruin everything I built. But I won't let you!" Any front of professionalism has been dropped. The true danger of the man has been revealed.
Move Abarran Arrigorriagakoa (Abarran Unleashed) to Relic Room.
If Abarran Arrigorriagakoa is in the victory display...
A ragged voice gasps from behind you. "I won't let you take it!" Abarran is somehow still on his feet in the doorway behind you. Although he looks ready to collapse, his eyes burn with hatred. Before you can stop him, he slams his fist against some kind of mechanism on the wall before slumping to the ground. Large sections of the solid steel ceiling begin to fall from above...
Each investigator must test [agility] (3). Each investigator who fails takes 2 damage.
Flavor: The heist begins. You must open the vault door, locate the Wellspring, make it past the mystical defenses, and find a way to open the container that holds it.
Name: The Take

Description: Each [[Casino]] enemy loses aloof and patrol. Each [[Casino]] enemy gains hunter and "Prey - Investigator that controls The Wellspring of Fortune." Objective - If the investigator with The Wellspring of Fortune has resigned, advance. (Beware - any investigator who has not resigned will be left behind!)
Description2: Each investigator who has not resigned is defeated and suffers 1 physical trauma. (→R1)
Flavor: Getting in was one thing, but now you must make it out with your prize. It feels as if the whole casino stands between you and the world outside.
Flavor2: There were times when you weren't sure whether you would make it out of the casino with your skin and soul intact, but here you stand. It almost feels like a dream, but you can still hear a commotion inside. It's time to leave this place behind and make yourself scarce.
Name: The Exit

Description: [action]: Resign. It's time to get out of here! [action]: Place an asset from your hand or play area facedown beneath Casino Floor, as part of your crew's "stash for the heist." (Limit once per turn.)
Flavor: Standing in the center of the casino floor is overwhelming, with its dazzling interior and the clamor of well-to-do patrons.
Name: Casino Floor

Description: [action] Spend 2 resources: Discard the top 5 cards of the encounter deck and check their game icons. You may mulligan once. If all 5 cards have a sequential rank, or if 3 or more of the cards have the same rank, gain 5 resources.
Flavor: Omaha 8-or-better, nothing's wild, sky's the limit.
Flavor2: The poker tables are constantly in demand, each game filled with players from around the continent and the world. Clattering fills the air as piles of chips are relentlessly pushed and stacked, each one a bet against destiny. The air is thick with smoke, sweat, and the tension of a good bluff.
Name: Poker Table

Description: [action] Spend 1 resource: Name a color and a rank. Then, discard the top card of the encounter deck and check its game icon. If it matches the named color and rank, gain 5 resources.
Flavor: Red or black, what tickles your fancy?
Flavor2: Roulette seems to be a favorite of many patrons and of the establishment itself. The casino is named after this icon of Monte Carlo gambling, after all.
Name: Roulette Wheel

Description: [action] Spend 2 resources: Name "player," "banker," or "tie." Discard the top 2 cards of the encounter deck and check their game icons. If the combined value of their ranks is higher than 18, the "player" wins. If the combined value is lower than 18, the "banker" wins. If the combined value is equal to 18, it is a "tie." If this result matches the result you named, gain 4 resources.
Flavor2: Baccarat has been popular among French nobility and aristocrats for over a century, perhaps longer. Even in this casino, this seems to remain true, with the most well-dressed and ostentatious sitting around the baccarat tables.
Name: Baccarat Table

Description: [action] Spend 1 resource: Discard the top 3 cards of the encounter deck and check their game icons. If all 3 cards have the same suit or same rank, gain 3 resources.
Flavor: "Jackpot!"
Flavor2: Several rows of machines stand to one side, hooking unwary souls into an endless cycle of spend and pull, spend and pull, spend and pull. No skill or finesse needed here - just raw submission to the whims of fortune.
Name: Slot Machines

Description: [action] If there are no clues here, spend 4 resources: Remember that you "impersonated a high roller." Discard the top 5 cards of the encounter deck and check their game icons. You may mulligan once. If all 5 cards have the same suit or a sequential rank, or if 4 of the cards have the same rank, gain 8 resources.
Name: High Roller's Table

Description: [action] If there are no clues on Casino Lounge: Test [agility] (3). If you succeed, remember that you "found a vent."
Flavor: The sumptuous lounge area boasts culinary delights, a stage suitable for all manner of entertainment, and countless tables for conducting business - both legal and illicit.
Name: Casino Lounge

Description: Forced - When Staff Access Hallway is revealed: Spawn Abarran Arrigorriagakoa (Abarran Unleashed) at Owner's Office. Shuffle the encounter discard pile and the set-aside Fortune's Chosen encounter set into the encounter deck.
Description2: As an additional cost to enter Staff Access Hallway, investigators at a connecting location must spend 4 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.
Flavor: "Is this the way to the bathroom?"
Flavor2: The door to the restricted section of the casino beckons... but you must find a way through when no one is looking and the entrance is unguarded.
Name: Staff Access Hallway

Description: [action]: Choose 1, 2, or 3. Discard that many cards from the top of the encounter deck and check their game icons. If an icon matches the rank of an enemy in play, remember that you "observed the staff." If the combined value of the discarded cards is 19 or higher, draw the top card in the encounter discard pile.
Flavor2: A sign on the door reads "Security." You've heard from your sources that the staff has some means of monitoring the casino at all times. Perhaps whatever is behind this door provides the answer.
Name: Security Office

Description:
[action] If all of the following are true, remember that you "impersonated a guard:"
- There are no enemies at Guard Room.
- There are no clues remaining on Guard Room.
- An investigator "obtained an employee uniform."
Flavor2: Through a crack in the door, you see a room filled with security uniforms and equipment.
Name: Guard Room

Description:
X is equal to the highest alarm level among investigators at Owner's Office.
[action] If there are no clues on Owner's Office: Remember that you "found Abarran's sigil."
Description2: The Owner's Office is locked. As an additional cost to enter Owner's Office, investigators at a connecting location must spend 2 [per_investigator] clues, as a group, unless an investigator "stole Abarran's keys."
Flavor: Abarran's safe and desk drawers are locked. The far side of the office peers into the main hall of the casino through a false wall.
Flavor2: The placard next to the door reads "Abarran Arrigorriagakoa." It's likely that important secrets and materials might be kept here... if only you could get in.
Name: Owner's Office

Description:
[action] Investigators at Counting Room spend 10 [per_investigator] resources, as a group (5 [per_investigator] instead if you "found a vent"): Remember that you "obtained a schematic."
[reaction] After you successfully investigate Counting Room by 2 or more: Gain 2 resources. (Limit once per turn.)
Flavor2: The clinking of chips and coins emanates through the doorway of this room. You're not really here for money, though… right?
Name: Counting Room

Description: [action] Move. Discard the top card of the encounter deck and check its game icon (if an investigator "obtained a schematic," you may mulligan up to two times): - Ifits suit is ♣ or ♠: Move to Guard Room. - If its suit is ♥: Move to Casino Lounge. - If its suit is ♦: Move to Baccarat Table.
Description2: The door to the casino vault is locked, guarded, and warded with magic. You cannot enter Vault Door unless you have completed at least 4 of the tasks on The Heist story card.
Flavor2: A massive steel door looms before you. Miniscule grooves run through it from top to bottom, seemingly acting as channels for the arcane energy that keeps it shut.
Name: Vault Door

Description: Forced - After Relic Room is revealed: Move all clues from The Wellspring of Fortune to Relic Room. [action] If there are no clues on Relic Room: Take control of The Wellspring of Fortune and attach it to your investigator card.
Description2:
You cannot enter Relic Room.
Vault Door gains: "[action] Take 1 damage and 1 horror unless an investigator "found Abarran's sigil": Test [willpower] or [agility] (4). If you succeed, investigators at Vault Door may spend 4 [per_investigator] clues, as a group, to reveal Relic Room.
Name: Relic Room

Description:
Each of the following is a task that can be completed in Fortune and Folly, Part I: □ An investigator "found a vent." □ An investigator "impersonated a high roller." □ An investigator "convinced Isamara to participate in the heist." □ An investigator "obtained an employee uniform." □ An investigator "stole Abarran's keys." □ An investigator "cleaned out the house."
Forced - When an investigator is eliminated (by defeat or resignation): Place each of that investigator's clues on this story card, instead of placing them at their location.
Description2: Each of the following is a task that can be completed in Fortune and Folly, Part II: □ An investigator "won a cultist medallion." □ An investigator "observed the staff." □ An investigator "found Abarran's sigil." □ An investigator "obtained a schematic." □ An investigator "impersonated a guard." □ An investigator "stayed out of sight." □ An investigator "delivered a decoy package." □ "Isamara mesmerized the guards with her song." Hint: You must complete at least 4 of these tasks to unlock the vault door.
Name: The Stakeout

Description:
This casino employee looks like they are wearing a uniform in your size.
[action]: Fight. Perform this attack only on the attached enemy. Test [combat] (3). If you succeed, attached enemy has been knocked out (read the section below). If you fail, raise your alarm level by 1. If attached enemy leaves play, remove this story card from the game.
If attached enemy is knocked out: Remember that you "obtained an employee uniform." Raise your alarm level by 1 if another enemy is at your location or a connecting location. Discard the attached enemy. Remove this story card from the game.
Description2:
You pass the package to the employee.
The attached enemy's patrol location changes to Vault Door. Attached enemy loses the [[Casino]] trait. If attached enemy enters Vault Door, the package has been delivered (read the section below). If attached enemy leaves play, remove this story card from the game.
If the package has been delivered: Choose an investigator to search their deck for an [[Ally]] or [[Item]] asset and place it facedown beneath Vault Door. Remember that you "delivered a decoy package." Discard the attached enemy and attach this story card to Vault Door. [action]: Put the facedown asset beneath Vault Door into play under your control. Remove this story card from the game.
Name: If the Uniform Fits…

Description:
Isamara warned you that the relic you seek possesses strange abilities that bring misfortune upon those who are not favored by its bearer. Perhaps, then, you should have factored a sudden turn of fortune into your plans. For, at this moment, in the midst of your high-stakes heist, everything is about to be turned upside-down...
Flip this card over and resolve the text on its other side.
Description2:
Just as you are about to act, there is a sudden pop and a spark, and the casino plunges into total darkness. There are panicked whispers from all around. This seems like an unfortunately timed malfunction of some kind. Now you must find your way forward in the dark unless you can find a way to restore the power.
Put this card into play next to the agenda deck. Place a damage token on each location. Each location with a damage token has no lights and gains: "This location gets +1 shroud. As an additional cost to trigger an ability on this location, you must either spend an additional action or take 1 horror." While an investigator is at Security Office, they may perform the following action: [action]: Spend 1 [per_investigator] clues. Choose one - - Restore power to the main hall. Remove a damage token from each [[Public]] location. - Restore power to the staff area. Remove a damage token from each [[Restricted]] location.
Name: Fortune's Disfavor

Description:
Isamara warned you that the relic you seek possesses strange abilities that bring misfortune upon those who are not favored by its bearer. Perhaps, then, you should have factored a sudden turn of fortune into your plans. For, at this moment, in the midst of your high-stakes heist, everything is about to be turned upside-down...
Flip this card over and resolve the text on its other side.
Description2:
What suddenly strikes the casino can only be described as a series of extremely unlikely and unfortunate mishaps. Glasses shatter, stray dice cause patrons to slip and fall, and chandeliers crash onto skulls.
Put this card into play next to the agenda deck. One at a time, each investigator discards the top card of the encounter deck and checks its game icon. The following injury applies to that investigator for the remainder of the game: - If its suit is ♥: You are limited to one move action per turn. - If its suit is ♦: You are limited to one investigate action per turn. - If its suit is ♣: You are limited to one fight action per turn. - If its suit is ♠: You are limited to one activate action per turn. [free] Take 1 damage or 1 horror: Ignore the effects of your injury until the end of your turn. Any investigator may trigger this ability. (Limit once per turn.)
Name: Fortune's Disfavor

Description:
Isamara warned you that the relic you seek possesses strange abilities that bring misfortune upon those who are not favored by its bearer. Perhaps, then, you should have factored a sudden turn of fortune into your plans. For, at this moment, in the midst of your high-stakes heist, everything is about to be turned upside-down...
Flip this card over and resolve the text on its other side.
Description2:
You have learned that someone from your past works in this casino - what are the odds? Unfortunately, Abarran has learned of this connection as well. You have to rescue them before it's too late!
Attach this story card to Owner's Office. This story card represents somebody connected to the lead investigator. [action] Investigators at Owner's Office spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Remove this story card from the game. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase: Place 1 horror on this story card (2 horror instead if there is an enemy at Owner's Office).
If there is 6 or more horror on this story card: You are too late. The lead investigator suffers 1 mental trauma. Each investigator takes 2 direct horror. Remove this story card from the game.
Name: Fortune's Disfavor

Description: Cannot be discarded. [action] Parley. Choose a [[Casino]] enemy at your location and test [willpower] or [intellect] (3). If you succeed, exhaust The Face to reduce any investigator's alarm level by 1.
Flavor: Who needs lockpicks when you have this smile?
Name: The Face

Description:
Cannot be discarded.
[reaction] After you defeat a [[Casino]] enemy, exhaust The Muscle: Reduce your alarm level by 1 (2 instead if there are no other [[Casino]] enemies at your location or a connecting location).
Name: The Muscle

Description:
Cannot be discarded.
[reaction] When a [[Casino]] enemy at a connecting location resolves its patrol keyword, exhaust The Thief: Change the patrol location of that enemy from "clockwise" to "counterclockwise," or vice versa, for this move.
Name: The Thief

Description: Cannot be discarded. [reaction] When you check game icons while resolving an ability on a [[Game]] location, exhaust The Grifter: Choose one - - Raise your alarm level by 1 to change the rank, suit, or color of a discarded game icon (to anything). - Reduce your alarm level by 1.
Name: The Grifter

Description: [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] (X), where X is the highest alarm level among the investigators. If you succeed, place 1 clue (from the token pool) on Isamara Ordoñez. Then, if there are 1 [per_investigator] clues on her, remember that you "convinced Isamara to participate in the heist."
Name: Isamara Ordoñez

Description: [free]: Move Cash Cart to a connecting location. [reaction] When an enemy would engage you or enter your location: Deal 1 damage to Cash Cart. Until the end of the round, enemies at this location cannot engage you. Forced - When Cash Cart is defeated: Remember that you "stayed out of sight." Remove Cash Cart from the game.
Name: Cash Cart

Description: Aloof. Patrol (clockwise). Forced - When you engage Abarran Arrigorriagakoa: Immediately advance the agenda. [action]: Test [agility](3). If you fail, raise your alarm level by 1. If you succeed, discard the top card of the encounter deck and check its game icon. If its color is red, remember that you "stole Abarran's keys." ♦A
Name: Abarran Arrigorriagakoa

Description: Aloof. Patrol (counterclockwise). Spawn - High Roller's Table or Guard Room (whichever is nearest to you). Forced - After you raise your alarm level while at Casino Guard's location: Take 1 damage. ♣Q
Flavor: I need to talk to you for a moment.
Name: Casino Guard

Description: Aloof. Patrol (counterclockwise). Spawn - High Roller's Table or Guard Room (whichever is nearest to you). Forced - After you raise your alarm level while at Casino Guard's location: Take 1 damage. ♣J
Flavor: I need to talk to you for a moment.
Name: Casino Guard

Description: Aloof. Patrol (clockwise). Spawn - High Roller's Table or Guard Room (whichever is nearest to you). Forced - After you raise your alarm level while at Casino Guard's location: Take 1 damage. ♥10
Flavor: I need to talk to you for a moment.
Name: Casino Guard

Description:
Aloof. Patrol (clockwise).
While House Dealer is ready, each ability on its location costs an additional action to trigger.
♥9
Flavor: Would you like to stay or hit?
Name: House Dealer

Description:
Aloof. Patrol (counterclockwise).
While House Dealer is ready, each ability on its location costs an additional action to trigger.
♣9
Flavor: Would you like to stay or hit?
Name: House Dealer

Description: Aloof. Patrol (clockwise). Spawn - Casino Lounge or Security Office (whichever is nearest to you). Forced - After Security Patrol moves to your location during the enemy phase: Raise your alarm level by 1. ♥Q
Name: Security Patrol

Description: Aloof. Patrol (clockwise). Spawn - Casino Lounge or Security Office (whichever is nearest to you). Forced - After Security Patrol moves to your location during the enemy phase: Raise your alarm level by 1. ♥J
Name: Security Patrol

Description: Aloof. Patrol (counterclockwise). Spawn - Casino Lounge or Security Office (whichever is nearest to you). Forced - After Security Patrol moves to your location during the enemy phase: Raise your alarm level by 1. ♣10
Name: Security Patrol

Description: Revelation - If there are no non-unique [[Casino]] enemies in play, Inconvenient Questioning gains surge. Otherwise, the nearest non-unique [[Casino]] enemy moves once toward you, and you test [intellect] (3). If you fail, raise your alarm level by 1 and each non-unique [[Casino]] enemy at your location loses aloof until the end of this round. ♠9
Name: Inconvenient Questioning

Description: Revelation - If there are no non-unique [[Casino]] enemies in play, Inconvenient Questioning gains surge. Otherwise, the nearest non-unique [[Casino]] enemy moves once toward you, and you test [intellect] (3). If you fail, raise your alarm level by 1 and each non-unique [[Casino]] enemy at your location loses aloof until the end of this round. ♦9
Name: Inconvenient Questioning

Description: Revelation - If there are no non-unique [[Casino]] enemies in play, Inconvenient Questioning gains surge. Otherwise, the nearest non-unique [[Casino]] enemy moves once toward you, and you test [intellect] (3). If you fail, raise your alarm level by 1 and each non-unique [[Casino]] enemy at your location loses aloof until the end of this round. ♠8
Name: Inconvenient Questioning

Description: Revelation - If there are no non-unique [[Casino]] enemies in play, Inconvenient Questioning gains surge. Otherwise, the nearest non-unique [[Casino]] enemy moves once toward you, and you test [intellect] (3). If you fail, raise your alarm level by 1 and each non-unique [[Casino]] enemy at your location loses aloof until the end of this round. ♦8
Name: Inconvenient Questioning

Description: Revelation - Attach to the nearest location without a copy of Arcane Spotlight attached. Forced - After you enter attached location: Raise your alarm level by 1. Forced - At the end of the round: Each investigator at attached location raises their alarm level by 1. Discard Arcane Spotlight. ♠Q
Name: Arcane Spotlight

Description: Revelation - Attach to the nearest location without a copy of Arcane Spotlight attached. Forced - After you enter attached location: Raise your alarm level by 1. Forced - At the end of the round: Each investigator at attached location raises their alarm level by 1. Discard Arcane Spotlight. ♠J
Name: Arcane Spotlight

Description: Revelation - Attach to the nearest location without a copy of Arcane Spotlight attached. Forced - After you enter attached location: Raise your alarm level by 1. Forced - At the end of the round: Each investigator at attached location raises their alarm level by 1. Discard Arcane Spotlight. ♠10
Name: Arcane Spotlight

Description: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Take 2 horror. - Test [willpower] (X), where X is half your alarm level (rounded up). If you succeed, gain 2 resources. If you fail, take 2 horror and raise your alarm level by 1. ♦Q
Name: Avarice Calls

Description: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Take 2 horror. - Test [willpower] (X), where X is half your alarm level (rounded up). If you succeed, gain 2 resources. If you fail, take 2 horror and raise your alarm level by 1. ♦J
Name: Avarice Calls

Description: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Take 2 horror. - Test [willpower] (X), where X is half your alarm level (rounded up). If you succeed, gain 2 resources. If you fail, take 2 horror and raise your alarm level by 1. ♦10
Name: Avarice Calls

Description: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). If you fail, you must either take damage equal to half your alarm level (rounded up), or raise your alarm level by 1. ♣8
Flavor: Are they watching you or somebody else? All the same, might be better to get lost in the crowd.
Name: Suspicious Gaze

Description: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). If you fail, you must either take damage equal to half your alarm level (rounded up), or raise your alarm level by 1. ♠7
Flavor: Are they watching you or somebody else? All the same, might be better to get lost in the crowd.
Name: Suspicious Gaze

Description: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). If you fail, you must either take damage equal to half your alarm level (rounded up), or raise your alarm level by 1. ♣7
Flavor: Are they watching you or somebody else? All the same, might be better to get lost in the crowd.
Name: Suspicious Gaze

Description: Revelation - Put Obsessed Gambler into play in your threat area. Limit 1 per investigator. Forced - At the end of your turn: Take 1 horror if you did not gain resources this turn. Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Obsessed Gambler. ♥8
Name: Obsessed Gambler

Description: Revelation - Put Obsessed Gambler into play in your threat area. Limit 1 per investigator. Forced - At the end of your turn: Take 1 horror if you did not gain resources this turn. Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Obsessed Gambler. ♦7
Name: Obsessed Gambler

Description: Revelation - Put Obsessed Gambler into play in your threat area. Limit 1 per investigator. Forced - At the end of your turn: Take 1 horror if you did not gain resources this turn. Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Obsessed Gambler. ♥7
Name: Obsessed Gambler

Description:
Permanent.
[action]: Draw the top card of the possibilities deck. Flip this card over and consult the list on its other side to resolve its effect. Remove the drawn card from the possibilities deck for the remainder of the campaign. (Limit once per game.)
Name: Deck of Possibilities

Description:
You get +1 [willpower].
During the upkeep phase, you may choose to not ready Isamara Ordoñez.
[fast] Exhaust Isamara Ordoñez and deal 1 horror to her: Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location or a connecting location. That enemy cannot move until Isamara Ordoñez readies or leaves play.
Name: Isamara Ordoñez

Description: Shift - During the next skill test performed this round, the performing investigator reveals an additional chaos token, chooses one to resolve, and ignores the other. Flip this key to its [[Unstable]] side.
Flavor: File #93-♠ / Subject Class: Yellow / Subject appears as small coin, 34 mm in diameter, of unidentified metal.
Name: Wellspring of Fortune

Description: Patrol (counterclockwise). Retaliate. Forced - When you would deal 1 or more damage to Fortune's Shield: Discard the top card of the encounter deck and check its game icon. If its suit is ♥, cancel 1 of that damage. ♠K
Name: Fortune's Shield

Description: Patrol (clockwise). Retaliate. Forced - When you would deal 1 or more damage to Fortune's Shield: Discard the top card of the encounter deck and check its game icon. If its suit is ♥, cancel 1 of that damage. ♥K
Name: Fortune's Shield

Description: Patrol (counterclockwise). Retaliate. Forced - When Fortune's Dagger attacks you: Discard the top 2 cards of the encounter deck and check their game icons. For each card that has the ♣ suit, this attack deals +1 damage. ♣K
Name: Fortune's Dagger

Description: Patrol (clockwise). Retaliate. Forced - When Fortune's Dagger attacks you: Discard the top 2 cards of the encounter deck and check their game icons. For each card that has the ♣ suit, this attack deals +1 damage. ♦K
Name: Fortune's Dagger

Description: Hunter. Forced - After any investigator performs the same type of action twice in a row during the same phase, if Dimensional Shambler is ready and unengaged: Move it once toward that investigator. (Limit once per turn.) ♠A
Name: Dimensional Shambler

Description: Hunter. Forced - After you deal 1 or more damage to Dimensional Duplicator: Put the top card of your deck into play facedown, engaged with you. Treat this card as an [[Extradimensional]] enemy with 1 fight, 1 health, 1 evade, 1 damage, and 1 horror. If that enemy disengages from you, discard it. ♠6
Name: Dimensional Duplicator

Description: Hunter. Forced - After you deal 1 or more damage to Dimensional Duplicator: Put the top card of your deck into play facedown, engaged with you. Treat this card as an [[Extradimensional]] enemy with 1 fight, 1 health, 1 evade, 1 damage, and 1 horror. If that enemy disengages from you, discard it. ♣6
Name: Dimensional Duplicator

Description: Hunter. Retaliate. Spawn - Discard the nearest non-unique [[Casino]] enemy without an encounter card attached to it. Spawn Dimensional Displacer at that location. (If there are no such enemies in play, instead discard Dimensional Displacer and it gains surge.) ♦6
Name: Dimensional Displacer

Description: Hunter. Retaliate. Spawn - Discard the nearest non-unique [[Casino]] enemy without an encounter card attached to it. Spawn Dimensional Displacer at that location. (If there are no such enemies in play, instead discard Dimensional Displacer and it gains surge.) ♥6
Name: Dimensional Displacer

Description: Revelation - Attach to the nearest location without a copy of Dimensional Hypnosis attached. As an additional cost for you to leave attached location, test [willpower] (3). If you fail, cancel the effects of the move, move the nearest [[Extradimensional]] enemy once toward you, and discard Dimensional Hypnosis. ♠5
Name: Dimensional Hypnosis

Description: Revelation - Attach to the nearest location without a copy of Dimensional Hypnosis attached. As an additional cost for you to leave attached location, test [willpower] (3). If you fail, cancel the effects of the move, move the nearest [[Extradimensional]] enemy once toward you, and discard Dimensional Hypnosis. ♣5
Name: Dimensional Hypnosis

Description: Revelation - Attach to the nearest location without a copy of Dimensional Hypnosis attached. As an additional cost for you to leave attached location, test [willpower] (3). If you fail, cancel the effects of the move, move the nearest [[Extradimensional]] enemy once toward you, and discard Dimensional Hypnosis. ♠4
Name: Dimensional Hypnosis

Description: Revelation - Put Grip of the Beyond into play in your threat area. Forced - At the end of your turn: Take 2 damage. Reduce this damage by 1 for each time you moved this turn. Discard Grip of the Beyond. ♦5
Name: Grip of the Beyond

Description: Revelation - Put Grip of the Beyond into play in your threat area. Forced - At the end of your turn: Take 2 damage. Reduce this damage by 1 for each time you moved this turn. Discard Grip of the Beyond. ♥5
Name: Grip of the Beyond

Description: Revelation - Put Grip of the Beyond into play in your threat area. Forced - At the end of your turn: Take 2 damage. Reduce this damage by 1 for each time you moved this turn. Discard Grip of the Beyond. ♦4
Name: Grip of the Beyond

Description: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Discard an [[Ally]] asset you control. Each other investigator takes 1 horror. - Test [agility] (3). If you fail, take 1 direct damage and 1 direct horror. ♣4
Name: Hunter's Hunger

Description: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Discard an [[Ally]] asset you control. Each other investigator takes 1 horror. - Test [agility] (3). If you fail, take 1 direct damage and 1 direct horror. ♥4
Name: Hunter's Hunger

Description:
"Ashcan" Pete deck only. Replacement.
[fast] Exhaust Pete's Guitar: Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location or a connecting location. Move that enemy once in a direction of your choice. Then, if there are no enemies at your location, either heal 1 horror or gain 1 resource.
Name: Pete's Guitar

Description: Replacement. Revelation - Put Hard Times into play in your threat area. Forced - After you draw 1 or more cards: Choose and discard that many cards from hand. [action][action]: Discard Hard Times.
Name: Hard Times

Description: You begin the game with Ravenous (Controlled Hunger) in play. During each upkeep phase, draw 1 additional card and devour anon-weakness player card in your hand. [fast]: Devour a non-story card controlled by an investigator at your location. (Limit once per round.) [elder_sign] effect: +2. After this test ends, you may add a devoured card to its owner's hand.
Description2: Deck Size: 50. Deckbuilding Options: Neutral cards level 0-5, cards from any class level 0. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Ravenous, 3 copies of Regurgitation, 3 copies of Reality Acid, 2 random basic weaknesses. Deckbuilding Restrictions: No permanents except story and signature permanents. Additional Requirements: Your deck must include at least 7 cards from each class ([guardian], [seeker], [rogue], [mystic], and [survivor]). Additional Upgrade Options: After each scenario ends, separate each card you devoured (beneath Ravenous and set-aside) by class. Before the next scenario in this campaign, you may spend experience to purchase or upgrade 1 or more cards of any level from the class with the most devoured cards (if there is a tie, choose one).
Name: Subject 5U-21

Description: Subject 5U-21 deck only. Permanent. Each time you devour a card, place it facedown beneath Ravenous. You get +1 to each of your skills for each card beneath Ravenous (max +5). Forced - If there are 5 or more cards beneath Ravenous: Flip it over.
Name: Ravenous

Description: Subject 5U-21 deck only. Fast. Play only during your turn. If Ravenous (Uncontrolled Hunger) is face up, flip it over. Choose and return up to 3 cards you devoured (beneath Ravenous or set-aside) to their owners' hands. For each card returned in this way, heal 1 damage or 1 horror.
Name: Regurgitation

Description: Revelation - If Ravenous (Controlled Hunger) is face up, flip it over. You devour a random aspect of reality. Reveal a random chaost token from the chaos bag and consult Reality Acid reference card to determine what you devoured.
Name: Reality Acid

Description: Subject 5U-21 Devours... (If the chaos token revealed is not listed, or if the listed aspect cannot be devoured, reveal a new chaos token and consult the list again.) - [elder_sign]: ...a non-[[Elite]] enemy or treachery, at your location and worth no victory points. - +1: ...the top card of each investigator's discard pile. - 0: ...the top card of each investigator's deck. - -1: ...1 card at random from your hand. - -2: ...a non-story, non-weakness asset controlled by an investigator at your location. - -3: ...a player card attached to your location, or attached to an encounter card at your location. - -4: ...the top 2 cards of each investigator's deck. - -5: ...-3 cards of your choice from your hand. - -6: ...all events from each investigator's hand. - -7: ...a non-story, non-weakness asset from each investigator's play area. - -8: ...a non-weakness siganture card in any player's deck, hand, discard pile, or play area. - [skull]: ...1 card beneath Ravenous, at random. - [cultist]: ...each card committed to each skill test at your location (after the test ends), until the end of the next investigation phase. - [tablet]: ...each event played by investigators at your location, until the end of the next investigation phase. - [elder_thing]: ...the player card at your location with the most evidence, supplies, ammo, charges, or secrets on it. - [auto_fail]: Reveal 3 more chaos tokens and resolve each of those devour effects.
Name: Reality Acid

Description: You get +1 to all skills. [reaction] When you would fail a skill test by exactly 1: Play G-Men from your hand. (This may cause the test to succeed.) Forced – At the end of the phase: Return G-Men to your hand.
Name: G-Men

Description: Uses (3 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Evade. If you succeed, automatically evade each enemy at your location and deal 1 damage to each of them. If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol is revealed during this test, each investigator at your location takes 1 damage and loses 1 action.
Name: Corrosive Cloud

Description: [action]: Investigate. Choose an exhausted [[Creature]] or [[Monster]] enemy at your location. The difficulty of this skill test is equal to the chosen enemy’s evade value. If you succeed, deal 1 damage to the chosen enemy and discover 1 additional clue at your location.
Name: Alien Instruments

Description:
Jim Culver deck only. Advanced.
[reaction] When a [skull] or [curse] token is revealed during a skill test you are performing, exhaust Jim's Trumpet: Heal 1 horror from each investigator and [[Ally]] asset at your location or a connecting location.
Name: Jim's Trumpet

Description: Advanced. Revelation - Reveal 5 chaos tokens from the chaos bag. For each non-[elder_sign], non-[bless] symbol token revealed, take 1 damage and 1 horror.
Flavor: When the dead start talking about what scares them, that's when it's time to listen.
Name: Final Rhapsody

Description: Jim Culver deck only. Permanent. Each attached spirit loses all printed traits and gains the [[Geist]] trait. When damage/horror would be placed on an attached spirit, it must be placed on Jim Culver, instead. Forced – When your turn begins: Attach the top card of the spirit deck to The Beyond, as a spirit. If 4 or more spirits are attached, flip this card and resolve its text.
Name: The Beyond

Description: Hunter. Prey – Jim Culver only. You may fight or evade this enemy while it is attached to The Beyond (as if it were engaged with you). If you succeed, discard it. If you fail, spawn it engaged with you. Forced – When you attach a spirit to The Beyond via its forced effect: Vengeful Shade attacks you (even if it is not at your location).
Name: Vengeful Shade

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is 1 more than the number of copies of Unfinished Business in the victory display.
[cultist]: -X. X is the number of cards attached to The Beyond.
[tablet]: -X. X is the number of [[Spectral]] locations in play.
[elder_thing]: -2. If there is a [[Geist]] enemy at your location, reveal another token.
Description2:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is 2 more than the number of copies of Unfinished Business in the victory display.
[cultist]: -X. X is twice the number of cards attached to The Beyond.
[tablet]: -X. X is twice the number of [[Spectral]] locations in play.
[elder_thing]: -3. If there is a [[Geist]] enemy at your location, you automatically fail.
Name: Laid to Rest
