Forced - If there are 5 or more damage on this enemy, or after a pillar token is placed on the Mouth of K'n-yan: Heal all damage from this enemy and exhaust it. It does not ready during the upkeep phase this round.
Name: The Winged Serpent

Description:
Hunter. Massive. Retaliate.

Angry Mob gets +4 health.

Angry Mob cannot make attacks of opportunity.
Name: Angry Mob

Description:
Agnes Baker must decide (choose one):

- Agnes Baker collects 1 memory from Elspeth Baudin.

- Agnes Baker gains 2 clues from the token bank.

Then, flip this card over, exhausted and unengaged.
Flavor: Light crashes against the night sky as your magic and Elspeth's intersect. A blaring peal - like an otherworldly siren, calling for judgment - sends you and Elspeth both to your knees. She reels in pain, digging her nails into her temples. You reach out with your power, grasp at her memories, and pull with all your strength.
Name: Triumph and Subjugation

Description:
Spawn - Fishing Vessel's location.

Hunter. Massive. Retaliate.

The Terror of Devil Reef cannot enter Cave locations.

The Terror of Devil Reef gets +3 health.
Flavor: "It's got us in its grip! It ain't goin' nowhere. Now's your chance!"
Name: The Terror of Devil Reef

Description:
Spawn - Fishing Vessel's location.

Hunter. Massive. Retaliate.

The Terror of Devil Reef cannot enter Cave locations.

Forced - When The Terror of Devil Reef would be defeated: Instead, remove all damage from it and exhaust it. It cannot ready for the remainder of the round (including the upkeep phase).
Name: The Terror of Devil Reef

Description:
Spawn - Rearmost location.

Hunter. Massive. Retaliate.

Forced - When The Terror of Devil Reef would be defeated: Instead, remove all damage from it and exhaust it. It cannot ready for the remainder of the round.
Name: The Terror of Devil Reef

Description:
Vehicle. Limit 2 investigators in this vehicle.

This vehicle is stopped.

If you are this vehicle's driver: You start the car. Flip this vehicle over.
Name: Thomas Dawson's Car

Description:
Vehicle. Limit 2 investigators in this vehicle.

This vehicle is stopped.

If you are this vehicle's driver: You start the car. Flip this vehicle over.
Name: Elina Harper's Car

Description:
Holding Cells cannot be flooded.

Enemies cannot enter or spawn at Holding Cells (if one would spawn here, spawn it at any Sunken Grotto instead).

: Test (3) to break the bars or (3) to pick the locks. If you control the yellow key, this test automatically succeeds. If you succeed, free an investigator who is captured here.
Name: Holding Cells

Description:
Dagon is slumbering. He cannot attack or engage, and is immune to investigator actions and player card effects.

Forced - After an investigator at this location fails a skill test: Place 1 resource on Dagon. Then, if there are at least 1 +2 resources on Dagon, flip him.

Spend 1 key: Remove 1 resource from Dagon.
Name: Dagon

Description:
Exhaust Y'ha-nthlei Statue and add 2 tokens to the chaos bag: Deal 1 damage to a Humanoid enemy at your location.

Spend the blue, white, red, or yellow key: Ready Y'ha-nthlei Statue and flip it to its other side.
Name: Y'ha-nthlei Statue

Description:
Hunter. Massive. Retaliate.

Dagon gets -1 fight for each Sanctum location with a key on it.

Forced - After Dagon is evaded or dealt damage: Do the same to a copy of Dagon's Brood in play, as well.
Name: Dagon

Description:
Hunter. Massive. Retaliate.

Hydra gets -1 fight for each Sanctum location with a key on it.

Forced - After Hydra is evaded or dealt damage: Do the same to a copy of Hydra's Brood in play, as well.
Name: Hydra

Description:
Spawn - Engaged with Roland Banks.

Hunter. Mr. Grey gets +2 health.

Forced - After Mr. Grey attacks an investigator: That investigator draws the top card of the encounter deck.
Flavor: "Take comfort in the idea that your death serves a much greater purpose."
Name: Mr. Grey

Description:
: Resign. "Whose bright idea was this, anyway?"

Haunted - Place 1 clue from the supply on Hangman's Brook.
Name: Hangman's Brook

Description:
The drowned spirit lunges for you, croaking with the garbled sounds of torment. Sodden weeds are tangled through its hair.

Keep this card in your threat area (this side faceup). If you are eliminated, flip it over.

Forced - At the end of the round: You must either discard an asset you control or flip this card back to its enemy side.

If you are at Hangman's Brook and it has no clues on it: Test a skill of your choice (5). If you succeed, the ghost is "banished" (resolve the text below).

Do not read until this ghost is "banished."

At the bottom of the riverbank, you find the spirit's remains. You dig a shallow grave beside the brook and there you lay its body to rest, dry and safe at long last.

Add this card to the victory display.
Flavor: AIR... PLEASE, I NEED AIR...
Name: Unfinished Business

Description:
The wraith is in a panic, casting its gaze into the dark woods in search of some enigmatic predator. What could something that is dead possibly fear?

Keep this card in your threat area (this side faceup). If you are eliminated, flip it over.

Forced - At the start of the enemy phase: If The Spectral Watcher is in play, ready it.

: Evade. Use only on The Spectral Watcher. Use your lowest skill for this evasion attempt. If you succeed, the ghost is "banished" (resolve the text below) (in addition to evading The Spectral Watcher).

Do not read until this ghost is "banished."

You force the spectral horror back, buying enough time to calm the spirit down. As it dissolves into the night, its gaze never wanders from the watcher's form.

Add this card to the victory display.
Flavor: IT'S COMING! IT'S COMING FOR US BOTH!
Name: Unfinished Business

Description:
Lily Chen deck only. Permanent.

After the round ends, if you took no damage or horror this round: Flip this asset over to its Unbroken side.
Name: Discipline

Description:
Lily Chen deck only. Permanent.

After the round ends, if your hand did not have 2 or more cards in it at any point this round: Flip this asset over to its Unbroken side.
Name: Discipline

Description:
Lily Chen deck only. Permanent.

After the round ends, if you performed no skill tests this round: Flip this asset over to its Unbroken side.
Name: Discipline

Description:
Lily Chen deck only. Permanent.

After the round ends, if no enemies were at the same location as you at any point this round: Flip this asset over to its Unbroken side.
Name: Discipline

Description:
Choose one:

- Put the set-aside Base Camp location into play.

- Put the set-aside Deck of the Theodosia location into play.

- Put the set-aside University Halls location into play.

Flip this card back over.
Flavor:
You wander for what seems like hours through the myriad reflections. The further you venture from where you arrived, the more distant reality becomes. There are many paths to take through the hallucination. Places you recognize from your memories, and others you do not, taken from the memories of your companions.
As the shape of the mirage changes around you, you consider which prison might be worse - the one that reveals its true, deadly nature? Or the one that hides it?
Name: Prison of Memories

Description:
Choose one:

- Follow Takada’s memories. Put the set-aside Coastal Waters location into play.

- Follow Eliyah’s memories. Put the set-aside Deserted Station location into play.

- Follow Dr. Sinha’s memories. Put the set-aside Riverview Theatre location into play.

Flip this card back over.
Flavor:
Eliyah and his companion, Anyu, shimmer into view along the outskirts of the camp. "Where have you been?" Takada says, also appearing before your very eyes.]
"It is foolish to venture out alone," Dr. Sinha joins in the scolding.
"Relax. I wasn’t alone," Eliyah replies, his gloved hand gently petting Anyu’s neck.
The physician rolls her eyes and departs, but Takada remains, folding her arms across her chest. "There is still a lot to do before we head out, you know," she states.
Eliyah sighs and nods. "I know. Just...anxious. Something about this place..." he trails off.
Takada nods. "Yes. I feel it, too."
Name: Base Camp

Description:
Choose one:

- Follow Cookie’s memories. Put the set-aside Coastal Waters location into play.

- Follow Ellsworth’s memories. Put the set-aside Hedge Maze location into play.

- Follow Claypool’s memories. Put the set-aside Standing Stones location into play.

Flip this card back over.
Flavor:
Ellsworth appears in a shimmer of mirage-light, staring out over the railing into the cold, blue ocean. "Beautiful, isn’t it?" he says.
Cookie and Claypool appear nearby, carrying several crates of supplies between them. "Y’know what would be beautiful?" Cookie hollers. "If maybe yeh helped out a lil’ bit. Think yeh might get off yer ass for a minute ’n pitch in, Ellsworth?"
The explorer nods with a soft sigh and takes the weight from Claypool’s hands, nodding aside for him to take a break. Claypool gives him a gentle, knowing smile.
Name: Deck of the Theodosia

Description:
Choose one:

- Follow Danforth’s memories. Put the set-aside Elder Chamber location into play.

- Follow Dr. Kensler’s memories. Put the set- aside Riverview Theatre location into play.

- Follow Dyer’s memories. Put the set-aside Standing Stones location into play.

Flip this card back over.
Flavor:
Three figures shimmer into view as they cross one another in the darkened halls. "Professor," you hear Dr. Kensler’s voice acknowledge, and her outline becomes defined. Professor Dyer and his protégé appear next. "I do hope you’ll consider my proposal," she continues. If she truly cared one way or the other, her tone of voice surely does not reveal it.
In response, Dyer simply glances at Danforth, who appears to be staring behind her - far, far behind her. "Well. In any event..." she adjusts her glasses, and enters the door labeled with her name.
Dyer shakes his head with a sigh, but Danforth is the one who breaks the silence. "I...I think we should go."
Name: University Halls

Description:
Put the set-aside Mo‘ai Statues location into play.

Flip this card back over.
Flavor: "You really think I can’t navigate a simple maze?" Ellsworth chuckles. He looks several years young instead of his comfortable jacket and trousers. The figure he speaks to stands just out of view, a dark silhouette with a muffled, indistinct voice. "Fine," the explorer replies with a roll of his eyes. He hands the figure his champagne glass and loosens his tie. "But when I get back, you are going to tell me what this is really all about."
Name: Hedge Maze

Description:
Put the set-aside Alaskan Wilds location into play.

Flip this card back over.
Flavor:
When Eliyah materializes into view, you are stunned to see him without his steadfast companion, Anyu. He holds an unfamiliar woman’s hands, her wavy hair the color of a brilliant ruby. The two young lovers stare into one another’s eyes as the old train approaches. "How long do you think you will be gone?"
"I...I’m not sure," he confesses. "It is a lengthy journey. Alaska is a hell of a big place."
"So, this is goodbye, then," the woman says. She wipes angry tears from her eyes. "Will you write?"
"I’ll try, but..." he glances away.
"Right, right," she says, understanding. The train pulls into the station, its piercing squeal muffling their words. "You...fool." She leans up and kisses his cheek. "You are a fool, Eliyah."
"I...I know," he replies. "I know."
Name: Deserted Station

Description:
Choose one:

- Follow Takada’s memories. Put the set- aside Airfield location into play.

- Follow Cookie’s memories. Put the set- aside Ottoman Front location into play.

Flip this card back over.
Flavor:
"Hell of a test run!" Cookie yells over the roar of the rushing wind. The two of them are up in one of Takada's aeroplanes - this must have happened just after she completed work on the first plane, before the lot of you set off toward the peaks, and the events that ensued.
"Get used to it!" Takada shouts from the pilot’s seat. "Weather’s gonna be rough anytime we’re in the air. Don’t worry though, she’ll hold." You see the grim copilot hold back a smile. "You’re enjoying this, aren’t you?" Takada chimes.
"Naw," Cookie lies. "Just been a while, is all."
Name: Coastal Waters

Description:
Put the set-aside Cluttered Dormitory location into play.

Flip this card back over.
Flavor:
These are the sledges missing from Lake’s camp," Professor Dyer remarks, shimmering into view. He doesn’t sound particularly surprised - it seems they must have accounted for this possibility.
Danforth is already at the first of the sledges, examining its contents. "Here’s the gasoline stove, the fuel, all of their research instruments..." he trails off. "God, what is that awful stench?" He motions toward the farthest sledge, the tarpaulin strapped around its cargo bulging oddly.
"Danforth, don’t-" Dyer calls out, but it’s too late. The moment Danforth removes the tarpaulin, he staggers backward, covering his mouth and nose. Frozen and preserved beneath the tarpaulin are the corpses of a young explorer and one of his sled dogs. "Gedney," Dyer whispers.
Name: Elder Chamber

Description:
Choose one:

- Follow Dr. Kensler’s memories. Put the set-aside Dr. Kensler’s Office location into play.

- Follow Dr. Sinha’s memories. Put the set-aside Infirmary location into play.

Flip this card back over.
Flavor:
"Thank you for...for inviting me here, Dr. Sinha," Dr. Kensler says quietly, her outline shimmering into view. She and Dr. Sinha sit next to one another in the almost-empty theatre. The lights are dim and the curtain drawn, but the show has not yet begun.
"Of course. And just Mala is fine."
Kensler flinches and clears her throat. "Then call me Amy."
"I already do," the physician replies as the screen in front of them kindles to life.
Name: Riverview Theatre

Description:
Choose one:

- Follow Claypool’s memories. Put the set-aside The Black Stone location into play.

- Follow Dyer’s memories. Put the set-aside Dyer’s Classroom location into play.

Flip this card back over.
Flavor:
Claypool stares up at the ruins with a twinkle of wonder in his eyes. "Marvelous, isn’t it, William?" Behind him, Professor Dyer materializes within the mirage. Both of them are at least a decade younger, perhaps more. You note Claypool did not address the professor by his title.
"Marvelous and mysterious," Dyer replies. "Nobody knows the true purpose of this site. Perhaps nobody ever will."
"But that’s why we do this, right?" Claypool says with a grin. "To learn the truth."
Dyer glances back at the youth, lines of worry pulling at his eyes. "Yes," he whispers, "the truth."
Name: Standing Stones

Description:
If Takada Hiroko is alive:

Spawn the set-aside Memory of a Missing Father enemy at this location.

Flip this card back over.

If Takada Hiroko is crossed out:

Move each investigator and enemy at this location to Prison of Memories. Discard each card attached to this location. Add this card to the victory display.

The investigators may advance the current act or continue playing.
Flavor: A teenage girl shimmers into view. You recognize Takada’s chestnut eyes and thin, straight hair. Her cheeks are stained with tears and rain. She waves as the old, rickety aeroplane takes off. You don’t recognize the design - this must have been over a decade ago. "Don’t worry, kiddo." The man next to her grips her shoulder encouragingly. "He’ll be back soon," he reassures her, his voice soft with compassion. "You’ll see."
Name: Airfield

Description:
If Eliyah Ashevak is alive:

Spawn the set-aside Memory of a Hunt Gone Awry enemy at this location.

Flip this card back over.

If Eliyah Ashevak is crossed out:

Move each investigator and enemy at this location to Prison of Memories. Discard each card attached to this location. Add this card to the victory display.

The investigators may advance the current act or continue playing.
Flavor: Eliyah sits huddled up against a tree, a torrent of snow falling around him. In his arms, Anyu whines. Blood soaks his gloves, staining the dog’s fur red as he holds her tight. "I know, girl," he chants, "I know, I know. We...we are going to be okay. You and me, girl. Anyu, right? That was your name?" The dog peers up into his eyes. "We will be okay, Anyu. I promise you."
Name: Alaskan Wilds

Description:
If Danforth is alive:

Spawn the set-aside Memory of an Unspeakable Evil enemy at this location.

Flip this card back over.

If Danforth is crossed out:

Move each investigator and enemy at this location to Prison of Memories. Discard each card attached to this location. Add this card to the victory display.

The investigators may advance the current act or continue playing.
Flavor: Danforth screams and throws his covers aside. Sweat drenches his forehead and drips down his cheeks. "Just a dream," he whispers. "Just a dream, just a dream." He collapses from his bed, dabs his head with a handkerchief, and wanders over to the nearby window to peer outside. The shape he sees on the other side causes him to leap back in fear, crashing into the opposite wall. "No...no!"
Name: Cluttered Dormitory

Description:
If Professor William Dyer is alive:

Spawn the set-aside Memory of a Regretful Voyage enemy at this location.

Flip this card back over.

If Professor William Dyer is crossed out:

Move each investigator and enemy at this location to Prison of Memories. Discard each card attached to this location. Add this card to the victory display.

The investigators may advance the current act or continue playing.
Flavor:
Dyer shakes the man’s hand vigorously, a smile beaming across his face. "You have no idea how much this means to me," he exclaims. "This will be a journey of profound importance. For all of us."
You recognize the man he speaks to - it is the late Professor Lake, one of many who ventured with Dyer to Antarctica and never returned.
"Yes, William," Lake replies, his eyes dribbling over with terrible black ichor. "This expedition will change everything."
Name: Dyer’s Classroom

Description:
If Dr. Mala Sinha is alive:

Spawn the set-aside Memory of a Lost Patient enemy at this location.

Flip this card back over.

If Dr. Mala Sinha is crossed out:

Move each investigator and enemy at this location to Prison of Memories. Discard each card attached to this location. Add this card to the victory display.

The investigators may advance the current act or continue playing.
Flavor:
A young Dr. Sinha appears by the bedside, her face contorted with grief. You have never seen her so stricken. A nurse places a hand on top of Dr. Sinha’s in consolation, but she bats it away. "Don’t," she barks, choking back a sob.
"There is nothing more you could have done, Doctor," the nurse says.
"There is always more that can be done," Dr. Sinha shouts. "We could have been smarter! Faster!" Her hands shake as she tries to make a fist. Black miasma seeps from between her knuckles. "We - I - this is my fault. All my fault."
Name: Infirmary

Description:
If Dr. Amy Kensler is alive:

Spawn the set-aside Memory of an Unrequited Love enemy at this location.

Flip this card back over.

If Dr. Amy Kensler is crossed out:

Move each investigator and enemy at this location to Prison of Memories. Discard each card attached to this location. Add this card to the victory display.

The investigators may advance the current act or continue playing.
Flavor: Dr. Kensler sits at her desk, struggling to focus on her work. Various papers sit in neat piles around her, and the bookshelf is perfectly ordered, just as you would expect from the professor. But the journal she writes in is cluttered and unkempt. She runs her hand through her hair, undoing her ponytail. "No, no, no..." she mutters, ripping a piece of paper from the book. You spot a photograph serving as a bookmark, keeping her page as she shuts the journal angrily. She opens one of her desk drawers and throws the crumpled paper inside, barely noticing the way the drawer bubbles over with miasma, and the putrid gray mist emanating from within...
Name: Dr. Kensler’s Office

Description:
If Roald Ellsworth is alive:

Spawn the set-aside Memory of an Alien Translation enemy at this location.

Flip this card back over.

If Roald Ellsworth is crossed out:

Move each investigator and enemy at this location to Prison of Memories. Discard each card attached to this location. Add this card to the victory display.

The investigators may advance the current act or continue playing.
Flavor: Rain patters against the face of the statue as Ellsworth examines the inscription at its foundation. "This one isn’t like the rest," he murmurs to himself. "This isn’t Rapa Nui. This isn’t one of the mo‘ai at all." The statue in the mirage cracks open, and miasma begins to seep from inside...
Name: Mo‘ai Statues

Description:
If James "Cookie" Fredericks is alive:

Spawn the set-aside Memory of a Ravaged Country enemy at this location.

Flip this card back over.

If James "Cookie" Fredericks is crossed out:

Move each investigator and enemy at this location to Prison of Memories. Discard each card attached to this location. Add this card to the victory display.

The investigators may advance the current act or continue playing.
Flavor:
Through the din of war - a hail of gunfire and mortars so loud it shakes the earth - Cookie reloads his rifle, slowly and methodically. "Sergeant Fredericks!" a voice calls out to him. His companion ducks through the trench as another nearby explosion kicks up a spray of mud. "Germans broke the line last night. They’re circling around. We have to get out of here!"
Cookie affixes a bayonet to the end of his rifle. "Did the lieutenant give the order?" he asks.
"Lieutenant Williams is dead," the soldier replies, the fear in his voice palpable. "Sir...you’re in charge."
Name: Ottoman Front

Description:
If Avery Claypool is alive:

Spawn the set-aside Memory of a Terrible Discovery enemy at this location.

Flip this card back over.

If Avery Claypool is crossed out:

Move each investigator and enemy at this location to Prison of Memories. Discard each card attached to this location. Add this card to the victory display.

The investigators may advance the current act or continue playing.
Flavor:
"According to Inuit legend, this megalith has stood here since before humanity walked the Earth," a young Avery recounts, examining the runic language along its surface.
"I don’t know about any of that, but it is definitely ancient. That’s not even the weirdest part, though." "What is?" one of the other explorers asks, pulling his hood down to get a better view of the towering structure.
"See for yourself," Claypool says, unfolding a map and placing it against the smooth stone. Drawn over the map’s surface are many rings and lines depicting various weather patterns. "This thing...is like a lightning rod."
Name: The Black Stone

Description:
In your Campaign Log, record Eliyah has confronted his demons. Draw a checkmark next to his name in the Expedition Team section.

From now on, whenever Eliyah Ashevak is included or used during a scenario, use the set-aside Resolute version instead of the version from the Expedition Team encounter set. If he is currently in play, switch him with that version now.

Add this card to the victory display.

The investigators may advance the current act or continue playing.
Flavor: "We almost died that day. Anyu and I," the real Eliyah says as the mirage fades. Anyu licks his gloved hand and whines. "We were the only two that survived. And nobody ever believed me when I told them about the creature that attacked us. They turned me into a pariah. I thought...maybe I was crazy, after all." He shudders as he recalls the shape the mirage took. "But now I know. What attacked us that day was real."
Name: Memory of a Hunt Gone Awry

Description:
In your Campaign Log, record Dr. Sinha has confronted her demons. Draw a checkmark next to her name in the Expedition Team section.

From now on, whenever Dr. Mala Sinha is included or used during a scenario, use the set-aside Resolute version instead of the version from the Expedition Team encounter set. If she is currently in play, switch her with that version now.

Add this card to the victory display.

The investigators may advance the current act or continue playing.
Flavor: "I will never forget that day. The day I lost my first patient." She crosses her arms as the mirage fades. Her eyes are tired and worn. "They tell you it happens to even the best of us, but even so, we are never prepared. I was not foolish enough to vow that I would never lose another one. I knew that was a fantasy." She glances at you knowingly. "Instead, I simply vowed never to get attached. So do not be upset at my distance. It is for my own sake. So if - when - I lose you, I am not lost, myself."
Name: Memory of a Lost Patient

Description:
In your Campaign Log, record Takada has confronted her demons. Draw a checkmark next to her name in the Expedition Team section.

From now on, whenever Takada Hiroko is included or used during a scenario, use the set-aside Resolute version instead of the version from the Expedition Team encounter set. If she is currently in play, switch her with that version now.

Add this card to the victory display.

The investigators may advance the current act or continue playing.
Flavor: "He never did come home," Takada whispers, choking on her words. "I spent my whole life following in his footsteps. I thought...I thought if I did, maybe..." she wipes the tears - and inky miasma - from her eyes. "He’s gone. Gone forever."
Name: Memory of a Missing Father

Description:
In your Campaign Log, record Cookie has confronted his demons. Draw a checkmark next to his name in the Expedition Team section.

From now on, whenever James "Cookie" Fredericks is included or used during a scenario, use the set-aside Resolute version instead of the version from the Expedition Team encounter set. If he is currently in play, switch him with that version now.

Add this card to the victory display.

The investigators may advance the current act or continue playing.
Flavor: As the mirage dissolves, you watch a young Sergeant James Fredericks command his men to flee, a hail of bullets and mortar fire following in their wake. "Kid never did make it back," the real Cookie says, grinding his teeth. "Very few of us did that day. And for what?" He spits. The roar of gunfire fades into the distance. "For what?"
Name: Memory of a Ravaged Country

Description:
In your Campaign Log, record Dyer has confronted his demons. Draw a checkmark next to his name in the Expedition Team section.

From now on, whenever Professor William Dyer is included or used during a scenario, use the set-aside Resolute version instead of the version from the Expedition Team encounter set. If he is currently in play, switch him with that version now.

Add this card to the victory display.

The investigators may advance the current act or continue playing.
Flavor: "We never should have gone," the real Dyer whispers as the shape of Professor Lake fades into the mirage. "I should have convinced him. I should have...but I was too greedy, too eager." he chokes. "And now, here I am again. You and I, we have led these people to their ends. Even if we survive, we will never forget what we have done to these people. What we have risked."
Name: Memory of a Regretful Voyage

Description:
In your Campaign Log, record Danforth has confronted his demons. Draw a checkmark next to his name in the Expedition Team section.

From now on, whenever Danforth is included or used during a scenario, use the set-aside Resolute version instead of the version from the Expedition Team encounter set. If he is currently in play, switch him with that version now.

Add this card to the victory display.

The investigators may advance the current act or continue playing.
Flavor: "It’s here, it’s here," the real Danforth mutters as he sees the miasma dripping from the cracked window. "It was always here, always here and I returned, returned to hear that accursed sound..." He continues to watch in horror as the miasma retreats, returning his dormitory to its natural state. It takes several minutes for him to stop shaking.
Name: Memory of an Unspeakable Evil

Description:
In your Campaign Log, record Claypool has confronted his demons. Draw a checkmark next to his name in the Expedition Team section.

From now on, whenever Avery Claypool is included or used during a scenario, use the set-aside Resolute version instead of the version from the Expedition Team encounter set. If he is currently in play, switch him with that version now.

Add this card to the victory display.

The investigators may advance the current act or continue playing.
Flavor:
"After that, there was no going back," the real Claypool explains. "We had opened Pandora’s box, so to speak. I could no longer bury my head in the sand. There are forces out there beyond our comprehension. Things that science cannot explain. Just as I could not explain that stone’s meteorological impact on the region. Nor could I explain the nature of the storm that hit us after we uncovered it."
You ask Claypool what happened to the other man who was with him that day. He grinds his teeth and shakes his head.
Name: Memory of a Terrible Discovery

Description:
In your Campaign Log, record Ellsworth has confronted his demons. Draw a checkmark next to his name in the Expedition Team section.

From now on, whenever Roald Ellsworth is included or used during a scenario, use the set-aside Resolute version instead of the version from the Expedition Team encounter set. If he is currently in play, switch him with that version now.

Add this card to the victory display.

The investigators may advance the current act or continue playing.
Flavor: "I...I remember this," the real Ellsworth says, staring at his own memory. "This is what made me want to become an explorer. To discover things like this. Ancient secrets, left behind by God knows what. But the more I discover, the more I think that perhaps there are parts of the Earth better left alone. Perhaps all of this is the fault of people like me, who refuse to let history lie. Arrogant fools, the lot of us."
Name: Memory of an Alien Translation

Description:
In your Campaign Log, record Dr. Kensler has confronted her demons. Draw a checkmark next to her name in the Expedition Team section.

From now on, whenever Dr. Amy Kensler is included or used during a scenario, use the set-aside Resolute version instead of the version from the Expedition Team encounter set. If she is currently in play, switch her with that version now.

Add this card to the victory display.

The investigators may advance the current act or continue playing.
Flavor: Dr. Kensler - the real one - eyes you coldly. "This memory is not for you," she warns. "Though I suppose you have no more control over this than I do." You cannot help but be a little curious what kind of academic work would rattle somebody like her, so you ask. "It was not academic in nature," she confesses, running her hand idly along the vision of her office desk, before pulling the photograph out from inside the journal and examining it in private. "I was never very skilled in expressing myself in...matters of the heart," she says, and the photograph fades in her hands, along with the rest of the mirage. "Come along. I do not wish to remain here any longer," she states.
Name: Memory of an Unrequited Love

Description: Exhaust Mysterious Photo: Either take an investigate action at a Hideout location or flip Mysterious Photo over. If you are at a Hideout location with no clues on it, investigators at that location spend clues, as a group, equal to its clue value: “Where is Dad now?” Add that location to the victory display, moving each enemy and investigator there to a connecting location.
Name: Mysterious Photo

Description: Shift - Draw the top card of the encounter deck. Then, if an investigator shifted this key, flip it to its Stable side.
Flavor: ...completely impregnable despite all piercing and crushing attempts. What could possibly be inside? A device? Or another world entirely?
Name: The Eye of Ravens

Description:
Compare the number of rescued civilians on Aftermath with the number of slain civilians on the Scenario Reference card. (Note: Civilians still on locations are neither rescued nor slain.)

- If the number of rescued civilians is more than the number of slain civilians, each investigator earns 2 bonus experience. If the number of rescued civilians is more than twice the number of slain civilians, each investigator earns 2 additional bonus experience.

- If the number of slain civilians is more than the number of rescued civilians, each investigator suffers 1 mental trauma. If the number of is more than twice the number of rescued civilians, each investigator suffers 1 additional mental trauma.

- If it is a tie, nothing happens.
Flavor: As day breaks, the remaining survivors in Marrakesh emerge and the morbid arithmetic of counting survivors begins.
Name: Aftermath

Description:
Hunter. Retaliate.

Forced - When Amaranth attacks: She shifts each of her attached keys. If damage and/or horror from this attack is assigned to an asset, defeat that asset.
Flavor: "All of you are just weeds in my garden."
Name: Amaranth

Description: Shift - Heal 1 damage from each enemy in play. Then, if an investigator shifted this key, flip it to its Stable side.
Flavor: ...forming a neural link with host, much like the symbiotic relationship of a parasite, with access to host's thoughts and memories.
Name: The Last Blossom

Description: When your turn ends, exhaust La Chica Roja: Place your investigator mini-card in the shadows. While you are in the shadows, you are not at any location. Enemies that would spawn engaged with you instead spawn at your previous location. At the start of your turn, move back to your previous location (or any revealed location if you cannot).
Name: La Chica Roja

Description: Shift - Each investigator must discard an asset they control, if able. Then, if an investigator shifted this key, flip it to its Stable side.
Flavor: ...emergence of unknown substance does not cease despite external manipulation. Fluid pH 11. Constains no impurities or known bacteria of any kind.
Name: The Weeping Lady

Description:
Each non-weakness enemy gains: "Hunter. Prey - Investigator with The Twisted Antiprism." If The Twisted Antiprism is attached to that enemy, it instead gains "Patrol (Galata Docks)."

Forced - When 1 or more doom would be placed on an enemy: It instead moves and attacks as if it were the enemy phase (without exhausting).

Forced - After a non-weakness enemy attacks the investigator with The Twisted Antiprism: Attach The Twisted Antiprism to that enemy, Unstable side faceup. Then, that enemy shifts it.

After you evade or defeat the enemy with The Twisted Antiprism: Take control of The Twisted Antiprism, attaching it to your investigator.
Name: The Unsealing

Description: Shift - The nearest investigator must place 1 doom on an asset they control, an encounter card at their location, or the current agenda. Then, if an investigator shifted this key, flip it to its Stable side.
Flavor: ...do not store in darkness under any circumstances.
Name: The Twisted Antiprism

Description:
Café Luna gets –1 shroud for each Outsider enemy in play.

Forced – If there are no clues on Café Luna: Add clues to it until it has 1 clues on it.
Flavor: Desi's bar offers a variety of drinks and a rich, wild nightlife for both locals and tourists from the States looking to escape the tight grip of Prohibition.
Name: Café Luna

Description: When an attack from a Monster enemy deals damage to Desiderio Delgado Álvarez, exhaust him: Cancel 1 of that damage and deal 1 damage to the attacking enemy.
Name: Desiderio Delgado Álvarez

Description:
Revelation - Put Outsiders' Lair into play and move Void Chimera (True Form) and each investigator at its location to Outsiders' Lair.

While Outsiders' Lair has no clues on it, Void Chimera (True Form) gets -1 fight and -1 evade.
Name: Outsiders' Lair

Description: After an investigator at your location sets a card aside as a hollow, exhaust Thorne: That investigator may take an immediate action as if it were their turn.
Flavor: "Just admit it. I'm better at this than you."
Name: Thorne

Description: Shift - Each investigator sets the non-weakness card in their hand with the highest printed cost aside, out of play, as a hollow. Then, if an investigator shifted this key, flip it to its Stable side.
Flavor: ...beware of prolonged exposure to paradimensional viewpoint / other side can see you, too...
Name: The Sable Glass

Description:
Spend 1 clue: Test (2). Heal 1 damage from Key Locus, plus 1 additional damage for each point you succeed by.

Forced - If Key Locus is defeated: Remove it from the game (do not add it to the victory display).
Name: Key Locus

Description:
Exhaust The Claret Knight: Move up to 3 resources from your resource pool to The Claret Knight.

Exhaust The Claret Knight: Move up to 3 resources from The Claret Knight to your resource pool, or to an asset you control as charges, ammo, supplies, or secrets.
Flavor: "I will serve, until such time as I am no longer needed."
Name: The Claret Knight

Description: Forced - After you fail a skill test while at The Beast in a Cowl of Crimson's location, if it is ready: It shifts each of its attached keys.
Flavor: The thing in the cowl growls, its voice low and gutteral. Is it even human?
Name: The Beast in a Cowl of Crimson

Description: Shift - Each investigator must discard 2 random non-weakness cards from their hand. Then, if an investigator shifted this key, flip it to its Stable side.
Flavor: ...liquid cannot be allowed to leak from container. In event of catastrophic containment failure, alert Foundation operatives at once.
Name: The Light of Pharos

Description:
If an investigator has "embarrassed the consulate," read the following (otherwise, flip this card back to its enemy side, heal all damage from it, disengage it from all investigators, and exhaust it):

The sound of laughter turns to weeping, then turns back to laughter. "It is the spirit of a boy," Melati tells you. A round ball rolls out from the darkness to your feet as you look up at the trembling forms. "The padang where he once played is now the ground of one of Ms. Tzu's endeavors. Your small gesture amused him. I think he will be at peace now."

Add this card to the victory display.
Flavor: The theater fills with the sound of chittering laughter as wavering shapes dance against a papery backdrop. Melati chuckles as she looks at you. "No need to worry," she says. "This spirit is restless, but it does not bear us ill will." Looking up at the papery shadows, she intones a low chant in Malay.
Name: Playful Shadows

Description:
If an investigator has "peered beyond," read the following (otherwise, flip this card back to its enemy side, heal all damage from it, disengage it from all investigators, and exhaust it):

"It is the spirit of a girl. She watched many stories unfold in this very theater," says Melati. The shadow on the screen forms a hungry smile filled with sharp teeth that turns to a fearful frown. "She is loathe to let go of this place, for she does not know if her story will continue." As Melati translates, you assure the spirit that you have looked beyond the veil and she can leave this plane of existence. As the hoary shadows dissipate, you feel a coldness as you reflect on what you saw - and didn't see - in the beyond. Was it wrong to reassure her?

Add this card to the victory display.
Flavor: The theater fills with cacophonous laughter as a spindly shape on the paper screen grows menacing. Melati stride forward, her voice firm. "I know that you are restless," she says. "But you have nothing to fear from us." She intones a low chant in Malay.
Name: Timorous Shadows

Description:
If an investigator has "found a cheap memento," read the following (otherwise, flip this card back to its enemy side, heal all damage from it, disengage it from all investigators, and exhaust it):

"These are the spirits of fallen miners," says Melati, holding onto the flimsy tin figurine you found. "This belonged to one of them. It is sculpted from tin from this very mine. Tzu San Niang's heartless business separated the workers from their families. And now, they will never be reunited, except in death."

She holds the tin figurine over the surface of the water and lets go of it. You think you can see the outline of wispy, spectral hands grasping at it as it sinks to the bottom of the pit.

Add this card to the victory display.
Flavor: Warm, heavy rain begins to fall as you traverse the treacherous walkways. The moans of the departed echo in the dim. Melati holds one hand to her forehead and puts the other to the chiseled rock.
Name: A Lost Memento

Description:
If an investigator has "found hidden bones," read the following (otherwise, flip this card back to its enemy side, heal all damage from it, disengage it from all investigators, and exhaust it):

"These are the spirits of fallen miners," says Melati, gesturing to the oily dark water. "Compelled by Tzu San Niang's relentless greed, the foreman of the mine has worked them... well, literally to the bone. Their bodies lie, unburied, in these deep pits."

With her help, you begin exhuming the bones of the fallen miners. It is gruesome, awful work, but as you do it, you can feel a sense of gratitude wash over you. Only when you are finished can you feel a final wave of relief emanate from your surroundings.

Add this card to the victory display.
Flavor: The mines are pocked with deep pits brimming with dark, black rainwater. As you traverse the treacherous paths, spectral hands dart out of the water, grasping at you. Melati holds up one hand and turns her ear, as if listening for a whisper.
Name: Exhume the Bones

Description:
If an investigator has "shared a deep pain," read the following (otherwise, flip this card back to its enemy side, heal all damage from it, disengage it from all investigators, and exhaust it):

Melati prepares a ritual of banishment as you stare into the spirit's eyes. While the bomoh chants, you feel a ripple of pain resonate in your own mind, and for a moment you glimpse a memory from the rail worker's life: them, holding a sledgehammer, as a shadowy figure stood above them, smiling cruelly. A sudden blur of motion, followed by an awful screech. As the memory fades, so too does the spirit.

Add this card to the victory display.
Flavor: A pained howl echoes through the station as the shade bears down on you, bleeding ethereal blood and clutching its side. Melati holds up one hand to stop you. "This spirit is in great distress for a loss," she says. "It will only respond to one who has shared in its anguish."
Name: Sympathy Pain

Description:
If an investigator has "traded for a kitten," read the following (otherwise, flip this card back to its enemy side, heal all damage from it, disengage it from all investigators, and exhaust it):

Melati gestures for you to hold the kitten out to the spirit. "This one had two daughters and many cats," the bomoh says. "They simply want to know their loved ones are cared for." The spirit reaches out and strokes the kitten's fur with a glimmering, spectral hand.

After speaking rapidly in Malay, Melati looks to you. "Bringing this animal to the family of the departed would comfort them. I have told the spirit I will bring it as a gift soon." When you look, the spirit has vanished.

Add this card to the victory display.
Flavor: As Melati entreats the spirit, it turns its head, as if it hears something you can't. The bomoh pulls you aside, a gentle smile upon her face. "It's searching for something," she explains. "Something that reminds it of home."
Name: Familial Pain

Description:
Hunter. Retaliate.

Tzu San Niang gets +2 health.

Forced - When you succeed at a skill test while attempting to fight or evade Tzu San Niang: Remove 1 charge from The Shade Reaper for each point you succeeded by. Take damage and/or horror equal to the number of charges removed, divided as equally as possible.
Name: Tzu San Niang

Description: Shift - Each investigator loses 1 action (or if it is not their turn, loses 1 action during their next turn). Then, if an investigator shifted this key, flip it to its Stable side.
Flavor: ...capable of metaphysical absorption? / release conforms to indicated patterns of neural suppression...
Name: The Shade Reaper

Description: Shift - Each investigator takes 1 direct damage. Then, if an investigator shifted this key, flip it to its Stable side.
Flavor: ...different for each individual who perceives reflection. No known explanation for this discrepancy.
Name: The Mirroring Blade

Description: Shift - Each investigator loses 3 resources. Then, if an investigator shifted this key, flip it to its Stable side.
Flavor: ...currently does not recommend activation of device, without understanding of indirect consequences.
Name: The Bale Engine

Description: Shift - Each investigator takes 1 direct horror. Then, if an investigator shifted this key, flip it to its Stable side.
Flavor: ...unclear what parameters establish capability to hear or endure subject frequency. Use with caution.
Name: The Ruinous Chime

Description:
Permanent. Kate Winthrop deck only.

When you place a clue on an asset you control: Get +2 skill value for your next skill test this phase.
Flavor: Is this the same energy harnessed by Nikola Tesla?
Name: Flux Stabilizer

Description:
: Resign. It's time to get out of here!

If an investigator "impersonated a high roller" and your alarm level is 6 or lower, spend 2 resources: You set up a delivery to the vault. Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Casino enemy, spawn it here, and attach the set-aside Package Delivery story card to it. (Group limit once per game.)
Name: Casino Floor

Description: Spend 4 resources: Discard the top 5 cards of the encounter deck and check their game icons. You may mulligan once. If all 5 cards have the same suit or a sequential rank, or if 4 cards have the same rank, gain 8 resources and remember that you "won a cultist medallion."
Name: High Roller's Table

Description:
If you "found a vent," investigators at Casino Lounge spend 2 clues, as a group: Move. Move to Guard Room. Then, reveal Staff Access Hallway if it has not already been revealed. Remember that "the vent is open." (Group limit once per game.)

While "the vent is open," investigators may move from Casino Lounge to Guard Room as if they were connected, and vice versa.
Name: Casino Lounge

Description:
Cannot be discarded.

Parley. Choose a Casino enemy at your location or a connecting location and test or (2). If you succeed, exhaust The Face to reduce any investigator's alarm level by 1.
Name: The Face

Description:
Cannot be discarded.

After you defeat a Casino enemy, exhaust The Muscle: Reduce your alarm level by 1 (2 instead if there are no other Casino enemies at your location).
Flavor: Shh. Shhhhh. Go to sleep.
Name: The Muscle

Description:
Cannot be discarded.

When a Casino enemy up to 2 locations away resolves its patrol keyword, exhaust The Thief: Change the patrol location of that enemy from "clockwise" to "counterclockwise," or vice versa, for this move.
Name: The Thief

Description:
Cannot be discarded.

When you check game icons while resolving an ability on a Game location, exhaust The Grifter: Choose one -

- Raise your alarm level by 1 to change the rank, suit, or color of up to 2 discarded game icons (to anything).

- Reduce your alarm level by 1.
Name: The Grifter

Description:
: Parley. Take control of Isamara Ordoñez.

: If you control Isamara Ordoñez: Parley. Automatically evade all Casino enemies at your location. Then, test (3). If you fail, lose 2 actions. If at least 1 enemy at a Restricted location was evaded by this effect, remember that "Isamara mesmerized the guards with her song." (Group limit once per game.)
Name: Isamara Ordoñez

Description:
While an investigator's alarm level is 5 or higher, Abarran Arrigorriagakoa gains hunter.

Forced - When you deal 1 or more damage to Abarran Arrigorriagakoa, if he is ready: Discard the top card of the encounter deck and check its game icon. If its suit is ♦, Abarran attacks you.

♦A
Name: Abarran Arrigorriagakoa

Description:
- J♠: The Prayer. Nothing happens.

- J♥: The Wind. You may take an additional 3 actions this turn.

- J♦: The Chest. Gain 10 resources.

- J♣: The Tome. Choose 2 different skills. You get +1 to each of those skills for the remainder of the game.

- Q♦: The Champion. Select an Ally asset from among your collection and put it into play (for the remainder of the game).

- Q♠: The Sword. Select an Item asset from among your collection and put it into play (for the remainder of the game).

- K♥: The Lifeblood. Heal all damage and horror on your investigator.

- K♣: The Lamp. Choose a non-Elite enemy or treachery in play. That card ceases to exist (remove it from the game).

- A♠: The Evil Eye. For the remainder of the game, treat each you reveal on a chaos token as an .
Name: Deck of Possibilities

Description: Shift - During the next skill test performed this round, the performing investigator reveals an additional chaos token (resolve both). Then, if an investigator triggered this ability, flip this key to its Stable side.
Flavor: ... pertains to no known civilization or currency.
Name: Wellspring of Fortune

Description:
Subject 5U-21 deck only. Permanent.

Each time you devour a card, set it aside, out of play. You get +1 to each of your skills for each card beneath Ravenous (max +5).

Forced - At the end of your turn: Devour a non-story card beneath Ravenous or controlled by an investigator at your location. If there is nothing beneath Ravenous, flip it over.
Name: Ravenous

Description:
Forced – One at a time, choose each non-weakness spirit attached to The Beyond and reveal a random token from the chaos bag. If it is...

- ... an token: You may either heal 1 horror, or attach the top card of the spirit deck to The Beyond, as a spirit. (Do not reveal tokens for the spirit you attach after resolving this effect.)

- ... an token: Discard this spirit. Take 1 direct damage/horror.

- ...a token: Discard this spirit. Heal 1 horror.

- ...a , , , or token: You must either discard this spirit or take 1 direct damage.

- ...any other token: Discard this spirit.

Flip this card back to its asset side.

Reminder: Spirits attached to The Beyond are in play but only retain their names and text boxes. Spirits do not take up slots and do not have health or sanity values. When a unique spirit is attached to The Beyond, any other asset that shares its name and is already in play is discarded. Spirits are always discarded to the bottom of the spirit deck.
Name: The Beyond

Description:
Hunter. Prey – Jim Culver only.

: Parley. Test (3). This test gets +1 difficulty for each copy of Unfinished Business in the victory display. If you succeed, heal all damage from Jean Devereux and flip him (he is no longer engaged).

Forced – If Jean Devereux is defeated: Advance the act.
Name: Jean Devereux
